eng: The Millennial Fair
jap: 旅立ち！夢みる千年祭
re: Setting Out! The Dreamy Millennial Festival

eng: Crono... Crono! Good morning, Crono!
jap: 「クロノ…… クロノ！ クロノったら！
re: Crono...... Crono! Hey, Crono!

eng: Come on, sleepy head! Get up!
jap: いつまでねてるの？ いいかげん起きなさい！
re: How long are you sleeping? Get up already!

eng: Ah, Leene's Bell makes such beautiful music!
jap: ああ、リーネの鐘があんなに 気持ちよさそうに歌ってる。
re: Ahh, Leene's Bell is singing so pleasantly.

eng: You were so excited about the Millennial Fair that you didn't sleep well, did you...? I want you to behave yourself today!
jap: どうせゆうべ、こうふんして ねつけなかったんでしょ？ ま、建国千年のお祭りだから 無理ないけど…… あんまり調子に乗って ハシャぎすぎるんじゃないわよ！
re: I'll bet you wound up too excited to get to sleep last night, didn't you? Well, it's the National Foundation Millenial Festival, so that's only natural, but...... Don't get caught up in the moment and party too much!

eng: Let's get moving, now!
jap: さ、いいかげん起きなさい！
re: Come on, get up already!

eng: Finally! By the way, that inventor friend of yours... Uh...you know...! Oh, dear, I've forgotten her name!
jap: やっと起きたのね。 そうそう、あの、おさななじみの 発明好きな子…… アラ、ドわすれしちゃったわ。 なんていったっけ、あの子？
re: I see you finally got up. Oh yes, your childhood friend, that girl who likes inventions...... Oh, it's slipped my mind. What was that girl's name?

eng: That's right, Lucca! Don't forget that she invited you to see her new invention!
jap: そう、ルッカ！ ルッカの発明、見に行くんでしょ？
re: That's right, Lucca! You're going to see Lucca's invention, right?

eng: Run along now, and be back before dinner.
jap: あんまり、おそくならないようにね。 さ、行ってらっしゃい。
re: Make sure not to be too late. Well, I'll see you later.

eng: Oh, I almost forgot! Here's your allowance, dear! Have fun at the fair! Received 200 G!
jap: あっ、そうそう。 はい、おこづかい。 お祭り楽しんでらっしゃい。 200Gを手に入れた！
re: Oh yes, that's right! Here's your allowance! Have fun at the fair! Got 200G!

eng: How about a snooze?
jap: 休みますか？
re: Rest?

eng: Yes.
jap: はい
re: Yes

eng: No.

eng: Hard to believe Guardia is now 1000 years old, and our King is the XXXIII descendant to the throne! But how can he rule a kingdom when he can't even control his own daughter?!
jap: ねえ、知ってる？　ここガルディア王国が できて、今年で1000年。現ガルディア王 つまり、今の王様だけど33代なのよ。 で、その王様のなやみのタネは 一人娘の王女様。 なんでもすっごい、おてんばなんですって。 たぶん今ごろは、お城のなかで 『あたしも、お祭りいきたーい！』 なんて、おおさわぎしてるんじゃ ないかしらね。
re: Hey, did you know? It's 1000 years this year since Guardia Kingdom here was formed. The current King Guardia, our king now in other words, is the 33rd. And the root of that king's worries is the princess, his only daughter. They say she's an incredible tomboy. I wonder if she isn't making a big fuss in the castle about now, something like “I wanna go to the festival too!”
RetranslatorComment: Marle was directly  foreshadowed as being present at the Millennial Fair in the Japanese version.  This text was trimmed during translation.

eng: That brat, Lucca, says she's made the discovery of a lifetime.
jap: あの、まいどおさわがせ娘、ルッカが 千年祭会場で、せいきの大発表をするって せんでんしてたぜ。
re: That girl who's always causing a big fuss, Lucca, was advertising about making the announcement of the century at the Millennial Festival grounds.

re: Ah, welcome. Take your time. Or whatever, it's overdoing it to say that. Aaah, I wanna hurry up and finish work and go see the festival too!

jap: この家の町長は、ぼうけん者が好きでね。 初心者にぼうけんのノウハウを 教えてくれるのよ。

jap: いいえ

eng: You can take the things you find here!
jap: それから、この家にある宝ばこは 町長がぼうけん者のためにって 置いてあるの。 えんりょしないで持って行ってね。

eng: Need a brief Weapons and Items seminar?
jap: 武器や防具について 聞かせてあげましょうか？
re: Shall I let you hear about weapons and armoring?

eng: Yes.
jap: はい
re: Yes

eng: Weapons include swords, bows, and guns. Some weapons can only be used by specific party members. You'll find a variety of armor for the head and body. Finally, there are numerous accessories with unique properties and effects. As you gain Power, swords will inflict greater damage. Bows and guns get more powerful as your Hit rate increases.
jap: 武器といっても、色々なものがあるのよ。 刀とか、ゆみとか、けんじゅうとかね。 けど人にはとくい、ふとくいがあって その人に合った武器しか、使えないの。 防具には3つのしゅるいがあるわ。 頭につけるものと、体につけるものと それからアクセサリー。 防具も自分の体に合ったものしか 装備できないのよ。 それからアクセサリーには、特別な力が あるものが多いから色々と調べてみると いいわ。 それと、刀は力が上がれば攻撃力も 上がるけど、ゆみやけんじゅうは チョットちがうの。 必要なのは命中りつ、これが上がれば 強いダメージをあたえられるわ。
re: We call them all weapons, but there are a variety of them. Like katanas, bows, and pistols. But everyone has their strengths and weaknesses, and can't use any weapons but those suited to them. There are three types to armoring. The ones you put on your head, the ones you put on your body, and accessories. You can't equip armoring either except for the ones suited to your body. Next, in accessories, many of them have special special powers, so you should try checking out a variety of them. Also, for katanas, if your power increases, your attack power also increases, but for bows and pistols, it's a LITTLE different. What you need is hit rate; the more it increases, the more powerful damage you'll be able to inflict.

eng: No.
jap: いいえ
re: No

eng: Scattered throughout this world are places where you can save your game. Save whenever you can, especially in unfamiliar or dangerous areas! That's just a replica. Record your journey whenever you find the real McCoy! You'll find more of them in riskier areas. Also, remember that you can log in anywhere on the World Map!
jap: この世の中には時の記憶がとどまる所が あるという。 そこでは危険にみちた場所でも 旅の記録をとる事が出来る。 それはレプリカさ。　もし本物を見かけたら 旅の記録を取ることをすすめるぜ。 なんせ危険な所ほど出現しやすいと いう話だからな。 おっと、それともう1つ！ ワールドマップでは、どこでも旅の記録を とれる、わすれないでくれ。
re: It's said there are places in this world where time's memory abides. There, even in places full of danger, you can take a record of your journey. That's a replica. If you happen to see the real thing, I recommend taking a record of your journey. Anyhow, they say they appear more easily the more dangerous the place is. Oh, one more thing! On the world map, you can take a record of your journey anywhere, don't forget.

eng: You can walk while reading messages. But go too far, and you can miss them!
jap: メッセージが出てる間も、兄ちゃん達は 動き回れるんだぜ。 遠くはなれれば、声も聞こえなくなるよ。
re: You guys can move around even when there's a message up. If you get too far away, you won't be able to hear the voice.

eng: Use the Y Button to move the Message/Battle window up or down.
jap: メッセージやバトル中のウインドウは Yボタンで上下に、いどうするのよ。
re: Move messages and the in-battle window up and down with the Y button.

eng: Do you know about «Shelters?» They're quite useful!
jap: お前さん『シェルター』のことは 知っているのかい？
re: Do you know about "Shelters"?

eng: Yes.
jap: はい
re: Yes

eng: Use «Shelters» at Save Points, or on the World Map, to completely restore HP and MP.
jap: 『シェルター』はセーブポイントと ワールドマップで使用できるアイテムで HPもMPも全回復するんじゃよ。 べんりじゃの～。
re: Shelters are items you can use at save points and on the world map, and they fully recover both HP and MP. Convenient...

eng: No.
jap: いいえ
re: No

eng: All right, I'll teach you about skills. Are you willing to learn?
jap: よっしゃあ、俺様が技のこうかはんいを 教えてやる。　聞くか？
re: Okay! I'll teach you about technique effect ranges. Listen?

eng: Yes.
jap: いいえ
re: Yes

eng: During combat, the effect of each attack can vary. First, some of your attacks will damage more than one enemy. For example, target this critter... ...and your attack will hit another monster in the area. But if you target this one... ...you can get all three at once! Use this fact to your advantage! Next, you can hit enemies in your direct line of sight. There are two attack patterns. The first one... ...allows you to attack all the enemies oriented on a straight line from you. You may place the cursor on any one of them on the line. The other pattern... ...allows you to hit only the enemies in a straight line between you and the target. As in the previous example, all 3 creatures are targeted here, but... ...select this one, and that's all you'll get! Next, use an enemy to establish a line, and any others on it will also be hit. They're lined up horizontally here... The final pattern puts you at the center of the attack zone. You can't use an attack like this if your enemies are outside of the zone. However, your attack will hit all enemies inside the active zone! ...so you may target any of them. That's about it. Feel more confident?
jap: 戦闘時の技には、様々な こうかはんいがある。 まずは、モンスターを中心に 広がるダメージだ。 たとえば、こいつを ターゲットしていしたときは…… このハンイにいるモンスター つまりこの場合は2ヒキに ダメージをあたえる事ができる。 だがな、こいつを ターゲットしていすると…… このとおり、3ビキのモンスターに ダメージをあたえられる。 うまく使いな。 次に、自分から直線的に ダメージをあたえる場合。 これには2しゅるいのパターンがある。 1つめのパターンは…… 自分からまっすぐのびた直線上の モンスターこの場合は3ビキ全てに ダメージをあたえる。 この場合は直線上のどのモンスターに カーソルをもっていってももんだいない。 もう1つのパターンの場合は…… 自分とモンスターをむすぶ直線上の 敵だけにダメージをあたえる。 この場合は先ほどと同じく3ビキだが…… この場合は1ピキになるから 気をつけろ。 次はターゲットしていしたモンスターを ジクにして、ヨコ方向のモンスター全てに ダメージをあたえる。 この場合、ヨコならびなら…… 最後に自分を中心に ダメージをあたえるパターン。 まずこのように、はんい内にモンスターが いない場合は使えない。 はんい内にモンスターがいれば 自分を中心としたはんい内の全ての モンスターにダメージを あたえることができる。 どのモンスターにターゲットしていしても オーケーだ。 ってところかな。 べんきょうになったろ？
re: For techniques used during battle, there are various effect ranges. First, damage that spreads out centered on a monster. For example, when this one's designated target..... You can inflict damage to the monsters in this range, that is, two monsters in this case. But, designate this one target and...... As you can see, you can inflict damage on three monsters. Use it well. Next, the case where you inflict damage on a line from yourself. There are two types of patterns to this. The first pattern is...... You inflict damage on all monsters along a straight line from yourself, three in this case. In this case, no matter which monster along the line has the cursor, there's no problem. In the case of the other pattern...... You inflict damage only on the enemies on the line between you and the monster. This case, like before, is three monsters, but...... In this case, it becomes one monster, so be careful. Next, you make the monster designated as target an axis, and damage all the monsters crosswise from it. In this case, as long as they're in a horizontal line...... Finally, the pattern that inflicts damage with yourself at the center. First, in the case where there are no monsters in range, like this, you can't use it. If there are monsters in range, then you can inflict damage on all the monsters in the range centered on yourself. Whichever monster you designate target, it's okay. That's pretty much how it goes. Learned something, didn't you?

eng: Want my advice?
jap: わしの話を聞きたいかの？
re: Want to listen to what I have to say?

eng: Yes.
jap: はい
re: Yes

eng: You've got potential! You'll learn a number of «Techniques» as you progress! «Techniques» are magic attacks that also utilize your weapons. You'll acquire them with discipline. My, my! You're so enthusiastic! Use this to help you get started! A gift of 300 G!
jap: ふむ、お前さんはそしつがありそうじゃの。 お前さんは戦いを続けていくうちに 『技』を身につける事が出来るじゃろう。 技とは、おのれの武器をつかった とくしゅな攻撃法じゃ。 これは、おのれのたんれんでのみ身につく。 日々これ精進じゃ。 ほっほっほっ。 熱心なわかものじゃの！ よし、わしからのプレゼントじゃ。 これで装備でもととのえるとよかろう。 300Gを手に入れた！
re: Hmm, it seems that you have potential. As you continue fighting, you should be able to learn \"techniques\". Techniques are unique attack methods using your weapons. You will learn these only by your training. Focus on this daily. Ho, ho, ho. Zealous youngster! All right, a present from me. I hope you use this to ready yourself with some equipment or the like. Got 300G!

eng: No.
jap: いいえ
re: No

eng: Want to learn about damage in battle?
jap: 戦闘中に受けるダメージについて レクチャーしましょうか
re: Shall I lecture about the damage you take during combat?

eng: Some monsters have special attacks. Poison HP slowly decreases. Your attacks are weakened. Slow Increases the time between attacks. Sleep Lowers your guard. A good hit will wake you up again! Chaos Confuses you into attacking allies! A little tough on friendships! Blind You can't see too well... It's hard to hit enemies! Lock Can't use any «Techniques.» Stop Immobilizes and disables you. In these situations your guard is down, and you'll sustain more damage. Use «Heal,» or wait until the battle ends to heal automatically. Would you like to hear more?
jap: モンスターの攻撃には特別なダメージを あたえてくるものがあるわ…… 毒 HPが少しずつへっていくの。 このじょうたいでは 攻撃力も落ちるわ。 スロウ スピードがおそくなって、次の攻撃に すばやくうつれなくなるわ。 スリープ 眠ってしまって防御力が下がるの。 けど、攻撃を受けるとめざめるわ。 こんらん 自分が何をしてるのか わからなくなってしまうの。 味方を攻撃したりね。　コワいわよ。 ブラインド 回りがよく見えなくなって モンスターに攻撃をあてにくくなるわ。 ロック いっさいの技がつかえなくなるの。 ストップ これは動きが止まって 何もできなくなるわ。 これらのじょうたいの時は 防御力が落ちてダメージが大きくなるわ。 『ばんのうやく』などの体調回復アイテムで なおせるけど戦闘が終われば、アイテムを 使わなくても自然になおるのよ。 続き聞きます？
re: Some monster attacks inflict special damage...... Poison: Your HP gradually decreases. Your attack power also drops in this condition. Slow: Your speed slows, and you can't move on to your next attacks as quickly. Sleep: You fall sleep, and your defense drops. But take an attack and you'll wake up. Confusion: You don't know what you're doing any more. You'll do things like attacking allies. Scary! Blind: You can't see your surroundings well and have a hard time hitting monsters with attacks. Lock: You become unable to use any techniques. Stop: This is when your movement stops and you become unable to do anything. You defense power drops and damage increases when you're in these conditions. You can cure them with status recovery items such as the "panacea", but if combat ends, you get well naturally even without using items. Will you listen to the continuation?

eng: Yes.
jap: はい
re: Yes

eng: When your HP hits 0, you'll be disabled. Use «Revive» to restore yourself, but if everyone goes down, you're through. Be careful!
jap: モンスターの攻撃を受けて、HPが0に なると戦闘不能になっちゃうわ。 もちろん『アテナの水』とかのアイテムで 復活も出来るわよ。 けどね、みんなが戦闘不能になった時は 時のながれのわすれ物になっちゃうの…… 気をつけてね。
re: If your HP goes to 0 from taking monsters' attacks, you become incapacitated. Of course, you can revive too, with items like "Athena's water". But when everyone is incapacitated, you'll be lost in the flow of time...... Be careful.

eng: No.
jap: いいえ
re: No

eng: No
jap: いいえ
re: No

eng: Hold down the L and R Buttons to escape from battle! Know when to run! But you need to fight to grow strong! Now, about the Equip menu... Numbers next to the Sword and Shield icons indicate Attack and Defense power. The higher the number, the greater the power. «M. Def.» indicates your ability to block magic attacks. If it's 10, then magic damage will be reduced by 10%. A star after any characteristic means it's at maximum strength.
jap: LRを押し続けると戦闘から逃げる！！ こいつも大事だ。 戦術的てったいとでも言おうかな。 けどよ、逃げてばっかじゃ弱いままで 強くなれないから気をつけな。 それから、もう1つ。メニューの説明だ。 武器マークのヨコの数字は攻撃力。 たてマークのヨコの数字は防御力。 防御力は、なぐりや物理攻撃を どれだけふせぐかあらわす。 魔法をふせぐのは『まほうぼうぎょ』。 これがたとえば40だったら 敵の魔法を40パーセントふせぐ。 それと数字が星マークになったら そのパラメーターは最高ということだ。
re: Keep pressing L and R and you'll run from combat!! This's important too. I guess we'll call it a strategic retreat. But, look, keep running away, and you'll stay weak won't be able to get stronger, so be careful. And one more thing. Menu explanation. The number next to the weapon mark is attack power. The number next to the shield mark is defense power. Defense power indicates how well you defend against hits and physical attacks. It's “magic defense” that defends against magic. If, for example, that's 40, you'll defend 40 percent against enemy magic. Also, if the number becomes a star mark, it means that parameter is maximum.

eng: Sometimes a mysterious whirlpool appears in the ocean near here. What could cause that?
jap: この海いきに、なぞの大うずが 現われる時があるんだ……。 一体あのうずはなんなのだろう？
re: There are times when a mystery whirlpool appears in the ocean around here...... What the heck is that swirl?

eng: It's 10 G to Porre. Hop aboard? Yes. No.
jap: 船にのりますか？ パレポリまで10Gです。 はい いいえ

eng: If only Fritz would return. I'd ask for nothing more!

re: He...... Fritz is away on a journey, and hasn't come back...... Yet if he were here, I wouldn't need anything else......
RetranslatorComment: Or possibly “my boyfriend...”

eng: I guess he's forgotten me.
jap: もう私のことなんて……
re: I guess I don't matter any more......
RetranslatorComment: The verb's missing, but it's implied that he's forgotten about her or doesn't care any more. Or she could be saying it doesn't matter what happens to her as long as he's okay. That's the problem with these half-finished sentences... it would help if there was tone of voice to go by.

eng: Oh, hi Crono. Lucca's off at Leene Square with her father, Taban, unveiling her new invention.
jap: おや、クロノかい？ ルッカならお父さんのタバンと リーネ広場にいってるよ。 せいきの大発明を見せるんだとか 言ってね。
re: Oh, Crono? If it's Lucca, she's gone to Leene Square with her father, Taban. She said they were showing the great invention of the century or something.

eng: You're Lucca's friend right?
jap: おう！ ルッカの仲間達だな。
re: Oh! You're Lucca's companions.

eng: The forest leads north, to Guardia Castle.
jap: 森をぬけて北……　ガルディア城
re: North through the forest...... Guardia Castle

eng: Approaching Guardia Castle. No trespassing.
jap: この先、ガルディア城。 用のない者の出入りをきんずる。
re: Guardia Castle is ahead. Passage prohibited to those without business.

eng: An open field lies ahead.
jap: この先、空き地あり。
re: An open area is ahead.

eng: Who's there!
jap: 何者だ！
re: Who goes there!

eng: Can't let you through. Go check out the festival!
jap: 民間人を通すワケにいかん。 子供は祭りにでも行くんだな。
re: There's no way we can let civilians through. Go to the festival or something, kid.

eng: C'mon, let's check out the fair!
jap: な、何してんの？ 早くお祭り行こうよ！
re: Wh, what're you doing? Let's hurry up and go to the festival!
RetranslatorComment: If Marle's around.

eng: Going to the fair!
jap: ガルディア王国の千年祭に行くんだ！
re: I'm going to Guardia Kingdom's Millennial Festival!

eng: Always wanted to go to a 1000th Anniversary!
jap: 一度、千年祭とやらに行ってみようと 思っての～。
re: I've been thinking I'd try going to that Millennial Festival or whatever it's called once.

eng: Yea! A festival! Let's get crazy!
jap: わ～い！　お祭り、お祭り！
re: Yay! A festival, a festival!

eng: I'm opening a  stall at the fairgrounds. Why don't you drop by!?
jap: 千年祭の広場へ行って お店を出すつもりです。 あなたも、ぜひ私の店に来て下さい。
re: I intend to go to the Millennial Festival grounds and put up a store. Please be sure to come to my shop.

eng: All right, everyone! Let's have some fun!
jap: うおーっ、祭りだーっ！ ひごろのウサをわすれてガンガン飮むぞー！
re: Woohoo, it's a festival! I'm forgetting my usual gloom and tossing back some drinks!

eng: 20G in advance... Well?
jap: 20Gになるが…… とまって行くかね？
re: It's 20G...... Will you stay here?

eng: Yes
jap: はい
re: Yes

eng: Come again soon.
jap: またいつでも来なさい。
re: Come again any time.

eng: No
jap: いいえ
re: No

eng: Very well!
jap: ほうほう、そうかい！
re: Ho, ho, I see!

eng: The person I hate most? My dad, of course.
jap: この世で1番きらいな人？ もちろん父さんよ。
re: The person I hate most in this world? My father, of course.

eng: Dad loves money more than he loves me...
jap: お父さん、お金大好きなの…… 僕よりも……。
re: Dad loves money...... Even more than me......

eng: Everyone says Daddy's greedy. They're lying, right?
jap: みんなが、うちのパパはヨクバリだって 言うの……
re: Everyone theth daddy'th greedy...... It'th a lie, right?
RetranslatorComment: The 'little kid lisp'

eng: The children are slipping away from us. It's so sad...
jap: 子供たちの心がはなれていくのが とってもつらいんです……。
re: It's very painful that the children's hearts are moving away......

eng: Ha! I run this town! And I'm so rich I don't know what to do with it all!! Give you 10G if you act like a chicken!
jap: ガハハッ！ 俺は、この町の町長。 実は金持ちなんだよ！！ 3回まわってコケコッコーで 10Gやってもいいぞ？
re: Ga ha hah! I'm this town's mayor. The truth is, I'm rich!! I'll could give you 10G if you'll spin around 3 times and cock-a-doodle-doo, okay?

eng: Yes.
jap: やる
re: Do it

eng: No.
jap: やらない
re: Don't do it

eng: Bo-oring!
jap: つまらん。
re: Boring.

eng: HAAAHAHA! Here ya go, 10G!
jap: ガハハッ！ そーら10G！
re: Ga ha hah! There, 10G!

eng: Grandpa & Grandma went to the 1000th Anniversary in Truce. We're keeping an eye on things here!
jap: じいちゃんも、ばあちゃんも、みんな トルースの千年祭へ行っちゃって…… 私たちは、るす番ですよ。
re: Grandpa, grandma, they've all gone to Truce's Millennial Festival...... We're house-watching.

eng: I wanna go to the festival, too!
jap: わたしもお祭り行きた～い！
re: I wanna go to the festival too!

eng: Some monsters coexist with humans. Like that piano player.
jap: なかよく人とくらすモンスターもいるの。 あのピアノひきさんとかね。
re: Some monsters live with and get on well with humans. That piano player, for example.

eng: Everyone's over at the festival. What fools!
jap: みーんなトルースの千年祭へ 行っちまったよ。 ったく。　うかれやがって……　ゲプッ……
re: Eeeveryone's gone to Truce's Millennial Festival. I mean, come on, getting damn festive...... urp......

eng: 400 years ago a woman named Fiona died trying to save the great forest that once flourished to the north. How sad...
jap: 400年前、フィオナという女性が 北のあれた大地を森に変えようとして 死んでいった……悲しい話ですね……。
re: 400 years ago, a woman called Fiona died trying to turn the rough land to the north into forest...... it's a sad story......

eng: The piano man's got talent. Stop by and check...it...out!
jap: うちのピアノひきは腕がいいんだ。 ぜひ聞いていっておくれ！
re: Our piano player's skilled. Be sure to go listen!

eng: I'm the piano man [musicsymbol] Play a sad one, Joe! Something upbeat, please!
jap: お～いらは　ピアノひき～[note] かなしいやつ はでなやつ
re: I'm a piano player~[note] A sad one A flashy one

eng: I've got the best Jerky in town, but I'm saving it. I might let some go for, say, 9900G. How about it?
jap: とっておきの、ハイパーほしにくが あるんだけどねえ～ とっておきだからねえ～。 9900Gでなら考えてもいいな。 買うかい？
re: I've got Hyper Dried Meat set aside... And since it IS set aside... I could consider it, if it's for 9900G. Buy it?

eng: Yes.
jap: 買う
re: Yes

eng: You must be really hungry! Here you go!
jap: もの好きだよね～ そ～ら、ハイパーほしにくだ！
re: You're peculiar... There ya go, Hyper Dried Meat!

eng: No.
jap: やめとく
re: No

eng: Didn't think so...
jap: やっぱりね。
re: Thought so.

eng: A one-way ticket is 10G. Want one?
jap: 定期船に乗るなら10Gだよ。 チケット買うかい？
re: It's 10G if you're riding the ferry. Buy a ticket?

eng: Yes.
jap: はい
re: Yes

eng: Here you go. Have a nice day!
jap: はい。　これがチケットだ。 まいどあり！
re: Here. This is your ticket. Come again!

eng: No.
jap: いいえ
re: No

eng: But you'd love the trip! I guarantee it!
jap: 乗れば気分そうかい！ そんはしないと思うけどなあ……。
re: It feels great if you ride! I don't think it would hurt you......

eng: STATUS: Not enough cash.
jap: STATUS: お金が、たりないなあ
re: STATUS: You don't have enough money ...

eng: Not enough cash.
jap: お金が、たりないなあ……。
re: You don't have enough money......

eng: I take the ferry every chance I get!
jap: 定期船はいいわねえ。
re: The ferry's nice.

eng: Nothing like a ferry ride!
jap: 定期船はいいなあ……。
re: The ferry's nice......

eng: Welcome to the Millennial Fair! Have fun!
jap: おお、わか者よ！ 今日はわが王国の千年祭だ！ ぞんぶんに楽しんでゆかれよ。
re: Oh, the young! Today is our kingdom's Millennial Festival! Go enjoy it to your heart's content.

eng: Those runners are busy racing, so they won't talk to you.
jap: 走っている人はレース中よ。 話しかけても返事してくれないんだから。
re: The running people are in the middle of racing. They won't answer even if you talk to them.

eng: Press the A Button while facing the bell. Judge your distance carefully, and press the A Button again! Impressive! I'll put 1 Silver Point on your card!
jap: 正面にたってボタンを押しな。 動きだしたらタイミングよく Aボタンだ。 やったね！！ シルバーポイントカードに1ポイント ためておくよ！！
re: Stand in front and push the button. Once you start moving, hit the A button with good timing. You did it!! You collect one point on your silver point card!!

eng: Can't carry any more Silver Points.
jap: もうこれ以上シルバーポイントは ためられないよ。
re: You can't accumulate any more silver points than this.

eng: This Kingdom's been through a lot, like the war against Magus, 400 years ago. Thank goodness things are so peaceful now.
jap: 思い返せばこの国にもいろいろな事が あったからねえ……。 400年くらい前の魔王軍との あんたも今の平和にかんしゃしなよ。
re: Thinking back on it, a lot's happened to this country...... Like the war with Magus's army about 400 years You be thankful for the peace now too.

eng: I heard this guy pays big bucks for charms, weapons, pendants, and other rarities.
jap: ここのおじさん、アクセサリーなんかも 買い取ってくれるそうよ。 そうねェ……、ペンダントなんかも 売れるかしらねえ。
re: I hear this guy buys accessories and stuff too. Yeah...... I bet you could sell pendants and stuff too.

eng: What's the big deal? So what if we won a war against a Wizard hundreds of years ago!
jap: エヘヘ、ボク知ってるよ。 何びゃく年か昔、魔王軍と すごい戦いがあったんだって。 もしその戦いに負けてたら 今こんなお祭りはなかったって うちのママが言ってたよ。
re: Eh, heh, heh, I know about it. I heard there was an awesome battle with Magus's army hundreds of years ago. My mama says that if we'd lost that battle, there wouldn't be a festival like this now.

eng: The race is on. Be quiet and watch!
jap: レース中さ。 だまって見てな！
re: It's the middle of a race. Be quiet and watch!

eng: The Steel Runner might try something. I knew it! It's the Green Ambler! Catalack, you're a sure bet! Can't anyone beat G. I. Jogger?
jap: 今日のてっかめんランナーは 何かやらかす予感がするぜ。 うっちゃれダイナ…… ふっ……、俺が見込んだやつさ。 たのもしいぜ……、スイートキャット。 今のほいほいソルジャーの右に 出る者は……。
re: I get the feeling the Iron-Masked Runner's up to something today. Throw-Down Dina...... Phew...... I've got high hopes for you. Promising...... Sweet Cat. There's none above the Novice Soldier today......

eng: Last round's winner: ... Steel Runner! Last round's winner: ... Green Ambler. Last round's winner: ... Catalack. Last round's winner: ... G. I. Jogger.
jap: 前回の勝者は…… てっかめんランナーです。 前回の勝者は…… うっちゃれダイナです。 前回の勝者は…… スイートキャットです。 前回の勝者は…… ほいほいソルジャーです。
re: Last round's winner...... The Iron-Masked Runner. Last round's winner...... Throw-Down Dina. Last round's winner...... Sweet Cat. Last round's winner...... The Novice Soldier.
RetranslatorComment: Seems to be some  wordplay here, as the first part resembles a verb for 'abandon' or 'neglect'  and also a term that refers to a sumo throw-out-of-ring move and to sudden  reversals. I haven't paid much attention to the racers, but this one may tend  to have come-from-behind wins.

eng: That's great! I'll put your 20 Silver Points on the card!
jap: やったね！！ シルバーポイントカードに20ポイント ためておくよ！！
re: You did it!! You collect twenty points on your silver point card!!

eng: You can't earn any more points!
jap: もうこれ以上ポイントは
re: You can't accumulate any more points.

eng: This is the renowned «Tent of Horrors!» Spend your  [num8] Silver Points here! Parental discretion advised.
jap: 世にも恐ろしい見せ物小屋だよ。 あんたのシルバーポイント[value8]てんは この小屋の中でしか使えない。 勇気をためすかい？
re: This exhibition hut is feared the world over. There's nowhere to use your [value8] silver points except in this hut. Test your courage?
RetranslatorComment: The place doesn't seem to have a name.

eng: I'm Vicks.
jap: ビッグスです。
re: I'm Biggs.
RetranslatorComment: And unlike in FF6, his  name really is spelled with a 'g' sound here. He's probably 'Vicks' in the NA  version to match FF6, where 'Vicks' was probably never anything more than a  typo to begin with. Various sources, including Japanese Wikipedia, support 'Biggs'  as the correct name, after Biggs Darklighter from Star Wars.

eng: I'm Wedge.
jap: ウェッジです。
re: I'm Wedge.
RetranslatorComment: Presumably from Wedge Antilles of Star Wars.

eng: I'm Piette.
jap: ピエットです。
re: I'm Piett.
RetranslatorComment: Assuming he fits the Star  Wars pattern Biggs and Wedge start, he should be Piett (no ending 'e'), after  the Imperial admiral.

eng: Find Vicks. Find Wedge? Find Piette? [Vicks/Wedge/Piette] Is it THAT obvious?
jap: ビッグスは誰だ？ ウェッジは誰だ？ ピエットは誰だ？ [Vicks/Wedge/Piette] バレちゃいましたか？
re: Who's Biggs? Who's Wedge? Who's Piett? [Vicks/Wedge/Piette] I've been found out?

eng: It's a Poyozo doll. It'll spruce up your room!
jap: ポヨゾー人形。 お部屋にかざってね。
re: A poyozo doll. Decorate your room.

eng: Mimic what you see! L...Left Arm   R...Right Arm Y...Laugh        A...Surprise! Start when you hear the signal. And...action! Excellent! The Clone will be at  [member1]'s house.
jap: 分身のマネをしろ！ L…左手あげ　R…右手あげ Y…わらい　　A…ビックリだ。 ヒュッ　……と音がなったら ドッペル　ゴー！ 見事にドッペルった！ このドッペル人形 [pc1]の家に送っておくよ。
re: Mimic your clone! L...raise left hand   R...raise right hand Y...laugh               A...surprise Mimic once the 'hyu' noise sounds. Dopple GO! Magnificently doppled! I'll send this dopple-doll to [pc1]'s house.
RetranslatorComment: Clone is 'bunshin', one  of those lovely vague terms that doesn't translate well. Or whatever you want to  call the noise the game makes when the clone picks a pose.

eng: Monsters are closing in! Throw your pack against them and push them back into the cage! A hostage will be slowly lowered into the flames! To save the day, you must hit the blue light, to raise the rope. Defeat all monsters before the hostage's goose is cooked! Well done! Take this cat! Cat food... I'll leave it at Crono's house, so his cat won't run away.
jap: モンスターが下にせまってくる。 パックをモンスターにぶつけてオリの 中まで追い返せ！ 人質をもらっていくよ。 人質は上からつるされ、ほのおの上に ズリズリっと下ろされていく。 あおい光にぶつかれば、人質の 命がわずかにのびる。 人質を殺さないようにモンスター をたいじしな！ みごと！！ ネコちゃんプレゼント。 ネコのえさ。 クロノの家に送っておくよ。 おなかへらすとネコは逃げちゃうからな。
re: Monsters are closing in. Knock the puck at the monsters and drive them into the cage! I'm taking a hostage. The hostage will be suspended from above and lowered into the flames. If you hit the blue light, the hostage's life will be slightly prolonged. Exterminate the monsters so I don't kill the hostage! Well done!! I present you with a cat. Cat food. I'll send it to Crono's house. Cats run away when they get hungry.
RetranslatorComment: It's not really clear who's doing the killing.

eng: Keep going if you want to demo Lucca's robot battle trainer! Collect Silver Points if you win!
jap: ルッカが開発した2足ほ行ロボット ゴンザレスと戦いたいかたはこの奥へ！ 勝てばシルバーポイントもらえるよ！！
re: Those who want to fight with Gonzales, the bipedal robot that Lucca developed, head in here! You can get silver points if you win!!

eng: They call me Gato [musicsymbol] I have metal joints [musicsymbol] Beat me up [musicsymbol] And earn 15 Silver Points [musicsymbol]
jap: あ～　ゴンザ～レス[note] オ～レは　強い[note] オ～レに勝ったら 15ポイント～！！[note]
re: Ah~, Gonza~les[note] I~'m strong[note] If you beat m~e 15 point~s!![note]

eng: You're so weak [musicsymbol] And I'm so strong [musicsymbol] I punched your lights out [musicsymbol] Now run along [musicsymbol] [musicsymbol]
jap: あ～んたは　弱い[note] オ～レは　強い[note] それじゃあ　あんたは へなちょ～こ～さ～！！[note]
re: You~'re weak[note] I~'m strong[note] So you're A ne~w~b!![note]
RetranslatorComment: Internet jargon dictates  that a 'newb' is simply 'new' and lacking experience, while a 'noob' or  'n00b' has... serious maturity issues, to put it nicely. HEEL PLZ!!!1!!

eng: I lost [musicsymbol] You won [musicsymbol] Here's 15 Points [musicsymbol] Now wasn't that fun!? [musicsymbol]
jap: あ～んたは　強い[note] あ～んたは　す～ごい[note] だ～から　あげるよ 15ポイント～！！[note]
re: You~'re strong[note] You~'re amazing[note] So~ I give you 15 point~s!![note]

eng: I hate fairs! Say, do you know the latest gossip?
jap: ふォふォふォ　祭りは楽しいのう。 ところであんた知ってるかね？
re: Ho, ho, ho, festivals are such fun. By the way, have you heard?

eng: Yes.
jap: はい
re: Yes

eng: Just between us, I heard that the King is distressed over his tomboy of a daughter! Just once, I would like to see how wild she really is!
jap: ここだけの話、わが国の王、ガルディア王は 娘のおてんばぶりに頭をかかえている そうじゃ。 しかしどこまでおてんばなのか いっぺんその王女様とやらを見てみたい もんじゃのう。
re: Just between us, our country's king, King Guardia, is at a loss over his daughter acting like a tomboy, or so I hear. But I'd like to see just how much of a tomboy that Princess is some time.

eng: No.
jap: いいえ
re: No

eng: Then scram!
jap: そうか……、だったらええわい。
re: I see...... okay then.

eng: After pressing the B Button and dashing here and there, I'm pooped! But this dance has rejuvenated me!
jap: Bボタンダッシュで走り回ってたら つかれちゃった。 でも踊りを見たらまた元気だよ！
re: I got tired out from running around with the B button dash. But since watching the dance, I'm energetic again!

eng: A prehistoric dance. How enchanting!
jap: 大昔の踊りなんですって。 しんぴてきよね～！
re: They say it's a dance from the distant past. Such mystique!

eng: Jurassic rhythm
jap: 原始の～　リズム～[note]
re: Primeval~ rhythm~[note]

eng: Catchy rhythm! Use the X, Y, L, and R buttons to dance!
jap: あついリズムだね！ あんたも、XYLRボタンで踊りなよ！
re: Hot rhythm! You dance too, with the X, Y, L, and R buttons!

eng: Ladeedadeeda! Got some spending money from the Elder!
jap: ランラ～ランララ～！ 町長さんの家で、おこづかいもらったの！
re: Lan la~ lan la la~! I got spending money from the elder's house!

eng: Hey!!
jap: キャッ！
re: Kyah!

eng: Ouch, that hurt!
jap: いったー……
re: Owww......

eng: I'm so sorry! Are you okay?
jap: ゴ、ゴメンなさい！ だいじょうぶ？
re: I, I'm sorry! Are you okay?

eng: Uh oh... My pendant!
jap: ア、アラ？ ペンダントが……。
re: H, huh? My pendant......

eng: Oh, no! Don't tell me I lost it!
jap: た、大変！ なくしちゃったのかしら？
re: Th, this is awful! Could I have lost it?

eng: Oh, come on! I don't know anyone around here! Please! Ok. No.
jap: そんなー！　か弱い女のコを 助けると思って、お願いッ([heart]) はい いいえ
re: No way! I thought you'd help out a frail little girl, please ([heart]) Yes. No.

eng: You're a true gentleman!
jap: わーい、やったーッ！
re: Yaaay, all right!

eng: Oh, by the way... My name is, er...
jap: あ、名前言ってなかったね。 え、えーと私は……
re: Ah, I haven't told you my name. Uh, ummm, I'm......

eng: ...um, Marle! And you're?
jap: マールって言うの。 あなたは？
re: I'm Marle. And you?

eng: Crono? What a nice name! Pleased to meet you! Now, lead on!
jap: クロノか、いい名前だね！ よろしくね、クロノ！ さ、早く行こう！
re: Crono? That's a good name! Nice to meet you, Crono! C'mon, let's go, quick!

eng: My, how nice! I've only seen you with Lucca! Who's your pretty new friend?
jap: あら、ルッカ以外の女の子を 連れて来るなんて、めずらしいわね。 お名前は？
re: Oh my, it's unusual for Crono to do something like brining along a girl besides Lucca. What's your name?

eng: Hi, I'm Marle!
jap: はじめまして！ マールです。
re: It's nice to meet you! I'm Marle.

eng: Eh?! Marle? ...? I'm sure I've seen you before, dear! Now, where was that...?
jap: えっ？　マールさん？ ……？ どこかでお会いしてません？ おかしいわね、気のせいかしら。
re: Huh? Marle-san? ......? Haven't I met you somewhere? That's funny, I wonder if it's my imagination.

eng: [num8] ounces of cat food.
jap: ネコのえさ [value8]　グラム
re: Cat food: [value8] grams.

eng: You have {value 8} Silver Points.{full break} Want to exchange 10 Silver Points for 50 G?
jap: 今あなたのシルバーポイントは [value8]　てん。 シルバーポイント10Pを50Gに かえるかい？
re: You currently have [value8] silver points. Change in 10 silver points for 50G?

eng: Yes.
jap: はい
re: Yes

eng: Come again.
jap: まいど。
re: Come again.

eng: No.
jap: いいえ
re: No

eng: Not enough Silver Points.
jap: ポイントたりないね。
re: Not enough points.

eng: They're still setting up. Why don't you come back in a while?
jap: この先じゅんび中さ。 広場で一通りあそんでからまた来な。
re: They're in the middle of setting up ahead. Come again after having a look around the square.

eng: No time to talk. I'm just sitting down for my lunch.
jap: そのつつみはオラの母ちゃんのべんとうだ。 元気モリモリ！　オラまいにち楽しみに してんだ。
re: That bundle's my mommy's lunch. Packed with energy! I look forward to it every day.
RetranslatorComment: I didn't realize at first  that the bundle was his lunch in the NA version. I figured he was carrying  his lunch with him, since he's obviously not sitting down. The old man with the  lunch comically notes that his "mommy" made it for him. This is  echoed when he complains and whines in the trial of Crono if Crono devoured  it.

eng: Yum! Tastes like chicken!
jap: おべんとうを食べ元気になった！！
re: Ate the lunch and became healthy!!
RetranslatorComment: Lunch is bentou (sort of a boxed lunch).

eng: Hee, hee. You're such a pig, Crono!
jap: (うふふ)。 クロノって食いしんぼね！
re: (giggle) Crono, you're a pig!
RetranslatorComment: Not literally pig, but you know what she means.

eng: Wahhh! Where's my cat?!!
jap: わーん！ わたちのネコが……。
re: Waah! My cat......

eng: You brought back my cat! Thank you!
jap: わたちのネコちゃん、連れて来てくれて ありがとう。
re: Thanks for bringing me back my kitty.

eng: You're so sweet, Crono!
jap: クロノ、やっさしい！
re: Crono, you're nice!

eng: It's a soda guzzling contest! Press the A Button as fast as you can! Ready? Set? Go!
jap: となりに立ちな！　飮みくらべ！ Aボタンれんだだ！ よーい　どん！！
re: Stand next to me! Compete in drinking! Mash the A button! Ready... GO!!

eng: Only  [num8] cans? Is that the best you can do?!
jap: [value8]本か。 まだまだだな！
re: [value8]? You've got a ways to go!

eng: Not too shabby!
jap: やるねえ！
re: Not bad!

eng: You're too much, kid!
jap: あんたとは飮めないな。
re: I can't drink with you.

eng: Not bad! I'll put 5 Silver Points on your card.
jap: やったね！！ シルバーポイントカードに5ポイント ためておくよ！！
re: You did it!! You collect five points on your silver point card!!

eng: You're awfully competitive, aren't you, Crono?
jap: 何にでも いっしょうけんめいなのね。 クロノは。
re: You give your all no matter what you're doing, don't you, Crono.
RetranslatorComment: The Japanese version's way of speaking about Crono makes him look like a passionate person rather than one who suffers from an inferiority complex.

eng: Buy something from Melchior, the swordsmith? Sure. No thanks.
jap: 「この刀かじボッシュの作った剣でも 買って行かんか？ 買う いらない
re: Buy a sword that I, the swordsmith Bosch, made? Buy Don't need it

eng: By the way... Could you talk that young lady into selling her pendant? I'll try. No.
jap: ところで後ろのおなごのペンダント。 売ってくれるように 話をつけてくれんかね？ はい いいえ
re: By the way, the pendant the girl behind you has. Could you talk her into selling it? Yes No

eng: Oh, my! It's...the pendant...! Er, sorry, but I can't buy that! It's...far too special! Keep it safe!
jap: おお！　よく見れば、そのペンダントは…… あんたが大事にとっておきなされ。
re: Oh! On a closer look, that pendant...... You take good care of it.

eng: I live on the continent to the east. Come see me sometime...
jap: ワシゃ東の大陸に住んどる。 何かの時は立ち寄るがよい。
re: I live on the eastern continent. Stop by some time.

eng: This is Leene Square. They say people who hear Leene's Bell ring will have interesting and happy lives!
jap: ここはリーネ広場。 リーネの鐘の音を聞けばしあわせに なれるって言い伝えがありまちゅ。
re: This is Leene Square. There's a legend that says if you hear the sound of Leene's bell, you'll be able to live happily ever after.

eng: Crono... I'm having a great time!
jap: しあわせ！ クロノとこうしているの。
re: I'm happy! I'm with Crono like this.

eng: Lucca's device is all set up. She's at the north end of the Square.
jap: ルッカの発明がもう完成したよ。 広場をずうっと奥へ行った所だよ。
re: Lucca's invention's ready now. It's waaay in the back of the square.

eng: I heard Lucca and her dad have made another crazy invention. Hope it doesn't blow up like all the others! They ought to be ready now. Make for the far side of the Square.
jap: ルッカがまた、かじやの親父さんと 怪しげな発明品を作ってるそうね。 こないだみたく、いきなりドカン！ てな事にならなきゃいいわねえ。 もう完成しているころじゃない？ 広場をずうっと奥へ行った所よ。
re: I hear Lucca's made another questionable invention with her blacksmith father. Hope it doesn't suddenly go BOOM! like that other one did. Isn't it about time for them to be ready? It's waaay in the back of the square.
RetranslatorComment: Yay! Taban's a  blacksmith. I guess that explains why he keeps making Lucca armor.

eng: This is going to be fun! Come on, Crono!
jap: へー、面白そうじゃない。 連れてってよ、クロノ！
re: Hmmm, sounds interesting. Take me there, Crono!

eng: Hold your horses! I want to get some candy.
jap: 待って！！ キャンディ買っていくわ！
re: Wait up!! I'm gonna go buy some candy!

eng: Give me just a second!
jap: ちょっと待ってて 急がないでよ！
re: Hold on a minute, don't rush!

eng: There's no need to drag me by the arm like some kidnapper!
jap: 人さらいってわけじゃ あるまいし。
re: It's not like you're a kidnapper. Don't drag my arm like that!

eng: Hi! I'd like some of this.
jap: おばさん これちょうだい！
re: Miss, this one please!

eng: Sure, young lady.
jap: あいよ。
re: Gotcha.

eng: Thanks for waiting!
jap: おまたせ！
re: Thanks for waiting!

eng: Step right on up, any of you who have the time and the courage! Our «Super Dimension Warp» is the invention of the century!
jap: さあさあ、お時間と勇気のある方は お立会い！ これこそ、せいきの大発明！ 超次元物質転送マシン1号だ！！
re: Come, come, those with time and bravery witness it! THIS is the great invention of the century! It's the Ultra Dimensional Matter-Transfer

eng: To use it, jump up here...
jap: 早い話が こっちに乗っかると
re: In short, when you get on over here,

eng: ...and you'll get teleported here! It's the masterwork of my beautiful daughter, Lucca.
jap: こっちに転送されるって 夢の様な装置だあ！
re: You're transferred to over here. It's a dreamlike device!

eng: Check out that girl's glasses!
jap: 転送って何だ？
re: What's “transfer”?
RetranslatorComment: Glasses insults are an invention.

eng: She could probably see the back side of the moon with those.
jap: 物がまたたく間にいどうするって話じゃ。
re: They speak of moving things in the blink of an eye.

eng: Lucca's inventions never work right.
jap: ルッカの発明の事だから また何か……。
re: It's Lucca's invention we're talking about, so something will......

eng: Give it a try, kid? ...Oh, it's you, Crono!
jap: おッ？　兄ちゃん やるのかい？
re: Oh? You gonna do it, boy? ......oh, it's you, Crono.

eng: Crono!
jap: クロノ！
re: Crono!

eng: Where have you been!? No one wants to try the Telepod! How about you?
jap: 待ってたわよ！ だーれも、このテレポッドの転送に こうなったら、あんたやってくれない？
re: I was waiting for you! Nooo one will brave this Telepod's transmission. Won't you do it now that it's come to this?

eng: It looks like fun! I'll watch while you try it out!
jap: 面白そう！ やってみなよ。　私見ててあげる！
re: It looks fun! Try doing it. I'll be watching!

eng: Just hop onto the left pod!
jap: 左のポッドにのればいいのよ。
re: Just get on the left pad.

eng: Don't worry, we tried it on our pets! There's no reason why it shouldn't work as well on humans! So, step right up!
jap: なーんにもこわい事ないぜ。 ネコではうまくいったんだ。 まだ人間ではためしてないけど……。
re: There's not a THING scary about it. It worked fine with cats. Though we haven't tried on humans yet......

eng: All systems on!
jap: スイッチオン！
re: Switch on!

eng: Begin energy transfer!
jap: エネルギーじゅうてん開始！
re: Energy loading beginning!

eng: Oh wow. That was GREAT!
jap: おおーッ！！ グレイト！！
re: Ohhhh!! Great!!

eng: So, how was it? Want to try it again?
jap: どう、おどろいた？ 何だったらもう一度やる？
re: How was it, were you surprised? You can do it again, if you want?

eng: It...WORKED?! I CAN'T BELIEVE IT! Uh, er, a thrilling display of science at its best, ladies and gentlemen!
jap: 本当にうまくいった！？ めずらしい事も…… コ、コホン！ いやいや、ルッカの発明だから 当然！　すごいだろう！
re: It really went well!? Even rarities can happ...... C, cough! No, no, it's Lucca's invention, so naturally! Great, right!

eng: I guess even HER inventions have to work, sometimes.
jap: ルッカの発明もたまには 成功するのね。
re: Even Lucca's inventions succeed once in a while.

eng: Wow!
jap: 本当じゃ！
re: It's true!

eng: What a kick! I want to try it, too!
jap: 面白そうね、私もやる！
re: It looks fun, I'll do it too!

eng: Huh?
jap: へ？
re: Huh?

eng: Hey Crono, how did you pick up a cutie like her?
jap: ちょ、ちょっとクロノ あんたいつの間に、こんなカワイイ子 口説いたのよ。
re: H, hold on, Crono. Just when did you seduce such a cute girl?

eng: Hang on, Crono! I'll be right there!
jap: ね、いいでしょクロノ？ ここで待ってて。 どこにも行っちゃやだよ！
re: Hey, you don't mind, right, Crono? Wait here. Don't go anywhere!

eng: Behold, ladies and gentlemen, as this vision of loveliness steps aboard the machine!
jap: さあさあ、ちょう戦するのは何と こんなにカワイらしい娘サンだ！ ささ、どーぞこちらへ！
re: Well, well, the one who braves it is such a lovely young woman! Come, come, this way please!

eng: Don't go away. I'll be right back!
jap: エヘヘ。 じゃ、ちょっと行ってくるね！
re: (giggle) Well, be right back!

eng: You're sure about this...? There's still time to change your mind!
jap: だいじょぶかい？ やめるんだったら今のうちだぜ。
re: Is this okay? If you're quitting, now's the time for it.

eng: No way! Throw the switch!
jap: へっちゃらだよ！ 全然こわくなんかないもん。
re: No problem! It's not like it's scary or anything.

eng: Okay, everyone, let's give her a great big hand when she reappears!
jap: それでは　みなさん！ このカワイイ娘サンが見事 消えましたら、はくしゅかっさい。
re: Well then, everyone! When this cute young woman beautifully vanishes, let's have some applause.

eng: What's happening? My pendant...it's...
jap: 何これ？ ペンダントが……。
re: What's this? My pendant......

eng: Huh?
jap: えッ！？
re: Huh!?

eng: Lucca! Where is she?!
jap: おい、ルッカ 出て来ねーぞ？
re: Hey, Lucca, she's not coming out, you know?

eng: Show's over, folks! Let's head along now!
jap: ハ、ハイ！　ごらんの通り影も形も ありません！ こ、これにてオシマイ！！
re: Y, yes! As you can see, she's vanished without a trace! Sh, show's over!!

eng: What's going on Lucca? WHERE IS SHE?
jap: おい、ルッカ！ 一体どうなってんだ？ あのコはどうしちまったんだ！？
re: Hey, Lucca! What the hell's going on? What happened to that girl!?

eng: The way she disappeared... It couldn't have been the Telepod! The warp field seemed to be affected by her pendant...
jap: あのコの消え方 テレポッドの転送の消え方じゃない。 あの空間のゆがみ方…… ペンダントが反応していたようにも… もっと別の……何かが……。
re: The way that girl vanished isn't the way things vanish with the Telepod's transfer. The way space warped...... The pendant seemed like it was reacting... And another...... something......

eng: What are we going to do now?
jap: どうしたらいいんだい？ 助けることは？
re: What should we do? About helping her?

eng: She's so familiar! I KNOW I've seen her somewhere...
jap: あのコは…… ……んっ？　そういえばあのコ どこかで見たことがあるような？
re: That girl...... ......hm? Come to think of it, it feels like I've seen that girl somewhere?

eng: Crono! You brought her here, YOU get her back!
jap: ちょ、ちょっとクロノ！ あのコ、あんたが連れて来たのよ！ どこ行こーってのよ！
re: H, hey, Crono! You brought that girl here! Where do you think you're going!

eng: Crono!
jap: クロノ！
re: Crono!

eng: You're actually going to do it?! What a fine lad!
jap: おーッ！ 後を追うってのかクロノ。 さすがは男だぜ！
re: Ohh! So you mean you're going after her, Crono. That's a man for you!

eng: Listen! I don't know where this machine is going to send you, but we haven't any other choice.
jap: そうね！ あの空間の先に何があるのかわからない けど、それ以外に方法はなさそうね。
re: That's right! Though we don't know what's beyond that space, it looks like there's no way but that.

eng: Won't they both be lost?
jap: でも、都合よくまた あなが現れるとはかぎらないぜ。
re: But the hole won't necessarily conveniently appear again.

eng: This is our only hope! That pendant seems to be the key, so hang on to it Crono, and brace yourself!
jap: やってみるかちはあるわ！ きっとペンダントがキーに なってるのよ！ クロノ！ しっかりそれをにぎってて。 きっと同じ事が起こるはずよ！
re: It's worth trying!   The pendant has definitely become the key!     Crono!     Hold on to it tight, and the same thing should     definitely happen!

eng: Power to full!
jap: もっと出力をあげて！！
re: Raise the output more!!

eng: Roger!
jap: あいさ！！
re: Gotcha!!

eng: More! Give me more power!
jap: もっと！もっと！
re: More! More!

eng: There! We did it!
jap: ビンゴ！！ うまくいきそうよ！！
re: Bingo!!     It looks like it's going to go well!!

eng: I'll follow you after I know what went wrong. Good luck, Crono!
jap: 私も原因を究明したら 後を追うわ！ たのんだわよ、クロノ！
re: Once I investigate the cause, I'll follow     after you too!     I'm counting on you, Crono!

eng: The Queen Returns
jap: 帰ってきた王妃
re: The Queen who Returned

eng: A Millennial Fair? Here? What ARE you talking about? It's the year 600, and the 21st King of Guardia reigns.
jap: 千年祭？　建国1000年？ こんなひるまから何ねぼけてるんだい？ 今は建国600年、ガルディア21世が 国をおさめてるじゃないか。
re: Millennial Festival? 1000th year since founding? Why're you still half-asleep at this time of day? It's the 600th year since founding, and Guardia the 21st is governing the country, right?

eng: We've been at war for years. When will it end?
jap: 魔王軍と王国軍の戦いが始まってから もう何年もたつ……。 一体この戦はいつまで続くのだろう……。
re: It's been years already since the battle between Magus's army and the kingdom's started...... Just how long will this war continue......?

eng: That'll be 10 G. Register?
jap: おとまりですか？ 10Gになりますが？
re: Are you staying? It's 10G.

eng: Yes.
jap: はい
re: Yes

eng: Welcome!
jap: いらっしゃいませ。
re: Welcome.

eng: No.
jap: いいえ
re: No

eng: «Where am I?» Are you stupid? THIS is the kingdom of Guardia! We're battling Magus's army. You DID know that, right?
jap: ここはどこだと？　バカ者！！ わがガルディア王国を知らぬわけは あるまいっ！ わが国は、いま平和をとりもどすため 魔王軍と日夜戦っているのだ。 そのくらいは知っておるであろう？
re: “Where is this?” Idiot!! There's no way you don't know about our Guardia Kingdom! Our kingdom is currently fighting day and night against Magus's army to take back peace. You at least know that much, don't you?

eng: Of course.
jap: はい
re: Yes

eng: Then shut your pie hole!
jap: ならば！　ここはどこだなど ねぼけたことをいうのはやめるのだな。
re: In that case! Quit asking things like where this is like you're half asleep.

eng: No.
jap: いいえ
re: No

eng: Lovely... We NEED more ignorant strangers around here...
jap: なんと！　それも知らぬとは……。 もしかして、おぬし旅の者か？ ふむ。　それならばしかたがないか。
re: What! To not know even that...... Could you be a traveler? Hmm. Then I guess you can't help it.

eng: Millennial Fair? What? Are you crazy?! What nonsense!
jap: 建国のお祭り？　なに言ってんだ！ 今、それどこじゃねーだろ！！
re: National foundation festival? What're you saying! Now's no time for that, is it!!
RetranslatorComment: Taking context into  account, he's saying that the thought of having a festival in the middle of a  brutal war is laughable.

eng: The Magus's army destroyed Zenan Bridge, so the south continent is inaccessible.
jap: ゼナンにかかる橋は、魔王軍に 壊されてしまったよ。 当分、南の大陸へはわたれないって事だな。
re: The bridge across Zenan was destroyed by Magus's army. Which means we can't cross to the southern continent for now.

eng: What a relief! They finally found Queen Leene wandering up in the mountains! She must be glad to be home! The Queen has been through a lot! She's babbling about the oddest thing.
jap: いやもう、うれしくって！ ずっと、いなくなっていたリーネ王妃が 裏山で見つかったんですよっ！ 今ごろは、お城に戻られて ホッとしているころだろうな。 でもリーネ王妃は、どういうわけか わけのわからない事を口走っているとか…… よっぽど、こわい思いをされたんだな。
re: Wow, this is great! Queen Leene, who was long missing, was found in the back hills! She's probably been returned to the castle by now, and it's about time to feel relieved. But I hear Queen Leene's blurting out some kind of nonsense for whatever reason...... She must have had quite a fright.

eng: Everyone was worried! The King freaked when the Queen took off. We all thought Magus had grabbed her. Thank goodness she's safe!
jap: いやはや一時はどうなることかと……。 リーネ王妃がいなくなって 王様は何も手につかなくなるし。 魔王のしわざじゃないかって 兵士たちに国中を探させていたんですよ。 しかし、見つかってよかった！
re: Amazing what can happen in such a short time...... Queen Leene disappeared, and the King couldn't focus on anything else. Thinking it might have been Magus's doing, he had the soldiers searching the whole kingdom. But it's a good thing she was found!

eng: Are you a stranger here, too? I'm Toma, the explorer. If you're buying, I'll tell you a story. How about it?
jap: あんたもヨソ者かい？ 俺は探検家のトマってんだ。 いっぱいおごってくれるんなら いいネタをやるぜ。 どーだい？
re: Are you an outsider too? I'm Toma the explorer. If you treat me to a drink, I'll give you some good info. How 'bout it?

eng: Sure.
jap: おごる
re: Treat him

eng: No.
jap: おごらない
re: Don't treat him

eng: Cider please!
jap: おやじ、酒！！
re: Old man, sake!!

eng: Thanks! It's about the missing Queen. She disappeared while visiting that cathedral to the west, and... Beg your pardon? WHAT?! They FOUND her? Never mind...
jap: こいつはすまねえな。　さて……。 リーネ様が、いなくなったって 話だが…… 俺は西のほうにできたという あの修道院があやしいと 思っているんだ。 え？　リーネ王妃はとっくに 裏山の方で見つかったって？ ふーむ……　そうだったのか……。
re: Thanks for that. Now...... The story is Leene-sama went missing...... I think that abbey they say was built to the west is suspicious. Huh? You say Queen Leene was already found in the back hills? Hmmm...... So that was it......

eng: I was sure there was something fishy about that cathedral...
jap: 俺は、西にたてられたという あの修道院が、ぜったいに あやしいと思っていたんだがな。
re: I thought for sure that abbey they say was built in to west was suspicious.

eng: So, you think I'm a beggar, huh?! Well, scram!
jap: そーかい。　俺は物ごいじゃねえ。 無理にとは言わねーよ。
re: I see. I'm no beggar. I won't force you.

eng: How rude…
jap: ちょっとすまねえな。
re: 'Scuse me.

eng: I'm Banta, the blacksmith. I'm forging a bell for the King to present to his beloved Queen Leene! I lost it when the Queen disappeared. I just couldn't keep working on the But now it's back to business as usual!
jap: 俺は、かじ屋のバンタ。 ガルディア王にたのまれて、王様から リーネ様への愛のあかし『リーネの鐘』を 作ってるのさ。 しかしよ、一時はどうなるかと思ったよ。 リーネ王妃になにかあったら、鐘だなんて 言ってられないからな。 裏山で見つかった、リーネ王妃も無事 お城に戻られたというし。俺も安心して しごとに戻ったってわけよ。
re: I'm the blacksmith Banta. I'm making “Leene's Bell” as requested by King Guardia, proof of the King's love for Queen Leene. But for a while, I wasn't sure what would happen. When something happened to Queen Leene, we couldn't be talking about BELLS. They say Queen Leene was found in the back hills and safely returned to the castle. So I'm relieved too, and back to my work.

eng: My husband wants a daughter who is as intelligent as she is beautiful.
jap: さいしょくけんびの娘をもつのが 夢なんですって。
re: He says it's his dream to have a daughter gifted with both intelligence and beauty.

eng: No window shoppers! Whaddaya want? Thanks. See ya.
jap: せっかく来たんだ、見るだけじゃなくて ぜひ買っていってくれ。 まいど！ また来てくれよな。
re: You've gone to all the trouble of coming, so don't just look, be sure and buy something. Thanks! Come again.

eng: You're going to fight Magus's army? Wonderful! But remember to equip yourself with the weapons you buy!
jap: そうか。　お前も武器を手にして 魔王軍と戦おうというのだな。 それはなかなかいい心がけだ。 しかし武器や防具は買うだけでは ダメだぞ！ その後、装備してこそ意味があると いうものだ。
re: I see. You intend to take up arms and fight Magus's army too. That's quite a good attitude. But just buying weapons and armors won't cut it! It's only once you equip them afterwards that it means anything.

eng: This bridge is being fixed because Magus's Army trashed it. But until Sir Cyrus returns, we'll fight Magus's Army, tooth and nail!
jap: この橋は、魔王軍にこわされて 修理中だ。 しかし、サイラス様が戻られるまで、 我らが手で王国を死守するのだ！
re: This bridge was destroyed by Magus's army and is under repair. However, until Cyrus-sama returns, we will protect the kingdom by our hands, unto death!

eng: The monster dropped a Shelter!
jap: モンスターがシェルターを落としていった！
re: The monster dropped a Shelter and left!

eng: Dead end ahead.
jap: この先、行き止まり。
re: A dead end is ahead.

eng: Halt! Who goes there!
jap: 何者だ！
re: Who goes there!

eng: Check out that hair! Where're you from, son? Are you one of Magus's troopers?
jap: 見かけんヤツだな。 大体なんだ、そのかっこうは？ もしや魔王軍の手先？
re: I've never seen this guy. And what's with that getup? Maybe he works for Magus's army?

eng: Hardly! This kid never would have made the cut! Show us your stamp collection, son!
jap: と、こんな弱々しいヤツが 魔王軍という事もあるまい。
re: But I doubt such a frail guy would be in Magus's army.

eng: Stop that at once!
jap: 「おやめなさい！
re: 'Stop!

eng: Queen Leene!
jap: リ、リーネ王妃様！
re: Qu, Queen Leene-sama!

eng: Show your manners! This is a friend of mine!
jap: その方は私がお世話になったお方。 客人として、もてなしなさい。
re: That person is one to whom I am indebted. Make him welcome, as a guest.

eng: But there's something odd about him!
jap: しかし、こんな怪しい……
re: But, such a suspicious......

eng: You refuse to obey my orders?!
jap: 私の命が聞けないと？
re: Do you mean won't obey my orders?

eng: Forgive me, my lady! Please enter, Sir!
jap: めっそうもありません！ どうぞお通りを！
re: That is surely not the case! By all means, pass!

eng: Giggle...
jap: フフ……。

eng: Please pardon us! We revere our Queen's guests!
jap: 王妃様の客人とは知らず失礼いたしました。
re: Pardon me, I did not know you were the Queen's guest.

eng: I envy you, whom the Queen calls friend!
jap: 王妃様とお近づきになれるなんて ラッキーなヤツだな。
re: You're a lucky guy, being able to get close to the queen.

eng: King Guardia the XXI is in the throne room.
jap: この先にガルディア王21世がおわします。
re: King Guardia the 21st is in here.

eng: Mind your manners!
jap: くれぐれも、失礼のないようにな。
re: Make absolutely certain not to be impolite.

eng: Sir! I understand that you are the one who saved my dear wife, the Queen! But can you tell me what happened? Leene's acting rather odd. And she seems to have lost her coral pin, which is something she guarded with her life... Forgive me! You must be tired. We can talk about this later. Please rest in the Knights quarters, downstairs, to the left.
jap: おお、そなたか。 リーネが外で世話になったというのは。 心から礼を言うぞ！ しかし外で何があったのだ？ リーネの様子がどうもおかしいのだ。 いつも身につけていたサンゴの かみかざりも、なくしていたようだし。 あれほど大事にしていたというに……。 いや、失礼。 そなたの事、騎土団長に話しておこう。 左地下の騎土団の部屋で休んでくれ。
re: Oh, it's you? Leene said she became indebted to you out there. I thank you from my heart! But what happened out there? Leene hasn't been quite her usual self. She seems to have even lost the coral hair ornament she always wore, for one thing. For something she treasured that much...... No, excuse me. I shall tell the Knight Captain about you. Rest in the Knights' room in the basement on the left.

eng: Hmmm...
jap: うーむ……
re: Hmmm......

eng: What do you want? Get out of my face!
jap: なんじゃお前は！ え～い、向こうへ行け！
re: What is it, you! Arrgh, get away from me!

eng: The King's room is upstairs. The Knights' quarters are downstairs, to the left.
jap: この先は王のお部屋。 騎土団の部屋は、ここを出て すぐに左に行った、かいだんの下だ。
re: This leads to the King's room. For the Knights' room, leave here, go left soon after, and down the stairs.
RetranslatorComment: Both versions: It's left  on the screen, but right from the character's perspective.

eng: Just between us, the Chancellor's been acting VERY strange lately. He's been sneakin' out at night...
jap: ここだけの話だが、最近大臣の様子が どうもおかしいのだ。 城をよくぬけ出しているようだし……
re: Just between us, the chancellor's seemed really funny lately. Seems he slips out of the castle a lot......

eng: Speaking of nut cases, I haven't seen the Queen's guard, that frog-thing, recently. Heard a spell turned him into a frog. Do you believe that? I think he's a spy!
jap: おかしいと言えば、リーネ王妃様のごえいの あのカエル野郎、近ごろ姿を見てないな。 そんな事があるのだろうか。 もしや魔王軍のスパイだったのでは？
re: Speaking of funny, I haven't seen Queen Leene's guard, that frog bastard, lately. back by a curse, but do things like that happen? What if he was a spy for Magus's army?

eng: People say the Chancellor's gone crazy, but I don't believe it. The Chancellor's a decent man. Why, he goes to the cathedral everyday.
jap: 大臣様がおかしくなったなんて言う人が いますが、私はそうは思いませんわ。 大臣様は、とても信心深くなられて 西のマノリア修道院に、まいにちのように おいのりに行かれてるんですよ。
re: There are people who say things like the Chancellor's gotten funny, but I don't think so. The Chancellor is very devout, and it seems like every day that he goes to Manorial Abbey in the west to pray.

eng: The Queen seems to be waiting for you upstairs in her room.
jap: この先は王妃様のお部屋。 お前を通してもよいとの事だ。
re: This leads to the Queen's room. She said I may let you pass.

eng: The Queen awaits.
jap: 王妃様がお待ちかねだ。
re: The Queen eagerly awaits you.

eng: YOU saved our Queen? You don't look that tough.
jap: おや、アンタかい。 王妃様が外で世話になったってのは。 なんだかサエないね～。
re: Oh my, it's you? The one the Queen became indebted to outside. Doesn't seem like you've got the skill.

eng: The Queen married into the family 10 years ago. She still looks so youthful! In fact, she looks even younger now than on her wedding day...
jap: 十数年……。 今でもおわかくていらっしゃいます。 おわかくなられたみたい……。
re: Ten-odd years...... She is youthful even now. since she came back......

eng: Ah! There you are.
jap: 来ましたね。
re: You came.

eng: Please leave us. I need to talk to this individual.
jap: はずしてちょうだい。 この者と話があるのです。
re: Please remove yourselves. I have something to speak with this person about.

eng: Certainly, your Highness.
jap: かしこまりました。
re: Certainly.

eng: Come nearer, Sir.
jap: さ、えんりょせず、もっと近くへ。
re: Now, come closer, without reservation.

eng: Giggle...
jap: プッ……。
RetranslatorComment: Going by the context and the sound, she's trying not to laugh and not quite succeeding.

eng: Fooled you, didn't I, Crono?
jap: なーんてね、来てくれたんだ クロノ！
re: Just kidding! You came for me, Crono!

eng: It's me! But everyone calls me, Leene!
jap: そ、私よ！ 何だかみんな私の事リーネって言うの。
re: Right, it's me! For some reason everyone calls me 'Leene'.

eng: I'm so relieved you're here!
jap: でも、うれしかった。
re: But I'm glad.

eng: We barely know each other, but somehow, I knew you'd come for me...
jap: ほんの少し、お祭りでいっしょ だっただけなのに、来てくれて。
re: Even though we were only together for just a little while at the festival, you've come for me.

eng: Thank you, Crono!
jap: クロノ…… ありがと……。
re: Crono...... Thank you......

eng: S, something's wrong!!!
jap: な、何！？
re: Wh, what!?

eng: W, what's happening?! It feels like...I'm being torn apart!
jap: ！！ な、何コレ？ 心がバラバラになってくみたい……
re: !! Wh, what is this? It's like my heart is going to pieces......

eng: Help me, Crono! I'm scared!!! Please... Crono ...h, help me!
jap: こ、こわいよ！ 私がなくなってしまうみたい……。 た、助けて、クロ……
re: I, I'm scared! It's like I'm going to disappear...... He, help me, Cro......

eng: Did you notice anything odd about the Queen?
jap: ね、リーネ王妃様、なんだか 変じゃなかった？
re: Hey, wasn't something weird about Queen Leene?

eng: Yes.
jap: はい
re: Yes

eng: Just as I thought! She claims she's not Leene! There's something...different about her. Don't mention this to anyone!
jap: やっぱり！　私はリーネじゃないって言うし なんとなく前とはちがうのよ。 あ！　コレないしょよ！
re: I knew it! There's something different about her from before that says “I'm not Leene”. Oh! Keep this between us!

eng: No.
jap: いいえ
re: No

eng: Okay, if you say so.
jap: そ。　なら、いいけど。
re: Oh. Never mind then.

eng: ... I grow so tired of the gossip around here!
jap: …… まったく女というものは、いつの世も うわさ話が好きなものだな。
re: ...... Sheesh, those women love their gossip no matter when the era.
RetranslatorComment: The knight's hatred of  gossip could have been inferred as a temporal joke in the Japanese version.

eng: Crono!
jap: 「クロノ！
re: 'Crono!

eng: Huff, puff...you're okay! Did you find the girl?
jap: ハアハア……無事みたいね！ それより、あのコは？
re: haa, haa.... looks like you're safe! More importantly, what about that girl?

eng: GONE?! Whadd'ya mean she's gone?!
jap: 何ですって、消えたあ！？
re: What was that, she vanished!?

eng: Hmm...it's just as I thought.
jap: ……やっぱりね。
re: ......I was afraid of that.

eng: I knew I recognized her!
jap: あのコが消える時、どっかで 見たかおだと思ったのよ。
re: When that girl disappeared, I thought I'd seen her face somewhere.

eng: And this looks identical to the castle in OUR time!
jap: ここは、王国は王国でも ずいぶんと昔の王国みたいね。
re: This IS the kingdom, but it looks like the kingdom of extremely long ago.

eng: I'll bet they mistook that girl for her ancestor... You see, she's a member of the royal family in OUR time!
jap: あのコは、自分のご先祖様に 間違えられたってワケよ。 あの子は私達の時代でも、お姫様……
re: That means that girl was mistaken for her own ancestor. Even in our era, that girl's a princess......

eng: She's Princess Nadia!
jap: マールディア王女なのよ！
re: She's Princess Marledia!

eng: Marle, that is, Princess Nadia, is a descendant of Queen Leene! Queen Leene has been kidnapped. As I recall, someone was supposed to have saved her. But history has been changed! Marle looks so much like Leene, that they probably called off their search when she appeared here. But if the real Queen is killed... ... Marle will simply disappear. There might still be time! If we can save Leene, history as we know it should remain unchanged!
jap: マール、つまりマールディア王女は この時代の王妃の子孫なの。 この時代の王妃がさらわれた…… 本当はそのあと、誰かが助けることに なっていたの。 でも歴史は変わってしまった…… つまり、マールがこの時代に現われ 王妃に間違えられたために本物の王妃の そうさくがうち切られてしまった。 もし王妃が殺されてしまったら… マールの存在が消えてしまうの…… でもまだ間に合うわ！ 今からでも王妃を助け出すことができれば 歴史はもとにもどるはず！！
re: Marle, that is, Princess Marledia, is a descendant of this era's queen. This era's queen was kidnapped...... The truth is that, after that, it happened that someone saved her. But we've changed history...... In other words, due to Marle appearing in this era and being mistaken for the queen, the search for the real queen was discontinued. If the queen were to be killed... Marle's existence would vanish...... But we're still in time! If we can help out the queen, even after now, history should revert to the way it was!!

eng: Something must have happened to the Queen in this era. As a result, Princess Nadia ceases to exists!
jap: おそらく、この時代の 王妃の身に何かあったんだわ。 だから、子孫であるあのコの存在 そのものが……
re: Probably, something happened to this era's queen. That's why the very existence of that girl, her descendant......

eng: Hurry! We have to find the real Queen! The Queen is Gone
jap: とにかく、本物の王妃の行方を 探さなきゃ！ 消えた王女
re: In any case, we've got to search for the true queen's whereabouts! The Vanished Princess

eng: She escaped?! But how? She was in a secured room!
jap: なぜ戻って来られた？ 一人であそこから、ぬけ出せるはずが ……
re: How was she able to come back? She shouldn't have been able to sneak out of there on her own......

eng: Go downstairs if you want to rest.
jap: 休むなら下に行きな。
re: Go below if you're resting.

eng: The Knight's quarters is downstairs.
jap: 地下は騎土団の部屋だ。
re: The basement is the Knights' room.

eng: Zenan Bridge is our last line of defense! We MUST guard it with our lives! So you're the one who helped the Queen. Talk to the maid if you need to rest.
jap: ゼナンの橋は最終防えい線。 なんとしても死守せねばならん！ お前か、王妃様を外で世話したというのは。 休むのならメイドに言ってくれ。
re: Zenan Bridge is our last line of defense. We must defend it unto death, no matter what! So it's you they say helped the Queen outside. Talk to the maid if you're resting.

eng: Take a snooze?
jap: お休みになられます？
re: Will you be resting?

eng: Yes.
jap: はい
re: Yes

eng: Refreshed?
jap: お目ざめはいかがです？
re: How is your awakening?

eng: No.
jap: いいえ
re: No

eng: Oh! If only Sir Cyrus were here! You've heard of him, haven't you?
jap: ああ！　こんな時サイラス様が いてくれたら！ お主も名前くらいは知ってるだろ？
re: Ahh! If Cyrus-sama were here for us at times like this! You at least know his name too, right?

eng: Yes.
jap: はい
re: Yes

eng: If HE were here, this whole mess with the Queen would never have happened.
jap: あの方さえいれば、王妃様が いなくなるなんて事もなかっただろうに……
re: If only that man were here, I doubt such a thing as the Queen disappearing would have happened......

eng: No.
jap: いいえ
re: No

eng: You don't know of Sir Cyrus?! From which land do you come? Or are you simply a fool?
jap: なんとサイラス様を知らぬのか！ あれほどの勇者を知らぬとは お主、どこに住んでおるのだ。
re: What, you don't know Cyrus-sama?! Where do you live to not about that great a hero?

eng: Sir Cyrus was the Commander of the Knights. His mission was to protect the King and Queen. He and a friend left on a journey 10 years ago. No one has heard from them since.
jap: サイラス様は騎土団長だったお方。 いつも、王やリーネ様は自分が守ると おっしゃっておられたのに…… 十年近く前に、おともを一人つれ旅に出られ それっきりなのです。
re: Cyrus-sama is the man who was the Knight Captain. He was always saying that he himself would protect the King and Leene-sama...... Close to ten years ago, he took a friend and left on a journey, and that's the last we've heard of him.

eng: Long ago, a beast called Yakra lurked in the western forest. But after the cathedral was built, Yakra disappeared. We're thankful for that.
jap: 昔、西の森あたりは、ヤクラという魔物が 住んでいて、誰も近寄らなかったんだ。 だが少し前、その森の中に 修道院がたてられてからは 魔物も出なくなったのだ。 さすが神のごかご。　ありがたい事だ。
re: A monster called Yakra used to live in the forest region to the west, and no one would go near it. But since the abbey was built in that forest a little while back, the monster stopped appearing. That's divine godly protection for you. It's a welcome thing.

eng: What a relief, the Queen's been found. Now we can concentrate on the war!
jap: いやはや、王妃様が見つかって 本当によかった。 これで戦に、せんねんできる！
re: Oh yes, I'm so glad the Queen's been found. Now we can give the war our undivided attention!

eng: Oooohhh...
jap: うう……
re: Oohh......

eng: Magus's troops are strangely quiet... Something's about to happen.
jap: このところ魔王軍は ナリをひそめているが、かえって不気味だ。
re: Magus's army has been keeping quiet lately, but that's all the more eerie.

eng: The dining room's below.
jap: この下はしょくどうだ。
re: The mess hall's below here.
RetranslatorComment: Generic term for eating  hall or cafeteria, but those sound too modern and clinical.

eng: The chef's got a nasty temper, so don't get in his way!
jap: ウロチョロして料理長に どなられんようにな。
re: Careful you don't get yelled at by the Head Cook for loitering around.

eng: This dining room is for us soldiers. Feel free to grab a bite.
jap: ここは俺達兵士のしょくどうさ。 お前も食ってけよ。
re: This's the mess hall for us soldiers. You eat too before you go.

eng: Magus's troops had better watch out for us!
jap: せいつけて、魔王軍を ぶちのめしてやる！
re: I'm gonna build up my energy and beat up Magus's army!

eng: The chef's food is great. I give it 3 stars.
jap: 料理長の作るメシは最高さ。 三つ星ってトコかな。
re: The grub the Head Cook makes is the best. About three stars I guess.
RetranslatorComment: This might be a cultural  reference I don't understand, or it might be the more familiar rating on a  scale of one to five stars, but it is literally three stars.

eng: I... I'm hungry...
jap: ハ…… ハラへった……

eng: Here's your food!
jap: あいよ、お待ち～！
re: Here ya go, thanks for waiting!
RetranslatorComment: The head cook's wife.

eng: All right!
jap: ヒャッホ～ッ！
re: YAHOO!

eng: This is great!
jap: うまうま！
re: Yum, yum!

eng: Hungry? Sit down at the upper left corner of the left table.
jap: 食べてくなら、左のテーブルの 左上のせきにどうぞ。
re: If you're eating, have a seat in the top left spot at the left-hand table.

eng: This place is a mini war zone!
jap: あ～いそがし！　ここも戦場だね。
re: Aaah, busy! It's a war ground here too.

eng: This is no place for kids! Wait! Maybe you'd know! What's this «Eyes Cream» stuff that Queen Leene wants so badly?
jap: しろうとが、ちゅうぼうに しかし、王妃様が食べたいという クレープってな一体何だ？
re: No amateurs in the kitchen! But what the heck's a crepe, what the Queen says she wants to eat?
RetranslatorComment: I guess ice cream was deemed more recognizable than crepes.

eng: Where's supper?
jap: 食事はまだか？
re: Isn't the food ready yet?

eng: Oh, Captain! I'm sorry...
jap: あっ騎土団長！ すみません……
re: Ah, Knight Captain! We're sorry......

eng: We're fighting a war out there! Can't you even keep us fed?
jap: 我々は命がけで戦ってるのだ。 早く持って来い！
re: We're risking our lives fighting. Hurry and bring it!

eng: What are you fussing about? You're not the only one who's fighting out there!
jap: るせえ！　命はってんのは 騎土団だけじゃねんだ！
re: Shaddup! The Knights ain't the only ones putting their lives on the line!

eng: Hey, I don't have time for this. Just feed my men, okay?
jap: フン、私はおくびょう者が作った 物など食うヒマがないが、部下達には しっかり食わせてやれよ。
re: Hmph, I haven't got the time to eat anything a coward made, but let my men have a good feeding.

eng: Shut your trap! I'll decide who's going to get fed, and when!!
jap: てやんでえ！　言われなくたって そうすらあ！
re: Leave off me! I'd do it without being told anyhow!
RetranslatorComment: Not sure about the first exclamation, but he's clearly not pleased.

eng: That fool...he thinks HE'S the boss!
jap: あのヤロウ、てめえ達だけが戦ってると 思ってやがる！
re: That bastard, thinking you're the only damn ones fighting!

eng: The Knight Captain is normally very kind. The chef just rubs him the wrong way.
jap: 騎土団長は強くやさしいお方。 だが料理長とはいつもこれだ。
re: The Knight Captain is a strongly kind man. But it's always like this with the Head Cook.

eng: The Knight Captain is trying hard to fill the shoes of his predecessor, Sir Cyrus, Commander of the Knights.
jap: 騎土団長はかつての騎土団長サイラス様の 後をついでがんばっているのだ。
re: The Knight Captain is trying his best in succeeding the previous knight captain, Cyrus-sama.

eng: Those two are brothers. You've heard the expression, «sibling rivalry,» right?
jap: あの2人、兄弟なんですけど 仲が悪くて……
re: Those two are brothers, but they don't get along......

eng: My husband chose this life because he's a pacifist.
jap: ウチの人は殺し合いがキライでこの道を えらんだのよ。
re: My husband chose this path since he hates people killing each other.

eng: What will you have?
jap: 何にする？
re: What'll it be?

eng: Refresh Salad
jap: リフレッシュサラダ
re: Refresh Salad

eng: Just a sec, okay? Here you go!
jap: はい、お待たせ！はい、お待たせ！
re: Just a minute. Here, thanks for waiting!

eng: Power Stew
jap: スタミナシチュー
re: Stamina Stew

eng: Just a sec, okay? Here you go!
jap: はい、お待たせ！はい、お待たせ！
re: Just a minute. Here, thanks for waiting!

eng: Hyper Kabob
jap: ハイパーまるやき
re: Hyper Barbecue

eng: Just a sec, okay? Here you go!
jap: はい、お待たせ！はい、お待たせ！
re: Just a minute. Here, thanks for waiting!

eng: MP recovered! HP recovered! HP and MP recovered!
jap: MPが回復した！ HPが回復した！ HP・MPが回復した！
re: MP recovered! HP recovered! HP and MP recovered!

eng: The chef's stubborn, but he's a good man.
jap: 料理長はキビしいけど、いい人よ。
re: The head cook is strict, but he's a good person.

eng: So! YOU saved Queen Leene!
jap: へえ、キミがリーネ様を……
re: Hmm, you saved Leene-sama......?
RetranslatorComment: The question is implied  (by the dubious sound at the beginning), and so is 'saved' (since it's just  about the only verb that fits).

eng: We want nothing but world peace... Or a piece of the world, tee, hee...
jap: 私達は、世界の平和のために いのっておりますですことよ。 ウフフ……。
re: We are praying for the sake of world peace. U, hu, hu......

eng: People wouldn't know what to do with themselves in a truly peaceful world! My, what delicious, er...... I mean, delightful looking humans!
jap: 一日もはやく、私達の明日が とりもどせますように……。 あら、おいしそうなニンゲ…… い、いえ、なんでもありませんわ、オホホ。
re: May we take back our tomorrow one day soon...... Oh my, tasty-looking huma...... N, no, it is nothing, o, ho, ho.

eng: You might like to stick around for the organ recital. It's a real killer!
jap: われらが、いだいなる主よ。 かよわく、力なき者達に、さばきの いかずちを……。　イヒヒヒ……。
re: O our great Lord. Upon the frail, powerless peoples, the thunder of judgment..... ee, hee, hee, hee......

eng: Oh dear! It looks like you could use some food and a place to...rest!
jap: さあ、あなた達も、かわいそうな 自分達のために、いのりをささげては いかがですか。　ククク……。
re: Come now, why do you not also offer up prayers for your own poor selves? Ku, ku, ku......

eng: What did you find?
jap: 何か見つけたの？
re: Did you find something?

eng: A hair pin.
jap: かみかざり……？
re: A hair ornament....?

eng: That's Guardia's royal crest!
jap: これ、ガルディア王家の 紋章じゃない！
re: This's the Guardia royal family's coat of arms!

eng: Phew! That was close!
jap: ふ～。　ビックリした。
re: Pheeew. What a shock.

eng: Aack!
jap: キャアッ！！
re: Kyaah!!

eng: Lower thine guard and thou'rt allowing the enemy in. Thou'rt here to save the Queen? The lair is deep within. Will thee accompany me?
jap: 「最後まで気をぬくな。 勝利によいしれた時こそ スキが生じる。 「お前達も王妃様をお助けしに来たのか？ この先はヤツらの巣みたいだな。 どうだ、いっしょに行かないか？
re: 'Don't let your guard down until the end. It's when you're drunk with victory that your guard's wide open. 'Did you come to aid the Queen too? It looks like it's their den from here on. How's this, would you come with me?

eng: A...a FROG!? Crono, it's a talking FROG! I hate frogs!
jap: あ、あなたは……！？ クロノ、知ってるでしょ。 私、カエル苦手なの……！
re: Y, you're......!? Crono, you know, right? I can't handle frogs......!

eng: My guise doth not incur thy trust... Very well, do as thee please. But I shall save the Queen.
jap: 「まあ、こんなナリをしていては 「いいだろう、好きにしろ。 だが王妃様は俺が助け出さなきゃ ならないんだ……。
re: 'Well, as long as I'm like this I guess it'd be Fine, do what you want. But I've got to help the Queen out......

eng: W, wait!
jap: ちょ、ちょっと……。
re: H, hold on......

eng: You don't seem like a bad... ...uh, person-frog-thing... I mean...
jap: 悪いカエ……、人では なさそうね……。 うーん……。
re: You don't seem like a bad fro....... person........ Umm......

eng: Crono! What should we do? Go with the frog. Refuse.
jap: どうする、クロノ？ カエル男といっしょに行く いっしょに行くのはイヤ
re: What'll we do, Crono? Go with the frogman Don't want to go together

eng: It may be risky going alone...
jap: でも、私達だけじゃ この先ちょっと不安だわ……。
re: But I'm a bit worried about what's ahead if it's just us......

eng: I'll just have to handle it! I mean...deal with...him!
jap: ガ……、ガマンして いっしょに行きましょう！
re: L...... let's put up with it, and go together!

eng: What's your name?
jap: あなた、お名前は？
re: What's your name?

eng: Frog will do.
jap: カエルでいいぜ。
re: Frog's fine.

eng: All right... Nice to meet you Frog.
jap: ええ、それじゃ…… お手やわらかにね、カエル。
re: Yes, well then...... Don't be too hard on me, Frog.

eng: Mayhap a hidden door lurks nigh? Let us search the environs.
jap: ああ。きっと、この部屋の どこかに、かくし通路があるはずだ。 そこから奥へ行けるだろう。
re: Sure. I'm positive there should be a secret passage somewhere in this room. I'll bet we can get in the back from there.

eng: Y, you're humans? They're hiding the Queen in the back. Please rescue her!
jap: まさか……、人間か！？ この奥に王妃様がとらわれているのだ。 どうか王妃様をお助けしてくれ！
re: It can't be...... you're humans!? The Queen is imprisoned in the back. Please rescue the Queen!

eng: Inside this building, there's a room dedicated to Magus... Heard something about a treasure there...
jap: この建物のどこかに、にっくき魔王を まつった部屋があるらしい……。 そこにはお宝もあるようだぜ。
re: I heard there's a room somewhere in this building enshrining that hateful Magus...... I hear there's treasure there too.

eng: Found the secret Naga-ette Bromide!
jap: ひみつのミアンヌ・ブロマイド([heart])を 見つけた！！
re: Found the secret Mianu bromide([heart])!!
RetranslatorComment: Same monster, just the name changed.

eng: Hey everyone! Humans!
jap: おい、こいつら、人間だぜ、兄キ！
re: Hey, these guys are humans, boss!

eng: They're after the Bromide!
jap: 俺達の、お宝ブロマイドを……！！
re: Our prized bromide......!!

eng: Get them!
jap: 女の子なんか、いじめちゃえ！！
re: Bully the girls!!
RetranslatorComment: I'm not sure what that's  supposed to mean, but the meaning seems to be correct. Probably calling the  humans weak little girlie-girls.

eng: Buurp! Hey what's with the disguise? No need for them here!
jap: んん……、なんだあ？ ヒック！ お前らも、はやくもとの姿にもどれや。 いつまでも人間のカッコなんか してないでよ。ウイック！
re: Hmm...... what? Hic! You guys hurry up and turn back to your normal forms too. Don't go looking like HUMANS forever. Uhic!

eng: It's almost my shift. I hate pretending to be human... it's so repulsive.
jap: ち、もうすぐ交代の時間か、ヒャック。 あー、イヤだ、イヤだ、人間に化けるのは。 ダサイし、くさいし……。
re: Tch, I guess it's almost time for my shift, hyak. Ah, ick, ick, disguising as a human. It's lame and it stinks......

eng: I'll look in on Magus's statue before my shift.
jap: よし、交代する前にもう一度 魔王様のお姿でも、おがんでくると するかな。ヒャック！
re: Okay, I guess I'll go worship Magus-sama's figure one more time before my shift. Hyak!

eng: Burrp! The ones we ate recently weren't SO bad. And those 2 soldiers we caught look rather plump and juicy...
jap: こないだ食べた連中、そんなに マズくなかったわよね。 とじこめてある、あのふたりの兵士も そのうちに……。 キシシシ……。
re: The ones we ate recently weren't all that nasty. And sooner or later, those two soldiers we have locked up...... Kee, shi, shi, shi......

eng: Yakra's so smart! His plan to capture the Chancellor and take his place worked perfectly! Now the Queen's captive, and the castle's in an uproar. This is rich!
jap: ヤクラ様の計画はバッチリだな！ 大臣をつかまえて、自分が大臣に化けるとは いや～、さすがヤクラ様だぜ。 そのおかげで王妃もカンタンに さらってこられたし、いまごろは城の連中 てんてこまいだろうよ。ウヒャヒャ。
re: Yakra-sama's plan is perfect! Capturing the chancellor and disguising himself as the chancellor, oh, I'd except nothing less of Yakra-sama. Thanks to that we kidnapped the queen easy, and I'll bet all them at the castle are going nuts by now. Uhyahya.

eng: How nice of you to come. I'm sure Yakra will be just as pleased. Why not rest in here until he's available?
jap: よくぞ、来られた。 ここの主人ヤクラ様も きっとおよろこびになるであろう。 ささ、ヤクラ様がアイサツにみえるまで この部屋でゆっくりと休むがよいぞ。
re: Good of you to come. The master here, Yakra-sama, will surely be pleased as well. Now then, you should rest in this room until Yakra-sama can see to you.

eng: There was no need for you to come rescue me! The master, Yakra is very kind! I've decided to stay here. Now why don't you make yourselves at home, too!
jap: 私を助けに来てくれたのですね。 しかし、それにはおよびませんよ。 ここの主人のヤクラ様は、とてもよい方。 私は、ここにすむことにしました。 さあ、あなた達も楽になさって。
re: You came to rescue me. However, that was not necessary. The master here, Yakra-sama, is a very good person. I have decided to live here. Now, you make yourselves at home as well.

eng: A...are you here to save Queen Leene?! Oh, what a relief!
jap: も、もしや、リーネ王妃様を 助けに来られた方々では！？ おお、やはりそうであったか！
re: C, could it be that you are persons come to rescue the Queen!? Oh, so you really were!

eng: Don't be in such a hurry... Enjoy yourselves first...Hee hee.
jap: そんな、あわてて出ていかなくとも どうぞ、ゆっくりしていってください…… なギャギャギャギャ……！！
re: Don't be in such a rush to leave, please, take your time here...... Na, gya, gya, gya, gya......!!

eng: Oh...dearest Magus... [musicsymbol] Your flashing eyes...like stars... [musicsymbol] And flowing hair... [musicsymbol] Like waves atop the sea... [musicsymbol] No sad sunny day nor any frightful [musicsymbol] bright place can get us down [musicsymbol] as long as you're near... [musicsymbol] There's nothing to fear... [musicsymbol]
jap: ああ　魔王様～[note] 輝くひとみ　そよぐかみ[note] 山より高く　海より深い[note] あなたを思えば、こわくない[note] どんなに明るく、かなしい場所でも[note] あなたがいるなら、へっちゃら　ぷー[note]
re: Ah, Magus-sama~[note] Shining eyes, wind-blown hair[note] Higher than mountains, deeper than seas[note] If we think of you, we're not afraid[note] However bright and sad the place,[note] If you're there, we're fine   puu[note]

eng: Magus, oh Magus [musicsymbol] Our Hero, Magus [musicsymbol]
jap: 魔王様～[note] われらが　すくいの[note] 魔王様～[note]
re: Magus-sama~[note] Our savior[note] Magus-sama~[note]

eng: Come join us in singing your funeral dirge! Gyah hah ha!
jap: さあ、お前達も声をあわせて うたうんだよ、お前達自身の とむらいの歌！ ウギャギャッ！！
re: Now, you join your voices with us and sing too, the song of your own funeral! Ugya, gyah!!

eng: Stop! Intruders! Gack!!!
jap: 待てッ！　クセ者どもめが！！ ゲハゲハ……！
re: Wait! You fiends!! pant, wheeze......!

eng: No entry.
jap: ここは、通れません。
re: You cannot pass here.

eng: Try hard enough and you will find a way in.
jap: 行こうと心を決めた者のみが 行ける道がある。
re: There is a way that only those who have decided their hearts to go can go.
RetranslatorComment: My phrasing may be a bit awkward, but I think the meaning comes through.

eng: Snooore...szzzzzz... Nooo, stop it! I SAID that you can't... Huh?! I'll say this! You know what you're doing!
jap: グガー……、ゴガガー……。 う～ん、いや～ん、バカ。 だから、そこはダミだってばさ……。 ハアッ！？ この私の後ろをとるとは……！？ ただ者ではないな、きさまら！
re: ZzzZz...... zZzzZzzzZz...... Uhn, nhoo, silly. I told you, you can't, not there...... Haaa!? How could you have gotten behind me......!? You bastards aren't just anyone!
RetranslatorComment: This sounds disturbingly  like a drunken Arche mumbling in her sleep about Cless in Tales of Phantasia.  In other words... it's a sex dream.

eng: Prepare yourself, Queen Leene.
jap: 「かくごはいいかな、リーネ王妃？ この世にさよならをつげる時間だ。
re: 'I wonder if you're prepared, Queen Leene? It's time to say goodbye to this world.

eng: YOU! How did you get in here?
jap: ほう、お前達……！！ よくここまで、もぐりこめたな。
re: Oh? You......!! You've done well to have been able to slip in this far.

eng: Frog!
jap: カエル！
re: Frog!

eng: Majesty, stand back and allow us the honor!
jap: 王妃様、お下がりください！ こいつを、かたづけちまいますので。
re: Your Majesty, please step back! We will take care of this one.

eng: Be careful!
jap: 気をつけて……。
re: Be careful......

eng: Gyah, ha, ha... It's useless to fight! No one will leave here alive!
jap: ギャハハ……！　ムダ、ムダ！ ここからは誰一人として 生かして帰さぬぞ！
