re: Gya, ha, ha......! Useless, useless! I won't let a single one of you leave here alive!

eng: Stupid frog! It's time you jumped off this mortal coil!
jap: ハッ！　カエルふぜいが……！ きさまらから血まつりだ！！
re: Hah! Worthless frog......! You bastards are making my blood boil!!

eng: True-form...CHANGE!
jap: だいじーん…… チェーンジッ！！
re: Chancellor...... Change!!

eng: Reverts to Yakra!!
jap: ヤ～クラ～ッ！！　デロデロン！！
re: Yaaakraaa!! Ta-da!!
RetranslatorComment: Guessing on the second  part since it doesn't seem to have any real meaning. Also, I think he's  actually SAYING this.

eng: You came to rescue me! Thank you Frog.
jap: やはり、来てくれたのですね。 ありがとう、カエル……。
re: I knew you would come for me. Thank you, Frog......

eng: The King awaits. Let us return to the castle.
jap: 王が心配しておいでです。 城に戻りましょう。
re: The King is worried about you. Let us return to the castle.

eng: I thank thee Crono, and Lucca.
jap: 助かったぜ、クロノ。 ルッカ。
re: Thanks for your help, Crono, Lucca.

eng: Yes, thank you so much. Please join us.
jap: ありがとうございました。 あなた方も、どうか共にお城の方へ いらしてください。
re: Thank you very much. Please come to the castle along with us as well.

eng: Let's return to the castle!
jap: ええ。 それでは、お城へもどりましょう。
re: Yes. Well then, let us return to the castle.

eng: W, wait!! What about me?
jap: ま、待ってくれ～い！ 本物のわしは、これ、このとーり ぴんぴんしとるぞ！！
re: W, wait for meeee! The real me is here, just fine, as you can see!!

eng: Phew, thank you! That monster stuffed me in there.
jap: ふーっ、助かったわい！ あの化け物め、あんなとこに おしこめおってからに……！
re: Phew, I'm saved! That damn monster, shutting me up in a place like that......!

eng: Oh! Your Highness! As you can see, I am undamaged!
jap: おお、王妃様！？ 本物のわしは、これこのとーり。 ぴんぴんしておりますですじゃ！
re: Oh, the Queen!? The real me is here, as you can see. I am just fine!

eng: You had me worried, Leene.
jap: 心配したぞリーネ。
re: I was worried about you, Leene.

eng: I failed to protect Queen Leene. I hath disgraced thee.
jap: リーネ様を守りきれず めんぼくしだいもございません。
re: Unable to protect Leene-sama to the end, I am without honor.

eng: Frog!
jap: カエル！
re: Frog!

eng: That no good Yakra! Impersonating me and kidnapping the Queen! We MUST create a criminal justice system in this Kingdom to do away with such fiends.
jap: あのヤクラのヤツめ。 このワシになりかわり リーネ様をさらうなど…… ああいうやからをキビしくさばくため このガルディア王国にも、裁判所や 刑務所を作らんといけませんな！
re: That damn Yakra. Replacing me, kidnapping Leene-sama, and all that...... This Guardia Kingdom must build a courthouse and prison to strictly judge that sort!

eng: Thank you, Crono. But...who was that girl we found in the canyon?
jap: れいを言うぞ、クロノ殿。 しかし、すると裏山で見つかったあの娘は 一体誰なのじゃ……。
re: I thank you, Crono-dono. However, who on earth, then, is the girl who was found in the back hills......?

eng: Your timing was perfect. Who knows what would have happened had you not saved me!
jap: 助けていただき、本当に ありがとうございました。 あと少し、あなたがたの来るのが おそければ、私はどうなっていたか…… 娘は今はどちらに？
re: I truly thank you very much for saving me. If you had come a little later, what would have become of me....? mistaken for me now?

eng: Oh, yeah! I forgot all about Princess Nadia!
jap: そうだわ！ すっかりマールディア姫の事を わすれてたわ！
re: That's right! I'd completely forgotten about Princess Marledia!

eng: Crono! Where did Princess Nadia disappear? She may still be there!
jap: ね、クロノ！ マールディア様は、どこで消えた？ もしかしたら、そこに……。
re: Hey, Crono! Where did Marledia-sama disappear? Maybe there......

eng: Which means the real Leene was somewhere else. It's exactly as I thought.
jap: やっぱり本物のリーネ様は別の所に いたわけね。 私のすいり通りだったわ。
re: That means the real Leene-sama was somewhere else after all. It's just like I figured.

eng: But you're a dead ringer for her.
jap: けど本当にリーネ様そっくりで
re: But I'm shocked that she really looks just like

eng: Princess Nadia!
jap: マールディア王女！
re: Princess Marledia!

eng: Huh? What happened?
jap: あ、あれ？
re: Wh, wha?

eng: Crono!
jap: クロノ！
re: Crono!

eng: It was awful... I can't recall it all... I was somewhere cold, dark...and lonely. Is that what it's like to...die?
jap: こわかった…… いしきがないのに、冷たい所にいるのが わかるの。
re: I was scared...... Even though I'm not conscious, knowing I'm in a cold place.

eng: Welcome back, Princess Nadia!
jap: マールディア王女様 ごきげんうるわしゅう……
re: Princess Marledia-sama, may you be in good spirits......

eng: You risked your life to help me, too?! «Princess...Nadia...?!» Uh oh...
jap: あなたも来てくれてたの！ マールディアって……
re: You came for me too! Marledia......?

eng: I guess you guys figured it out, huh?
jap: バレちゃったみたいね……。
re: Looks like I've been found out......

eng: Sorry, Crono. I didn't mean to deceive you.
jap: ゴメンね、クロノ。 だますつもりじゃなかったの。
re: Sorry, Crono. I didn't mean to trick you.

eng: I'm Princess Nadia. My father's King Guardia the XXXIII. I really enjoyed being with you at the fair. But if you had known my identity...
jap: 私はマールディア。 父はガルディア王33世……。 けど私だってお祭りを男の子と 見てまわりたかったんだもん。 私が王女だってわかってたら……
re: I am Marledia. My father is King Guardia the 33rd...... But even I wanted to wander around and look at the fair with a boy. If you had known that I was a princess......

eng: Crono, you wouldn't have shown me around the fair, right! Right. Wrong!
jap: クロノは、いっしょに お祭り見てくれなかったでしょ？ はい いいえ
re: Crono, you wouldn't have seen the festival with me, right? Yes No

eng: See? I like Marle better than «Princess,» anyway!
jap: でしょ？ 私は王女様よりマールって いわれる方が好きだもん！
re: See? And I like being called Marle better than Princess!

eng: Oh, Crono! That's why I like you!
jap: さっすがクロノ！ 私達、友達よね！
re: That's just like you, Crono! We're friends!

eng: The real Queen's safe, right? So let's go home, Crono!
jap: 本物の王妃様も無事に もどったんでしょ？ 私達も帰ろうよ、クロノ！
re: The real Queen came back safely too, right? Let's go home too, Crono!

eng: Hmmm. The more I look at you, the stronger the resemblance...uncanny!
jap: ふーむ、見れば見るほどリーネ様に 似ていらっしゃる！
re: Hmm, the more I look the more she looks like Leene-sama!

eng: You guys leaving? Wherever you're heading, be careful!
jap: あんた達、帰るのかい？ どこまで帰るか知らないけど 気をつけてお行きよ。
re: You guys going home? I don't know how far you're going, but be careful on your way.
RetranslatorComment: She has no idea.

eng: Now the Knight Captain can concentrate on battling Magus's troops.
jap: これで騎土団長も対魔王軍にせんねん 出来る。
re: Now the Knight Captain can give his undivided attention to opposing Magus's army, too.

eng: Wow, you could be Leene's twin!
jap: おお、ほんにリーネ様に生きうつしじゃ！
re: Oh, you really are like a living copy of Leene-sama!
RetranslatorComment: The term apparently  refers to relatives (usually) who look so much alike that it's difficult to  tell them apart.

eng: Thank goodness, you're safe!! You may resemble Leene, but you sure don't act like her! Anyway, you've really helped me. Let me know how I can repay you.
jap: おお、無事じゃったか。 たしかに外見はリーネだが、中身はぜんぜん …… いや、そなたらには世話になった。 何かあれば国をあげて力になるぞ。
re: Oh, so you were safe. Your appearance is certainly Leene's, but your substance is not at all...... Never mind, I am indebted to you all. If something comes up, I will have the country assist you.

eng: You're the real Queen Leene, huh?!
jap: あなたが本物のリーネね！
re: You must be the real Leene!

eng: You really could be my twin.
jap: まあ、ほんとに私にうりニつ。
re: My, you really are as like me as two
RetranslatorComment: Literally “two melons”

eng: Well, you two better get along... or I'll be in big trouble. I'll keep my fingers crossed!
jap: ちゃんと王様と仲良くしないと 私おこっちゃう…… 事も出来ないのか。
re: If you don't get along well with the King, I'll get mad...... I guess I can't either.

eng: Excuse me?
Um...never mind! I guess it's time to go!
jap: ううん、とにかく おしあわせにね！
re: Never mind, anyway, may you live happily ever after!

eng: You seem like one of the family, now!
jap: あなたがたは、何となく他人とは 思えませんわ。
re: For some reason or another, I can't think of you as strangers.

eng: The King and Queen make such a great couple!
jap: お二人がそろわれるのは、ひさしぶりだ。
re: It's been a while since those two were both here.

eng: So... she wasn't Leene after all.
jap: やはり、リーネ様ではなかったか。
re: I guess she really wasn't Leene-sama.

eng: Hard to believe she really wasn't Leene...
jap: リーネ様じゃなかったとはな。
re: Never imagined she wasn't Leene-sama.

eng: Didn't know that a frog could be so brave.
jap: あのカエル野郎にも、そんな勇気が あったか。
re: So that frog bastard had such bravery too.

eng: Hmm. I still think there's a conspiracy going on here!
jap: わからんぞ、スパイと思わせないための 行動かもしれん。
re: I dunno, he might have acted so as to seem like he's not a spy.

eng: A beast was posing as the Chancellor? Well, the fake one had much better taste.
jap: 魔物が大臣様に化けてたなんて…… もっともニセモノの方が品はよかったけど。
re: A monster turning into the chancellor...... The fake was better quality, though.

eng: 'Twas a fault of mine, which endangered the Queen. I shall depart for good.
jap: 俺が近くにいたため 王妃様を危険にさらしたのだ……。 俺は城を出る。
re: The Queen was exposed to danger because I was near...... I'm leaving the castle.

eng: Eeeek!
jap: キャッ！
re: Kyah!

eng: Indeed, your resemblance to the Queen is uncanny.
jap: なるほど、王妃様によく似て おいでだ。
re: I see, you greatly resemble the Queen.

eng: Crono, you hath potential to be a good swordsman!
jap: クロノ、お前の太刀すじは なかなか見込みがあったぞ。
re: Crono, your swordsmanship had considerable promise.

eng: ... Froggy, you weren't such a bad guy either.
jap: …… カエルも悪くないもんね。
re: ...... You're not bad either, Frog.

eng: You can come and go as you please from now on.
jap: お前はこれから、かおパスだな。
re: You can pass freely from now on.
RetranslatorComment: Literally a 'face pass',  the use of status, influence, etc., to do things like going in theaters  without a ticket.

eng: You sure were lucky, defeating Yakra and all.
jap: ヤクラを倒すなんて、お前ホント ラッキーだな。
re: You're really lucky, beating Yakra.

eng: This ought to relieve the King.
jap: これで、王もご安心だ。
re: The King will be relieved too now.

eng: Leene's presence always brightens things up.
jap: やはりリーネ様がいると城内が明るいな。
re: The whole castle really is cheery when Leene-sama is here.

eng: So! That cathedral was at the heart of it all. That Frog's done a fine job. But since Magus's troops failed to kidnap Leene, they'll probably be back soon. If only Cyrus were here!
jap: そうか、あの修道院に…… カエルのヤツも、りっぱにお役目を はたしたな。 しかし、魔王軍もリーネ様ゆうかいに しっぱいした以上、ほんごしを入れて来る。 こんな時、サイラス様がいれば……。
re: I see, in that abbey...... That frog guy did a fine job of carrying out his duty too. However, now that Magus's army has failed at the abduction of Leene-sama, they're getting serious. If only Cyrus were here in times like these......

eng: We must crush Magus's troops!
jap: あとは魔王軍をたたくのみ！
re: All that's left is striking Magus's army!

eng: Heard that Magus's troops put Yakra up to it all.
jap: ヤクラも魔王軍のさしむけた 魔物だったか。
re: So Yakra was a monster Magus's army sent too.

eng: Can't believe the cathedral was  their hideout.
jap: 修道院が魔物のアジトとはな。
re: Never imagined the abbey was a secret base for the monsters.

eng: I guess Magus's troops kidnapped Leene.
jap: リーネ様ゆうかいも、やはり魔王軍の しわざか。
re: So Leene-sama's abduction was also the doing of Magus's army after all.

eng: The REAL Leene? Wonderful! Let's prepare a feast!
jap: 本物のリーネ様が？ こりゃ、ごちそうを作んないとね！
re: The real Leene-sama? Gotta make a feast for this!

eng: What?! That wasn't Queen Leene?! And I wasted my time whipping up a batch of that «Eyes Cream» dish she wanted so badly! Yuck!
jap: リーネ様じゃなかっただと？ 作ってみたのに。 クッキーとレバーの入ったスープだろ？
re: You're saying she wasn't Leene-sama? make some crepe. It's soup with biscuits and liver in it, right?
RetranslatorComment: Probable wordplay: crepe  (KUREEPU) as biscuit (_KU_KKII) + liver (_RE_BAA) + soup (SUU_PU_)... bonus  points to anyone who can come up with a nasty concoction in English that  sounds like it could be “crepe”.

eng: Well, Leene would never snack before meals like that other girl did!
jap: リーネ様なら、ここに来てつまみ食い なんてしないものね。
re: Leene-sama would never do such a thing as coming here to filch food before meals.
RetranslatorComment: It's phrased as 'if  Leene-sama', which sets it up as a contrast and implies that Marle did.

eng: I THOUGHT she ate too much to be our Queen.
jap: リーネ様にしては、よく食べると思った。
re: I thought she ate a lot for Leene-sama.

eng: That frog made it across by swimming to the other side.
jap: あのカエル野郎、およいで向こうへ わたって行きやがった。
re: That frog bastard swam his way across.

eng: How do we get home?
jap: どこから帰るの？
re: Where do we go back from?

eng: Your Highness, er, Princess...we...
jap: おそれながら、マールディア 王女……
re: Most humbly, Princess Marledia......

eng: Please call me Marle!
jap: マールでいいってば！
re: I'm telling you, Marle's fine!

eng: Well then, Marle... Observe!
jap: で、ではマール……。 ごらん下さい。
re: W, well then, Marle...... Please observe.

eng: Wow!
jap: キャッ！
re: Kyah!

eng: Lucca! You're amazing!
jap: ルッカ、すっごーい！
re: Lucca, that's aweeesome!

eng: Ain't it the truth!
jap: オホホホ……！
re: O, ho, ho, ho......!

eng: Oh, um...I mean...
jap: し、失礼しました……！
re: Ex, excuse me......!

eng: Enough with the false modesty! You have a real gift! I would trade my royal ancestry for your genius in a heartbeat!
jap: 話し方もふつうでいーの！ ルッカの方がスゴいんだよ！ 私は王女かもしれないけど、なんにも 出来ないんだから。
re: Talking normally is fine too! You're more amazing that I am! I might be a princess, but I can't do a thing.

eng: Well, if you say so...
jap: では、お言葉にあまえて……。
re: Then, taking you up on that......

eng: Anyway, I call this thing a «Gate.» It's a kind of portal, that takes you to the same location in a different era. Gates are very unstable, so I used the principal behind my Telepod device...
jap: 私は、このひずみに 『ゲート』って名付けたんだけど…… ゲートは、違う時代の同じ場所に つながっている『門』の様な物なのよ。 出たり消えたりするのは ゲート自体が不安定だからなの。 そこでテレポッドの原理を応用して この……
re: I named this distortion a "Gate"...... A Gate is something like a "gateway" that links the same place in different eras. The Gate itself is unstable when it comes to appearing and disappearing. Accordingly, I applied the principles of the Telepod, and use this......

eng: ...to create a «Gate Key.» Now we can use them as we please.
jap: ゲートホルダーを使って ゲートを安定させてるってワケ。
re: Gate Holder to stabilize the Gate.

eng: But why did this Gate suddenly appear?
jap: けど何で、このゲートが あの時突然現われたの？
re: But why did this Gate appear all of a sudden back then?

eng: Either the Telepod had something to do with it, or...something else made it.
jap: テレポッドのえいきょうか あるいはもっと別の何か……
re: It could have been the Telepod's effect, or possibly another something......

eng: This is getting pretty weird. Let's at least head back to our own time!
jap: 何だかムズかしいんだね……。 とにかく帰ろうよ私達の時代へ！
re: This's kinda complicated...... Anyhow, let's return to our era!

eng: All right! Coming, Crono?
jap: うん、そうね。 帰りましょ　クロノ！
re: Yeah, okay. Let's return, Crono!

eng: We're Back!
jap: ただいま！
re: I'm Home!

eng: Phew! We're back!
jap: わーい！ やっと帰って来られた！
re: Yaaay! We finally made it back!

eng: Crono, Lucca, why don't you come home with me to the castle? I'd like you to come over for dinner!
jap: ね、クロノ、ルッカ！ お城までいっしょに来てくれる？ 色々お世話になっちゃったし！
re: Hey, Crono, Lucca! Will you come with me to the castle? I owe you one!

eng: Sorry for putting you through all that, Marle.
jap: ゴメンなさいねマール。 大変な目にあわせて。
re: I'm sorry, Marle. For making you go through all that.

eng: Are you joking? That's the most fun I've had in months! And I have some new friends, too!
jap: ううん、スリルあって とっても楽しかったよ！ ステキな友達も出来たし！
re: Nah, it was thrilling and really fun. I made great friends, for one thing!

eng: Crono, be a gentleman and take her home. I've got some work to do.
jap: お城へは、クロノ あんたが送りなさいよ。 私はゲートの出てきた原因を 調べてみるわ。
re: Crono, you see her off to the castle. Do a good job of escorting her. I'll try investigating the cause of the Gate's appearance.

eng: See you soon, Lucca!
jap: またねー　ルッカ！
re: Later, Lucca!

eng: Will you escort me home, Crono?
jap: じゃ、お城までエスコートして クロノ！
re: Well then, escort me to the castle, Crono!

eng: I heard the Princess ran away from home again!
jap: 王女様がお城をぬけ出したそうよ。
re: I hear the Princess slipped out of the castle.
RetranslatorComment: Doesn't say again.

eng: The merchants went back to their warehouse to stock up on more goods.
jap: 広場の商人は新商品の しいれのためみんな家に帰ったよ。 町のグッズマーケットによってみな。
re: The merchants in the square have all gone home to stock up on new merchandise. Try going to the town goods market.

eng: Hello, Crono!
jap: お帰り、クロノ。
re: Welcome home, Crono.

eng: There used to be a cathedral in the woods to the west. I wonder what became of it?
jap: ねえ、知ってる？ なんでも昔は、西の森に修道院が たっていたことがあったんだって。 でも、どうしてなくなって しまったのかしらね……。
re: Hey, did you know? I hear that an abbey was built in the western forest long ago. But I wonder why it's gone now......?

eng: Heh, heh...you're never too old to collect Silver Points!
jap: ははっ、年がいもなく シルバーポイントをためるのに 夢中になっちまったよ。
re: Ha, ha, I'm getting caught up in collecting silver points despite my age.
RetranslatorComment: 年がいもなく means  something like he ought to know better at his age

eng: Elaine's down at the pier again? That Fritz! Where could he be?
jap: 今日もエレインさんは船つき場か。 フリッツのやつ……。 本当に、どこいっちまったんだ……
re: Elaine-san is at the pier again today? That Fritz...... Just where has he gone......?

eng: Oh! Hello! What can I do for you? Not enough cash! Thank you very much.
jap: あっ！ いらっしゃいませ なんのご用でしょうか？ お金がたりません。 まいど、ありがとうございました。
re: Ah! Welcome. What did you want? You don't have enough money. Thank you, and come again.

eng: Lucca and Taban only care about their silly toys!
jap: ルッカもタバンも発明で いそがしくて。
re: Lucca and Taban are both busy with inventions.

eng: Hmmm, two-legged, walking humanoid robots are virtually impossible to create. Oh! Crono! Hurry up and escort the Princess to the castle!
jap: うーん…… 2本足で完全なバランスをとって あるくロボットの小型化は あ！　クロノ！　早く王女を お城までつれていってやりなよ。
re: Hmmm...... The miniaturization of robots that balance perfectly on two legs and walk really is difficult. Ah! Crono! Hurry up and take the princess to the castle.
RetranslatorComment: Lucca mentioned in the  US version that two-legged robots were virtually impossible to create. She  originally said that miniaturized versions were impossible to create, which  ties in with a PSX cutscene (in which miniature Robos accompany her to find  Kid in the forest).

eng: Here's what we earned today!
jap: ほら、これが今日のかせぎで 手に入れたリンゴだ。
re: Look, I got these apples with what we earned today.

eng: You're so thoughtful.
jap: いつもすまないね。
re: Thanks for always.

eng: Princess Nadia!
jap: 「マールディア様～！
re: Marledia-samaaa!

eng: Are you all right? Where have you been?! I heard you were abducted! We had soldiers searching for you!
jap: ご無事でしたか？ 一体、今までどこに！？ 何者かにさらわれたという情報もあり 兵士達に国中を探させていたのですぞ！
re: You're safe? Where on earth have you BEEN!? There were even reports that you were kidnapped by someone, and we had the

eng: Scoundrel! You're the one, huh? Kidnapping Princess Nadia!
jap: ム！　そこのムサいヤツ！ そうか、お前だなッ！？ マールディア様をさらったのは！
re: Hey! You scum there! That's it, it's you, isn't it!? The one who kidnapped Marledia-sama!

eng: No! Crono's...
jap: 違うよ！　クロノは……
re: You're wrong! Crono......

eng: Admit it! You confused her and tried to take over the throne! Terrorist!!
jap: えーい！　ひっとらえろ！ マールディア様をまどわせ 王家転ぷくをくわだてる テロリストめッ！！
re: Hey! Arrest him! You damn terrorist, misleading Marledia-sama and plotting to overthrow the royal family!!

eng: S, stop it!
jap: や、やめてーッ！
re: S, stop it!

eng: Stop this at once!!
jap: やめなさ～いッ！！
re: Stoooop!!

eng: What are you doing!
jap: な、何をしておる！
re: Wh, what are you doing!

eng: But Princess Nadia said to...
jap: しかしマールディア様が……
re: But Marledia-sama......

eng: Idiots! Detain him!!
jap: かまわ～ん！　ひっとらえ～いッ！！
re: I don't caaare! Arrest him!!

eng: Crono!!
jap: クロノーッ！！
re: Cronoooo!!

eng: I'm the lawyer, Pierre.
jap: 私がベンゴシのピエールです。
re: I am the lawyer Pierre.

eng: I'm the Chancellor, the prosecutor!
jap: 私がケンジの大臣じゃ！
re: I'm the the public prosecutor, the Chancellor!

eng: Members of the court. We now bring forth the defendant, Crono, who is charged with abducting Princess Nadia.
jap: ようこそみなさん。 マールディア王女ゆうかいの罪で うたがわれているクロノという 男をここに連れてまいりましょう。
re: Welcome, everyone. Let us bring in the man called Crono, who is suspected in the crime of kidnapping Princess Marledia.

eng: What shall we do with him? Fire, perhaps? Hang him upside down for a few years? Or...shall we employ the guillotine?
jap: この男をどうしましょう… 火あぶり？　くすぐりのけい？ さかさづり？ それとも……ギロチンでクビを……。
re: What shall we do with this man... Burning at the stake? The tickling sentence? Hanging upside-down? Or...... his neck with a guillotine......

eng: You, the jury, shall decide his fate. Now, let us begin.
jap: それを決めるのはみなさんです。 さ、始めましょう。
re: It will be all of you who decide that. Now, let us begin.

eng: Crono, you are hereby ordered to tell the truth!
jap: では、ヒコク人クロノ！ 証言だいにつきなさい。
re: Well then, defendant Crono! Take the witness stand.

eng: Crono is charged with «Premeditated Abduction of Royalty.» The question is, did he kidnap Princess Nadia? The answer? No, he did not. In fact, no «abduction» took place!
jap: まずは私からいきましょう。 クロノに本当にゆうかいの いしがあったのか？　……いや無い。
re: I will begin. Did Crono truly have the intent to kidnap? ......no, he didn't.

eng: The two met completely by accident. In fact, the Princess ASKED Crono if SHE could join HIM!
jap: ケンジがわはヒコクが計画的に 王女をさらったと言いますが そうでしょうか？　……いやちがう。 2人はぐうぜん出会ったのであって 決して故意ではありません。
re: The prosecution says the defendant deliberately kidnapped the princess, but is that the case? ......no, it's wrong. The two met by chance, and it was by no means intentional.

eng: Is this true? Who actually started this whole mess? I did. Marle did.
jap: はたしてそうでしょうか？ どっちがきっかけをつくりましたか？ 私です。 マールです。
re: Is that really so? Which of you made the first move? I did. Marle did.

eng: Just as I suspected! The defendant deliberately tried to get near the Princess!
jap: よろしい！ 聞いての通りぐうぜんをよそおって ヒコクは王女に近づきました。
re: Good! As you have heard, feigning chance, the defendant approached the princess.

eng: Are you sure? We have witnesses who'll say YOU were the one that bumped into the princess.
jap: 本当にそう言い切れますか？ あなたからぶつかったという目撃者が いるのです。
re: Can you really say that with certainty? There are witnesses who say it was you who collided with her.

eng: The Princess then innocently followed you to Lucca's little sideshow. Whereupon you both disappeared! If that wasn't criminal abduction, I don't know WHAT is!
jap: そして王女はさそわれるまま ルッカ親子のショーへ 足を運びます。 その姿は何人もの人が目撃して います。 そして2人は姿を消した……。 これがゆうかいじゃなくして 一体何でしょう？
re: Then, with the princess invited, he proceeds to Lucca and her father's show. And then, the two disappeared...... If this isn't kidnapping, then what on earth is it?

eng: And I have facts that throw the defendant's character into question!
jap: ヒコクの人間性が うたがわれる事実も私はいくつか つかんでいます。
re: I have even gotten hold of several facts that place the defendant's humanity in question.

eng: Objection! This can't have any relevance whatsoever to this case!
jap: 異議あり！ それは今回のけんにかんけいあるので しょうか？　……いや無い。
re: Objection! Does this have any relevance to the current case? ......no, it doesn't.

eng: Care to respond, Chancellor?
jap: かんけいあるのかね？　大臣。
re: Is there relevance? Chancellor.

eng: Crono's character is at the very core of this case!
jap: はい。　証言の正しさを しめすためにもヒコクの人間性を 知らせておく必要があります。
re: Yes. There is a need to make known the defendant's humanity in order to show his testimony's accuracy.

eng: We have nothing to hide.
jap: いいでしょう。
re: Fine.

eng: We have a witness. A little girl who will vouch for the character of the defendant.
jap: では 証人を連れて来ましょう。 ヒコクのせいじつさを 証明するかわいい証人を。
re: Well then, we shall bring in a witness. A charming witness who will verify the defendant's honesty.

eng: This nice man... He brought me my kitty. Thank you for being so kind!
jap: この人はね…… わたちのネコちゃんを連れて来て くれたの。 あの時はありがとうね。
re: This person...... He brought me my kitty. Thanks for back then.

eng: How about that? Doesn't this young man deserve a medal?
jap: どうです？ このわか者の行動は？ くんしょうものですよ。
re: How is it? This young person's conduct? Worthy of a medal.

eng: Whew... Looks like they're buying it.
jap: くく…… きいてるみたいよんっ。
re: Heh heh...... Looks like it's working.

eng: The defendant's cruelty is quite evident.
jap: ヒコクのれいこくなせいかくは 明白なものであります。
re: The defendant's coldhearted character is obvious.

eng: You remember HER, don't you? The poor little girl who lost her cat? You wouldn't even listen to her!
jap: 身におぼえがあるだろう？ ネコちゃんを見失ったいたいけな少女の たのみも聞けないお前は……
re: You do remember doing this? You wouldn't even listen to the request of an innocent girl who had lost sight of her cat.

eng: You ignored me!
jap: わたちの事ムシしたでしょ。
re: You ignored me.

eng: Oh you poor dear! Thank you.
jap: おお……、かわいそうに…… どうもありがとう。
re: Oh...... you poor thing...... Thank you.

eng: As you can see, no further proof is necessary here.
jap: もう何の説明もいりますまい。
re: No further explanation is required.

eng: Have you ever stolen anything?
jap: あなたは盗みをはたらいた事は？
re: Have you ever committed theft?

eng: Well...yes.
jap: あります。
re: I have.

eng: See! He lacks morals! This should be on the record! He's crying out for help!
jap: ほら、この通り。 ヒコクはモラルにかけております。 それは自他共にみとめる事なのです。 聞いてください。　ひつうなさけびを！
re: Look, as he says. The defendant is lacking in morals. That is generally accepted. Please listen. It's a bitter outcry!
RetranslatorComment: I have to agree with the “crying out for help” interpretation.

eng: No! I've never been a thief.
jap: 決してありません。
re: I certainly have not.

eng: DO NOT feign ignorance! We have a witness.
jap: とぼけるのはいけません。 証人がいるのです。
re: Do not play dumb.

eng: Him! He ate my lunch right off the table!
jap: オラが大事にしてた、べんとうさァ コイツが食べてしまっただ。 母ちゃんがいっしょうけんめい 作ってくれたべんとうだべ！
re: My precious lunch! He ate it. The lunch mommy worked so hard to make me!

eng: Let the record show that he stole from a poor, helpless man!
jap: まじめにくらしている人の わずかな楽しみをもうばいさるヒコクに 同情のよちはありますまい。
re: There is no room for sympathy for a defendant who would even deprive an honestly living man of his faint pleasures.

eng: The issue here is MOTIVE. Was there any motive for this fine citizen to kidnap Princess Nadia? No! There was none.
jap: もんだいは動機です。 この一市民にマールディア王女を ゆうかいする動機がどこに ありましょう？　……いや無い。
re: The problem is motive. Where is the motive for this citizen to kidnap Princess Marledia? ......no, there is none.

eng: What about ransom? Crono, her fortune DID tempt you, did it not?
jap: お言葉を返すようで悪いが クロノ君？ 王女のざいさんに 目がくらんだのだね？
re: Sorry to contradict you, but what if You had your eyes on the princess's wealth, didn't you?

eng: No.
jap: いいえ
re: No

eng: Are you sure? You really weren't tempted?
jap: 本当にざいさんには きょうみが無いのかね？
re: Do you truly have no interest in her wealth?

eng: Not at all.
jap: きょうみない
re: No interest

eng: That's enough. I have no more questions.
jap: ま、まあいいでしょう。 私のじんもんは終わります。
re: W, well all right. My questioning concludes.

eng: Just a little.
jap: すこしだけ
re: Just a little

eng: So, you admit it!
jap: すなおにはいたようだね。
re: It seems he's spoken frankly.

eng: Yes.
jap: はい
re: Yes

eng: So, you admit it!
jap: すなおにはいたようだね。
re: It seems he's spoken frankly.

eng: Nothing more your honor. The prosecution rests.
jap: もうあえて私から言う事も ないでしょう。 裁判長。　判決を。
re: I have nothing more to say. Your honor. The verdict.

eng: It is evident that my client is a fine, noble young man! Your honor, the defense rests.
jap: 見ての通り正ぎ感の強い 少年です。　さあ裁判長。 判決を。
re: As you can see, he is a young man with a strong sense of justice. Now, your honor. The verdict.

eng: Please keep in mind that he just said he had NO interest in her fortune. Witness please!
jap: みなさん、今の言葉をしっかりと 頭に入れておいて下さい。 ヒコクはざいさんにはきょうみ無いと では証人を。
re: Everyone, please keep his words just now firmly in mind. The defendant said he has no interest in her Now for the witness.

eng: He can't fool me, I saw him with my own eyes! Dear me! I'm so nervous!
jap: やーね、私見ましたのよ。 あらま！ 何か私きんちょうしてきちゃったわ！
re: Uh-huhn, I saw it. Wow! I'm so nervous!
RetranslatorComment: She speaks kind of oddly.

eng: That man grabbed the pendant even before he checked to see if the Princess was okay! He didn't seem to want to return it, either.
jap: その人、王女様とぶつかって転んだ時に まっ先にペンダントをひろいに行ったわ。 王女様を気づかうよりも先に……。 王女様にペンダントを返すのを こばんだりしてたみたい……。
re: When this person ran into the Princess and they fell over, he went straight to grab up her pendant. Even before worrying about the Princess...... It looked like he was refusing to give the Princess back her pendant......

eng: He tried to sell it to the merchant, Melchior.
jap: ボッシュって物売りに、売り飛ばそうと していたのよ。
re: He tried selling it off to this peddler, Bosch.

eng: And this person's final bit of testimony will prove our case!
jap: 最後に決定的な証言をして しめくくってもらいましょう。
re: Finally, let us bring this to a finish with some conclusive testimony.

eng: I heard it clearly. I heard her cry out with my own ears! Is that it? Can I go?!
jap: 私は聞いたのよ！！ 王女様が言った言葉をこのみみで はっきりと！ あら、もう終わり？ やーね。
re: I heard her! What the Princess said, plain as day, with my own ears! Oh, done already? Uh-huhn.

eng: Members of the jury... If he is guilty, stand to the left. If innocent, stand to the right.
jap: ばいしんいん達よ。 有罪と思う者は左へ 無罪だと思う者は右へ行きなさい！
re: Jurors. Go, those who think he is guilty to the left, those who think he is not guilty to the right!

eng: Guilty.
jap: 有罪
re: Guilty.

eng: Not guilty.
jap: 無罪
re: Not guilty.

eng: Order in the court! A verdict has been reached! We have a majority! The verdict is...guilty! The sentence? Solitary confinement, pending execution in 3 days!
jap: せいしゅくに！　せいしゅくに！ 判決が出た！ ぜんいんいっち！！ 有罪とする。 ただちにどくぼうへ。 3日後には死刑をしっこうする！
re: Silence! Silence! A verdict has been reached! Unanimously!! We find him guilty. Take him to solitary confinement at once. We will enforce the death sentence in three days!
RetranslatorComment: Not exactly the same as a majority.

eng: The verdict is...not guilty! But the fact remains that even if he did not kidnap her, he ran off with her. 3 days solitary confinement as punishment.
jap: 無罪とする！！ ……しかしだ。　ゆうかいのいしは なかったにせよ、マールディア王女を しばらく連れ出したのは事実。 よってはんせいをうながすため3日間の どくぼう入りを命ず！！
re: We find him not guilty! ......however. Though he had no intent to kidnap, it is a fact that he took Princess Marledia away with him for a while. Accordingly, to urge him to contemplation, we sentence him to three days of solitary confinement!!

eng: Take him away!
jap: さ、連れていけ！
re: Now, take him away!

eng: Now just a darn minute...
jap: 待って！！
re: Wait!!

eng: Princess!
jap: お、王女様……
re: P, Princess......

eng: That's enough, my dear!
jap: いいかげんにしなさい！ マールディア！
re: Behave yourself! Marledia!

eng: But Father...!
jap: 父上！　聞いてください！
re: Father! Please listen!

eng: All I asked was for you to behave like a princess. Even royalty must obey rules. Leave the rest up to the Chancellor and forget about the events in town.
jap: 私はお前に 王女らしく城でおとなしくしていて 国のルールにはたとえ王や王女でも したがわなくてはな……。
re: I simply want you to behave like a proper princess in the castle. Even if you are, for example, a king or princess, you must abide by the country's rules… Leave the rest to the Chancellor.

eng: We're leaving!
jap: さ、いくぞ！
re: Now, we're going!

eng: Crono!!!
jap: クロノーーー！！
re: Cronoooooo!!

eng: This terrorist has tried to overthrow our kingdom!
jap: こいつは、王家てんぷくをはかった テロリストだ。
re: This guy's the terrorist who planned to overthrow the royal family.

eng: He has been found guilty, and you must now carry out his sentence.
jap: 裁判で有罪となったので 引きわたしに来た。
re: Because he was found guilty in trial, we came to hand him over.

eng: So THIS is the monster who kidnapped the princess!
jap: こやつが王女さまをゆうかいした テロリストですか。
re: So this guy's the terrorist who kidnapped the Princess-sama.
RetranslatorComment: 所長 simply means head of the place. Warden is appropriate here.

eng: The execution is 3 days away. Do NOT let him out of your sight!
jap: こいつの処刑は3日後だ。 にがさぬように、見はっておれよ。
re: His execution's in three days. Keep watch so you won't let him escape.

eng: Yes Sir!
jap: しょうちいたしました。
re: Acknowledged.

eng: Execution?! Strange, but I don't seem to recall hearing anything about an execution.
jap: 処刑？　そのような話は 聞いておりませぬが……
re: Execution? I've heard nothing about any such thing......

eng: WHAT!!! How DARE you question ME! The paperwork's probably just been held up in the system!
jap: 気にするな。 手続きのしょるいが おくれているだけだ。 それとも、わしの言葉が信じられぬか？
re: Never mind that. It's just that the paperwork's delayed. Or, can you not believe my word?

eng: Understood, Sir!
jap: め、めっそうもない！
re: Th, that is surely not the case!

eng: Guards!
jap: えいへい！
re: Guards!

eng: Take the prisoner away! The Trial
jap: こいつをつれてゆけ！ 王国裁判
re: Take him away! Kingdom Trial

eng: 3 day(s) until the execution... And finally, the day arrived...
jap: 処刑の日まで、あと[value8]日…… そして、処刑の日が来た……
re: [value8] day(s) left until the day of the execution...... And so the day of the execution came......

eng: HP and MP recovered!
jap: HP・MPが回復した！
re: HP and MP recovered!

eng: Some sympathizers brought that stuff for you, you lousy felon.
jap: それは、刑務所行きとなったおまえに 同情した裁判のぼうちょうにんが 持って来たさしいれだ。
re: That's a present that trial attendees who pitied you brought when it was decided you'd go to prison.

eng: Got 1 Ether!
jap: エーテルを手に入れた！
re: Got Ether(s)!
RetranslatorComment: I'm pretty sure it's one  or more based on how the jury votes, as long as the verdict is innocent.

eng: Pipe down!
jap: うるさいぞ！
re: Shut up!

eng: Knock it off! Ooh! I'll show him.
jap: うるさいと言っているのが聞こえんのか！ この野郎、だまらせてやる。
re: Didn't you hear me tell you to shut up?! I'll make you shut it, bastard.

eng: Open it up!
jap: おい、扉を開けろ！
re: Hey, open the door!

eng: That's what you get for misbehaving.
jap: へっ、いつまでもさわいでいるから イタイめにあうんだ。
re: Heh, you're making a fuss all the time, so now you pay for it.

eng: Where do you think you're going?!
jap: き、キサマ！　脱走するつもりか！
re: Y, you! Trying to escape?!

eng: The prisoner's escaping!
jap: 脱走者だ！！
re: Escapee!!

eng: What are you up to?!
jap: キサマ、そこで何をしている！
re: What do you think you're up to!

eng: So YOU'RE the escaped con!
jap: キサマが逃げ出した囚人か！
re: So you're the prisoner who ran off!

eng: They don't pay me enough for this!
jap: こ、こりゃ　たまらん。
re: I, I can't take this.

eng: H, Help me!
jap: た、助けて！
re: H, help me!

eng: Save him? Yes. No.
jap: 助けますか？ はい いいえ
re: Help him? Yes No

eng: You're a life saver! I'm Fritz. My dad runs a store in Truce village. Stop by if you're in the area.
jap: ありがとう、助かったよ。 僕の父さんは、トルースの町で グッズマーケットをけいえいしているんだ。 近くに来たら、ぜひたずねてきてよ。
re: Thanks, I'm saved. My father manages a goods store in Truce. If you come to the area, be sure to come visit.

eng: H...Help!!!
jap: ひ、ひえ～！　お助け～！！
re: H, hiii! Help meee!!

eng: Crono! I've come to save you!
jap: クロノ！ 助けに来たわよ！
re: Crono! I came to help!

eng: Gee, it looks like you didn't need my help, after all!
jap: ……っていっても 自力で逃げ出せたのね。 ……、なんか、つまんないなあ。
re: ......so I say, but you were able to escape by yourself. ......that's kinda boring.

eng: Let's blow this joint!
jap: さあ、こんな所とは さっさとおさらばしましょう！
re: Come on, let's get out of here, quick!

eng: He passed out!
jap: きぜつしている……
re: Passed out......

eng: Received a Mid Tonic! Amazing! You found 5 of them!!
jap: ミドルポーションをいただいた！ なんと！　5コも見つけた！！
re: Helped yourself to a Middle Potion! Wow! Found five of them!!

eng: We're here to take you to your place of execution.
jap: 処刑場へ連行する。
re: We're taking you to the place of execution.

eng: Come along.
jap: さあ、来るんだ。
re: Now, come.

eng: We've sharpened up the guillotine... Any last words?
jap: ギロチンの刑をしっこうする。 何か言い残す事はないか？
re: We'll carry out the guillotine sentence. Any last words?

eng: Who the heck are YOU?
jap: キサマ、何者だ！
re: Who the hell are you!

eng: Get outta my way!!
jap: あんた達、ジャマよ！
re: You're in my way!

eng: Take 5, you mugs!
jap: しばらくねむってなさい！
re: Sleep for a while!

eng: So, what do you think of my Zonker-38? Pretty cool, huh?
jap: どう？　ルッカ様じまんの 使いすてドッカンばくはつピストルの お味は？
re: How's that? The taste of Lucca-sama's pride, the Disposable Explosion Blast Pistol?

eng: This is what happens to fools who challenge the mighty Lucca! Ha-hahaha!
jap: このルッカ様の 行く手をはばむオロカモノは みんなこうなるのよ。 オーッホッホッ！
re: Those fools who stand in Lucca-sama's way all wind up like this. Oh, ho, ho!
RetranslatorComment: This is “refined feminine laughter”.

eng: A top secret document has been left behind the floor... Care to read it? Yes. No. To the Prison Supervisor «Dragon Tank Owner's Manual» The Tank Head repairs body damage. It contains a shield that prevents damage by Lightning and Fire. Unless the Head can be defeated, the Tank is unbeatable. Guardia R & D
jap: ひみつのしょるいが落ちている…… はい いいえ ガルディア王国刑務所所長殿へ ドラゴンせんしゃのせっけいず ドラゴンせんしゃの頭には、本体が受けた ダメージを回復させる機能がついています。 シールドが装備されていますので 剣やピストルによる攻撃でしか ダメージをあたえる事が出来ません。 つまり、剣などの攻撃で頭を壊されない限り ドラゴンせんしゃがたおされる事は ないと考えてよいでしょう。 ガルディア王国開発部より
re: A secret document has fallen...... Yes No To the Guardia Kingdom Prison Warden: Dragon Tank Blueprints An ability is installed in the Dragon Tank's head that recovers the damage the body takes. fire attribute skills is equipped to the head, so one cannot inflict damage except with attacks by weapons like swords or pistols. In other words, as long as the head is not broken by the attacks of swords, etc., you may consider the Dragon Tank unbeatable. From the Guardia Kingdom Development Dept.

eng: What was that?
jap: 何の音かしら？
re: I wonder what the noise is?

eng: Forward, Dragon Tank! Crush those rebels!
jap: ゆけ、ドラゴンせんしゃ！ テロリストどもを　たたきのめせ！
re: Go, Dragon Tank! Take down the terrorists!

eng: They got the Dragon Tank!! Fix it! Quickly!
jap: ド、ドラゴンせんしゃが！！ 修理するんだー！！
re: Th, the Dragon Tank!! Fix iiit!!

eng: Don't fool yourselves into thinking you've gotten away with this!
jap: き、きさまら、おぼえておれよ！
re: Y, you bastards, you'll pay for this!
RetranslatorComment: Literally an order to remember it, but it has to be an idiom.

eng: They're escaping!
jap: 「脱走だーッ！
re: 'It's an escaaape!

eng: This doesn't look good!
jap: ここはマズいわよ！
re: This place is trouble!

eng: We have no choice but to break through!
jap: ここは強行突破しかないわね！
re: There's no choice here but to force our way through!

eng: Stop!
jap: 「おやめなさい！
re: 'Stop!

eng: Princess Nadia!
jap: マールディア様！
re: Marledia-sama!

eng: This is my friend! Show him your respect!
jap: その方は私がお世話に なったのよ！ 客人として、もてなしなさい！
re: I'm indebted to that person! Make him welcome, as a guest!
RetranslatorComment: These lines strongly parallel the ones she uses as “Leene” earlier. The main difference is that her speech as “Leene” sounds loftier and more dignified.

eng: B, but...
jap: し、しかし……

eng: Can't you take orders?
jap: 私の言う事が聞けないの？
re: You won't obey what I say?

eng: Of course!
jap: いえ、めっそうもありません！
re: No, that is surely not the case!

eng: Hold it right there!
jap: 「そこまでじゃ～ッ！
re: 'That's as far as you're going!

eng: Do as King Guardia XXXIII says!
jap: え～い、頭が高ーい！ ガルディア王33世様のおな～り～ッ！
re: Hey, bow down! King Guardia the 33rd is cominnnng!
RetranslatorComment: Refer to similar line in the “new king Dalton” section above

eng: Father...
jap: 父上……。
re: Father......

eng: Silence, Princess Nadia! The throne comes before your personal wishes!
jap: いいかげんにしろマールディア。 お前は、一人のこじんである前に 一国の王女なのだぞ。
re: Behave yourself, Marledia. You are princess to the entire country before you are an individual.
RetranslatorComment: Probably by no accident,  “princess to the entire country” here could also mean “stubborn princess”...

eng: What!? Just because I have a title doesn't mean I'm not a person!
jap: ちがうもん！ 王女である前に一人の女の子なの！
re: You're wrong! I'm my own girl before I'm a princess!

eng: You pick up strange ideas venturing outside!
jap: 城下になど出るから 悪いえいきょうを受けおって！
re: You're suffering bad influences because of going out to places like the outlying areas!

eng: I didn't «pick up» anything! It's called «common sense!»
jap: えいきょうじゃない！ 私が決めた事だもん！
re: It's not influences! I decided it myself!

eng: Princess Nadia!
jap: マールディア！
re: Marledia!

eng: I despise you! I'm leaving!
jap: こんなトコもういたくない！ 私、城出するわ！
re: I don't want to be somewhere like this any more! I'm leaving the castle!

eng: Princess Nadia!
jap: マールディア様！
re: Marledia-sama!

eng: Come on, Crono!!
jap: 行こう！　クロノ！！
re: Let's go, Crono!!

eng: Don't just stand there! After them!
jap: 何をしておる！ 追えッ！　追え～いッ！！
re: What are you doing! After them! After themmm!!

eng: Princess Nadia...
jap: マールディア……。
re: Marledia......

eng: There they are! Don't lose 'em!!
jap: いたぞ！ 逃がすな！！
re: There they are! Don't let them escape!!

eng: There's no escape!
jap: もう逃げられんぞ！！
re: You can't run any more!!

eng: Silence!
jap: おとなしくしろ！
re: Come along quietly!

eng: Looks like a dead end!
jap: 行き止まり！？
re: A dead end!?

eng: A Gate!
jap: ！！　ゲートが！
re: !! A Gate!

eng: Come on!
jap: 行こう！
re: Let's go!

eng: But we don't know where it'll take us!
jap: 行こうって…… どの時代に出るか、わからないのよ！ 今度は帰って来れるかどうかも！！
re: Let's go, you say...... We don't know which era we'll come out in! Or even whether we'll be able to come back this time!

eng: Who cares?! This place stinks, anyway!
jap: それでもいい！ 私のためにクロノが つかまっちゃうこの時代よりは！
re: It's fine anyway! Better than this era where Crono was arrested because of me!

eng: Princess Nadia!
jap: マールディア様～！
re: Marledia-samaaa!

eng: This is completely irrational.
jap: えーい、もうどうとでも なれだわ！
re: Eey, I'm even getting used to acting without thinking it over!

eng: Hurry, Crono!
jap: 行こう、クロノ！
re: Let's go, Crono!

eng: Princess, move away from that hoodlum!
jap: 王女、その男からはなれるのです！
re: Princess, move away from that man!

eng: They...disappeared!!
jap: き、消えた……。
re: Th, they disappeared......

eng: Beyond the Ruins
jap: 廃墟をこえて……
re: Across the Ruins......

eng: Eeeek!
jap: キャッ！
re: Kyah!

eng: Yeoouch...!
jap: いった～……
re: Owww......

eng: There's no way the Chancellor can reach us here.
jap: さすがにここまでは、大臣も 追って来られないわね。
re: No way can even the chancellor come chasing us this far.

eng: But, where are we...?
jap: けど、ここ……どこ？
re: But, this place.... where are we?

eng: The civilization here seems so...advanced...
jap: ずいぶんと文明は発達 してるみたいだけど……
re: The civilization looks extremely advanced, but......

eng: Like we're in another world.
jap: まるで別の星に来ちゃった みたいだね。
re: It looks just like we've come to another planet.

eng: A strange crest is engraved here. It's sealed by some kind of power.
jap: 不思議な紋章がきざまれている。 何かの力によって封印されているようだ。
re: A mysterious crest is inscribed. It seems to be sealed by some power.

eng: If you're looking for food, you lose!
jap: 食い物なら、ない……。
re: If it's food you want, there is none......

eng: Truce Dome? Never heard of it. This is Trann Dome.
jap: トルース？ そんなドーム、聞いたこともない。 ここはトランドームだ。
re: Truce? I've never even heard of such a dome. This is Tran Dome.

eng: You light up my life...no, really!
jap: これを見てると、不思議と生きようって気が してくる……。
re: When I look at this, I get this mysterious feeling like we're gonna keep on living......

eng: Kingdom...? Whaddaya talking about...?
jap: 王国暦？　何それ……？
re: Kingdom Year? What's that......?

eng: You'll find some food at Arris Dome to the northeast. But only if you get past Lab 16... The beasts there don't react to weapons, like guns and swords.
jap: 北東のアリスドームに行けりゃ、食い物に ありつけるらしい。 16号廃墟をこえられればな……。 あそこに出るゆうれいにゃ、剣やガンなどの 物理攻撃はききやしねえ……。
re: I hear you can get food if you can get to Arris Dome to the northeast. If you can cross the 16 Ruins...... Physical attacks like swords and guns don't work on the phantoms that show up there......

eng: This is an Enertron. You get a full night's sleep in a few seconds, but it still leaves you hungry.
jap: こいつは、エナ・ボックス。 わずかな時間で、ぐっすり眠れるが ハラは、みたされやしねえ……。
re: This's the EnerBox. You can get a good sound sleep in hardly any time, but your stomach ain't satisfied......

eng: Will you rest in the Enertron?
jap: エナ・ボックスで休みますか？
re: Rest in the EnerBox?

eng: Yes.
jap: はい
re: Yes

eng: HP/MP restored! But you're still hungry.
jap: HP・MPが回復した！ しかし、空ふくはみたされなかった。
re: HP and MP recovered! But your hunger wasn't satisfied.

eng: No.
jap: いいえ
re: No

eng: Got any cash?
jap: あんた金持ってるか？
re: Got any money?

eng: Yes.
jap: はい
re: Yes

eng: You call this money? Oh well, I have some good stuff.
jap: 見たことない金だな。 ま、いーや、いいブツがあるぜ。
re: Never seen money like this. Well, okay, I've got some good stuff.

eng: No.
jap: いいえ
re: No

eng: Got nothing for you fools.
jap: ひやかしに用はねーよ。
re: I ain't got no business with window shoppers.

eng: STATUS: Not enough money
jap: STATUS: Not enough money
re: STATUS: Not enough money

eng: Save money. It'll do ya good. That's my motto.
jap: 金さえためときゃ、いつか役に立つ。 オイラはそう信じてんだ。
re: If you just save up money, it'll be useful some day. That's what I believe.

eng: Stole 500G!
jap: 500G盗まれた！
re: 500G was stolen!

eng: Stole a Tonic!
jap: ポーションを盗まれた！
re: A potion was stolen!

eng: You there, where're you from?...
jap: あ、あんた達、どっから 来なさった……。
re: Y, you people, where'd you come from......?

eng: We came from the laboratories to the west.
jap: 西の廃墟をこえてですけど？
re: We crossed the western ruins, why?
RetranslatorComment: That's a good approximation of what it means to put a 'but' word on a question. Basically, it's prompting for a follow-up.

eng: W, what?!
jap: な、何？
re: Wh, what?

eng: Hey, we've got people who crossed the ruins!
jap: おい、あの廃墟をこえて来た 者がおったぞ！
re: Hey, there's people who came across those ruins!

eng: Say again!?
re: 'Huh?

eng: You're joking!?
jap: 「本当か？
re: 'For real?

eng: So there ARE people who can beat up those freaky mutants...
jap: あそこのミュータントと 戦えるほどの者がおったか……。
re: So there were people good enough they could fight the mutants out there......

eng: Pardon me.  I'm Doan. I'm the descendant of the Director of this Info center. In the basement, there's a huge computer and a storage center for food. But we can't get through 'cause of the robot guards. It's a pity.
jap: もうしおくれた、私はドン。 かつてここ情報センターの 所長だった者のまつえいじゃ。 ここの地下には、大型コンピューターや 食料等のほかん庫もある。 しかし、けいびロボットが、いまだに 動いていて近づけないのじゃ。 ひにくなモンじゃよ……。
re: I'm Don, excuse me for not saying so sooner. I'm descended from the one-time director of the information center here. In the basement here, we've even got things like a super computer and storage for foodstuffs. But, the guard robot's active even now, and we can't get anywhere near it. How ironic......

eng: Who are you?
jap: だれ？　お兄ちゃん達……。
re: Who're you guys......?
RetranslatorComment: literally 'big brother  and other(s)', used if none of Crono, Marle, and Lucca (the characters that  came here before) are in the group.

eng: My husband went down to the food storage area below. I haven't seen him since...
jap: 主人は地下の食料庫をめざして…… それっきりなんです……。
re: My husband headed for the food stores...... That's the last we heard of him......

eng: Daddy's gonna bring us some food!
jap: お父さんが、もうすぐ食べ物 持って来てくれるの。
re: Dad's gonna come back with food soon.

eng: Did you really come from the dome to the west?...
jap: けど、あんたら、何か変だな…… 本当に西のドームから来たのか……？
re: But there's something weird about you...... Did you really come from the western dome......?

eng: Yes.
jap: はい
re: Yes

eng: A time portal?  What in the...? Well, guess we can get our own information using our computer!
jap: え？　時空のゆがみ？　何だいそれ……？ ま、地下の大型コンピューターが動かせりゃ いろいろと調べられるかもな……。
re: Oh, really......? Doesn't matter either way though......

eng: No.
jap: いいえ
re: No

eng: There's an old factory site called Proto Dome to the east. Can't get near it 'cause there's a bunch of lunatic robots in the area.
jap: 東にはプロメテドームと工場跡がある。 暴走したロボット達であふれかえっていて とても近寄れないがね。
re: Promethe Dome and factory ruins are to the east. Can't get anywhere near since it's overflowing with robots running wild, though.

eng: You can reach the continent to the south through the Sewer Access, but stay off of «Death Peak.
jap: 南の地下水道をぬけた大陸には 行かない方がいいわ。 大災害の源……『死の山』があるから。 もっとも地下水道に巣くっている 強力なミュータントは、さすがに あなた達でも……
re: You'd better not go to the continent past the underground waterway to the south. The great disaster's source......”Death Mountain” is there. But then, I'm sure even for you guys the powerful mutants lurking in the underground waterway are......
RetranslatorComment: ...too strong (implied)

eng: The door with the crest? Dynamite won't budge it.
jap: あの紋章がついたドア？ 押しても引いても開かんし、壊そうとしても 傷一つつかん。
re: The door with that crest on it? It won't open whether you push or pull, and even trying to destroy it doesn't leave a scratch.

eng: There's an old man living in a dome near «Death Peak.» Talk about crackpots!
jap: 死の山近くにドームを作り 物好きに監視しているジーサンがいるぜ。
re: There's an old man who built a dome near Death Mountain and keeps watch like some odd hobby.
RetranslatorComment: In the NA version, a  woman warns that some crackpot lives in a dome on the southern continent.  What was totally missed is that Belthasar not only lives in this dome -- he  created it. This tidbit not only adds to the legend of Belthasar's ingenuity,  but validates the notion of his creating the sealed doors in 2300 A.D. for  the heroes' later use.

eng: Are you going down below?
jap: お前達、地下に行くつもりか？
re: You guys plan on going to the basement?

eng: Of course!
jap: もっちろん！
re: Of course!

eng: But no one's ever returned from there.
jap: 私らが何度いどんでも地下には 行けなかったのだぞ。
re: No matter how many times we tried it, no one could get to the basement.

eng: Gotta try, right?
jap: やってみなきゃ わからないでしょ？
re: You never know until you try, right?

eng: ...... It's nice to see such spirited young people for a change.
jap: ……。 お前達のような生き生きした わか者を見るのはひさしぶりじゃ。
re: ...... It's been a while since I've seen such lively young people as you.

eng: Careful, now. And come back alive.
jap: 気をつけてな。 そして生きてもどって来いよ。
re: Be careful. And come back alive.

eng: This console controls the passageway. We need a password to get through.
jap: 通路を制御するコンソールね。 パスワードでロックされているみたい。
re: It's the console that controls the passageway. Looks like it's locked with a password.

eng: Looks like a statue. A memo is attached to it. Warning. Anyone within the vicinity of the stock room will be attacked!
jap: ただの置物のようだ。 きれいなかみにメモがある。 ケイコクスル ショクリョウコニ　チカヅクモノハ コウゲキスル！
re: It seems to be just a decoration. There's a memo on clean paper. WARNING I ATTACK THOSE WHO APPROACH THE FOOD STORAGE!

eng: Executing program...
jap: ヨテイプログラムヲ　ジッコウセヨ。
re: EXECUTE PLANNED PROGRAM.

eng: Crono! What's going on?!
jap: クロノ！ 何が起こったの！？
re: Crono! What happened!?

eng: Marle! Let's go!
jap: マール！ いくわよ！
re: Marle! Here we go!

eng: Phew! Something reeks!
jap: な、何、このニオイ！？
re: Wh, what's this SMELL!?

eng: Everything's completely rotten. The refrigeration must have failed...
jap: ひどい、全部くさってる……。 電源が不安定だったのね……。
re: How awful, it's all rotten...... The power must have been unstable......

eng: Crono, look!! ... ... Passed away long ago, I suppose...
jap: クロノ！！ …… …… もう、いきはないみたい……。
re: Crono!! ... ... Looks like he's not breathing any more.......

eng: He's holding something. What do you suppose this is?
jap: 何か、にぎっているわ。 何だろう、これ……？
re: He's clutching something. What could this be......?

eng: It looks like some kind of seed.
jap: 何かの種子みたいね。
re: Looks like some kind of seeds.

eng: A seed? Do you suppose it could grow in a place like this?
jap: タネ……？ こんな所で育つのかしら？
re: Seeds.......? I wonder if they'll grow in a place like this?

eng: The following is written on a soiled sheet of paper... The rat is more than just a statue! It knows the secret of this dome. Catch it!
jap: きたないかみにメモがある。 あのネズミは　ただの置物じゃない。 ドームのヒミツを知っている。 鉄の上のネズミをつかまえろ！
re: There's a memo on dirty paper. That rat is not a mere decoration. It knows the dome's secret. Catch the rat that's on the iron!

eng: There! There it is!
jap: いたいた！ あいつのことだわ。
re: It's here, it's here! That thing, I mean.

eng: Shhh! It might run away. Dash with the B Button, catch him with the A button!
jap: しー！ 逃げるかもしれないわね。 Bボタンダッシュして Aボタンで、つかまえるのよ！
re: Shh! It might run away. B button dash and catch it with the A button!

eng: Got it!
jap: つかまえた！
re: Caught it!

eng: Squeek!! I give up. I'll tell you everything, squeek. Press and hold the L&R Buttons and then press the A button to access the secret passage, squeek. Don't make any mistakes, or you'll be sorry!
jap: 「かんべんでチュー。 はくじょうするでチュー。 通路スイッチは、LとRを押し ながらAボタンを入れるでチュー！ でも、ボタンの設定変えてた場合は、 こんがらがっちゃうでチュー！
re: Forgive me chuu. I'll confess chuu. For the passage switch, press L and R while holding A chuu! But, if you've changed the button assignments, it's all mixed up chuu!
RetranslatorComment: This line was mangled  from the Japanese, which said that if you had changed button assignments in  the status menu, you'd have to figure out the button sequence on your own.

eng: So this is the info center!
jap: ここが情報センターね！
re: This is the information center!

eng: Good! The computer's still operational! If we run a search on time warps, we might find our Gate!
jap: よかった！ このコンピューターは、まだ生きてる！ 空間のゆがみをサーチすれば ゲートのありかがわかるかも！
re: Thank goodness! This computer is still live! If I search for spacial distortions, maybe I'll find out where there's a Gate!

eng: Here! Got it!
jap: お待たせ、ここよ！
re: Thanks for waiting, here it is!

eng: East of Arris Dome...
jap: このアリスドームから 東の……
re: East from Arris Dome, here......

eng: That would be Proto Dome, I believe.
jap: プロメテドームね！
re: Promethe Dome!

eng: Leave it to Lucca! I'm beginning to think you could find anything with this device!
jap: さーすが、ルッカ！ この機械で、そんな事もわかるんだ。
re: Way to go, Lucca! You even find out stuff like that with this machine.

eng: Say, what does this button do?
jap: じゃ、ここ押したら 何がわかるの？
re: So, what'll we find out if we push this?

eng: 1999 A.D.? Visual record of The Day of Lavos...
jap: A．D．1999？ 『ラヴォスの日』記録……？
re: A.D. 1999? "Day of Lavos" recording......?

eng: Wh, what...IS that?
jap: な…… 何、これ……
re: Wh...... What IS this......?

eng: Lavos?... Is that what's destroying our world?!
jap: ラ、ラヴォスって…… これが世界をこんなにした大災害！？
re: L, Lavos......? This's the catastrophe that made the world like this!?

eng: We must truly be in the future...
jap: じゃあ、やっぱりここは 私達の未来なの！？
re: Then, this really is our future?

eng: No! NO WAY! I refuse to believe it!!
jap: ひどい！　ひどいよ！ こんなのってない！！
re: Awful! It's awful! It can't be!

eng: This...
jap: これが……
re: How could this......

eng: ...this can't be the way the world ends...
jap: 私達の未来だなんて……
re: be our future......?

eng: Crono...
jap: クロノ……
re: Crono......

eng: There's only one thing we can do! We must change history! Just like Crono did when he saved me!
jap: そ、そうだよ！ 変えちゃおう！　クロノが 私を助けてくれたみたいに！
re: That, that's it! Let's go ahead and change it! Like when Crono saved me!

eng: Okay, Lucca?
jap: ね、ルッカ。
re: Right, Lucca?

eng: Okay, Crono?!!
jap: ね、クロノ！！
re: Right, Crono!!

eng: I...guess so...
jap: そうね……。

eng: We can't just go back to our world and live comfortably after seeing this...
jap: このまま私達だけ 元の時代に帰って、のうのうとくらす ワケに行かないわね。
re: There's no way we can just go back to our original era and live carefree lives now.

eng: It was a stroke of luck that we were sent here through that Gate.
jap: さいわい私達はゲートを 使って時代を超えられるんだもの。
re: Fortunately, we can cross over eras using the Gates.

eng: Crono, let's go! Okay! No...
jap: やろうか？　クロノ！ よし、やろう！ そんな……
re: Shall we do it? Crono! Okay, let's do it! You can't mean......

eng: Come on! Show Marle what you're made of!
jap: バカね、あんたも。 マールの前でしょ、カッコくらい つけなさい！
re: You're such an idiot. You're in front of Marle, right? At least ACT cool!

eng: Crono! Lucca! Together we can do this!
jap: よし、やろうクロノ！ ルッカ！！
re: All right, let's do it, Crono! Lucca!!

eng: Let's take a second and do some more research on Lavos' activities back in our time period!
jap: それじゃ早いトコ私達の時代に もどってラヴォスについて調べないと！
re: Then we'll have to hurry back to our era and look into Lavos!

eng: Next stop, Proto Dome!
jap: 行くわよ！ プロメテドームへ！
re: Here goes! To Promethe Dome!

eng: You're back!
jap: も、戻ってきおった！
re: Y, you came back!

eng: Well? What did you discover?
jap: どうじゃった？
re: How did it go?

eng: This is...our future!
jap: ここは……私達の明日なの！
re: This...... is our tomorrow!

eng: Who cares, where's the food?!
jap: それより食料庫は！？
re: Forget that, what about the food storage!?

eng: This is all we could get...
jap: これしか、なかったの……。
re: The was nothing but these......

eng: Seeds...?
jap: 種子……か。
re: Seeds......?

eng: You don't know how long the Enertron'll hold out. Those seeds might be your only hope.
jap: エナ・ボックスも、いつまで もつかわからないわ。 その種子を育ててみて下さい。
re: You don't know how long the EnerBox will hold out either. Please, try raising these seeds.

eng: You have to stay alive! And so do we!
jap: とにかく生きて！ ガンバって！ 私達もやってみるから！
re: In any case, live! Do your best! 'Cause we're trying too!

eng: Huh... You're strange... You're different from us...
jap: フッ…… あんた達は不思議じゃ。 何かこう、私らとは……
re: Hmm...... You're mysterious. Different from us somehow......

eng: I think it's because we're healthy!
jap: 元気ってコト？
re: You mean healthy?

eng: Heal-thy? Got a nice ring to it! We'll try growing the seeds...
jap: 元気？　聞いた事のない言葉じゃが なんだか気持ちのいいひびきだ……。 何の種子かわからんが、こいつを 育ててみるよ。
re: Healthy? I've never heard the word, but something feels good about it...... I don't know what kind of seeds these are, but we'll try raising them.

eng: What're those?
jap: コレなーに？
re: What're these?

eng: They just might be our future...
jap: 今の私らに必要なのは、こういった 物なのかも知れん。
re: It may be something like these that's what we need now.

eng: Heading for Proto Dome? Go by way of Laboratory 32, and take this with ya.
jap: プロメテドームに行くのか。 32号廃墟をぬけるならば これを持って行け。
re: You're going to Promethe Dome? If you're crossing the 32 Ruins, take this with you.

eng: It's a key to the Jet Bike in lab 32. I used to ride it when I was young. Hope it still works...
jap: 32号廃墟においてある ジェットバイクのキーじゃ。 私がわかいころ乗っていたものじゃ。 まだ動くといいが……。
re: It's the key for the Jet Bike left in the 32 Ruins. I rode it when I was young. I hope it still runs......

eng: They've got more powerful robots over there. Take care, and stay...healthy!
jap: むこうは、ここより強力なロボットが 暴れまわっている。　『元気』でな！
re: Over there, stronger robots are running wild than the ones here. Be “healthy”!

eng: Thanks a lot... You've given me hope.
jap: ありがとうよ……。 あんたらを見てたら、生きてく希望が わいてきたよ……。
re: Thanks...... When I saw you guys, the hope to live on came boiling up......

eng: My husband...he's...he's...gone... But he left me precious gifts! The seeds...and our child.
jap: そうですか、あの人が…… でも、あの人は私に大事なものを 残してくれました。 種子と……この子です。
re: I see, he's...... But, he left behind precious things for me. The seeds...... and this child.

eng: Daddy's sure taking his time.
jap: お父さん、おそいな……。
re: Dad's awful late......

eng: Bandits! Must report to Sir Krawlie!
jap: キー！　よそ者だあ！ 早くクロウリー様に知らせなくっちゃ！ キー！
re: Kii! Outsiders! I have to let Crawlie-sama know, quick! Kii!

eng: There was a bridge here! I SAW it, rrrribit!
jap: ここに橋があったのを みたんだケロ、ほんとだってばケロ。 ほんとなんだってば！！
re: I saw there was a bridge here, ribbit, it's the truth, ribbit. The truth, I'm telling you!!

eng: Fool! Grribbit! There's nothing here!
jap: うそをつくなゲロ！ どこにもないゲロ、まったく！
re: Don't lie, gribbit! There's none anywhere, gribbit, geez!

eng: B...but it's true, ribbit...
jap: ほんとなんだケロ……。
re: It's the truth, ribbit......

eng: Someone's coming! Let's scram, grribbit!
jap: ん？　誰か来る、逃ゲロゲロ！
re: Hm? Someone's coming, run away, gribbit!

eng: This is a tad on the spooky side...
jap: ちょっとこわいけど……。
re: It's a little scary......

eng: This is an eerie place. I've got a bad feeling about this...
jap: 不気味な所ね。 何かいやな予感がするわ……。
re: Eerie place. I've got a bad feeling about this......

eng: Bad place! Much danger.
jap: 用心　大切！
re: Caution important!
RetranslatorComment: Ayla only speaks if you enter Sewer Access for the first time after recruiting her.

eng: There's a diary. Here's the last page. It's all over. The fishmen attack if I make even the slightest noise. I'd rather have my gums scraped than have to fight these fiends.
jap: 日記がある。 最後のページには、こう書かれている。 もう限界だ。 音をたてたら、はんぎょ人に襲われる…… なんて、がまんできない。 こんなことだったら、ギロチンの刑に なっていてくれればよかったのに。 最後に大声だしてやる！
re: There's a journal. On the last page, this is written: I'm at my limit. If I make a sound, I'm attacked by the half-fish...... I can't take it any more. If it's gonna be like this, I'd rather have gotten the guillotine sentence. I'm gonna give it one final shout!
RetranslatorComment: Literally half-fish-people Sounds like a reference to Crono's trial...

eng: Press the switch, and the bridge opens, ribbit!
jap: どうやら、このスイッチを押すと 橋がかかるケロ！
re: It seems like if you hit this switch, the bridge spans the gap, ribbit!

eng: So, switch on, gribbit!
jap: それでは、スイッチオンだゲロ！
re: Well then, switch it on, gribbit!

eng: Riiiiiiiiibit! It's out of reach, ribbit!
jap: うわーん！ スイッチ高すぎて、とどかないケロ！
re: Waah! The switch is too high for me to reach, ribbit!

eng: And you call yourself a frog, ribbit, GRIBBIT!
jap: それでもカエルかっ、ゲロゲロ！
re: And you call yourself a frog, gribbit, gribbit!?

eng: Notice Go around back and press the switch!
jap: お知らせ まわりこんでスイッチを押せ！
re: Notice Circle around and push the switch!

eng: The 3 of them are almost here!
jap: キー！ 3人ぐみが、もうすぐやってきますぜ！ キー！
re: Kii! A group of three will come along any time now! Kii!

eng: Coming through the sewer like they own it! They must have a death wish! We shall teach them a lesson!
jap: この地下水道に来るとは まったくもって命知らずのヤツらめ。 ここの恐ろしさを、思い知らせて やるわい。
re: Coming into this underground waterway, they're an awfully reckless bunch. I'll make them realize the terror of this place.

eng: Let's show 'em. HEE HEE!
jap: キー！ 思い知らせてやりましょう。 キキキキキー！
re: Kii! Let's make them realize. Ki, ki, ki, ki, kii!

eng: Just let them come through here! They'll be chopped liver!
jap: 来やがったら こんなんして、あんなんして もうコナゴナしてやるからな！
re: Cause if they dare to come, I'll do this, and that, and break them into little pieces!

eng: Hahahahahaha!
jap: ギャハハハハ！
re: Gya, ha, ha, ha, ha!

eng: Heeheeheeheehee!
jap: キャハハハハ！
re: Kya, ha, ha, ha, ha!

eng: Harharharhar!
jap: グッキャキャキャ！
re: Gukkya, kya, kya, kya!

eng: HAHAHAHAHA!
jap: クッキャキャキャ！
re: Kukkya, kya, kya, kya!

eng: HEEEEHEEEEEHEEE!
jap: ドッヒャヒャヒャ！
re: Dohhya, hya, hya, hya!

eng: Huh?
jap: ん？
re: Hm?

eng: Schala...I've missed you so...
jap: サラか……、ひさしぶりじゃの……。
re: Sara......? It's been so long......
RetranslatorComment: This line looks like he's either mistaking someone for Sara or otherwise imagining that he's seeing her.
Actually, it's old *person*, but man sounds better in English, especially since we know he's a man in this case.

eng: NO! You MUST NOT climb Death Peak! Wouldn't make it very far, anyway! It has to be the right time... ...and...THEY...have to show you the way!
jap: ならん！ 行ってはならん！ 死の山だけは行ってはならん！ と、言っても、その時と、その者達で なければ、死の山には行けぬことにな っておるがの、ヒャヒャ。
re: You mustn't! You mustn't go! You mustn't go, not to Death Mountain! Well, actually, unless it's that time and you're those people, you can't go to Death Mountain the way things are, hya, hya.
RetranslatorComment: In the NA version,  Belthasar warns that the party cannot climb Death Peak until the time is  right and the Poyozos show them the way. In the JP version, Belthasar told  them that unless they were those "people" (the heroes), they could  not climb the mountain -- at least not in its present state, meaning  Belthasar was probably still preparing the Poyozo dolls. It almost sounds like  he's saying it's his doing that only the right people at the right time can  get there, but he doesn't actually say so outright.

eng: Say! Did you see my masterpieces? The Ocean Palace and the Blackbird? I designed and built them both.
jap: それよりも！ お前さん達は、見た事があるかいの？ 私の作った海底神殿や黒鳥号を？ そらー見事なモンじゃぞ、ヒャヒャ。
re: More importantly! Have you all seen them? The Ocean Floor Palace and Blackbird that I made? They're quite something, hya, hya.

eng: I am pleased you think me worthy, O wise one! I await your final program code!
jap: ウイー　ハカセガ　ワタシニ ドノヨウナ　プログラムヲ　スルノカ トテモ　タノシミデス。
re: WHEEE, I VERY MUCH LOOK FORWARD TO HOW THE WISE ONE WILL PROGRAM ME.

eng: Now, don't go getting all emotional on me, critter! Back to work, now!
jap: 老人「そんなに楽しみにしてくれてると わしもやりがいがあるのう。 どうじゃ？　ちっとは さまになってきたじゃろうが……。
re: Old Man: If you're looking forward to it that much, then it's rewarding for me too. How's this? Getting to look a bit good, isn't it......

eng: Hold it right there!
jap: 「待チナ！
re: 'WAIT!

eng: Hey it's...!
jap: ア！
re: AH!

eng: ...the MAN!
jap: アニキ！
re: BOSS!
RetranslatorComment: Not exactly “boss” (more like “big bro”), but that's the idea. It's what thugs and such call the guy in charge.

eng: Like, thanks for the intro, babe!
jap: 待タセタナ！！
re: SORRY TO KEEP YOU waitING!!

eng: You lowlifes can call me Johnny. Now listen up. Part of an old highway leads through these ruins. Think you can beat me in a bike race?
jap: 俺ノ名ハ……　ジョニー。 コイツラノ頭ダ……。 ムコウノ大陸ニ、通リヌケタキャ コノ先ノ、ハイウェイ跡デ 俺ト、ショウブダ……。
re: My Name IS...... JOHNNY. I'M THESE GUYS' Boss...... IF YOU WANNA Get THROUGH TO THE Continent ON THE OTHER SIDE, YOU GOTTA HAVE A MATCH WITH Me ON THE HIGHWAY Ruins Ahead......

eng: Use that «Jet Bike» and... don't chicken out, babe!
jap: ソコノ『ジェットバイク』ヲ 使ワセテヤル… ビビッテンジャネーヨ！ バリバリダゼ！　ベイベー！
re: DON'T CHICKEN OUT! SCREEEECH! BABY!

eng: The Man rides like a roller coaster!
jap: アニキ！　アニキ！ アニキハ、ツヨイ！！
re: BOSS! BOSS! THE BOSS IS STRONG!!

eng: Winning does that to Johnny's hair.
jap: アニキ！　アニキ！ アニキハ、ハヤイ！！
re: BOSS! BOSS! THE BOSS IS FAST!!

eng: ... Do you know how to ride? Yes. No.
jap: トコロデ、オメェ 動カシカタハ　知ッテンダロウナ？ はい いいえ
re: BY THE WAY, YOU Know HOW TO Run IT, RIGHT? Yes No

eng: Need some pointers? Yes. No.
jap: 動カシカタヲ、聞キテェノカ？ はい いいえ
re: WANNA Hear HOW TO Run IT? Yes No

eng: All right, listen up. The gas is on auto, so there's only one speed...FAST! Use the Control Pad to steer. Press the B Button for a Turbo Boost. I'll give you 3 of them, but it takes a moment to recharge between boosts! Check your position at the bottom of the screen. Now show me what you got, babe!
jap: シカタネェナ、ジョニーサマガ オシエテヤロウ。 アクセルハ、オートダ。 カッテニ、進ンデイクカラ安心シナ。 イドウハ、上下ノ方向キーヲ押セバ ソノ方向ニ、イドウスル。 ターボブーストハ『B』。 3回マデ、使ワセテヤル。 回数ハ右下ニ、Bノマークデ 書イテアル。 ダガ、シカシ！！ 1度使ッタ後ハ、マーク上ノゲージガ タマルマデハ、使エネエ、気ヲツケナ。 ゴールマデノ位置ハ 画面下ニデテイルゼ。 サァ、シッカリツイテキナ！ ベイベー！！
re: GUESS THERE'S NO HELPING IT, JOHNNY-SAMA WILL TEACH YOU. THE ACCELERATOR'S AUTO. Relax CAUSE IT Goes ON ITS OWN. FOR MOVEMENT, Press THE Up AND Down KEYS TO MOVE IN THAT Direction. TURBO BOOST IS “B”. I'LL LET YOU Use IT THREE Times. THE Number OF Times ARE Written IN THE Lower Left WITH B MARKS. BUT!! After Using IT Once, YOU CAN'T Use IT UNTIL THE GAUGE OVER THE MARKS FILLS, SO BE Careful. THE Distance TO THE GOAL SHOWS UP AT THE Bottom OF THE Screen. NOW, HANG TIGHT AND COME ON! BABY!!

eng: YOU beat me? I don't get it! You can challenge me anytime. We'll ride the wind, babe!
jap: 負ケタヨ、オメー達ニャ……。 マタ、イツデモ来イヨ。 イッショニ、風ニナローゼ！ ベイベー！
re: I Lost, TO YOU Guys...... Come AGAIN ANY TIME. LET'S BECOME THE Wind TOGETHER! BABY!

eng: J...Johnny lost!
jap: アニキ！　アニキ！ アニキガ、マケタ！！
re: BOSS! BOSS! THE BOSS LOST!!

eng: Hey, you're not half bad!
jap: アンタ！　アンタ！ アンタモ、ツヨイ！！
re: YOU! YOU! YOU'RE STRONG TOO!!

eng: My grannie rides faster than that! Hop on again, if you think you can handle it, babe.
jap: フッ！　ダセー走リダナ。 オ話ニナラネエゼ。 マタ走ルナラ、ジェットバイクニ 乗リナ。
re: PHEW! WHAT A SUCKY Run. NOT EVEN WORTH Talking ABOUT. IF YOU'RE GONNA Run AGAIN, Get ON THE JET BIKE.

eng: You're worthless!
jap: ヨワイ！　ヨワイ！ オマエハ、ヨワイ！！
re: WEAK! WEAK! YOU'RE WEAK!!

eng: Give it up! Go home!
jap: イカス！　イカス！ ジョニーアニキハ、チョウイカス！！
re: COOL! COOL! BOSS JOHNNY IS ULTRA COOL!!

eng: Ha! What losers! You CAN walk your way across but that's monster city! Ride again, if you think you can handle it, chump.
jap: フッ！　オ話ニナラネエナ。 アキラメルノナラ、アルイテ 向コウニワタリナ。 モンスターガ、タクサンイルガナ……。 マタ、走ル気ガアルノナラ ジェットバイクニ、乗リナ。
re: PHEW! NOT EVEN WORTH Talking ABOUT. WALK Across IF YOU'RE GOING TO GIVE UP. LOTS OF MONSTERS THOUGH...... IF YOU Feel LIKE Running AGAIN, Get ON THE JET BIKE.

eng: Hey! Looks like you have a neat gadget there! Ask Rx-xR how to use it.
jap: オッ！　オメエ面白イ物 持ッテルジャネエカ？ ソイツガアレバ、ウイニングポイントノ 記録ガトレルゼ。 クワシイコトハ、アイツニ聞キナ。
re: OH! YOU'VE Got Something Interesting, HAVEN'T YOU? IF YOU'VE GOT THAT, YOU CAN Record YOUR WINNING POINTS. Ask THAT GUY ABOUT THE DETAILS.

eng: Greetings, lifeforms! I am Rx-xR, the Log Keeper. I'll record your 3 fastest times. There are two ways to race Johnny. Which do you prefer? Which do you prefer? Mode 1   with Turbo boost. Mode 2   without boost. L & R change perspective. Mode 1   with Turbo boost. Mode 2   without boost. L & R change perspective.
jap: ハーイ！ レコーダーノ、リンスヨ。 私ガ、ウイニングポイントノ記録ヲ ベスト3マデ記憶シテオクワ。 ジョニートノ勝負ニハ 2シュルイノ、モードガアルノ ドッチガイイカシラ？ ドッチガイイカシラ？ モード1　ブーストアリ。 モード2　ブーストナシ。 LRデ、シテン回転ツキ。 モード1　ブーストアリ。 モード2　ブーストナシ。 LRデ、シテン回転ツキ。
re: HELLO! I'M THE RECORDER, RINSE. I'LL Store YOUR BEST 3 WINNING POINT Records. THERE ARE 2 TYPES OF MODES FOR Matches WITH JOHNNY, WHICH DO YOU PREFER? WHICH DO YOU PREFER? MODE 1: HAS BOOSTS. MODE 2: NO BOOSTS. HAS VIEW Shifting WITH L/R. MODE 1: HAS BOOSTS. MODE 2: NO BOOSTS. HAS VIEW Shifting WITH L/R.
RetranslatorComment: Yes, Rinse (RINSU). And it's apparently supposed to be girl robot, going by how it talks. Not to mention the giddy screaming.

eng: Change race mode? Yes. No.
jap: レースモードヲヘンコウスル？ はい いいえ
re: Change race mode? Yes No

jap: 1　　　　　[value16] 2　　　　　[value16] 3　　　　　[value16]

eng: That's a new High Score!! Impressive!
jap: キャー！　ハイスコアヨ！！ ヤルジャナイ。
re: KYAAA! A HIGH SCORE!! YOU'RE NOT BAD.

eng: Amazing! Take this!
jap: キャー！！ フィーバー、シタワ！！ ゴホウビニ、コレ、ア・ゲ・ル……。
re: KYAAA!! I'VE CAUGHT THE FEVER!! FOR REWARD, I'LL GIVE    YOU THIS......

eng: Receive a Full Tonic!
jap: ハイポーションを手に入れた！
re: Got a High Potion!

eng: Received an Ether!
jap: エーテルを手に入れた！！
re: Got an Ether!!

eng: Received a Mid Ether!
jap: ミドルエーテルを手に入れた！！
re: Got a Middle Ether!!

eng: Lucky 777! You deserve a REALLY big bonus! Wow! You got 10 Mid Ethers!
jap: キャー！ 777ヨ！！ ウン、モウ、出血大サービス！ なんと、ミドルエーテルを 10コ手に入れた！
re: KYAAA! 777!! RIGHT, Sacrificially Big FREEBIE TIME! Wow! Got ten Middle Ethers!
RetranslatorComment: Literally 'hemorrhage big'

eng: Beautiful! Over 1300 points! Let me slap some of these on ya! Receive 5 Mid Ethers.
jap: スゴイ、ジャナイ 1300ポイント以上イクナンテ ハイ、ゴホウビ……。 ミドルポーションを5コ手に入れた！
re: ISN'T THAT AMAZING. GOING Over 1300 POINTS, HERE, A REWARD...... Got 5 Middle Potions!

eng: Unbelievable! You broke the 1500 point barrier!! This is for you!
jap: キャー！　キャー！！ 1500ポイント以上イクナンテ！！ ゴホウビニ、1コシカナイケド コレ、ア・ゲ・ル……。
re: KYAAA! KYAAA!! GOING Over 1500 POINTS!! FOR REWARD, I ONLY HAVE ONE, BUT I'LL GIVE    YOU    THIS......
RetranslatorComment: Cutesy exaggerated pauses in the last line.

eng: You got a Power Tab!
jap: パワーカプセルを手に入れた！
re: Got a Power Capsule!

eng: Jumping anaconda! You broke the 2000 point mark! Take these!
jap: キャー！　キャー！！ 2000ポイントヲ、コエルナンテ スゴイ！　スゴイワ！！ モウ、大サービスシチャウ。
re: KYAAA! KYAAA!! CROSSING 2000 POINTS, AMAZING! AMAZING!! HERE'S A Big FREEBIE.

eng: Receive 5 Ethers!
jap: エーテルを5コ手に入れた！
re: Got 5 Ethers!

eng: Well shut me down! You made over 2300 pts. This calls for a prize! Oh yeaahh!!! 5 Full Ethers!!!
jap: キャー！　キャー！！　キャー！！ 2300ポイントヲ、コエルナンテ スゴイワ！！　スゴスギルノヨーー！ モウ、超出血大サービス。 なんと、なんと、ハイエーテルを 5コ手に入れた！！！
re: KYAAA! KYAAA!! KYAAA!! CROSSING 2300 POINTS, AMAZING!! TOO AMAZIIING! HERE'S AN Ultra Sacrificially Big FREEBIE. Wow! Wow! Got 5 High Ethers!!!

eng: Use the Enertron?
jap: エナ・ボックスで休みますか？
re: Rest in the EnerBox?

eng: Yes.
jap: はい
re: Yes

eng: HP/MP restored! But you're still hungry!
jap: HP・MPが回復した！ しかし、空ふくはみたされなかった。
re: HP and MP recovered! But your hunger wasn't satisfied.

eng: No.
jap: いいえ
re: No

eng: The door won't budge.
jap: 扉、開かないみたい。
re: It doesn't look like the door will open.

eng: Wh, what's this?
jap: な、何コレ？
re: Wh, what's THIS?

eng: It's in bad shape... ...but it appears to be a humanoid robot! Incredible!
jap: 壊れてるみたいね。 けど……、すごい……。 完全な人型ロボット……。
re: It looks like it's broken. But...... incredible...... A complete humanoid robot......

eng: ... I think I can fix it.
jap: ……。 直せるかも知れないわ。
re: ....... I might be able to fix it.

eng: What?! It might attack us!
jap: え？　直すって……。 他のロボット達みたいに 襲って来ちゃうわよ！
re: Huh? Fix it......? It'll attack us, like the other robots!

eng: I'll make sure it won't. Machines aren't capable of evil... ...humans make them that way.
jap: そうしないように直すの。 ロボット達は自分の意思で 襲って来るんじゃないのよ……。 人間がそういう風に作ったの。 ロボット達の心をね。
re: I'll fix it so that it won't. Robots don't come and attack us of their own will...... Humans made them like that. The robots' hearts.

eng: Lucca, you...pity them don't you?
jap: ……ルッカには ロボット達の気持ちが わかるんだね……。
re: ......Lucca, you understand the feelings of the robots......
RetranslatorComment: This line doesn't appear in JP.

eng: Let me get to work now, okay?
jap: じゃ、とりかかるわ。
re: Well, I'll get started.

eng: Right, that does it! I'm going to give it some juice!
jap: これで、よし……っと！ 動かすわよ！
re: That should do it......! I'll start it up!

eng: Good morning!
jap: おはよう！
re: Good morning!

eng: Mo...... Good morning, mistress. What is your command?
jap: お…… おはようゴザイマス、ご主人様。 ご命令を。
re: G...... Good MORning, master. Your orders?

eng: I'm not your «mistress.» I'm Marle! ...and this is Crono... ...and Lucca, here, fixed you!
jap: 私はご主人様じゃなくって マール！ それにクロノに…… あなたを直したルッカよ！
re: I'm not 'master', I'm Marle! And that's Crono...... And Lucca, who fixed you!

eng: Understood. Madam Lucca fixed me.
jap: 了解シマシタ。 ワタシを直して下さったのは ルッカ様デスネ。
re: UnderstOOD. The one who graciously repaired ME IS Lucca-sama.

eng: Just Lucca will do.
jap: ルッカでいいのよ。
re: Lucca is fine.

eng: Impossible. That would be rude.
jap: そんな失礼な事は 出来マセン。
re: I canNOT do such an impolite thing.

eng: Look, I hate formal titles! Don't you, Marle?
jap: 様づけで呼ぶ方が 失礼な事だってあるのよ。 ね、マール。
re: Addressing us with -sama attached would be more impolite. Wouldn't it, Marle.

eng: Hate 'em!
jap: フフ……！
re: (giggle)......!

eng: I understand, Lucca.
jap: 了解シマシタ、ルッカ。
re: UnderSTOOD, Lucca.

eng: All right! Now what's your name?
jap: よーし。 で、あなたの名前は？
re: All right. Well, what's your name?

eng: Name? Ah, my serial number. It is R66-Y.
jap: 名前？　開発コードの事デスネ。 R66ーYデス。
re: Name? The development code, YES? It IS R66-Y.

eng: R66-Y? Cool!
jap: R66ーYか…… イカスじゃない！
re: R66-Y......? Isn't that cool!

eng: No! That won't do at all!
jap: え～？ ダメよ、そんなカワイくないの！
re: Whaat? No good, such an uncute one!

eng: Come on Crono, let's give him a better name!
jap: ね、クロノ もっといい名前、つけてあげようよ！ 何がいいかしら？
re: Hey, Crono, let's give him a better name! I wonder what would be good?

eng: Robo... Robo...that's perfect!
jap: ロボ…… ロボか！　悪くないね！
re: Robo...... So it's Robo! Not bad!

eng: Your new name is Robo, okay?
jap: い～い？　あなたの名前は ロボよ！
re: Okaaay? Your name is Robo!

eng: I am... Robo. Data storage complete.
jap: ロボ……デスネ。 メモリーインプット完了。
re: Robo...... it IS. Memory input complete.

eng: Hey Robo, why aren't there any people here?
jap: ねえ、ロボ。 ちょっと聞きたいんだけど…
re: Hey, Robo. We want to ask you a little something...

eng: ...... What... What has happened here?
jap: ………。 コレは…… どうしたのデショウ？
re: ...... THIS...... What COULD have happened?

eng: There WERE many humans and others of my kind in this dome.
jap: このプロメテドームには 多くの人間やワタシの仲間がいたはず デスガ……。
re: There OUGHT to have been many humans and MY kind in this Promethe Dome......

eng: I think something awful happened here...
jap: 言いにくいんだけど……。 ロボ、あなたが倒れている間に ここの人達はたぶん……
re: It's hard to say, but...... Robo, while you were broken down, the people of this place probably......

eng: ...... It would appear so...
jap: ……。 ソウデスカ……。

eng: But how is it that you survived?
jap: ではアナタ方は なぜココに？
re: Then, why are YOU HERE?

eng: We came through a time warp from the year 1000.
jap: 私達は王国暦1000年から ゲートという時空のゆがみを通って ここに来ちゃったの。
re: We passed through a space-time distortion called a Gate from Kingdom Year 1000, and wound up here.

eng: While exploring Arris Dome we learned there was a Gate here.
jap: ここにもゲートがあるって アリスドームで調べて来たの。
re: We found out at Arris Dome there's a Gate here too, so we came here.

eng: We found you when we came looking for the Gate!
jap: そしたら、あなたが 倒れてたってわけよ。
re: And when we did, here you were, broken down.

eng: But the door to the inner chambers is locked, so we're out of luck...
jap: けどドアが動かなくって こっから先に行けないの。
re: But the door won't move, so we can't get past here.

eng: The power is off.
jap: ココの電源は完全に死んで しまっているようデスネ。
re: It sEEMS that the power HERE has completely died.
RetranslatorComment: Which makes me wonder what Robo runs on. He's fine after some repairs after being defunct for several centuries... twice!

eng: If we go to the factory up north, I can pass through security and activate this dome's generator.
jap: 北にある工場に行けば ここに連動する非常電源がありマス。 ワタシなら工場のセキュリティを 解じょ出来マス。
re: If we go to the factory to the north, there IS emergency power that links to here. IF I go, I cAN call off the factory's security.

eng: You'd do that for us?
jap: ホントー？
re: You mean it?

eng: You repaired me. Now it's my turn to help you. But the generator won't run for long, so someone must stay behind to open the door while the power's on.
jap: 修理して下さったのデス。 今度はワタシがお役に立ちマショウ。 シカシ、いつまで非常電源が持つか わかりマセン……。 ドナタかココに残って、電源が入ったら すぐにドアを開けないと……
re: You graciously fixed me. This time, I SHALL be of help. However, I dO NOT know how long the emergency power will hold...... Unless someone remains HERE and opens the door immediately when the power flows in......

eng: Then Marle or I will stay. Who will stay behind?
jap: じゃあ、私かマールが 残るわ。 どっちが残ろうか？
re: Well then, me or Marle will stay. Which one will stay behind?

eng: Marle
jap: マール
re: Marle

eng: Lucca
jap: ルッカ
re: Lucca

eng: Okay. Please be careful, Crono!
jap: わかった！ 気をつけてね、クロノ！
re: Got it! Be careful, Crono!

eng: Right! I'll handle things here!
jap: オーケー、わかったわ。 こっちは、まかせておいて。
re: Okay, got it. Leave this end of things to me.

eng: Hi! I was getting SO bored. May I take Lucca's place? Yes. No.
jap: やったー！　ヒマしてたんだ。 ルッカとかわっていい？ はい いいえ
re: All right! I had nothing to do. Can I switch with Lucca? Yes No

eng: Looks like you need my genius after all! Yes. No.
jap: やっぱり、私の天さい的 ずのうが必要みたいね。 はい いいえ
re: Looks like you need my genius intellect after all. Yes No

eng: Okay, I'll wait here.
jap: わかった、待ってる……。
re: Okay, I'll wait......

eng: Oh, all right... The Factory Ruins
jap: そ、そう……。 不思議の国の工場跡
re: I, I see...... Factory Ruins in the Land of Mystery

eng: Override Security System 00.
jap: セキュリティシステム00 アンロック。
re: Security system 00 unlocked.

eng: Left - Lab area Right - Factory area Caution! Do not turn off the conveyor belt in the factory. The security system will activate and you'll be in danger.
jap: 左　…　研究所エリア 右　…　工場エリア 工場エリアではベルトコンベアのながれを 止めないように気をつけよ。 セキュリティシステムが作動し 命を落とすこともある。
re: Left ... Research area Right ... Factory area Be careful not to stop the flow of the conveyor belt in the factory area. The security system will activate, and you could lose your life.

eng: Up Down Cancel
jap: アップ ダウン キャンセル
re: Up Down Cancel

eng: Code 00... ...X A Code 01... ...B B
jap: 00パターン　……　X　A 01パターン　……　B　B
re: Pattern 00 ...... X A Pattern 01 ...... B B

eng: To use the crane, enter any two of these letters, A B X Y, after the beep.
jap: クレーンを起動します。 A　B　X　Yの4つのボタンのうち 2つをくみあわせてじゅんばんに おしなさい。 ピンポンのあとに入力してください。
re: Starting up the crane. Combine two of the four buttons A, B, X, Y, and press them in turn. Please input after the chime.

eng: Last defense lock code named «ZABIE.» Translation...XABY. That's X A B Y.
jap: サイジュウヨウ　ケイカイ　ドア　ロック コード　……　ザ　ビ　ィ ザビィ……　ホンヤク X　A　B　Y　……
re: MOST CRITICAL DOOR LOCK CODE ...... ZA  BI I ZABII...... TRANSLATION: X A B Y ......

eng: Open hatch.
jap: ハッチ　オープン
re: Hatch open.

eng: All systems down. Defense lasers are off.
jap: パワーシステム…オール パワーダウン。 ボウゴ　ビーム　の出力をすべてオフ シマシタ。
re: Power systems... all powered down. All DEFENSE beam output TURNED off.

eng: Door lock system «Zabie» operational. Enter password.
jap: 「ドアロックシステム『ザビィ』作動中 パスコードを入力してください。 エレベーターハ　サドウフノウ
re: The door lock system “ZABI” is operational. Please input the password. ELEVATOR OPERATION NOT POSSIBLE.

eng: Emergency! Security system has gone haywire. Must escape immediately!
jap: 非常事態デス！ セキュリティ・システムが 暴走していマス。　脱出しなくテハ！
re: It IS an emergency situation! The security system is runNING wild. We MUST escape!

eng: Hurry! Now!!!
jap: ハヤク！ イマノウチニ！！！
re: QUICKLY! RIGHT NOW!!!

eng: Emergency elevator shut off.
jap: イマージェンシー
re: EMERGENCY.
RetranslatorComment: Ir's not an emergency  elevator. There's an emergency, and the elevator isn't running.

eng: Emergency! Elevators disabled.
jap: イマージェンシー エレベーターハ　サドウフノウ
re: EMERGENCY ELEVATORS CANNOT FUNCTION

eng: Th...these are my friends!
jap: オ……、オオ…… みんな仲間デス。
re: Oh...... ohhh...... These ARE all my companions.

eng: R-64Y, R-67Y, and R-69Y! Good to see you!
jap: Rー64Y Rー67Y　Rー69Y！ 生きていたのか、良かった。
re: R-64Y, R-67Y, R-69Y! So you were all alive, I'm glad.

eng: Wh, what are you doing?! R-64Y: You are defective. R-67Y: You have been tainted.
jap: な、何を…… Rー64Y「ケッカンヒンメ。 Rー67Y「オマエナド ナカマデハナイ。
re: Wh, what...... R-64Y: DAMMED DEFECT. R-67Y: THE LIKES OF YOU IS NO COMPANION.

eng: Pardon? R-69Y: Have you forgotten our mission? All intruders must be eliminated!
jap: ……！？ Rー69Y「ワレワレノ、ニンムヲ ワスレタノカ？ コノ、コウジョウ　ニ フホウシンニュウ　スルモノハ
re: .......!? R-69Y: DID YOU FORGET OUR MISSION? IT IS TO OBLITERATE THOSE WHO TRESSPASS IN THIS FACTORY!

eng: THAT was my purpose?
jap: ！！　ワタシは、そんな事を するために作られたと？
re: !! You mean I was created to do such a thing?

eng: I'm...malfunctioning? R-64Y: Affirmative.
jap: ケッカンヒン……。 Rー64Y「ソウダ。 ケッカン　ヒンダ。
re: A DEFECT...... R-64Y: THAT'S RIGHT. YOU'RE A DEFECT.

eng: A defect...I'm a defect... R-64Y: You shame us! You must be destroyed.
jap: ケッカンヒン…… ……ワタシは　……ケッカンヒン…… Rー64Y「キエロ、ワレワレノ ツラヨゴシメ。
re: DEFECT...... ......I'm ......a DEFECT...... R-64Y: DISAPPEAR, DAMMED SHAME OF OURS.

eng: Wh, what are you doing!
jap: あ、あんた達ーッ！
re: Y, you...!

eng: Robo! Crono, Robo's getting whipped!
jap: ロボ！ クロノ、ロボが！！
re: Robo! Crono, Robo!!!

eng: No, stop! These are my brothers!
jap: や、やめて下さい…… このロボット　ワタシの兄弟デス。
re: P, please stop.... These robots ARE MY brothers.

eng: But they'll destroy you!
jap: あんた死んじゃうわよ！
