re: You'll die!

eng: You'll break down!
jap: そんな事いったって このままじゃ、ロボ、あなたが！
re: Even if you say such a thing, Robo, at this rate you'll!

eng: Please stop. Pl...ease...
jap: やめてクダサイ。 やめ……て……
re: PLEASE stop. St......op......

eng: Robo! R-64Y: Now to take care of the intruders...
jap: 「ロボ！ Rー64Y「ヒキツヅキ シンニュウシャヲ ショブンスル。
re: 'Robo! R-64Y: WE WILL PROCEED TO DISPOSE OF THE INTRUDERS.

eng: Robo! R-64Y: Now to take care of the intruders...
jap: 「ロボ！ Rー64Y「ヒキツヅキ シンニュウシャヲ ショブンスル。
re: 'Robo! R-64Y: WE WILL PROCEED TO DISPOSE OF THE INTRUDERS.

eng: No! Let's take care of YOU!
jap: 処分されんのは…… あんた達よーッ！！
re: The ones who'll be disposed of...... are YOU!!

eng: You cocky boxes of bolts! You'll never get away with this!
jap: ふざけないで！ ぜったい許さないからッ！
re: Don't mess with us! Cause there's no way I'll let you get away with this!

eng: They trashed him!
jap: 「ひっかかってるわ！！
re: 'He's stuck!!

eng: They trashed him!
jap: 「ひっかかってるわ！！
re: 'He's stuck!!

eng: He's in bad shape... I'm not sure I can fix him.
jap: ひどいわ…… 私に直せるかしら。
re: Awful...... I wonder if I can fix him.

eng: Let's get him back to Proto Dome for now...
jap: とりあえずプロメテドームまで 運びましょう……。
re: For the time being, let's move him to Promethe Dome......

eng: Wahh...! What should we do?! Robo just got creamed!
jap: わーん。どーしよう。 ロボが死んじゃうよ！
re: Waah! What'll we do? Robo's gonna die!

eng: Crono, let's take him back to Lucca!
jap: クロノ！ とにかくルッカの所へ運ぼうよ！
re: Crono! Anyhow, let's move him to Lucca!

eng: C...can you r...repair...me?
jap: シュ……修復…… 出来そうデスカ……？
re: RE......repair...... WILL you BE able......?

eng: Shh, don't talk.
jap: あんまり、しゃべっちゃダメ。
re: You mustn't talk much.

eng: You...are trying to save our world?
jap: アナタ方は……。 この世界を変えるというのデスカ……？
re: YOU all...... say you're GOING to change this world......?

eng: I don't know how far we'll get, but that's the plan. Anyway Robo, what are you going to do when you're repaired?
jap: 私達の力で、どこまで出来るか わからないけど……ね。 ところでロボは…… 直ったら何がしたい？
re: I don't know how far we'll be able to get with our abilities, but...... yeah. By the way, Robo...... What do you want to do once you're fixed?

eng: What am I...going to do?
jap: ワタシの……したい事……？
re: What I...... want to do......?

eng: Yeah. I mean, what plans do you have for the future?
jap: そうよ、長い間こんな所で 故障してたんだもの、やりたい事が いっぱいあるはずでしょ？
re: Right, you've been broken down a long time in a place like this, so you should have lots of things you want to do, right?

eng: Lucca, no one has ever asked me that before!
jap: ワタシに、そんな事を 聞いたのは、あなたが初めてデス。 ルッカ……
re: You ARE the first one to have asked ME such a thing. Lucca......

eng: Good morning.
jap: おはようございマス。
re: Good MORning.

eng: Robo! You're all right!!
jap: ロボ！ 良かった、元気になって！
re: Robo! I'm glad you're better!

eng: Lucca, you're incredible!
jap: ごくろう様、ルッカ！
re: Great job, Lucca!

eng: I hope I never have to do that again...
jap: ちょーっとばかり 大手術だったけどね！
re: It was just a teensy major surgery!

eng: Lucca, I have made up my mind. I want to go with you...
jap: ルッカ、ワタシにも したい事が出来マシタ。 アナタ方といっしょに行く事デス。
re: Lucca, I too HAVE found something that I want to do. It IS to go along with YOU all.

eng: Pardon?
jap: えッ、本当に？
re: Huh, really?

eng: There is nothing left for me here. Together, maybe we can give this planet of ours a chance.
jap: ワタシも、見とどけて みたいのデス。 アナタ方のする事が、人間を…… いえ、この星の生命を、ドコへ みちびいて行くのか。
re: I too want to see how it goes with my own eyes. To WHERE YOUR deeds will lead humans...... no, the life of this planet.

eng: Then let's go! The Gate's up ahead!!
jap: 行きましょう！ あの先にゲートがあるわ！！
re: Let's go! The Gate's just past there!!

eng: Hang on to your shorts!
jap: さあ！　いくわよ！！
re: Now! Here we go!!

eng: The End of Time
jap: 時の最果て
re: The Farthest Reaches of Time

eng: Where are we?
jap: ココは？
re: Where is THIS?

eng: Ah, more guests...!
jap: おや、またお客さんだ……。
re: Dear me, visitors again......

eng: Say...where are we?
jap: あの、ここは一体？
re: Um, just where is this?

eng: What do you mean, «guest»...? And, WHERE are we?
jap: 客人って…… あの、ここは？
re: Visitors......? Um, where is this?

eng: Why, this is «The End of Time,» of course! All lost travelers in time wind up here! Now, where are you from?
jap: ここは、『時の最果て』……。 時間のまよい子が、行き着く所さ。 お前さん達、どっから来なすった？
re: This is "The Farthest Reaches of Time"...... The place where the lost children of time end up. Where did you all come from?

eng: We're from Guardia Kingdom, circa 1000 A.D.
jap: 私達は、王国暦1000年から 来たんです。
re: We came from Kingdom Year 1000.

eng: I come from 2300 A.D...
jap: ワタシはA．D．2300年の 世界からゲートで……
re: I, from the world of A.D.2300, by a Gate......

eng: When 4 or more beings step into a time warp, the Conservation of Time theorem states that they will turn up... ...at the space-time coordinates of least resistance. Here. Disturbances in the space-time continuum have increased recently. Far too many folks are just popping in here... I fear something is having a powerful effect on the very fabric of time...
jap: 違う時間を生きる者が、4人以上で 時空のゆがみに入ると、次元の力場が ねじれてしまう……。 しかし、この所、時空のゆがみが 多くてな。 お前さん達の様にフラリとここへ あらわれる者もいる……。 何かが時間全体にえいきょうを およぼしているのかも知れんな……。
re: When you enter a space-time distortion with four or more people who live in different times, the dimensional field distorts...... However, there are many space-time distortions in this place. There are even those who, like you, appear here aimlessly...... Perhaps something is exerting an effect on all of time......
RetranslatorComment: The CoT Theorem is detailed a tad more in the Japanese version, in which Gaspar states that it only acts if four or more beings from ''different'' time periods step into Gate, rather than just four beings as the NA version describes.

eng: Which means one of us has to remain here.
jap: って事は、誰か一人ここに 残った方が安全って事ね。
re: Which means it's safer if one of us remains here.

eng: Stay HERE? ALONE?
jap: ええ、こんなトコで おいてけぼりなの～？
re: What, leaving someone in a place like thiiis?

eng: It is pretty bleak here... But not to worry. All time periods connect here... You can visit your friends whenever you wish! But you can never travel in groups greater than 3...
jap: こんなトコはひどいな……。 何、しんぱいいらんよ。 ここはすべての時に通じている……。 お前さんがたが願えばいつでも 仲間を呼び出せる。 だが時の旅は不安定じゃ。 つねに3人で行動する事じゃ。
re: Place like this, that's rather harsh...... It sounds like he's fond of the place... You don't need to worry about anything. This place leads to all times...... If you wish, you can summon your companions at any time. But time travel is unstable. You should always act in groups of three.
RetranslatorComment: He's quoting her, duh :-P  ...should have realized that before.

eng: So, one of us must stay.
jap: デハ、ダレか残らないと なりマセンネ。
re: THEN, someONE MUST remain.

eng: Who'll it be, Crono?
jap: 誰が残る？　クロノ。
re: Who stays, Crono?

eng: Decide, Crono!
jap: 早く呼んでよ、クロノ！
re: Call me quick, Crono!

eng: Now don't you go getting any ideas, mister!
jap: 二人っきりだからって ヘンな事考えないでよね、おジイさん！
re: Don't get any weird thoughts just because we're alone together, old man!

eng: Please come for me whenever you need me.
jap: ゴヨウの時はいつでも お呼びクダサイ。
re: PLEASE call me any time when I may be of SERVICE.

eng: You can instantly bring any person here into your party, should the need arise.
jap: ここに残っている者ならば いつでもメンバーを入れかえる事が 出来るぞ。
re: You can switch members with those who remain here at any time.

eng: ...So there you have it. Don't forget.  Press the Y Button to switch party members.
jap: ……という事じゃ。 Yボタンで私を呼び出せば ここに残っている者といつでも メンバーチェンジ出来る。 わすれんようにな。
re: ......and that's that. If you call me with the Y button, you can change members at any time with those who remain here. Make sure not to forget.

eng: How do we get back to our time?
jap: 私達の時代に戻るには どうやったらいいの？
re: To return to our era, what should we do?

eng: You see those lovely pillars of light? Those hook you up to different eras. Once you've been through a Gate, you can always use it to come here. To use a Gate from here, step into the light and press the A Button. But beware the Gate which leads from that bucket...
jap: お前さん達がやって来た場所に 光のはしらがあるじゃろう。 あれは、あちこちの次元のゆがみと ここ、時の最果てをつなぐものじゃ。 一度通った事のあるゲートからは いつでもここに来られるじゃろう。 光にかさなりAボタンを押せば ゲートにもどれる。 じゃが、そこのバケツからつながる ゲートには気をつけるんじゃな……。
re: There are pillars of light where you arrived, correct? Those connect the scattered dimensional distortions to here, the Farthest Reaches of Time. Most likely, you can come here any time from any Gate you have already crossed once. You can return to the Gate if you overlap with the light and press the A button. But, be wary of the Gate that connects from the bucket over there......

eng: That Gate leads to 1999 A.D... It leads to the «Day of Lavos»... Go there only if you're looking to achieve a shorter life span... Lavos will help you leave this mortal coil.
jap: そこはA．D．1999…… 『ラヴォスの日』と言われる時へ つながっとる……。 世界のほろぶ姿が見たいのなら 行ってみるのもいいが…… お前さん達まで、ほろびちまうかも 知れんぞ。
re: That place is connected to A.D.1999.... the time called "The Day of Lavos"...... You could try going if you want to see what the destruction of the world looks like, but...... Even you might be destroyed.

eng: Go to «Day of Lavos» 1999 A.D.? Yes. No.
jap: A．D．1999年『ラヴォスの日』へ 行きますか？ はい いいえ
re: Go to A.D. 1999, “The Day of Lavos”? Yes No

eng: It's locked shut...
jap: かたく閉ざされている……。
re: It's shut tight......

eng: Hey.
jap: おーい。
re: Hey.

eng: Don't be in such a rush! Before you go, take a peek inside the room behind me!
jap: そう、せく事もあるまい。 上のドアの向こうにも 寄って行ってみなされ。
re: No need to rush, is there? Try dropping in on the other side of the door up there, too.

eng: What're you lookin' at? I'm Spekkio. The Master of War! I've seen all kinds of battles from here.
jap: 「なんだ、おめーら？ オレか？　オレ、スペッキオ。 戦の神！ こっからいろんな時代の戦、見てる。
re: 'Whaddaya want? Me? I'm Spekkio. God of war! I'm watching the wars in various eras from here.

eng: How do I look to you guys? Strong! Weak!
jap: おめー、オレどう見える？ 強そう 弱そう
re: You, how do I look? Strong Weak

eng: I see. Let's put it this way. If you're strong, I look strong. If you're weak, I look weak.
jap: そうか。 オレの姿、おめーの強さ。 おめーが強ければ強そうに 弱ければ弱そうに見える。
re: Is that so. My appearance is your strength. If you're strong, I look strong, if you're weak, I look weak.

eng: You are strong of will...! That's why the Old One let you through. Long before you were born... ...there was a kingdom where magic flourished. Everyone there could use it! But in time, people began to abuse their powers. It got so bad that no one was allowed to use magic except wizards. But you have it...determination, I mean! Magic needs power of the heart. It needs inner strength. Magic is divided into 4 types: Lightning, Fire, Water, & Shadow.
jap: ん？ おめーら、持ってるな。 心の力を……。 そうか、表のジジイ、それでここに 通したか。 おめーらの生まれるずっと昔…… 魔法でさかえた王国、あった。 その世界、みんな魔法使った。 けどその王国、魔力におぼれ ほろびた……。 それから人は魔法を使えなくなった。 魔族以外はな。 だが、おめーら、持ってる。 心の強さを。　魔法は心の強さ、力。 魔法は天・冥・火・水の4つの力で なりたってる。
re: Hm? You guys have it. Power of the heart...... I get it, that's why the old man outside let you in here. Long before you guys were born...... There was a kingdom that prospered by magic. Everyone in that world used magic. But that country grew addicted to magical power and was destroyed...... After that, people became unable to use magic. Except for the Demons anyway. But you guys've got it. Strength of the heart. Magic's the heart's strength, power. Magic's made up of the four powers Sky, Dark, Fire, and Water.
RetranslatorComment: In the Japanese version,  Spekkio talks about the fall of Zeal and how humans were never able to use  magic again. He then notes that this inability excludes the Mystics, who can  still use it. This was badly mangled in the NA release, where Mystics was replaced  by "wizards."

eng: You, with the punk hairdo! You're «Lightning.»
jap: ツンツン頭のおまえは『天』。
re: You, pointy head, you're "Sky".

eng: The one with the ponytail is «Water.»
jap: このポニーテールのギャルは 『水』の力。
re: This ponytailed girl's "Water" power.

eng: The one with goofy glasses is «Fire.»
jap: こっちのメガネのネーちゃんは 『火』の力。
re: Glasses chick here's "Fire" power.

eng: That's the biggest toy I've ever seen... Hey, you're not alive, are you?! You've got great strength, however, since I can't measure your inner character, I can't give any magic to you. But your laser weapons will suffice. They can inflict «Shadow» type damage.
jap: このデッカい人形は……。 おめー、生き物じゃないな。 おめーも強い心持ってるけど 昔の魔法の民の血ひいてないから 魔法ムリ。 でも、おめーのレーザーとかいう武器 スゴい殺傷能力。 『冥』の力に似てる。
re: This hugeass doll...... You, you're not a living thing. You've got a strong heart too, but since you're not descended from the ancient magic peoples, magic's a no-go. But that laser weapon of yours has got serious destructive ability. It resembles "Dark" power.

eng: Not just magic, but EVERYTHING is based on the balance of these 4 powers.
jap: てなぐあいに、魔法だけでなく すべてのものは、この4つのバランスで なりたってる。
re: Like so, it's not just magic, all things are made up of the balance of these four.
RetranslatorComment: The beginning of the line is contracted from 'to iu guai ni'

eng: Think «MAGIC,» and, starting from the door, walk clockwise along the walls of my room 3 times.
jap: 『魔法が使いたい～』と ねんじながら、ドアの所からはじめて この部屋のさくにそって、時計回りに 3回まわる！ バターにならないよう、気をつける。
re: While silently praying, "I wanna use magic", circle clockwise along the edge of this room three times, starting from where the door is! I'll pay attention so you can't cheat.
RetranslatorComment: Literally 'so as to not  become butter'. This interpretation seems to make sense, but I still can't  find any information on the phrase.

eng: No cheating! I'm watching! Do it over! From the door, clockwise along the wall, 3 times!
jap: ズルだめ！ オレちゃんと見てる！ もう1回やり直し！　ドアの所から さくにそって時計まわりに3回まわる！
re: No cheating! I'm keeping close watch! Start over again! Three times, clockwise, along edge, from the door!

eng: Very good!
jap: よーし！
re: All right!

eng: Ipso facto, meeny moe... MAGICO!
jap: ハニャハラヘッタミタ～イ！！
re: Hanyaharahettamitaai!

eng: Crono learns to use magic! Marle learns to use magic! Lucca learns to use magic! Robo can't use magic!
jap: クロノが魔法を使えるようになった！ マールが魔法を使えるようになった！ ルッカが魔法を使えるようになった！ ロボは魔法を使えない！
re: Crono became able to use magic! Marle became able to use magic! Lucca became able to use magic! Robo can't use magic!

eng: So! Fortified with magic! Wanna try it out? Yes. No.
jap: どーだ、新たな力わくだろ。 ためしてみるか？ はい いいえ
re: How about it, you're excited at you new powers, right? Wanna try testing them? Yes No

eng: All right!
jap: フフ、わくわく！
re: Hu, hu, I'm excited!

eng: Hi! Looking for some practice? Yes. No.
jap: なーんだ、おめーら。 腕だめししたいのか？ はい いいえ
re: Oh, it's you guys. Wanna test your skill? Yes No

eng: Any time, friends. Remember, I'M the Master of War!
jap: いつでもいいぞ。 なにしろオレ、戦の神！
re: Any time's fine. I'm the god of war after all!

eng: GRRRR... That was most embarrassing!
jap: オゴゴ…… オレ負けるなんて……
re: ogogo...... How could I lose......?
RetranslatorComment: That's the sound, don't ask what it means. 'Grrrr' may be pretty close.

eng: Wait a sec! I'M the Master of War!
jap: 何かの間違い！　オレ戦の神！ そーだ、オレが魔法おしえたから おめーら勝てた！
re: It's some kinda mistake! I'm the god of war! Oh, I get it, you could win since I taught you magic!
RetranslatorComment: This makes so much more  sense when this line isn't left out. He's rationalizing his defeat.

eng: See, I AM the Master of War! Uwahahaha!
jap: やっぱオレ、戦の神！ フンフフ～ン[note]
re: I really am the god of war! Hun, hu, huuuun[note]
RetranslatorComment: Probably a silly chuckle.

eng: Harrumph... Don't make a habit of this. Here, this is for you.
jap: フ、フン。 少しはやるみたいだな。 しかたない、コレやる。
re: H, hmph. Looks like you're sort of competent. Can't help it, I'll give you this.

eng: I AM the Master of War! Whew! Sometimes I scare myself!
jap: オレ、戦の神！　気前いい！ フンフフ～ン[note]
re: I'm the god of war! So generous! Hun, hu, huuuun[note]

eng: HEHEHEHE!! I WIN!
jap: フンフフ～ン[note] オレの勝ち！
re: Hun, hu, huuuun[note] I win!

eng: You guys are too much! Bring newcomers to meet me!
jap: 新しい仲間出来たら 連れて来る。 おめーら、オモシロイ。
re: If you make new companions, you're bringing them here. You guys are VERY interesting.

eng: Spekkio special refresher set! Got 1 Magic Tab and 5 Ethers! Spekkio choice set! Got 1 Magic Tab and 5 Mid Ethers! SPEKKIO Healthy choice set! Got 1 Magic Tab and 5 Full Ethers! SPEKKIO Graceful set! Got 1 Magic Tab 1 Speed Tab 1 Power Tab and 10 Elixirs! SPEKKIO Cheerful set! Got 10 Magical Tabs 10 Speed Tabs 10 Power Tabs and 10 MegaElixirs! Received enough of Spekkio's praise to last a year!
jap: スペッキオさわやかセット！ マジックカプセル1コ エーテル5コつめあわせを手に入れた！ スペッキオしなやかセット！ マジックカプセル1コ ミドルエーテル5コつめあわせを 手に入れた！ スペッキオすこやかセット！ マジックカプセル1コ ハイエーテル5コつめあわせを 手に入れた！ スペッキオたおやかセット！ マジックカプセル1コ スピードカプセル1コ パワーカプセル　1コ エリクサー10コつめあわせを 手に入れた！ スペッキオにぎやかセット！ マジックカプセル10コ スピードカプセル10コ パワーカプセル　10コ ラストエリクサー10コに…… スペッキオの気持ち 一年分を手に入れた！
re: Spekkio Refreshing Set! Got an assortment of 1 Magic Capsule and 5 Ethers! Spekkio Flexible Set! Got an assortment of 1 Magic Capsule and 5 Middle Ethers! Spekkio Healthy Set! Got an assortment of 1 Magic Capsule and 5 High Ethers! Spekkio Graceful Set! Got an assortment of 1 Magic Capsule 1 Speed Capsule 1 Power Capsule And 10 Elixirs! Spekkio Lively Set! Got 10 Magic Capsules, 10 Speed Capsules, 10 Power Capsules, 10 Last Elixirs, and...... A year's supply of Spekkio's feelings!
RetranslatorComment: I just noticed... every  single one of his sets is something-yaka. Wonder if it's possible to work a  similar connection into the English...?

eng: Cut it out, fellas! I'm empty!!
jap: いーかげんにする、おめーら。 オレもうカラッケツ！！
re: Cut it out already, you guys. I'm flat out broke now!!

eng: What're you laughin' at... Don't judge a book by it's cover...
jap: なにわらってる、おめーら…… 本当の強さとは姿形などとは むかんけいなのだ……。
re: What're you guys laughing at......? There's no connection between form and true strength......
RetranslatorComment: Said the first time the player sees Spekkio in his pink Nu form.

eng: Well, well! People who lived long ago ALL enjoyed such powers... Now, I know you are itching to go ripping back and forth through time, but first you need to return to your era. And you must hurry. The longer you remain here, the harder it will be to change that which must be changed... Stop by whenever you're in the area!
jap: ほ、やはりな。 はるか昔の人々はみなそういった力を 持っていたもんじゃ。 そう、はるか昔……な。 お前さん達、何かとてつもない事を やらかそうというみたいじゃが まずはお前さん達の時代に もどってみてはどうかな……？ 急がばまわれ…… ここにいると、そんな言葉の意味も よくわかってくるものじゃ……。 何かあったら、いつでも来なさい。 私がお前さん達の時間の道しるべに なってやろう。
re: Oh? Just as I thought. All the people of the distant past had such power. Ah yes, the distant past...... It looks as though you guys are about to go and perpetrate something unreasonable, but perhaps you should first try returning to your era....? Less haste, more speed...... When you're here, you come to understand well the meaning even such words as those...... If anything happens, come any time. I shall be a guide to time for you.

eng: Come see me anytime. Think of me as your guide.
jap: 何かあったら、いつでも来なさい。 私がお前さん達の時間の道しるべに なってやろう。
re: If anything happens, come any time. I shall be a guide to time for you.

eng: Take me too!! Yes. No.
jap: 私も連れてってよー！ はい いいえ
re: Take me toooo! Yes No

eng: OKAY!
jap: よーし、ガンバるぞ！
re: Okay, I'll do my best!

eng: Aw, come on!
jap: ちェッ、つまんない！
re: Tch, boring!

eng: Don't you need my brain power? Yes. No.
jap: 私の頭脳が必要じゃなくって？ はい いいえ
re: You need my brains, don't you? Yes No

eng: See! You DO need me!
jap: やっぱ、私がいないとダメね！
re: It really isn't any good without me there!

eng: Oh, get outta here!
jap: あ、あらそう？
re: Oh, ah, really?
RetranslatorComment: I imagine her saying this with utter disbelief.

eng: May I be of assistance? Yes. No.
jap: 何かお役に立てマスカ？ はい いいえ
re: May I BE of use? Yes No

eng: I'm ready,  [member1]!
jap: リョウカイシマシタ。 [pc1]！
re: UNDERSTOOD. [pc1]!

eng: I shall be waiting for you.
jap: ご用の時はエンリョなく おもうしつけクダサイ。
re: PLEASE instruct me without RESTRAINT when you have a use for me.

eng: Go to «Proto Dome» 2300 A.D.? Yes. No.
jap: A．D．2300年『プロメテドーム』へ 行きますか？ はい いいえ
re: Go to A.D. 2300, “Promethe Dome”? Yes No

eng: Go to «Medina Village» 1000 A.D.? Yes. No.
jap: A．D．1000年『メディーナ村』へ 行きますか？ はい いいえ
re: Go to A.D. 1000, “Medina Village”? Yes No

eng: Go to «Mystic Mountain» 65,000,000 B. C.? Yes. No.
jap: B．C．6500万年『不思議山』へ 行きますか？ はい いいえ
re: Go to B.C. 65 million, “Mystery Mountains”? Yes No

eng: Jump? Yes. No.
jap: 飛びおりますか？ はい いいえ
re: Jump down? Yes No

eng: You wear odd skins.
jap: ダサい　そのカッコ……。
re: Your look lame......

eng: You want to see pretty red stone? Chief has.
jap: 赤い石　とてもキレイ。 オマエ　見たいか？ 酋長　持ってる。
re: Red stone very pretty. You want see? Chief has.

eng: Chief's hut, north of village.
jap: 酋長のテント　村の北。
re: Chief's tent north village.

eng: You one of Reptites? I beat you up!
jap: オマエ　恐竜人　仲間か？ やっつけるぞ！
re: You with Dinomen? I beat you up!

eng: Reptites have scales, cold blood. Hard to beat.
jap: 恐竜人　ザンコク　冷血。 恐竜人　カタいウロコ。 倒す　とても力いる。
re: Dinomen cruel cold blood. Dinomen hard scales. Need much power to beat.

eng: Drink Sweet Water? Grow strong when drink. Yes. No.
jap: 元気の水　飮むか？ 飮むと　元気モリモリ。 はい いいえ
re: Drink healthy water? Healthy surge up when drink. Yes No

eng: Recover HP/MP!
jap: HP・MPが回復した！
re: Recovered HP and MP!

eng: Thunder stun all dinosaur! You know?
jap: 恐竜　みんな　みんな　かみなりで ビリビリ　感電！　知ってたか？
re: Dinomen all, all get shock by thunder! You knew that?

eng: You strange! Have good stuff? Chief no okay, no can trade!
jap: オマエ　ヘンなヤツ。 何か　かわったモン　あるか？ いや　酋長の許しない　交換出来ない。
re: You weird. Got strange stuff? No, can't do trade chief not okay.

eng: Find «Petal,» «Fang,» «Horn,» and «Feather,» in hunting range! When rain, rare monster appear!
jap: かりの森　で　かりする。 『はなびら』　『きば』　『つの』 『はね』　あつまる！ それに　あめ　ふった時　とてもめずらしい モンスター　出る。 そいつ　おとく！　おとく！！
re: Hunt in Hunting Forest. Gather “Flower Petal”, “Fang”, “Horn”, “Feather”! And when rain, very rare monster come out. That one good profit! Good profit!!

eng: This trading house. Many things for trade.
jap: ここ　交換屋。 とって来た物　いろんな物 とりかえる。
re: This trade hut. Swap brought stuff, various stuff.

eng: Trade your shiny stone?!
jap: オマエの　そのキラキラした 石と交換！
re: Trade for your shiny stone!

eng: Strong one become chief. Man, woman, child, no matter. Chief of Ioka, big muscles!
jap: 酋長　強いもの　なる。 男でも　女でも　子供でも。 イオカの酋長は　むっちんプリプリ。
re: Strong one become chief. Man, woman, child, not matter. Ioka chief lithe muscle.
RetranslatorComment: Not sure about  むっちん, but few things make sense besides muscles,  and プリプリ in this context means firm and flexible.  After review, that's still my conclusion.

eng: You came from mountain? Many strange things happen there. That's why name Mystic Mountain. Find baby Kino crying on mountain too. Chief raise Kino. Now chief's right arm.
jap: お前達　あの山　来た？ あの山　不思議な事　よく起こる。 だから　不思議山　いう。 キーノも　そう。 ある日　山で　泣いてた。 酋長　キーノ　育てた。 キーノ　今　酋長の右腕。
re: You came that mountain? Many mystery things happen that mountain. So called Mystery Mountain. Kino same too. Was crying at mountain one day. Chief raised Kino. Now Kino chief's right arm.
RetranslatorComment: Right arm: figure of speech, same meaning as right-hand man.

eng: We fight Reptites. Laruba clan no fight Reptites.
jap: 俺達　恐竜人　戦う。 ラルバ族　戦わない。
re: We fight Dinomen. Laruba clan no fight.

eng: Laruba clan hide in north woods. Always hide, run from Reptites. Weaklings!
jap: ラルバ族　北の森　かくれてる。 かくれて　あっちこっち。 ラルバ族　恐竜人　逃げてる　弱虫！
re: Laruba clan hidden north forest. Hide here, there. Laruba clan cowards run from Dinomen!

eng: Laruba clan call Dactyl. Fly in sky! We no can call Dactyl, no can fly.
jap: ラルバ族　プテラン呼ぶ。　空　飛ぶ！ オレ達　呼べない。　空　飛べない。
re: Laruba clan call Pteran. Fly sky! We no can call. No can fly sky.

eng: Where you from? Why you here?
jap: お前ら　どっから来た？ ここ　何し　来た？
re: Where you come from? Why came here?

eng: Kino no like you!
jap: キーノ　お前ら　キライ！
re: Kino not like you!

eng: The Village of Magic
jap: 魔の村の人々
re: People of the Demon Village

eng: Hey! Did you people just come out of the closet? Get outta here!
jap: 兄ちゃん達、ボクの家のタンスから 出て来たよね……？ なんで？　どーして？
re: You came out of the chest of drawers in my house......? Why? How?

eng: Who do you think you are? Coming and going out of our closet at all hours. Scram!
jap: お、おまえらなあ、事もあろうに 他人の家のタンスから出てくるとは どういうつもりだ？ これだから人間ってヤツは……
re: Y, you guys, hey, what's the big idea, coming out of the chest of drawers in a stranger's house? That's why you humans are so......

eng: Wait a sec.
jap: ちょっと待つんだ。
re: Wait a sec.

eng: Medina village was founded by the ancestors of the Mystics, who lost a war to human beings. Most Mystics hold a grudge against humans. Be careful...
jap: このメディーナ村は、魔族の村。 400年前、人間との戦いに負けた魔族の 子孫によってつくられた村だ。 この村に住む魔族のほとんどは 人間に対してにくしみをいだいている。 気をつけな。
re: This Medina Village is the Demons' village. The village was built by descendants of the Demons who lost the war with humans 400 years ago. Most of the Demons who live in this village hold a grudge against humans. Be careful.

eng: Hey, wait a minute.
jap: あ、兄ちゃん達、ちょっと待って。
re: Ah, wait a sec, you guys.

eng: There's an odd man who lives near the cave in the mountains to the west. You might enjoy a chat with him.
jap: 西の山の洞窟の近くに、ちょっと変わった 人間のおじいさんが住んでいるんだ。 きっと兄ちゃん達の力になってくれるよ。
re: A rather peculiar old human man is living near the cave in the mountain to the west. He'll definitely help you guys out.

eng: Thanks!
jap: 教えてくれて、ありがとう！
re: Thanks for telling us!

eng: Why are you being so nice? Mystics aren't supposed to get along with humans.
jap: でも…… なぜ私達に親切にしてくれるの？ 魔族は人間をにくんでいるのでしょう？
re: But...... Why are you being kind to us? Demons hate humans, right?

eng: Thanks a lot! Say. We were told that Mystics hate humans. Why are you being so kind?
jap: アドバイス、どうも！ でも、魔族は人間をにくんでいるはず でしょう？ なぜ、あなた達は……？
re: Thanks for the advice! But, Demons are supposed to hate humans, right? Why are you......?

eng: Thank you for your help.
jap: 助言ヲありがとうゴザイマス。
re: THANK you for the suggestion.

eng: But why are you being so kind? The Mystics supposedly despise humans.
jap: シカシ、あなた方はナゼ 我々に親切にシテ下さるのデスカ？ 魔族ハ人間をニクんでいるのデハ？
re: HOWEVER, WHY are you graciously being kind to us? Do NOT the Demons HATe humans?

eng: Humans fought the Mystics over 400 years ago. My motto is «forgive and forget» but not many seem to agree with me.
jap: 人間と魔族が戦ったのは 400年も昔の事だ。　いつまでも過去に まあ、私達のような考えを持った魔族は ほとんどいないが……
re: It was 400 long years ago that the humans and Demons fought. There's no point in staying There are hardly any Demons who think like we do, though......

eng: You folks hungry? Yes. No.
jap: ん、兄ちゃん達も食べてく？ はい いいえ
re: Hey, are you eating too before you go? Yes No

eng: You can use magic?! Magic-using humans supposedly perished long ago.
jap: 兄ちゃん達は人間なのに、なぜ魔力を 持ってるの？ 魔法を使える人間はずっと昔にいなくなった はずなのに……
re: Why do you have magical powers even though you're human? Humans who can use magic were supposed to have died out in the far distant past......

eng: No human's gonna talk to ME!
jap: 人間風情が、この俺様に話しかけるな！
re: Don't talk to me, you worthless humans.

eng: Nothing here to sell to humans! Get out of here!
jap: 人間なんかに売ってやるモノはないね。 とっとと帰りな。
re: I've got nothing I'd sell to the likes of humans. Hurry up and go home.

eng: Give up.
jap: あきらめる
re: Give up

eng: You know-it-all humans! Teach 'em a lesson, boss! They got the boss?! Beasts! All right. I'll sell something to you.
jap: 人間ごときがえらそうに！ 先生、ノシてやって下さい！ せ、先生が殺られた！？ こいつら、化け物だ～！ しかたがない。　売ってやるよ。
re: You're awfully full of yourself for a mere human! Sensei, please take them down! S, sensei was killed!? These guy's are monsters! I've got no choice. I'll sell.

eng: Plead.
jap: たのみこむ
re: Plead

eng: Hah! You think I'm gonna cut my prices for a HUMAN?!
jap: へっ！　人間なんぞに まともな値で売ってやるもんか！
re: Heh! As if I'd sell to the likes of humans at fair prices!

eng: You're spoilin' my meal! Scram!
jap: 酒がマズくなる！　あっちに行け！
re: You're spoiling the sake! Get lost!

eng: Hah! I hope those humans get what they deserve from Heckran!
jap: へっ、人間なんかヘケランのちょうはつに のせられて、いたい目を見りゃいいんだ。 ウケケケ。
re: Heh, I hope those humans fall for Hekeran's taunting and suffer for it. Uke, ke, ke.
RetranslatorComment: evil cackling.

eng: No room here for humans. Scat! Give up and walk away. Plead with them. Awww! Pipe down, okay!! Get' em!
jap: 人間なんか、とまらせてやるギリはないね。 とっとと帰りな。 あきらめる たのみこむ うるせえ！　ゴチャゴチャぬかすな！！ 殺っちまえ！
re: We've got no obligation to let the likes of humans stay here. Hurry up and go home. Give up Plead Shut up! Quit whining!! Kill them!

eng: Shriek!!! Help! 200G per night. Wouldn't you like to rest?
jap: ひえ～、お助け～！ 1ぱく200Gだ。 とまらせてほしいのか？
re: Hieey, spare me! One night's 200G. Want me to let you stay?

eng: Yes.
jap: はい
re: Yes

eng: No.
jap: いいえ
re: No

eng: STATUS: Not enough money
jap: STATUS: Not enough money
re: STATUS: Not enough money

eng: Not enough cash, huh?
jap: 金がたりないようだな。
re: It seems you don't have enough money.

eng: I'm Ozzie VIII, Medina village's leader! My ancestors served the great Magus. Oh, great Magus...why didn't you simply exterminate the human race 400 years ago?
jap: ワシがこのメディーナ村の村長 ビネガー8世じゃ！ ワシの先祖は、あのいだいな魔王様の ああ、魔王様……　なぜ400年前に 人間達をほろぼして下さらなかったのじゃ？
re: I am chief of this Medina Village, Vinnegar the 8th! My ancestor fought humans as right-hand man Ahh, Magus-sama...... Why didn't you graciously destroy humans for us 400 years ago?

eng: This work is brutal.
jap: そうじも楽じゃないよ……
re: Cleaning's no easy task......

eng: Ozzie VIII uses his ancestors' fame to boss us around!
jap: ちくしょう、ビネガー8世のヤロウ！ 先祖の地位をカサにきて 俺達をこき使いやがって。
re: Damn it, Vinnegar the 8th, you bastard! Damn you for taking advantage of your ancestor's position and overworking us.

eng: A beast lives in a cave on the mountain to the west. Only magic attacks can harm it. Those who do not possess magic will find it difficult sneak by. Well, I better get back to work and tidy up before Ozzie VIII finds me.
jap: 西の山の洞窟にすむ魔物は 魔法による攻撃しかうけつけないんだ。 魔法が使えない人間では さ、ビネガー8世に見つかるまえに そうじを終わらせなきゃ。
re: The monsters living in the cave in the mountain to the west don't take damage except from magic attacks. I'll bet humans would have a hard time Now, I have to get the cleaning finished before I'm noticed by Vinnegar the 8th.

eng: Crono, what's that weird chanting?
jap: ねえ、クロノ。 この不気味な声は何なのかしら？
re: Hey, Crono. I wonder what those eerie voices are?

eng: That chanting's pretty creepy! What do you make of it?
jap: ……不気味な声ね。 ここで何が行なわれているのかしら？
re: ......eerie voices. I wonder what's being done here?

eng: From where does this eerie chanting originate?
jap: コ、コノ不気味ナ声ハ イッタイ何なのでショウカ？
re: Wh, what ON EARTH could THESE eerie voices BE?

eng: Hut! Sir Magus
jap: ははーっ！　魔王様～
re: Yessir! Magus-sama~

eng: As soon as Magus's creation, the mighty Lavos, awakens from his long sleep, the human race is doomed.
jap: 魔王様が我々のために生み出された ラヴォス神が永き眠りからめざめれば 人間どもの世界などいっしゅんで終わりだ。
re: When the god Lavos, who was brought forth for us by Magus-sama, awakens from his long sleep, the world of the humans will be over in an instant.

eng: 400 years have passed since Magus commanded the Mystics, and waged war against the humans. When Lavos is awakened, all humans are DOOMED! Mwa ha!
jap: 魔王様が我ら魔族をひきいて人間に 戦いをいどんでから、400年が過ぎた。 ラヴォス神さえよみがえれば、人間など……
re: 400 years have passed since Magus-sama led us Demons and challenged the humans to war. If only the god Lavos were revived, the likes of humans......

eng: Long ago, the all mighty Magus brought forth the all-powerful Lavos.
jap: その昔、強大な魔力を持つ魔王様が ラヴォス神をたんじょうさせたのだ。
re: Long ago, Magus-sama, with his mighty powers of magic, caused the god Lavos to be born.

eng: Ah, hello! Could I interest you in a weapon? Yes, I'd like to buy one. No, I'm not interested.
jap: おお、たずねて来おったか！ ワシのじまんのコレクションでも 見て行くとよい。 ゆかんか？　安くしとくぞ。 はい いいえ
re: Oh, come to visit, have you! I hope you go view my proud collection too. I've made, haven't you? I'll make it cheap.

eng: Weapons... If there weren't evil in this world, there would be no need for weapons. What a sad state of affairs...
jap: 武器はな…… 生命をうばうための物ではないぞ。 生かすための物であるべきじゃ。
re: Weapons, you see...... They aren't for taking life. They ought to be for bringing life.

eng: Really? Well, you know where to find me should the need arise.
jap: そうか、ザンネンじゃの。
re: I see, that's too bad.

eng: That sword is an invention of mine. It's lightweight and handles superbly.
jap: それはの、かるくて使いやすい 名剣じゃ。 モチロン、ワシの作品じゃぞ。
re: That's a superior sword, lightweight and easy to use. Naturally, it's my work.

eng: Should you desire to return to Truce village, use the shortcut through the cave in the mountains to the north.
jap: そうじゃ、おぬし達。 トルース町に帰りたいのであれば、 この家の北にある山の洞窟を ぬけて行くがよい。
re: Ah, yes, you guys. If you want to return to the town of Truce, you should pass through the cave in the mountain north of this house.

eng: Death to the Mystics' enemies!
jap: 魔族の敵に死を！
re: Death to the Demons' enemies!

eng: If only the great Magus who brought forth Lavos 400 years ago, had destroyed the human race! The world would've belonged to us Mystics! GRRRRRR!
jap: ラヴォス神を生んだ魔王様が 400年前に人間共をほろぼしておいて くだされば、今ごろこの世界は ク　ソ　ー　ッ　！
re: If Magus-sama, who gave birth to the god Lavos, had graciously destroyed humans for us, the world of today would have been the age of us Demons...... D A M N !

eng: In the Middle Ages, Magus created Lavos, the destroyer of this planet's future!
jap: やっぱり、中世の魔王が この星の未来をメチャクチャにした ラヴォスを生んだのね……。
re: So the Magus of the Middle Ages really did give birth to the Lavos that wrecked this planet's future......

eng: In the Middle Ages, Magus created Lavos, who is responsible for destroying this planet's future.
jap: この星の未来をメチャメチャに したラヴォスを生んだのが 中世の魔王なのね……。
re: So the one who gave birth to the Lavos that wrecked this planet's future was the Magus of the Middle Ages......

eng: If we go to the Middle Ages and take out Magus, can we change history?
jap: 中世へ行って魔王を 倒せば歴史は変わるのかしら？
re: I wonder if history will change if we go to the Middle Ages and beat Magus?

eng: If we go to the Middle Ages and destroy Magus, can we change history?
jap: 魔王を中世で倒ス事ガ 出来レバ、歴史は変わるのでショウカ？
re: If we CAN defEAT Magus in the Middle Ages, MIGHT history change?

eng: We could use the Gate at the Fairgrounds!
jap: 千年祭広場のゲートを 使えば……。
re: If we use the Gate in the Millenial Festival square......

eng: Hey, Crono, we could use the Gate at the Fairgrounds!
jap: ねえ、クロノ。 千年祭広場のゲートを使えば……。
re: Hey, Crono. If we use the Gate in the Millenial Festival square......

eng: The Hero Appears
jap: 現われた　伝説の勇者
re: Appeared: The Legendary Hero

eng: If you see Lucca, tell her to drop by!
jap: ルッカに会ったら言っといて くれよ。
re: Tell Lucca I said 'hi' when you see her.
RetranslatorComment: He doesn't actually say WHAT to tell her,  but this makes as much sense as anything.

eng: Hey, Lucca!
jap: おう！　ルッカ。
re: Oh! Lucca.

eng: I'd like to see more of her. I've been making items she'd like.
jap: たまには、かお見せろって。 俺はルッカの気に入る防具を せっせと作ってるからな。
re: Show your face once in a while. I've been hard at work making armors you'd like.

eng: You're not going anywhere!
jap: 逃がすかーッ！
re: As if we'd let you get away!

eng: It's locked tight…
jap: かたく閉ざされている……。
re: It's shut tight......

eng: Come on, Crono! I don't wanna see that bullheaded fool!
jap: 行こう、クロノ！ あんなわからず屋の父上なんか 会いたくない！
re: Let's go, Crono! I don't wanna meet that thickheaded father!

eng: T, Terrorists!!
jap: テ、テロリストいちみだーッ！！
re: It, it's a gang of terrorists!!

eng: This is NOT good.
jap: マ、マズいわよ！！
re: Crap, not good!!

eng: What is going on?!
jap: ナ、何なんデス～！？
re: WH, what IS this!?

eng: Who, what? Terrorists?!
jap: テロリストお！？
re: Terrorists!?
RetranslatorComment: Frog has to be in the party here, of course.

eng: Come on in!!
jap: へい！　らっしゃい……！！
re: Hey! Welcome......!!

eng: Crono!! I owe you one! You saved my skin back there.
jap: クロノさん！！！ あの時は本当にありがとう ございました。 おかげでこうして家にもどることも 出来ました。
re: Crono-san!!! Seriously, thank you for back then. Thanks to you, I was able to come back home like this too.

eng: Man, was I up the creek! I went off on a buying trip, and ended up getting jailed with a bunch of thieves! The officials planned to execute me without a trial! What has gotten into them?
jap: まいりましたよ……。 おやじを見返してやろうと思って しいれの旅にでたのはいいんですが…… 帰りの宿で、ごうとうだんのとりものに まきこまれましてね。 いっしょに、つかまってしまった わけなんですよ。 それにしても私の話を聞きもしないで 死刑！　なんですから……、ふう…… ほんとうに助かりましたよ。
re: I'm beat...... I was thinking I'd outdo my old man, and going on a trip to stock up was all well and good...... But at the inn on the way back, I got caught up in the arrest of a gang of robbers. I got arrested along with them. Besides that, the death penalty, without even listening to my story! Why in the...... phew...... You really saved me.

eng: We're forever in your debt! Thank you, again!
jap: 本当に、本当に ありがとうございました。 私、今しあわせです。
re: I truly, truly, thank you. I'll be happy now.

eng: Hope my Dad never hears about this. Get 10 Mid Ethers!
jap: これ、おやじにはないしょで…… ミドルエーテルを10コ手に入れた！！
re: Keep this secret from my old man...... Got 10 Middle Ethers!!

eng: Huh, hey!
jap: ん、んん！
re: Ahem!
RetranslatorComment: He's probably clearing his throat to get their attention.

eng: D, Dad!
jap: お、おやじ！
re: D, dad!

eng: Working hard?
jap: ちゃんと、やってるんだろうな？
re: You're running things proper-like, right?

eng: But, of course! R, right?
jap: も、もちろん。な、なあ。
re: Of, of course. R, right?

eng: Y, yes.
jap: え、ええ。
re: Uh, yeah.

eng: Well, all right...
jap: まあ、いいだろう……。
re: Well, all right......

eng: Crono... I'm in your debt.
jap: クロノさん……。 ほんとうに、ありがとうございました。
re: Crono-san...... I truly thank you.

eng: Now Crono, down to business. Please, buy whatever you like!
jap: さあ、クロノさん。 こっからは商売だ、俺がしいれた物 買っていってくれ。
re: Well, Crono-san. It's business from here on, go on and buy what I stocked up.

eng: Welcome,  [member1]!
jap: いらっしゃい！ [pc1]さん。
re: Welcome! [pc1]-san.

eng: Thanks!
jap: まいど！！
re: Come again!!

eng: Crono!
jap: クロノ！！
re: Crono!!

eng: Crono! You had me so worried! I heard you were to be executed, dear.
jap: クロノ！　クロノ！！ よかった……。 母さん、あんたが死刑になるって 聞いて……
re: Crono! Crono!! What a relief...... I heard you were going to be executed......
RetranslatorComment: Actually, she's speaking  in third person (your mother heard...), as she usually (always?) does when  addressing Crono.

eng: Stop scaring me like that!
jap: もう、母さんを心配させるんじゃ ないわよ。
re: Don't make me worry any more.

eng: Hi!
jap: こんにちは、ジナおばさん！
re: Good afternoon, Jina oba-san!
RetranslatorComment: Probably could change this to “Ms. Jina” or maybe “Auntie Jina” if it's understood that she's not actually her aunt.

eng: Lucca! We hardly see you these days!
jap: おや、ルッカ。 最近、うちにあんまり来ないのね？
re: Oh, Lucca. You haven't been coming around much lately.

eng: I've been kinda busy...
jap: 最近、研究いそがしくって。
re: I've been busy with research lately.

eng: Don't let life pass you by, dear! And say «Hi» to your parents!
jap: そう、あんまりガンバリすぎて 体こわさないようにね。 ララとタバンにもよろしく言って ちょうだいな。
re: Yes, well make sure you don't push yourself too hard and damage your health. Give my best regards to Lara and Taban too, please.

eng: Goodness...! Lucca, is THIS one of your inventions?
jap: あら……、ルッカの発明品？
re: Oh my..... an invention of Lucca's?

eng: Greetings. I am Robo. Crono is my friend.
jap: お初にお目にかかりマス。 私はロボともうしマス。 クロノには、大変お世話に なっておりマス。
re: We mEET for the first time. I am calLED Robo. I have reciEVED considerable assistance from Crono.

eng: My, how polite! Strange looking, but well behaved! Crono, you could learn a thing or two.
jap: あらあら、ごていねいに。 ちょっと変わったカッコだけど とっても、れいぎ正しいわね。 クロノも少しは見ならいなさい。
re: My, my, so courteous. Even though you look a bit peculiar, you're very polite. Crono, follow his example a little.

eng: Go to «Leene Square» 1000 A.D.? Yes. No.
jap: A．D．1000年『リーネ広場』へ 行きますか？ はい いいえ
re: Go to A.D. 1000, “Leene Square”? Yes No

eng: Go to «Truce Canyon» 600 A.D.? Yes. No.
jap: A．D．600年『トルース村裏山』へ 行きますか？ はい いいえ
re: Go to A.D. 600, “Truce Village Back Hills”? Yes No

eng: Go to «Guardia Forest» 1000 A.D.? Yes. No.
jap: A．D．1000年『ガルディアの森』へ 行きますか？ はい いいえ
re: Go to A.D. 1000, “Guardia Forest”? Yes No

eng: Go to «Bangor Dome» 2300 A.D.? Yes. No.
jap: A．D．2300年『バンゴドーム』へ 行きますか？ はい いいえ
re: Go to A.D. 2300, “Bango Dome”? Yes No

eng: Wearing the «Hero Medal,» the chosen one has appeared! We're saved!
jap: なーに、心配いりません。 勇者のあかしといわれる 『勇者バッジ』をもった方が ついに、あらわれたんです！ これでこの世界にもやっと 平和がかえってきます。 よかった、本当によかった……。
re: What, there's nothing to worry about. The one holding the “Hero Badge”, said to be proof of the hero, has finally appeared! Now peace will finally come back to this world. Thank goodness, really, thank goodness......

eng: I heard Magus's army is at the bridge. We're in trouble now!
jap: なんでも魔王軍がゼナンの橋まで 来てるって話じゃないか。 一体どうなっちまうのかね。
re: Word is that Magus's army's come all the to the Zenan Bridge, isn't it? Just what's going to happen now?

eng: Have you heard?! The legendary Hero has appeared! He went to see the King. Now Magus's army hasn't a chance!
jap: あんた聞いたかね！ あらわれたんだよ！　ついに！ 伝説の勇者様がねっ！ それで、王様に会うため 城に向かったって話だ。 いやー、これで魔王軍もオシマイだな！
re: Have you heard?! He's appeared! Finally! The legendary Hero! And they say he headed to the castle to meet the King. Wow, Magus's army is done for now!

eng: They say the King has been wounded! Is this the end?
jap: 何でも王も倒れられたって言うし…… もうオシマイかー。
re: They say even the king has fallen...... Are we done for?

eng: No, the Hero has appeared! He'll save us!
jap: いや伝説の勇者様が現われたから もうだいじょうぶだ！
re: No, the legendary Hero has appeared, so everything's fine now!

eng: Is it true? I heard Magus's army has taken the bridge!
jap: 国王軍が前線でやぶれ 魔王軍が橋まで攻めて来てるって 話だが本当か？
re: Is it true that the royal army was beaten in the front lines and Magus's army is coming to attack as far up as the bridge?

eng: I had almost completed the bell when Magus's army wounded our King. I've lost the will to work.
jap: この鐘の完成も近いんだが……。 国王軍が魔王軍にやぶれて ガルディア王も負傷された。 鐘どころじゃねえやな……。
re: This bell is almost complete, but...... The royal army was beaten by Magus's army, and King Guardia was wounded too. This is no time for BELLS......

eng: I hope this bell will ring in a new world of peace.
jap: 私は、このリーネの鐘が 平和な世になりひびく…… そんな日が来るって信じてるの。 どんな時でも希望は失わないように……。
re: I hope that this, Leene's Bell, will ring out on a peaceful world...... I believe that such a day will come. May we never lose hope......

eng: Magus's army is awfully well trained!
jap: あとは魔王軍をげきたい出来れば……
re: Now, if we can just repel Magus's army......

eng: Our rations have run out! Have the supplies from Guardia Castle arrived yet?!
jap: 食料が底をついてしまった…… ガルディア城からのホキュウはまだか！
re: The food's bottomed out...... Aren't the supplies from Guardia Castle here yet?!

eng: Forming a protective ring around the Hero, the best knights of the Kingdom kicked off the offensive.
jap: 勇者様を守って、騎土団のせいえいが 突撃を開始しました。
re: Protecting the Hero, the best of the Knights have initiated an assault.

eng: It appears our knights and Magus's troops are locked in battle, at the center of the bridge. May we emerge victorious!
jap: 橋のまん中で騎土団と魔王軍が げきとつしたようだ。がんばってくれ……。
re: It looks as though the Knights and Magus's army have run into each other in the middle of the bridge. Keep at it......

eng: Does the Hero alone have the power to take on Magus's army?
jap: しかし、勇者様一人の力で 魔王軍をうちやぶれるのだろうか？
re: But can the Hero crush Magus's army with just his own power?

eng: We cannot defeat Magus's army by ourselves. Our only hope is the Hero.
jap: 我々の力では、魔王軍に勝てない…… 情けない事だが、勇者様だけがたよりだ。
re: We can't beat Magus's army with our power...... It's shameful, but our only recourse is the Hero.

eng: I never believed those stories about the Hero and his legendary medal... Now it turns out he's our only hope.
jap: 勇者バッジを持った勇者……。 おとぎ話だとばかり思っていた……。 今となっては勇者様の力を信じるしかない。
re: The hero who holds the Hero Badge...... I always thought it was a fairy tale...... Now there's no choice but to trust in the Hero's power.

eng: Our food supplies have run out.
jap: もう食料がありません……
re: There's no food any more......

eng: Oh, it's you again.
jap: 何だ、お前か。
re: Oh, it's you.

eng: Magus's troops had us cornered but the appearance of the Hero, saved us.
jap: 魔王軍におされていたが もう、だいじょぶだ。 勇者様があらわれたんだからな！
re: We were being pressed by Magus's army, but everything's fine now. For the Hero has appeared!

eng: Hero? He just went to see the King a moment ago.
jap: 勇者様？ 今ここを通って王に会いにいかれたよ。
re: The Hero? He just now went through here to see the King.

eng: The Knight Captain has gone to Zenan Bridge. Many of the wounded from there, are resting below.
jap: 騎土団長はゼナン橋に行かれた。 下は負傷者でいっぱいだ。
re: The Knight Captain is at Zenan Bridge. Below, it's full with the wounded.

eng: I'm sorry, the beds are all taken.
jap: すみません、ベッドがいっぱいで……
re: I'm sorry, the beds are full......

eng: Even the Knight Captain went to the front lines...
jap: 騎土団長まで、前線に行かれたと いうのに……
re: Even though even the Knight Captain is at the front lines......
RetranslatorComment: ...I'm stuck here.

eng: Magus has already defeated 3 fierce warriors.
jap: 魔王め、ついに3大しょう軍を戦いに とうじて来やがった。
re: That damn Magus finally threw his three great generals into the battle.

eng: There's a food shortage on the front lines.
jap: 前線の食料もそろそろ底をつくころ……
re: Food's about to hit bottom on the front lines too......

eng: Heard something 'bout a hero showing up.
jap: 勇者があらわれたって、話だが……
re: A hero's appeared, or so they say......

eng: Argh...
jap: うう……
re: Oohh......

eng: The King's trying his best, too. So snap out of it!
jap: 王様もガンバってんだ。 しっかりしな！
re: The King's doing all he can too. Keep it together!

eng: The chef's in a snit, trying to get food to the front lines while keeping the King healthy.
jap: 料理長は前線へとどける食料と、王に体力を つけようと、大いそがしさ。
re: Between the food sent to the front lines and trying to recover the king's strength, the Head Cook is very busy.

eng: Hey you, is this food good enough for the King?
jap: あんた、王様のお食事はこれでいいかい？
re: You there, will this do for the King's food?

eng: We've got to nurse the King back to good health!
jap: 王様にはスタミナをつけてもらわなきゃ！
re: We've gotta build up the King's stamina!

eng: Chef, hurry with the food that goes to Zenan Bridge!
jap: 料理長、ゼナン橋への食料も急がないと！
re: Head Cook, we must hurry with the food that goes to Zenan bridge too!

eng: What? My brother?! He's...
jap: 何？　アニキが！？ ……。
re: What? Big bro!? ..…

eng: That's what you get for thinkin' that you're the only ones fighting for your country!
jap: ヘッ、てめえ達だけで この国を守ってると思ったむくいだ。
re: Heh, that's what you bastards get for thinking it's just you protecting this country.

eng: Hey!
jap: あんた！
re: You!

eng: Stop bickering! Grow up!
jap: いつまでも、つまんない意地 はりあってんじゃないよ、男だろ！
re: Don't keep up this pointless stubborn thing with each other forever, aren't you a man?!

eng: ... Pipe down! What do you know?!
jap: …… るせえ！　お前に何がわかる！
re: ...... Shaddup! What do you know!

eng: Men are such fools!
jap: バカだね、男ってな！
re: They're such idiots, men!

eng: He acts that way, but the chef always worries about the Knight Captain.
jap: ああ言ってますけど、料理長は いつも騎土団長をしんぱいしてますよ。
re: He talks like that, but the Head Cook always worries about the Knight Captain.

eng: Those two are really looking for a way to make up.
jap: 本当は二人とも、なかなおりする きっかけをさがしてるのよ。
re: The truth is those two are looking for a chance to make up.

eng: Hey, hey, come on now!!
jap: そらそら～ッ！！
re: Hey, HEY!!

eng: Wait!
jap: 「待ちな！
re: 'Wait!

eng: ... Take this with you!
jap: ハアハア…… これを持ってってくれ！
re: haa, haa...... Take this with you!

eng: And, this is for you guys. Take it, will ya.
jap: それから、こいつはお前らにだ。 持ってけ。
re: And, this is for you guys. Take it.

eng: And tell that fool... He had better come back alive!
jap: それから、あのバカに
re: And, tell that idiot this for me

eng: Sir Crono! The legendary Hero has finally appeared! He just arrived a moment ago, to meet the King.
jap: おお、クロノどの！ ついに伝説の勇者様が姿を あらわしたのじゃ！ つい先ほど、ここに立ち寄られ 王に会いに行かれましたぞ。
re: Ohh, Crono-dono! The legendary Hero has finally made his appearance! Just a short time ago, he visited here and went to see the king.

eng: The King was injured, and is recuperating in bed.
jap: 王は、お部屋でねこまれている。
re: The King is bedridden in his room.
RetranslatorComment: No mention of why, but other characters explain that well  enough.

eng: Queen Leene has been at his side all night.
jap: リーネ様も王の部屋で、ねずのかんびょうを しておられる。
re: Leene-sama, too, is in the King's room, looking after him all night long.

eng: The King fought bravely against Magus's troops. Had he not heard of the arrival of the Hero, he might have fought to the death!
jap: おいたわしや！　王は魔王軍を前に みずから剣をとり戦ったのです。 もし伝説の勇者様が現れたという 知らせを受けなければ、王は引かずに あのまま戦死されていたやも知れません。
re: How terrible! The king took up his sword and personally battled Magus's army earlier. Had we not received word that the legendary Hero had appeared, the king might have kept on without falling back, and fought to the death.
RetranslatorComment: Meaning of first  sentence guessed based on context. Google turns up plenty of results for that  exclamation, but I couldn't find a single one that gives any explanation. It  might be some kind of joke-fad line like the 'all your base' insanity.

eng: I'm so ashamed... I treated him badly, thinking he was just some brat. Luckily, he forgave me. A hero, HE IS.
jap: 私は自分がはずかしい……。 はじめ、あのお方を勇者様とは気付かず ただのこぎたないガキだと思って しかし私は許されました。 なんと心の広い人物でしょう。 さすがは勇者様です。
re: I am ashamed of myself...... I'm afraid that at first, not realizing that person was the Hero and thinking he was just a filthy However, I was forgiven. What a generous personage. It is as befits the Hero.

eng: At this rate, Queen Leene will also succumb.
jap: このままではリーネ様も、まいって しまいます。
re: At this rate, Leene-sama will collapse of exhaustion too.
RetranslatorComment: Based on context, this  seems to be about right. The verb is very vague, and while the basic meaning  is 'go' or 'come', it's also used in all sorts of more idiomatic ways,  including being beaten, falling for someone, or being dead tired.

eng: Oh, Crono... I've let down my kingdom. Since we cannot locate Cyrus, our sole hope rests on the boy who has the hero medal... He searches the southern continent, for the sword that can defeat Magus.
jap: おお、クロノ。 もう、私も年老いたかな……。 サイラスの消そくが、つかめぬ以上 あのバッジを持った少年こそ 残されたゆいいつの希望……。 少年は、魔王を倒せる伝説の剣を もとめて南の大陸へ向かったよ。
re: Ohh, Crono. I wonder if I have grown old already...... As long as we are unable to catch hold of any news of Cyrus, it is that boy who holds the who is our sole remaining hope...... The boy headed for the southern continent, seeking the legendary sword that can beat Magus.

eng: Cyrus must have sent the boy to us.
jap: きっとサイラスが、あの少年をよこして くれたのですわ。
re: Surely Cyrus sent that boy to us.

eng: Mere mortals can never expect to beat Magus's troops.
jap: やはり人間の力では、魔王軍には かなわないのか……
re: Can we really not handle Magus's army with human power......?

eng: The Hero has made it across the bridge somehow, but our troops have suffered heavy losses.
jap: 勇者様は、何とか橋をわたりました。 しかしわが軍は、大きないた手をこうむって しまいました……
re: The Hero crossed the bridge somehow. But I'm afraid our army suffered a very serious blow......

eng: Aaagh!
jap: うう……
re: Uggh......

eng: Magus's army has the advantage now. Keep back!
jap: 魔王軍が 新手をくり出して来た。 今は危険だ。　下がっていなさい。
re: Magus's army has sent out a fresh supply of troops. It's dangerous now. Stay back.

eng: Sir Crono! Is that for us? Yes. No.
jap: クロノ殿、何事かな？ 料理長の食料をわたしますか？ はい いいえ
re: Crono-dono, what is it? Give him the Head Cook's food? Yes No

eng: Food rations! The cook...he has saved us all!
jap: こ、これは！？ そうですか、あいつが……
re: Th, this!? I see, he......

eng: Sir Crono, if I do not make it back... ...give my brother my thanks...
jap: クロノ殿、もし私がここで 死んだならば、弟に……
re: Crono-dono, if I die here, tell my little brother......

eng: WHAT is going on here?!
jap: 何事だ！！
re: What's going on!!

eng: Magus's troops have launched an attack! They're breaking through our defenses!!!
jap: 魔王軍の攻撃が始まりました！ もうささえきれません！
re: Magus's army's attack has begun! We can't hold any longer!

eng: Stop sniveling! It shames the Knights of the Square Table! We shall DESTROY Magus's troops and bring honor to our King!
jap: 弱音をはくな！ ガルディア王国騎土団のめいよにかけ 魔王軍をげきたいするのだ！
re: Don't whine! On the honor of the Guardia Royal Knights, repel Magus's army!

eng: But, we are far outnumbered!
jap: し、しかし、もう兵の数が……。
re: B, but, the number of soldiers is already......

eng: This is our last line of defense. We must let no one through!
jap: ここが最後の防えい線なのだ。 もうひとがんばりしてくれ！
re: This is our last line of defense. Hold out a while longer!

eng: Understood!
jap: わかりました！
re: Understood!

eng: Our troops are suffering greatly. Sir Crono, will you assist us? Yes. No.
jap: ごらんのとおり、我が軍は 苦戦しております…… クロノ殿、助太刀願えませぬか？ はい いいえ
re: As you can see, our army is fighting a difficult battle...... Crono-dono, may I not implore your assistance? Yes No

eng: We are eternally in your debt! You will find Magus's troops across the bridge! Take this with you!
jap: かたじけない！　魔王軍は 橋の向こうのたもとにおります！ これをお持ち下さい。 きっとクロノ殿のお役にたつはず。
re: We are grateful! Magus's army is at the far foot of the bridge! Please take this. It should surely be of use to you.

eng: Magus's troops are highly trained. Please be on your guard.
jap: 魔王軍は手強い敵です。 くれぐれもお気をつけて。
re: Magus's army is a tough foe. I insist that you be careful.

eng: I see... We Knights of the Square Table cannot surrender. We shall hold this position to the last man!
jap: そうですか……。 だが我等もガルディア王国騎土団。 メンツにかけてこの橋は死守しますぞ！
re: I see...... Be we are the Knights of Guardia Kingdom. Upon our honor, we will defend this bridge to the

eng: I'm Ozzie, Magus's top general! Those who dare defy Magus have to answer to me!
jap: ワシは、魔王様だいいちの部下 魔王3大しょうぐんの、ビネガー。 いだいなる魔王様の敵に、死を！
re: I am Magus-sama's foremost subordinate, Vinnegar of Magus's Three Great Generals. Death to the enemies of the great Magus-sama!

eng: Yes my children... Give 'em a taste of doom!
jap: ワシのかわいいムスコ達よ！ こやつらに死をあたえるのだ！
re: My dear children! Confer death upon them!

eng: Those wimps're stronger than I thought.
jap: くう～、なかなかやるな。
re: Khuu, better than I expected.

eng: Wait up, already!
jap: 待ちなさいったら！
re: Wait up!

eng: He's pretty swift when it comes to running away.
jap: 逃げ足だけははやいわね。
re: You're fast at running away, at least.

eng: We've got him.
jap: 追いつきマシタ。
re: We HAVE caught up.

eng: Seems I misjudged you. But I won't do that twice!
jap: 少々、お前達をあまく 見すぎていたようだ。 しかし、今度はそうはいかんぞ。
re: It looks as though I took you a bit too lightly. But that won't happen this time.

eng: Grrrr! You're through!
jap: 殺っちまえ！
re: Kill them off!

eng: Drat!
jap: ちくしょー！
re: Dammit!

eng: That's IT! Now you're finished!
jap: こ、今度こそお前達も おしまいだぞ！　ホントだぞ！
re: Th, this time for sure, it'll be over for you too! Really!

eng: Don't mess with Crono, or you'll really be sorry!
jap: 何よ！ クロノをナメると イタイ目見るわよ！
re: What's your problem! Underestimate Crono and you'll pay for it!

eng: Poor sport, huh?
jap: ふん、負けおしみね。
re: Hmph, you're a poor loser.

eng: You cannot win. You had best surrender.
jap: アナタに勝ち目はありマセン。 コウフクシナサイ。
re: YOU have NO chance. SURRENDER.

eng: Go Zombor! Crush Sir Magus's enemies!
jap: ゆけ、ジャンクドラガー！ 魔王様の敵をたたきのめせ！
re: Go, Junkdragar! Take down Magus-sama's enemies!

eng: Thanks to Sir Crono, we held the bridge! But, unless we defeat Magus, this is an empty victory.
jap: クロノ殿のおかげで 橋を守りきる事が出来ました。 しかし、魔王を倒さない事には こんぽん的な解決にはなりません。
re: Thanks to you, we were able to protect the bridge to the end. But there will be no overall resolution unless we can beat Magus.

eng: We held Zenan Bridge with Sir Crono's help.
jap: ゼナンの橋を魔王軍から とりもどす事ができました。 これもクロノ殿のおかげです。
re: We were able to take back Zenan Bridge from Magus's army. This, too, is thanks to Crono-dono.

eng: Welcome, what can I do for you? Thanks a lot!
jap: いらっしゃいまーしい。 今日はどんなごようで？ まいど、ありあとやしたー！
re: Welcome. What do you need today? Y'all come again!
RetranslatorComment: well, she DOES have an accent...

eng: The Hero has appeared? That means the epic battle will begin!
jap: 伝説の勇者様があらわれたんだって？ いよいよ歴史にのこるような 戦いのひぶたが きっておとされるのかねえ……。
re: The legendary Hero has appeared? Could that mean a battle to make history is finally going to be sparked......?

eng: Mom said I can't play outside 'cause of the monsters. I'm so bored!
jap: 魔物達がね、いっぱいいてね あぶないから、外に出ちゃダメだって。 チェッ、つまんないよー。
re: There's lots of monsters. They say I can't go outside cause it's dangerous. Tch, bo-o-oring.

eng: I heard Magus knows arcane magic which the monsters can't match.
jap: なんでも魔王は、失われた太古の魔術を あやつるという話よな。 そこいらの魔物どもの術など くらべものにならぬ おそろしいものだそうな。
re: The word is that Magus commands ancient lost magical arts. Supposedly it's something terrifying, incomparable to the arts of the monsters around here.

eng: Oh! Where could Sir Cyrus be? Surely he hasn't deserted the kingdom?
jap: ああ、騎土サイラス様は どこへ行かれてしまったのでしょう？ まさか…… 王国を見すて、一人でどこかへ 逃げてしまわれたとか……？
re: Aaah, where has the knight Cyrus-sama gone? Don't tell me...... He can't have abandoned the kingdom and run away by himself somewhere......?

eng: Is it true that the King was injured? What's going to happen to us, and to our country...?
jap: 王が負傷されたというウワサは本当か？ おお、この国は、われらは 一体どうなってしまうというのだ……？
re: Are the rumors that the King was injured true? Ohh, just what will become of us and this kingdom......?

eng: It's locked!
jap: なんとカギがかかっている！
re: What the, it's locked!

eng: Hey! Is that a Naga-ette Bromide you've got there?! I'll trade you something good for it. How about it?
jap: やや……！！ おぬしがそこにかくしもっとるのは きんだんのミアンヌ・ブロマイド[heart]！？
re: Hey......!! Is that a banned Mianu bromide[heart] you're secretly carrying!? If you give me that bromide, I'll give you something good...... how about it?

eng: Let's trade!
jap: そのブロマイド、わしにくれるなら
re: Let's trade!

eng: Really, you mean it? Yahoo! Now just hold your horses and I'll be back in a jiffy! It's unlocked so you're free to take it. And I'll be taking this. Hee hee...
jap: む……！ なら、勝手にせい。 ホントかね、ホントかね？ わーい、やったぞ、ベービィ！ よし、ちょこっと待っておれよ。 カギはあいとる じゆうにもって行くがいい。 それじゃ、ブロマイドはもらっとくぞ。 うひょひょ……。
re: Really, really? Yay, I've done it, baby! Okay, wait just a minute. It's unlocked. You can take it as you please. Well then, I'll be taking the bromide. Uhyo, hyo......

eng: I don't want the geezer's loot.
jap: いいものをやるが……、どうかね？
re: Don't need the old man's treasure

eng: Hmph! Fine then, suit yourself.
jap: とっかえっこしよう！ じーさんのお宝などいらない
re: Mh......! Then suit yourself.

eng: Don't tell Grannie. Hee, hee, my very own Naga-ette pet.
jap: ばーさんには、ないしょじゃぞ。 むふふ……、ミアンヌちゃん……。
re: Keep it secret from grannie. Mu, hu, hu...... Mianu-chan......

eng: I want you to find the mythical «Rainbow Shell.» Here's some front money. We're counting on you Toma!
jap: 探し出してもらいたい物は まぼろしの虹色の貝がら……。 これは前金じゃ。 よろしくたのむぞ、トマよ。
re: It's the mythical Rainbow-Colored Shell that I want to have you find for us. This is advance payment. I'm counting on you, Toma.

eng: Hey, no problem! 'cause, like, I'm the mythical explorer. Good match, eh chief.
jap: ヘヘッ、まかせときなって。 俺も伝説の探検家とよばれる男。 きたいはうらぎらないぜ、村長。
re: Heh, heh, leave it to me. I'm the man they call the legendary explorer. I won't betray your hopes, chief.

eng: Hmm... I'll be waiting for good news.
jap: うむ……。 よい知らせ、待っておるぞ。
re: Yes...... I'll be waiting for the good news.

eng: With that settled, I'll grab a bite before I go.
jap: よし、そうと決まれば いっぱい、ひっかけてくるかな。
re: All right, now that that's settled, I guess I'll go have a drink.

eng: I'm busy right now. Let's talk later.
jap: おりゃ、ちょっといそがしいんだ また後でな。
re: Hey, I'm a little busy. Try again later.

eng: We can use the «Rainbow Shell» to make some reflective armor. It'll be strong against magic! But that guy's a little flakey... Was it a mistake to trust him?
jap: 虹色の貝がらさえあれば 魔法ぼうぎょバツグンの プリズム防具がつくれるのじゃ。 しかしあのわかぞう、ほんとうに だいじょうぶなんじゃろか？ 自分では、いだいなる探検家などと いきまいとったが……。
re: If only we had the Rainbow-Colored Shell, we could make prism armoring with outstanding magic defense. But will that youngster really be all right? He declared himself a great explorer and such, but......

eng: The Hero has come! He's strong and he's gonna thrash those monsters!
jap: ゆうしゃたまが、あらわれたんだ！ わるいまものをやっつけてくれる すっごく、つおーいひとなのよ！
re: The Hero's appeared! He's a rea-a-ally stro-o-ong person who's gonna beat up the bad monsters for us!

eng: Only the ancient sword, «Masamune,» can defeat him. And only the Hero can wield it!
jap: 言い伝えでは、魔王をたおせるのは 太古より伝わる剣グランドリオンだけ なんですってね。 えらばれた勇者様だけが グランドリオンを装備できるのだそうよ！
re: According to legend, the only thing that can beat Magus is the sword Grandleon passed down from ancient times. Supposedly only the chosen Hero can equip the Grandleon!

eng: Magus has 3 fearsome henchmen, Ozzie, Flea, and Slash. They're tone-deaf, evil fiends!
jap: 魔王には恐ろしい手下がいる。 ビネガー、マヨネー、ソイソーの3人さ。 できることなら、あいつらとは かかわりあいにならない方がいい。 血もなみだもないバケモノどもだよ。
re: Magus has three terrifying subordinates. Vinnegar, Mayonnay, and Soysaw. You'd better not get mixed up with them if you can help it. They're cold-hearted monsters.
RetranslatorComment: Literally, they have neither blood nor tears.

eng: The chief of Sandorino Village lives here. Are you foreigners? Did you flee from Magus's troops?
jap: ここは、サンドリノの村長の家だよ。 お前さん達も魔王軍に追われて 逃げのびてきたのかい？
re: This is the house of Sandrino's village chief. pursued by Magus's army?

eng: Magus's lair is on an island to the east. Sheer cliffs make it inaccessible.
jap: 魔王の城は東の海の島にあるんだ。 でも島のまわりはだんがいぜっぺきで 誰にも近づけないんだよ……。
re: Magus's castle is on an island in the eastern sea. But it's sheer cliffs all around the island, and no one can get close......

eng: Are Magus's armies really closing in? Well, the mythical Hero has appeared so we'll be all right!
jap: 魔王の軍が今にも攻め込んでくるという うわさは、本当かしら……？ でも、伝説の勇者様があらわれたからには もうだいじょうぶですよね！
re: I wonder if the rumor that Magus's army will invade soon is true......? But now that the legendary Hero has appeared everything's okay!

eng: Want to hear my tale?
jap: とっておきの話、聞きます？
re: Want to hear something I've been saving?

eng: Yes.
jap: はい
re: Yes

eng: Goblins with huge hammers, roam the Denadoro Mountains to the east. But burn their weapons, and they're pussycats.
jap: 東にあるデナドロ山には 巨大なハンマーをもったオウガンどもが でも、ハンマーさえもやしてしまえば へっちゃらですよ。
re: Ougan with huge hammers prowl the Denadoro Mountains to the east. But if you just burn their hammers, they're no problem.

eng: No.
jap: いいえ
re: No

eng: Well...I'll tell someone else...
jap: いいよ。　じゃ、とっておくから……。
re: Fine. Then I'll keep saving it......

eng: Did you know? They say the mythical Masamune lies deep within the Denadoro mountains. But it's guarded by terrible beasts.
jap: 知ってるかい？ 伝説の剣グランドリオンは デナドロ山の奥に眠ると言われてる。 でも、すっげーおっかない魔物が 剣を守ってるって話だよ。
re: Did you know? It's said that the legendary sword Grandleon sleeps within the Denadoro Mountains. But, the story says a reeaal scary monster is guarding the sword.

eng: Clear your conscience, the end of the world is coming.
jap: いのりなさい。 世界の終わりが始まるのです。
re: Pray. The end of the world is beginning.

eng: Magus is trying to bring forth an immense evil... If he succeeds, there will be nowhere to run. We'll all perish! That's why I'm living it up now!
jap: 魔王は、邪悪で強大な力を生みだそうと しているらしいぞ……。 もしそうなったら、どこへ逃げても同じ！ みんな死んじまうんだよ……。 俺はこうして酒に逃げてるのさ。 ヒック！
re: It sounds like Magus is trying to bring forth an immense evil power...... If that happens, anywhere you run'll be the same! Everyone'll die...... like this. hic!

eng: Hey, how have you been? You pay my tab and I'll let you in on some stuff. How about it?
jap: よう、元気だったか。 いっぱいおごってくれるんなら いいネタをやるぜ。 どーだい？
re: Yo, how've you been? If you treat me to a drink, I'll give you some good info. How about it?

eng: Sure.
jap: おごる
re: Treat him

eng: No way.
jap: おごらない
re: Don't treat him

eng: Thanks a bunch!
jap: こいつは、すまねえな。
re: Thanks for that.

eng: Tsk! Not enough money!
jap: ち、金がたりないぜ。
re: Tch, not enough money.

eng: Hey, one more, please!
jap: おやじ、もういっぱいくんな！
re: Old man, bring another drink!

eng: Some creepy, dangerous frogs have taken over the southern woods.
jap: ちかごろ南の森の奥にゃ ヘンな魔物が かくれ住んでるって話だな。 なんでも、うすっきみわるい 化け物ガエルらしいぜ。　ヘッ。
re: There's a story that a strange monster's been living in the forest to the south lately in hiding. I hear it's an unearthly monster frog. Heh.

eng: Fine! Go away, I don't have time for you.
jap: はん。じゃ、むこうへ行ってくれ。 おれもヒマじゃないんだ。
re: Huh. Then go away. I haven't got time for you.

eng: Now for that «Rainbow Shell»... I guess Porre would be the first place to look.
jap: 虹色の貝がらか……。 手始めにパレポリから あたってみるとするか。
re: The Rainbow-Colored Shell, huh...... I guess I'll try heading for Parepoley to start with.

eng: Many people go to the inn. If you seek someone, ask there. By the way, EnergyWhirls will dissipate if you use your «Slash» attack. There's balance in nature.
jap: 旅の宿には、いろんな人がたちよる。 もし人をさがしておるのなら、 ところで、知っていなさるかな。 ぶつけてやれば、消えてしまう……。 自然ってのは、いろんなものの 調和とバランスでなりたっとるのさ。
re: Various people drop in at travel inns. If you're looking for someone, you should By the way, I wonder if you knew this? cut, it dissipates...... Nature, you see, consists of the harmony and balance of various things.

eng: You're looking for the Hero? Go south, to the village of Porre, where they say he's from.
jap: あんたら、勇者様をさがしてるとか？ だったら、南のパレポリの村に 行ってみちゃどうだい。 なんでも勇者様は、パレポリから あらわれたって話だぜ。
re: You guys looking for the Hero? Then how about you go to the village of Parepoley to the south? Word is the Hero appeared out of Parepoley.

eng: Helloooo there! This is the R & R hotel. It'll cost you 50 G! Well? Will you stay?
jap: は～い、ここは愛といこいのホテル。 料金は50Gになるんだけれど よろしいかしらん、あはん？ おとまりになっちゃうん？
re: He-e-ello, this is the hotel of rest and love. The charge is 50G, is that okay with you, tee-hee? Will you stay over?

eng: Yes.
jap: とまる
re: Stay

eng: Oh yes! Well then rest and relax!
jap: キャンッ！ それじゃ、ごゆっくりどうぞ～ん。
re: Kyahn! Well then, take your time.

eng: No.
jap: とまらない
re: Don't stay

eng: Huh? You don't have enough! What a shame! I'll wait for you to come back...
jap: あらん？　お金、たりないわよ。 まあ、ざんねん！　またのおこしを お待ちしておりますわん。 うふん。
re: Wha? You don't have enough money. Oh, that's too bad! We'll be waiting for you to come again. *giggle*

eng: A sword called the «something-or-other mune» was made hundreds of years ago. No one has the skill to make a sword like that anymore.
jap: なんとかドリアンとかいう剣は はるか昔にほろんじまった人達の手で つくられたんだそうだよ。 今ではもう誰にも、あんな剣を 作り出すことは出来ないんだとさ。
re: Supposedly the sword called the something or other durian, or something like that, was made by people who perished in the distant past. They say no one can make a sword like that any more now.

eng: Have you met the Hero already?
jap: あなた達、もう勇者様に会った？
re: Have you all met the Hero yet?

eng: Yes.
jap: はい
re: Yes

eng: Wow! I wish I could just get a glimpse of him... I've got butterflies!
jap: すごい！　私も一目でいいから 勇者様に会ってみたかったな……！ うるうるしてきちゃう……！
re: Wow! I wanted to meet the Hero too, even if it's just a glimpse......! I'm getting so worked up......!

eng: No.
jap: いいえ
re: No

eng: I haven't met him either. I wonder what the champion of the world looks like? I'm so excited!
jap: そう……。　私も、まだなの。 世界を救ってくれる勇者様って いったいどんな人なのかしら……？ うるうるしてきちゃう……！
re: Oh...... I haven't yet either. I wonder what kind of person the Hero who's going to save the world is......? I'm getting so worked up......!

eng: My husband Marco hasn't returned from the war. But these woods mean a lot to us, so I'll guard them until he returns.
jap: おっとのマルコは、兵士として 戦いに出たまま、帰って来ません……。 私達ニ人は、この森で育ったの。 せめて、この森だけは守りたい。 いつかマルコが帰って来る日まで……。
re: My husband Marco is still out fighting as a soldier and hasn't come back...... The two of us grew up in this forest. I want to at least protect this forest. Until the day when Marco comes back......
RetranslatorComment: Fiona and Marco actually grew up in the forest on central  Zenan.

eng: I'm gonna put on this armor and fight that stupid Magus! Yeeeoooww! It's heavy!
jap: 僕も、このよろいを着て魔王と戦うんだ！ うーーー お　も　い　……。
re: I'm gonna put on this armor and fight Magus too! uuuuuuuuuu h e a v y ......

eng: Don't overdo it!
jap: お兄ちゃん、無理しちゃって！
re: Big brother, you're trying too hard!

eng: Little Tata must be away... We haven't seen him in awhile. But things are a lot quieter without that brat around.
jap: タータの姿をしばらく見ないけど どっか出かけてるのかしら……。 でも、あのイタズラこぞうがいないと ホッとするわね、ほんと。
re: I haven't seen Tarta in a while, wonder where he's gotten to......? But when that mischievous kid's not around, it's really a relief.

eng: A strange monster came by the other day, mumbling about Queen Leene and the Masamune... That shore were an ugly frog! Hardy har!
jap: 以前ヘンな魔物が、酒を飮んでいたことが ありましたっけな。 リーネ様がどうしたの グランドリオンがどうだのと ひとりブツブツ言いながら……。 ありゃほんと、うす気味悪い カエル男でしたぞ！　うひゃひゃ。
re: A weird monster was drinking sake earlier. Was mumbling to itself, what's happened with Leene-sama, what about the Grandleon...... That was a really creepy frogman! Uhya, hya.

eng: I can't believe the legendary Hero was a boy from this village! Did you hear the latest?
jap: 伝説の勇者様が、実はこの村の 少年だったとはな！ あんた、知ってたかい？
re: To think the legendary Hero was actually a boy from this village! Did you know?

eng: Yes.
jap: はい
re: Yes

eng: Everyone's talking about him! I bet his old man is proud!
jap: そうか、もうそんな有名な話なのか！ こりゃ、あのオヤジもハナが たかいだろうな。
re: I see, it's already that well known! I'll bet his old man's proud too.

eng: No.
jap: いいえ
re: No

eng: Well, remember that the legendary Hero is from this village then!
jap: じゃあ、おぼえておきな。 伝説の勇者様は、この村の生まれよ！
re: Then remember it. The legendary Hero is born of this village!

eng: I can't believe the legendary Hero is that naughty runt, Tata!
jap: あのイタズラこぞうのタータが、 伝説の勇者様だったなんて……。 世の中、信じられないわっ。
re: How could that mischievous kid Tarta have been the legendary Hero......? I can't believe the state of the world.

eng: Have you heard about the magical cave? The one east of the Denadoro Mountains? I saw a rock wall there pop open, and a gaggle of ghouls just walked right in! Best to leave Magus and his cronies alone, though!
jap: デナドロ山の東にある魔岩窟って 知ってるかい？ あそこの岩が、ぽっかり口を開けて でも、さわらぬ魔王にたたりなし！
re: Know about the Demon Cavern east of the Denadoro Mountains? I saw the rock there gaping open and monsters But it's better to let sleeping Maguses lie.
RetranslatorComment: The original saying is  触らぬ神にたたりなし,  roughly “the gods you don't touch won't curse you”.

eng: Hey, you again! How 'bout buying me a soda? Sure. No way.
jap: よう、また会ったな。 いっぱい、おごってくれねえか？ おごる おごらない
re: Yo, we meet again. Treat me to a drink? Treat him Don't treat him

eng: Thanks! I'll wish you a safe journey.
jap: おう、ありがとよ。 お前さん達の旅の無事をいのって。
re: Hey, thanks. I'll pray you have a safe journey.

eng: I tracked down the Rainbow Shell that the chief wanted. It's on some small island... Only thing is...I don't know WHICH island. And the money he gave me is gone. What should I do?
jap: サンドリノの村長のほしがってる 虹色の貝がらだが、どこかの小島に あるらしいってことまでは その島がどこにあるか しかし、村長からあずかった前金は もう、みんな使っちまったしな。 さて、どうしたもんか……。
re: About the Rainbow-Colored Shell the Sandrino village chief wanted, I've determined that it's on a small island somewhere, but...... I haven't got a clue where that island is. But I've already used up all the advance payment I got from the chief. What to do now......?

eng: What a miser! I don't even have enough for grub!
jap: ちェ、ケチだな。 サンドリノの村長の前金 もういっぱい飮めるくらいは 残ってたかな……？
re: Tch, stingy. Is there enough of the Sandrino village chief's advance payment left for another drink......?

eng: My son's the legendary Hero! It must have been all that oatmeal! And to think that I'm his father...!
jap: 俺のせがれが勇者だってんだ。 トンビがタカを生んだってヤツかね……。 だが、どうひいき目に見ても、そんな ごたいそうなヤツじゃねえんだが…… ま、勇者の親父ってのも悪くねえやね。 ヘッヘ。
re: They say my son's the hero. Guess this's that thing about even normal parents having genius kids...... But, no matter how favorably you look at it, this's like a huge exaggeration, ain't it though...... Well, being the hero's old man ain't bad either. Heh, heh.

eng: My grandson's a brave Hero! That's from my side of the family! Heeheehee...
jap: わしの孫が勇者らしいぞい！ わしの血じゃな！ ファファファ……！！！！
re: I hear my grandson's the hero! That's my blood! Fwa, ha, ha......!!!!

eng: I'm gonna marry Tata!
jap: 私タータのおよめさんにして もらうの！
re: I'm gonna have Tarta make me his bride!

eng: If only I had some Jerky... What a great meal I could make...
jap: ハイパーほしにくがあれば すんごい料理がつくれるんだけどねえ……。
re: If I had Hyper Dried Meat, I could make some incredible cooking, but......

eng: Next to the bed is a treasure box. Open it, and the contents are yours.
jap: ベッドのそばにあるのは この家に代々伝わる、開かずの宝ばこです。 中には何が入っているのやら？ もし開けられたらあなたにあげますよ。
re: Next to the bed is an unopened treasure chest that's been passed down in this family for generations. I wonder what's inside? I'll give it to you if by some chance you can open it.

eng: The «Magic Cave» lies under a mountain east of Denadoro.
jap: デナドロ山の東にある山は魔岩窟と 呼ばれておる。 あそこに行くと、せすじがゾッと するんじゃ。
re: The mountain to the east of the Denadoro Mountains is called the Demon Cavern. It sends shivers down my back when I go there.

eng: Tata received the Hero Medal! At first I thought it was fake! He must have done something very brave! He's probably up north, looking for the legendary sword. Tata and the Frog
jap: タータが勇者のあかしであるバッジを 持っていたんです。 はじめは、にせ物かと思いましたが あれはまさしく勇者のあかし。 タータは本当に勇者様だったんです！ 今ごろはきっと伝説の剣をさがして 北のデナドロ山ではないでしょうか。 タータとカエル
re: Tarta had the badge that's proof of the hero. At first, I thought it might have been a fake, but that's definitely the hero's proof. Tarta was really the Hero! He's sure to be in the Denadoro Mountains to the north now, searching for the legendary sword. Tarta and Frog

eng: Aaagh!
jap: 「うっひゃ～ッ！
re: 'Uhhyaaa!

eng: Th, this is a terrible place! Y, you'd best run away while you can!
jap: こ、ここは、とんでもないトコだ！ あ、あんちゃん達も、アブナイぜ とっとと、ズラかんねーと。
re: Th, this is a horrible place! Y, you guys too, it's dangerous. Gotta run away quick.

eng: Shut up! Get lost!
jap: 「うるさい！　じゃましないでくれ！
re: Shaddup! Don't disturb me!

eng: Mountains're nice.
jap: 「山はいいよねえ。
re: Mountains are nice, aren't they.

eng: This's the life.
jap: 「いいんだな、これが。
re: This's nice.

eng: Mountains're nice.
jap: 「山はいいよねえ。
re: Mountains are nice, aren't they.

eng: Man, you're nosy. Here, take this.
jap: 「君達もしつこいなあ。これやるよ。
re: You guys sure are stubborn. I'll give you this.

eng: I'm the wind! Whoosh!
jap: ボクは風だぞー。 ぴゅぴゅ～ん！
re: I'm the wind. whooshwhoooosh!

eng: Stop!
jap: ダメッ！！
re: Don't!!

eng: Are you here for the Masamune? Yes No
jap: お兄ちゃん達も、取りに来たの？ グランドリオン。 はい いいえ
re: Did you guys come to take it too? The Grandleon. Yes No

eng: You're not? Then you should leave quickly.
jap: なーんだ、ちがうの。 なら、早く山を下りた方がいいよ。
re: What, that's not it? Then you should leave the mountain quickly.

eng: Thought so... Wait a second, okay?
jap: うーん、そーか。 ちょっと待っててね……。
re: Huhn, I see. Hold on a sec......

eng: Oh big broooother... Where are you, Masa?!
jap: おーい、グラン兄ちゃ～ん！
re: Heeey, Gran nii-chaaan!
RetranslatorComment: Or big brother Gran if you'd rather drop the Japanese entirely

eng: What is it, Mune?
jap: どーした、リオン？
re: What's wrong, Leon?

eng: Not again!?
jap: やれやれ、またか……。
re: Oh, come on, not again......?

eng: So! You want to get a name for yourself by grabbing the Masamune? What a buffoon!
jap: グランドリオンを手に入れて 勇者としての名声がほしいんだろ？ くだらないよ……。
re: You want to get the Grandleon and make a name for yourself as the hero, right? Ridiculous......

eng: Humans are so...silly! It's how you USE the sword that's important...not who owns it!
jap: 人間って、バッカだねー。 手にした力をどう使うかが 大事なのに……。
re: Humans are idiots. It's how you use the power you've gained that's important, and yet......

eng: You can't even understand something as simple as that. That's why you're human.
jap: そんな当り前の事も わからないから人間やってんだよ。
re: It's because they don't even understand something so obvious that they're human.

eng: What should we do?
jap: どーする、兄ちゃん？
re: What'll we do, nii-chan?

eng: The usual...test them. You can entertain us for awhile.
jap: 決まってるだろ、ためすのさ。 少しばかり、あそんでやろう！
re: It's obvious, we test them. For just a little, we're gonna play with them.
RetranslatorComment: Literally “it's decided”.

eng: All right! Here we go!!! Whooosh!
jap: うん！　行くぞー！！ ぴゅぴゅ～ん！
re: Yeah! Here we gooo!! whooshwhoooosh!

eng: Hey they're pretty tough.
jap: 兄ちゃん、コイツら、やるね。

eng: Yeah, it'll be all right.
jap: ああ、だいじょうぶさ。
re: Yeah, it'll be fine.

jap: これがグランドリオン……。 でも、この伝説の剣…… もうかなり昔に おれてしまったみたいね……。
re: This is the Grandleon...... But, this legendary sword...... It looks like it's already been quite a long time since it broke......

eng: So! The Masamune is not just a myth... But it has long been broken.
jap: この剣が、伝説の グランドリオン……。 しかし、これは…… おれてしまってから かなりの時間がたっていマスネ。
re: This sword is the legendary Grandleon...... However, this...... A considerable time HAS passED since it broke.

eng: You got the broken Masamune!
jap: おれたグランドリオンを手に入れた！
re: Got the broken Grandleon!

eng: Allow me! We'll ride the wind to the base of the mountain!
jap: ふもとまで風にのせて 一気にはこんでやるよ。
re: I'll give you a ride on the wind and transport you at once to the mountain base.

eng: Good luck to you.
jap: ガンバってね お兄ちゃん達……。
re: Do your best, guys......

eng: Ride the wind? Yes No
jap: 風にのりますか？ はい いいえ
re: Ride the wind? Yes No

eng: Last I heard, the Hero went to the Denadoro Mountains to find a sword. I hope he's okay!
jap: 勇者様はデナドロ山に 剣をとりに行ったまま、 それっきり何の話も聞かんけど…… その後どこに 行っちまったんだろう……？
re: The Hero went to the Denadoro Mountains to get a sword, and we haven't heard a thing since. Where could he have gone after that......?

eng: Sorry, but I'm out on the road peddling my wares. Please come back some other time. Melchior
jap: 行商に行っておるので しばらく帰ってこんぞよ。 また今度たずねてきておくれ。 ボッシュ
re: I'm going peddling, so I won't be back for a while. Do come visit again another time. Bosch

eng: Say, where's Melchior?
jap: あれ？　ボッシュはどこ？
re: Huh? Where's Bosch?

eng: There's a note? What does it say?
jap: てがみかしら？ なになに……
re: A letter? Let's see......

eng: What!! The geezer's gone when we need him the most!
jap: な、なんですってえ！！ あのオヤジ、カンジンな時に いないんだから！　まったく！
re: Wh, what!! That old geezer's not here when we need him! Oh, come on!

eng: Hey, looks like Mr. Melchior isn't home!
jap: あれれ？ ボッシュさんいないね。
re: Huh? Bosch-san isn't here.

eng: I wonder what this is? Let's see here...
jap: これ、何かしら？ どれどれ……
re: What could this be? Let's see......

eng: He's gone when we need him the most!
jap: 何よ　それェ！ カンジンな時にいないんだから～！
re: What's that supposed to mean! He's not here when we need him!

eng: Stop it you dog!
jap: イヤン、エッチィ！
re: Yah, you pervert!

jap: これより　私有地。 立ち入りきんし。　ゲロゲロ。

eng: Who's there!?
jap: 「誰だ！？

jap: よう、クロノか！ どうした、剣でもならいに来たか？

...... Is that so......
