jap: 俺には、どうする事もできん。 悪いが……　一人にしてくれ……。
re: There's nothing I can do. Sorry, but...... leave me alone......

eng: The Hero, I am not. I can do naught.
jap: 俺は勇者などではない。 俺には、どうする事もできん……。
re: I'm not the hero or anything. There's nothing I can do......

eng: I...I'm sorry everyone. Some frog guy dropped this in a cafe. I thought I'd sell it, but then everyone started calling me a «Hero.» I couldn't bear to get rid of it! I just can't fake it any longer. I'm no Hero...! I'm so ashamed! Here. Please take this! TATA'S FATHER: Scoundrel! I knew this was all a sham!
jap: ゴ、ゴメンよお……。 この勇者バッジ、ホントは酒場で よいつぶれてた、カエルのオヤジが 落としてったのさ。 で、高く売れるかと思って 町に出てったら、みんなが勇者様って チヤホヤしてくれるから 引っ込みがつかなくなって…… でも、やっぱりオイラには無理だよ。 伝説の勇者だなんて…… もうコリゴリだよ。 このバッジ、あんちゃん達にやる！ タータの父「ったく、こんなこったろうと 思ったぜ……。 父ちゃん、情けなくって なみだ出てくらあ！
re: I, I'm sorry...... This Hero Badge, the truth is, a seriously drunk frog man dropped it in the bar and left. Then, when I went out in the city thinking I could sell it for a lot, everyone made a big fuss over me, calling me the Hero, so I was in too deep to back out...... But it's too much for me after all. Legendary hero, as if...... I've learned my lesson now. I'll give you guys this badge! Tarta's Father: Sheesh, I thought it might be something like this...... Your father's ashamed to the point of tears!

eng: How could I have fallen for that? For my dear departed wife's sake, I vow to keep my feet on the ground!
jap: まい上がっちまって、おはずかしい。 死んだかかあのためにも、俺もせがれも 地道に生きますよ。
re: thinking my son was the hero. For the sake of my dead wife as well, both I and my son will live with our feet on the ground.

eng: Listen to YOU! Who was going around telling everyone that you raised a Hero, huh?!
jap: 父ちゃんだって、俺も勇者を育てた 親父かって、ハナたかだかだった クセにさ……！
re: This even though YOU'RE the one who was all proud about, "I'm the dad who raised the hero"......!

eng: Oh, my grandson! He secretly told me, «My next goal is to command the Super Legendary Space Ship, XR-RX!»
jap: なーに、わしの孫じゃぞ。 タータはこんなことではくじけんよ。 わしにこっそり教えてくれたよ…… 『次にめざすは、スーパー伝説の船乗り スペシャルデラックス！！』 とな。 ファファファ…！！！
re: Hey, he's my grandchild. Tarta won't be crushed by something like this. He secretly told me...... “My next goal is to be a super legendary sailor special deluxe!!” That's what he said. Fwa, ha, ha...!!!

eng: I guess Tata's home now. It was so quiet without him... But I'm glad he's back. It was a bit TOO quiet around here...
jap: 帰ってきたみたいね、タータ。 しばらくどこかに行ってたらしくて でも、無事でよかった。 いないとみょうにさびしくてね。 あの人すごく心配してたし……。
re: Looks like he's come back, Tarta has. Seemed like he'd gone somewhere for a while, and But I'm glad he's okay. It's strangely lonely when he's not around. And that person was so worried......

eng: And I thought the Hero was from here. What a let down...
jap: せっかくこの村から伝説の勇者様が あらわれたって思ったのによ……。 もう、トホホだよ。
re: And after all this time I thought the legendary Hero had appeared from this village...... I feel so miserable.

eng: So Tata was a fake after all! Then where's the real Hero?
jap: やっぱりタータはニセ者だったのね。 でも、だとすると、どこかに 本物の勇者様がいるってことかしら。
re: I knew Tarta was a phony. But, if that's so, I wonder if it means there's a real Hero somewhere.

eng: Oh, that Tata! He's just too loveable.
jap: タータはしょうがないわね…… でも、にくめないのよね。
re: Tarta's so hopeless...... But you just can't hate him.

eng: Thee hath returned? Th, the Hero Medal!
jap: また、来たのか……？ む、そのバッジは……。
re: You've come again......? Mh, that badge......

eng: You hath done well to find this locale. Th, the Hero Badge!
jap: しかし、よくここが…… む、そのバッジは……！？
re: But well done finding your way...... Mh, that badge......!?

eng: Aye... Then thou hast seen the lad. Yet there's nary a thing I canst do against Magus.
jap: そうか……。 あのチビに会ったのか……。 しかし、もう魔王には手も足も 出ない……。
re: I see.… So you met that runt.… But, I can't do a thing against Magus anymore......

eng: The legendary Masamune is required to fight Magus. And I've no right to wield it.
jap: 魔王と戦うのに必要な 伝説の剣グランドリオンは……。 それに、グランドリオンを持つしかくも 俺にはない。
re: The legendary sword Grandleon, essential to fighting Magus, is...... And besides, I'm not even qualified to hold hold the Grandleon.

eng: Please leave now...
jap: もう、ほっといてくれないか 俺のことは……。
re: Won't you leave me alone already......?

jap: おれた剣ね……。 グランドリオンの一部だわ！

eng: It's engraved with archaic letters. I think I can read it. Um...mm...
jap: 古代文字で何かほってあるわ。 このていどなら何とか読めそう。 えっ……　と……
re: Something's engraved in characters from an ancient era. Seems like I'll be able to read this difficulty anyway, one way or another. U...... mm......

eng: «Melchior?!» That guy in Medina Village?
jap: 『ボッシュ』ですって！？ まさか……　メディーナ村の……？
re: You said "Bosch"!? It can't be...... Medina Village's......?

eng: Something is written in archaic script. I will translate...
jap: 古代のショウケイ文字で なにか、しるされていマス。 解読してみマショウ……。
re: Something IS writTEN down in an ancient era's hieroglyphic characters. I SHALL try decoding it......

eng: Roihclem?
jap: ュシッボ……？？

eng: System error! I reversed it! It says «Melchior!»
jap: アア、さかさまデス！ 『ボッシュ』としるされて いるのデス。
re: AH, it IS upside down! "Bosch" is inscribed.

eng: Melchior? That guy in Medina Village? What does this mean, Crono?
jap: ボッシュって、あのボッシュ？ メディーナ村のâ€¦â€¦？ ど、どーゆー事、クロノ？
re: 'Bosch', that Bosch?     Medina Village's......?     W, what's going on, Crono?

eng: Nary a soul remains to mend'eth the Masamune.
jap: グランドリオンを なおせる者は、もうこの世には いないのだâ€¦â€¦。
re: There isn't a person in this world     anymore who can fix the Grandleon......

eng: You're back again? Come to see my collection?
jap: ほう、お主達か。 また、ワシのコレクâ€¦â€¦！！
re: Hey, it's you guys.     Come again for my collec....!!

eng: Th, this sword...it's the Masamune! How did you get it?
jap: こ、この剣は、たしかに グランドリオン！　お主達これを どこで？
re: Th, this sword is definitely the Grandleon!     Where did you guys get that?

eng: Why would YOUR name be on that sword?
jap: なぜ、この剣にあなたの名が？
re: Why's your name on this sword?

eng: Why would your name be engraved on the sword?
jap: どうして、この剣にあなたの 名前がほってあるのかしら？
re: I wonder why your name's carved on this     sword?

eng: ... It's a...long story.
jap: â€¦â€¦ それはのâ€¦â€¦、話せば長くなるがâ€¦â€¦
re: ......     That is...... it's a long story......

eng: You do want to hear this story, right?
jap: お主達がたずねて来たのは その事を聞くためではなかろう？
re: But you didn't come visit to ask about that,     did you?

eng: Yes! Tell us about the Masamune!
jap: そうよ！　グランドリオン！
re: That's right! The Grandleon!

eng: Of course! Tell us about the Masamune!
jap: そうだわ！　グランドリオン！
re: That's right! The Grandleon!

eng: Can you fix it somehow?
jap: 何とか元通りに出来ない？
re: Can't you somehow put it back the way it was?

eng: Is it possible to reforge it?
jap: 復元する事は可能なの？
re: Is it possible to restore it?
RetranslatorComment: In the NA version, he asks if they want to hear the story, they agree that they want him to tell it, and then he says nothing else about it and no one seems to care. However, in the original, he's changing the subject ahead of time by asking why they came in the first place. Marle and Lucca's aren't so much agreement (like "Of course!" and "Yes!" in the NA version) as they are a startled "Oh, that's right, how could I almost forget we came here to get this thing fixed!" kind of meaning.

eng: Hmmmm... It might be possible if we could get our hands on some Dreamstone, which the sword is made of.
jap: こいつの原料である ドリストーンっちゅう原石が 今でも入手出来ればâ€¦â€¦な。
re: If you can even now get the ore called     Dreamstone that's its raw material...... I suppose so.

eng: Dreamstone? Where can we get that?
jap: ドリストーン？ どこにあるのかしら？
re: Dreamstone?     I wonder where it is?

eng: Dreamstone...? No data in my memory banks of such a rock.
jap: ドリストーンâ€¦â€¦ ワタシのメモリーには記録されていない 石の名前デス。
re: Dreamstone......     The stone name IS not recorded in MY memory.

eng: You can't find it anymore. It was a red stone that was once used as money. Unfortunately, it hasn't been available for a very long time.
jap: 今じゃどこにもなかろう。 昔は金よりも、ねうちがあった赤く 輝く石なのじゃが。 もう、はるか昔じゃよ。 気の遠くなるほどのなâ€¦â€¦
re: I doubt it's anywhere, now.     It's a red shining stone that long ago had more     value than even gold.     That's far in the past now.     So far the mind boggles......
RetranslatorComment: Dreamstone was never used as money, as it stated in the English translation.

eng: I doubt that you'll ever find the red stone, but if you bring some to me, I will fix the Masamune. Keep the sword with you until then. Would you like to buy something? Yes. No.
jap: ま、無理じゃろが、まんがいち 赤く輝く石、ドリストーンが手に入れば グランドリオンを修復してやるぞい。 それまで剣はお主達が持っとけ。 で、何か買って行くか？ はい いいえ
re: Well, I don't expect it's possible, but if by     any chance you get the red shining stone,     Dreamstone, I'll mend the Grandleon for you.     Until then, you guys hold onto the sword.     Well, will you buy something before you go?           Yes           No

eng: The Rare Red Rock
jap: 赤い石　めずらしい石
re: Red Stone, Rare Stone

eng: Dreamstone?... I've heard of it, of course. It's a prehistoric mineral... You might find it way back in the prehistoric era.
jap: ドリストーン……？ なんだか聞きおぼえのあるひびきじゃ。 昔も昔、大昔の原石じゃよ……。 原始の時代にでも行けば 見つかるのではないかな？
re: Dreamstone......? That sounds somewhat familiar. It's an ore from long before even the distant past...... Might you not be able to find it if you go perhaps to the Primeval era?

eng: Wh...what are those?
jap: な、何？　こいつら！？
re: Wh, what are they? These things!?

eng: They're all green and scaly!
jap: み、緑のウロコのはだ！
re: Gr, green scaly skin!

eng: Half human, half dinosaur... An unlikely life form.
jap: 人間と恐竜の中間……。 ありえない生態けいデス。
re: Midway between human and dinosaur...... It IS an unlikely mode of life.

eng: What should we do, Crono?!
jap: どうしよう、クロノ！
re: What'll we do, Crono!?

eng: We're outnumbered!
jap: 数が多すぎるわ！
re: There's too many!

eng: Goodness! She is tough!
jap: つっよーい！
re: Stroooong!

eng: Who IS that woman?!
jap: な、何なの？　あの女！
re: Wh, what's up with her? That woman!

eng: Her fighting capabilities far exceed those of humans!
jap: 彼女の戦闘能力値は 人間の値をはるかに上回っています。
re: Her combat ability level far exceeds human levels.

eng: Uh oh...they're coming our way!
jap: 残りがこっち来るよ！
re: The rest are coming this way!

eng: Now they're after us!
jap: コチラにターゲットを変こう したもようデス。
re: It appeaRS they have changed their target to US.

eng: Wh...what do you want?
jap: な、何……
re: Wh, what......?

eng: What the...!
jap: な、何よ……！
re: Wh, what......!

eng: Do not upset her. She's rather agitated right now.
jap: シゲキしてはイケマセン。 現在の彼女の精神じょうたいは 非常にたかぶっています。
re: We MUST NOT EXCITE her. Her present mental state is extremely agitated.

eng: Ack!
jap: キャッ！
re: Kyah!

eng: We're not looking for a fight!
jap: や、やろうってーの！？
re: Y, you wanna fight!?

eng: Crono!
jap: 「クロノ！
re: 'Crono!

eng: You strong. What name? Crono, huh? Good name. Me? Me...
jap: 強いな　お前。 名は何だ？ クロ　いうか。　いい名だ。 あたいか？　あたいの名は……
re: You strong. What is name? Called Cro? Is good name. Me? My name......
RetranslatorComment: This is the only time  Ayla calls herself anything but her name. The pronoun she uses,  あたい (atai) is, in short, feminine but tough.

eng: Me Ayla. Ayla like strong people. So Ayla like Crono!
jap: エイラ　いう。 エイラ　強い男　好き。 だから　エイラ　クロ　好き。
re: Called Ayla. Ayla like strong men. So Ayla like Cro.

eng: Get away from her, Crono!
jap: は、はなれてよ、クロノ！
re: G, get away from her, Crono!

eng: I think she likes you, Crono...
jap: エイラのに気に入られたわね クロノ……
re: You've been found suitable to be Ayla's, Crono......
RetranslatorComment: This is messier than I first thought... 気に入る means to be pleased with, but it's in passive form, and on top of that it's エイラのに and not エイラに, which is what I'd expect. The only way the  エイラのに works grammatically is with the  …のものとして (in a role as something  of...) variant of のに, so it's something like “as Ayla's”...  ick.

eng: You strong too. Ayla respect strong people. Men and women.
jap: お前達も　強い。 エイラ　強い者　好き。 男でも　女でも。
re: Yous strong too. Ayla like strong people. Even if man, even if woman.

eng: Oh, brother...
jap: な～んだ、そういう事か。
re: What's THAT supposed to mean?

eng: Where have they been keeping her?
jap: わ、私は、そのケはないわよ！
re: I, I'm not interested in that sort of thing!
RetranslatorComment: Took out the explicit reference to being into girls. After all, the original doesn't say it outright, even if the Japanese professor I asked back in college (a young native speaker) agreed that they're definitely talking about the girl-on-girl scene.

eng: Y, yes?
jap: な、何デショウカ？
re: Wh, what MIGHT it BE?

eng: You different, but strong too.
jap: お前　変わったヤツ。 けど強いな。
re: You weird guy. But strong.

eng: It's because I'm a robot.
jap: ワタシは、あなた方と違って ロボットデスカラ。
re: It is BECAUSE I AM a robot, unlike all of you.

eng: «Rawboot?» What that? Ayla don't know.
jap: ロボット？　何だそれ？ エイラ　わからない。
re: Robot? What that? Ayla not understand.

eng: It's a machine that looks like a man.
jap: 人間によって作られた 人間型の機械デス。
re: It IS a humanoid machine built by humans.

eng: What you say?! No rubbish or Ayla, head go boom!
jap: お前　何言ってる。 わからない事　言うな。 エイラ　頭　火山　なる。
re: What you say? No say not understand thing. Ayla head turn volcano.

eng: Crono, where from?
jap: クロ達　どっから来た？
re: Where Cros come from?
RetranslatorComment: Ayla's primitive speech gives me an excuse to translate 達 as something short and simple... I think the closest English comes to matching it is "and the other(s)", and that's not nearly as concise.

eng: Uh, how can we explain?
jap: え、えーと、なんて言えば いいのかしら……。
re: Uh, errr, I wonder how we should say this......

eng: It is beyond her grasp.
jap: コノ方に、理解出来る様 説明するのは、不可能デス。
re: It IS impossible to explain so that THIS person can comprehend.

eng: We're from way after the day after tomorrow.
jap: 明日の、明日の、明日の…… ずーっと明日から、来たのよ。
re: We came from tomorrow's tomorrow's tomorrow's...... faaar off tomorrow.

eng: We're from many days ahead of tomorrow.
jap: ずーっと、ずーっと、ずーっと 先の明日から、来たのよ。
re: We came from a faaar, faaar, faaar ahead tomorrow.

eng: Ha ha, you funny. Ayla like funny people.
jap: ハハハ！　お前　面白い。 エイラ　面白いヤツ　好き。
re: Ha, ha, ha! You interesting. Ayla like interesting people.

eng: It's no use...
jap: ダーメだ、こりゃ。
re: This's hopeless.

eng: Come to village! We talk and eat. Dance! Eat! Fun!!
jap: お前達　村　来る！ かんげいする。　うたげやる。 酒飮む！　踊る！　楽しい！！
re: Yous come village! Do welcome. Have party Drink sake! Dance! Fun!!

eng: Thank you but we can't. We're looking for a Dreamstone.
jap: 気持ちは、うれしいんだけど それどころじゃなくってね……。 ドリストーンっていう石を 探してるのよ。
re: I feel pleased, but now's not the time for that...... We're looking a stone called Dreamstone.

eng: We'd love to go, but we've got to look for the Dreamstone now.

re: Yous strangers...... Ayla welcome yous No understand.…

eng: Ayla fight Reptites. Their leader Azala. Very smart.

eng: All in Ioka village fight. No fight, go to Laruba village. Don't know where village is. Always hide. Azala want to destroy Ioka AND Laruba. But Ayla no lose. Only when Ayla dead, give up!
jap: イオカの村　みな　戦う。 戦わない者　ラルバの村　行く。 ラルバの村　どこか　わからない。 恐竜人から　いつも　逃げてる。 アザーラ　イオカも　ラルバも なくすつもり…… でも　エイラ　負けない。 戦うのやめる　それ　エイラ 死ぬ時！
re: Ioka village everyone fight. No fight people go Laruba Village. Laruba Village, no know where. Always running from Dinomen. Azarla mean to get rid of Ioka too, Laruba too...... But Ayla not lose. Stop fight, that when Ayla die!

jap: ま　いい。 今日　クロ　会えた　うれしい日。 飮め　食え　歌え　踊れ！
re: No mind that. Today happy met Cro day. Drink, eat, sing, dance!

eng: Ayla no like Kino...
jap: エイラ　キーノ　好き 違うから……
re: Because Ayla no like Kino......

eng: No! Ayla like Kino BEST! No more do bad stuff, okay?! That wrong!
jap: それ　違う！ エイラ　キーノ　一番好き。 だから　いけない事　ゆるさない！ それ　違う！！
re: That wrong! Ayla like Kino best. That why not forgive bad things! That wrong!!

eng: Ayla...
jap: エイラ……
re: Ayla......

eng: Sorry Ayla!
jap: ゴメン　エイラ！
re: Sorry, Ayla!

eng: Sorry Crono!
jap: ゴメン　クロ！
re: Sorry, Cro!

eng: Give back stuff to Crono!
jap: さ、クロ達に　大事な物 返す！
re: Now, give back important thing to Cros!

eng: ...No have... Reptites take!
jap: ……ない。 恐竜人　持って行かれた……
re: ......not have. Taken by Dinomen......

eng: Reptites!! Where they go?!
jap: 恐竜人！！ どっち行った！？
re: Dinomen!! Went which way!?

eng: Run into trees...there!
jap: この木の間　入ってった……
re: Went in these trees......

eng: Ayla go too. Kino go back village. Kino protect village when Ayla not there.
jap: エイラ達　行く。 キーノ　村　もどる。 エイラ　いない時　キーノ 村　守る！
re: Aylas go. Kino go back village. Kino protect village when Ayla not there!

eng: Okay, Ayla!
jap: わかった　エイラ！
re: Got it, Ayla!

eng: Kino is man... so if Ayla die, Kino chief then.
jap: キーノ　男…… エイラ　死んだり　子供出来たら キーノ　酋長。
re: Kino man...... If Ayla die, have baby, whatever, Kino chief.

eng: Ayla...
jap: エイラ……
re: Ayla......

eng: Ayla's one tough cookie.
jap: 強いな、エイラは。
re: You're awfully strong, Ayla.

eng: Ayla, you are gentle at heart.
jap: エイラさん、暴力などと 言って…　スミマセン。
re: Ayla-san, for saying such a thing as brutality... I AM SORRY.

eng: Chase Reptites! Get back Crono stuff!!
jap: さ　恐竜人　追う！ クロ達　大事な物　取り返す！！
re: Now, we chase Dinomen! Take back Cros' important thing!

eng: What's this?! Could those apes have made something THIS advanced?
jap: これは一体……。 本当に、あのサル共が こんな高度な物を……？
re: What on earth is this......? Something so advanced, did those monkeys really.......?

eng: Azala!!
jap: アザーラ！！
re: Azarla!!

eng: Ah, the apes have arrived! Hmm. You're nothing like Ayla... Tell me what this is, at once! Tell Azala about the key?
jap: 来たなサルが…… ほう、お前達、エイラ達とは 少しばかりデキが違うようだな……。 フフ、ちょうど良い。 この装置は何に使うものだ……？ 教えてもらえるかな？
re: They're come, the monkeys...... Oh? You seem to be of a marginally different quality than Ayla and the others...... Hu, hu, perfect timing. What do you use this device for......? Could I have you tell me?

eng: Yes.
jap: はい
re: Yes

eng: No.
jap: いいえ
re: No

eng: Liars! No one would talk that easily. This should loosen your tongues.
jap: ウソをつけ。 そう、かんたんに話してもらえるとは 私も思ってはおらぬ……。 だが、これならどうかな？
re: You lie. Even I didn't expect that I could get you to tell me so easily...... But, how about this?

eng: I guess you need some...motivation.
jap: では、しかたない……。 話したくなるようにしてやろう！
re: Then I have no choice...... I'll make you want to talk!

eng: Come, Nizbel!
jap: 出でよ　ニズベール！
re: Come forth, Nizbel!

eng: Th...the apes beat Nizbel!
jap: ニ……、ニズベールが サルどもに負けるとは……。
re: I...... I can't believe Nizbel lost to the monkeys......

eng: Give thing back to Crono. NOW!
jap: さ　クロ達の　それ　返せ！
re: Now, give back Cros' that!

eng: But remember, WE Reptites will rule the world!
jap: ……だが、おぼえておれ。 この大地は我が恐竜人の物だと いう事をな……。
re: ......but remember. This earth belongs to we Dinomen......

eng: Your days are numbered!
jap: きさま達サル共なぞに ゆずりはせんぞ！
re: We will not give it over to the likes of you monkeys!

eng: Is the Gate Key okay?
jap: ゲ、ゲートホルダーは 無事？
re: Is, is the Gate Holder safe?

eng: Is the Gate Key okay?
jap: こ、壊れてないわよね。 ゲートホルダー！
re: It, it's not broken. The Gate Holder!

eng: No problem!
jap: ふ～ッ、だいじょうぶだわ。 これで戻れるわよ！
re: Phew, it's okay. Now we can return!

eng: I do not detect any damage.
jap: だいじょうぶデス。 特に故障は見あたりマセン。
re: It IS all right. NO particular faults ARE found.

eng: Thank goodness! It looks all right.
jap: よかった だいじょうぶ、みたい。
re: Thank goodness. It looks like it's okay.

eng: I fight anytime, Azala! Ayla no lose!
jap: いつでも来る　アザーラ！ エイラ　負け…… ウ……　ウゲ……
re: Come any time Azarla! Ayla no los...... u...... ugeh......

eng: Bbburp!
jap: ゲエーッ！　ゲロゲロ……！
re: ghehhh! ghkhkh......!
RetranslatorComment: Puking noises. I got a little creative with the spelling.

eng: You leave, Crono? No fun for Ayla!
jap: クロ　行くか……。 エイラ　つまらない。
re: Cro go......? Ayla bored.

eng: I'll never forget you! Thanks!
jap: 色々とお世話になって…… 楽しかったわ。
re: We owe you one for all you've done...... It's been fun.

eng: Thanks Ayla. I learned a lot from you.
jap: ありがと、エイラ。 あんたには色々教えられたわ。
re: Thanks, Ayla. We've been taught a lot by you.

eng: Sorry, Crono! I try be strong now. Just like Crono!
jap: ゴメン　クロ。 キーノ　強くなる　クロよりも！
re: Sorry, Cro. Kino get stronger, even more than Cro!

eng: Come again, Crono! Party! Eat! Dance! Fight! Fun!
jap: また来い　クロ！ うたげやる。　飮む。　食べる。 踊る。　戦う。　楽しい！
re: Come again, Cro! Have party. Drink. Eat. Dance. Fight. Fun!

eng: Come again, Crono! [member2] and [member3] too!
jap: また来い　クロ！ [pc2]！　[pc3]～！
re: Come again, Cro! [pc2]! [pc3]~!

eng: Reptites no come around lately.
jap: 恐竜人　これで　しばらく 出てこない。
re: Dinomen not come out for while after this.

eng: You brave!
jap: オマエ　カッコいい。
re: You cool.

eng: Chief strong! You strong too!
jap: 酋長　強い！ オマエも　強い！！
re: Chief strong! You strong too!

eng: Admire Crono! Strong!
jap: クロ　強い　たたえる！
re: Cro strong, praise!

eng: Where Azala run? The Masamune!
jap: アザーラ　どこ　逃げた？ 戦え！グランドリオン
re: Where Azarla run? Fight! Grandleon

eng: You found a Dreamstone! I'd forgotten how beautiful they are. You'll need to find someone that can process that mineral. You'll probably find him in Medina, a village near the Mystic Mountains.
jap: おお、ドリストーンか。 なつかしい輝きじゃ……。 ドリストーンをあつかえる男か……。 今ではメディーナとかいう 魔族の村近くにきょをかまえておるぞ。
re: Oh, Dreamstone? The radiance takes me back...... A man who can handle Dreamstone......? He's taken up residence now near the village of the Demons, called Medina.

eng: Oh you're just in time.
jap: お、いいとこに来た。
re: Oh, you came at a good time.

eng: It's my finest work! The ultimate in defense for my, daughter!
jap: タバン様の大発明。 ルッカ用の防具の完成さ！ 大事に使いな！
re: Taban-sama's great invention. The perfect armoring for Lucca's use! Use it well!

eng: You found some Dreamstone?! Then I'll repair the Masamune!
jap: お～ッ、それじゃ！ そのドリストーンがあれば グランドリオンを修復出来るぞい！
re: Oh, that's it! If I have that Dreamstone, I can repair the Grandleon!

eng: HOW on earth did you get the Masamune... ...and the Dreamstone?
jap: しかし、グランドリオンといい ドリストーンといい、一体どこで……
re: But, the Grandleon and Dreamstone, where on earth......

eng: No, don't tell me. I don't think my heart could take it. It'll take a little while to fix this...
jap: ま、いいわい。 ちょっと、待っておれ。
re: Oh, never mind. Wait a minute.

eng: I'll lend a hand!!
jap: 私も手伝うわ！
re: I'll help too!

eng: I shall help also.
jap: ワタシも手伝いマショウ。
re: I SHALL also assist.

eng: Crono! Where are you going? The Masamune isn't fixed yet!
jap: ちょっと、クロノ！ グランドリオンが直らないのに どこへ行くつもりなのよ？
re: Hold on, Crono! Where do you think you're going, when the Grandleon's not even fixed?

eng: Hey, Crono! Are you just gonna leave the Masamune here?!
jap: ちょっと、クロノ！ グランドリオンをほっぽって どこへ行くつもりよ！
re: Hold on, Crono! Where do you think you're going, giving up on the Grandleon before it's done!

eng: Mr. Crono, the Masamune has not been fully repaired.
jap: クロノさん まだグランドリオンが修復されて イマセンガ。
re: Crono-san, the Grandleon IS NOT yet repaired.

eng: All right, then!
jap: さて、と……
re: Now, then......

eng: How are you gonna fix it?
jap: どうやって直すつもりかしら？
re: I wonder how he plans on fixing it?

eng: These repairs seem quite difficult.
jap: 修復はムズカしそうデス。
re: The repairs seem DIFFICULT.

eng: Don't interrupt me while I'm conducting research!
jap: 今、調べもの中じゃ。 話しかけるでない。
re: I'm in the middle of looking something up now. Don't speak to me.

eng: At any rate, leave this to me!
jap: まあ、ワシにまかせておけ。
re: Anyhow, leave things to me.

eng: To repair the Masamune, we must process the Dreamstone, and activate the sword. You work on the Dreamstone, and I'll work on the sword.
jap: グランドリオンを修復するには ドリストーンを精製するだけでなく 剣を活性化させる必要があるのじゃ。 おぬしはドリストーンを精製してくれ。 ワシは剣の活性化を行なう。
re: In order to repair the Grandleon, it is essential not only to refine the Dreamstone but also to make the sword activate. You refine the Dreamstone for me. I'll carry out the activation of the sword.

eng: OK! Leave it to Lucca the Great!
jap: わかったわ！ このルッカ様にまかせなさい！
re: Got it! Leave it to me, Lucca-sama!

eng: Understood.
jap: わかりまシタ。
re: UnderstOOD.

eng: Gonna be mighty busy!
jap: さ～て、いそがしくなるわよ！
re: All right, it's gonna get busy!

eng: First, the tools...
jap: 道具をそろえナイと……
re: I MUST get the tools ready......

eng: This's pretty complicated... You're breaking my concentration, so would you find somewhere else to go for awhile?
jap: う～ん、けっこうメンドウね。 気がちるから、あっちへ行ってて！
re: Uhn, this is a lot of trouble. You're distracting me, so go over there!

eng: Without the proper facilities, refining the Dreamstone could take some time.
jap: 設備がないノデ、精製ハ 手間取リそうデスネ。
re: We lack the equipment, SO it seems the purificatION will take some time.

eng: To energize this sword, we must first rejuvenate the broken sword...
jap: この剣を活性化するには 一度はおれて力を失った剣の本体に ふたたび命をふきこまねばならぬ。
re: In order to activate this sword, I must breathe life back into its substance now that it has broken and lost its power.
RetranslatorComment: “Breathe life into” is the literal meaning, and sounds good too!

eng: The spell to energize the sword takes immense concentration. Could you leave us alone for awhile?
jap: 剣を活性化させる呪文は 高度でむずかしいものじゃ。 しばらく話しかけんでくれんか。
re: The spell to make the sword activate is a highly difficult one. Would you not speak to me for a while?

eng: All right, it's done! Now, bring me the Dreamstone.
jap: よし、終わったぞ。 ドリストーンを持ってきてくれんか？
re: All right, I've finished. Would you bring me the Dreamstone?

eng: I'm done here too.
jap: こっちも終わったわ。
re: I'm done over here too.

eng: All right, let's get started.
jap: 始めるぞ。
re: We're starting.

eng: Sorry to keep you waiting.
jap: 待たせたの。
re: Sorry to keep you waiting.

eng: Take a good look! THIS is the Masamune!
jap: 見るがよい！ これこそが、グランドリオンじゃ！
re: Behold! THIS is the Grandleon!

eng: Awesome! What a weapon!
jap: スッゴ～い！ これが、あのグランドリオン！？
re: Aweesoome! This is that Grandleon!?

eng: The Masamune... It's mystic powers might just force me to believe in the supernatural...
jap: これがグランドリオン…… 私の知らないエネルギーが出ているわ。 研究イヨクをそそるわね……
re: This is the Grandleon...... Energy unknown to me is coming from it. It arouses my desire to investigate......

eng: How strange. My sensors are picking up...spiritual energy emanating from the Masamune.
jap: 不思議デス。 このグランドリオン自体に 精神エネルギーが感じられマス。
re: It IS mysterious. I CAN sense spiritual energy from this Grandleon itself.

eng: Well, I think that's everything.
jap: まあ、ワシにかかれば こんなもんじゃて。
re: Well, if you get me involved, that's how it is.

eng: Ok Crono, let's take the Masamune to Frog.
jap: じゃあ、クロノ はやくグランドリオンを カエルさんの所に 持って行きましょう！
re: Well, Crono, let's take the Grandleon to Frog-san's place, quick!

eng: Crono, let us take the Masamune to Frog.
jap: では、クロノ、 グランドリオンをカエル殿に わたしに行きマショウ。
re: Well then, Crono, LET US go to hand the Grandleon over to Frog-dono.

eng: Okay, Crono, let's get this back to Frog.
jap: じゃあ、クロノ とっとと、グランドリオンを カエルの所に持って行くわよ！
re: Well, Crono, we're taking the Grandleon to Frog's place, quick!

eng: This weapon represents considerable power... Your actions may either save or destroy life. Wield your sword with full knowledge of the consequences! Would you like to buy something? Yes. No.
jap: 剣はな、使う者の心のあり方 しだいで、生命をうばう道具にも 救う道具にもなるものじゃ。 使い方をまちがえんようにな。 で、何か買って行くか？ はい
re: A sword may become either a means of taking life or a means of saving life, depending how the user's heart is. Be sure not to misuse it. Well, will you buy something before you go? Yes

eng: What luster! The Masa...Mune, correct? A...person in the Middle Ages wants to take down Magus with that.
jap: その輝き…… グラン……ドリオン？ そいつを手にして魔王を 倒さねばならぬ者が中世におるはず。 お前さん達ではあつかえまい？
re: That radiance...... Gran...d...leon? There should be one in the Middle Ages who needs to take that in hand and defeat Magus. I assume you can't handle it on your own?
RetranslatorComment: Maybe I'm reading too  much into this, but his word choice suggests that there's more to using the  Grandleon than simply wielding it.

eng: 'Tis thee again.
jap: また、お前達か……。
re: You guys again......?

eng: This sword... 'Tis the Masamune?
jap: まさか、この剣は…… グランドリオン……！？
re: It can't be, this sword is...... the Grandleon......!?

eng: I must ponder this turn of events. Remain'eth here the night.
jap: ……少し考えさせてくれ。 今夜はここで休むといい……。
re: ......let me think a little. I hope you'll rest here tonight......

eng: Cyrus! Are you leaving?
jap: 行ってしまうのですね。 サイラス……。
re: So, you are going. Cyrus......

eng: Yes, it's time we took back the Medal from the Frog King. And I'd like to see that mythical sword for myself.
jap: ええ。　そろそろ誰かが ゴールデンフロッグのヤツから あのバッジをうばいかえしても よいころかと……。 それに伝説の剣とやらも この目でたしかめてみたい……。
re: Yes. I've been thinking it's about time someone retakes that badge from that Golden Frog character...... Moreover, I want to try confirming the so-called legendary sword with my own eyes......

eng: But Cyrus, the kingdom needs you! And Leene and I need you. You must return to us!
jap: サイラスよ、お前は この国にとって必要な男……。 また、私とリーネにとっても かけがえのない友人だ。 きっと、もどって来るのだぞ。
re: Cyrus, you are an indispensable man to this country...... And an irreplaceable friend to me and Leene. Be sure to come back.

eng: As long as there is life in these bones, I shall return! By your leave...
jap: 命あるかぎり、かならず。 たとえこの身に、何があろうとも……。 それでは、これにて……。
re: As long as I have life, I will without fail. Even if something should happen to me...... Well then, I take my leave......
RetranslatorComment: More of an idiom meaning  that their business is concluded. Literally it becomes something like “with  this” or “now that this [has happened]”

eng: Sir Cyrus!!
jap: サイラス様！！
re: Cyrus-sama!!

eng: We, the Knights of the Square Table, wish you a safe journey!
jap: われら、王国騎土団一同！ みな団長の旅のごぶじを いのっております……！！
re: We, the Royal Knights, all present! We are all praying for our leader's safe journey......!!
RetranslatorComment: No square table, sorry. I can't decide whether that was more amusing or corny.

eng: Listen well, my friends...
jap: ……お前達。
re: ......you guys.

eng: I now entrust the safety of the kingdom to you!
jap: 後の事は、たのんだぞ。
re: Take care of the rest.

eng: Pardon the delay. Shall we be off?
jap: 待たせたな。 さあ、行くとするか。
re: Sorry to keep you waiting. Now, shall we go?

eng: Glenn, you be careful too!
jap: グレン！ あなたも気をつけてね。
re: Glenn! You be careful too.

eng: Be of sound health, your Majesty!
jap: 王妃様も、どうか お元気で……。
re: May the Queen also remain in good health......

eng: So! You want the Badge of Courage, dear knight of the kingdom? Well come and take it...if you can!!! Grribit...
jap: 「この勇者のバッジがほしくば 力ずくでとってみよ、王国の騎土！！ グギャギャギャ……！！
re: If you want this Hero's Badge, try taking it by force, royal knight!! Gh, kya, kya, kya......!!
RetranslatorComment: Definitely the real  Hero's Medal, not some garden-variety "Badge of Courage".

eng: Prepare yourself, polywog! En guarde! Nirvana Strike!
jap: むろん、そうさせてもらう。 行くぞ、G・フロッグ！ ニルヴァーナ・スラーッシュ！
re: Naturally, I'll have you let me do so. Here I go, G-Frog! Nirvana Slaash!
RetranslatorComment: “Have you let me” is kind of awkward in English, even if that is exactly what させてもらう means.

eng: GRAAAACK...! How dare you pick on a helpless amphibian! Filthy medal! I won't forget this!
jap: 「ハギャーッ……！！！ や……、や…… やりやがったな、このヤロー！ なんでい、こんなバッジ！ お、おぼえてやがれよ、チクショーめ！
re: HAGYAAAA......!!! H...... h...... How DARE you do that, you bastard! Why, for badge like this! Y, you'll PAY for this, damn you!
RetranslatorComment: Part of my effort to find  better ways to represent the insulting ～やがる verb  ending. Literally an order to remember it, but it has to be an idiom.

eng: Aaah!
jap: うわっ！？
re: Uwah!?

eng: Beware Glenn!!
jap: あぶない、グレン！！
re: Watch out, Glenn!!

eng: Cyrus! The sword... The Masamune!
jap: サイラス！ 剣が……！？ グランドリオンが……！！
re: Cyrus! The sword......!? The Grandleon......!!

eng: Gyah ha ha... Is THAT the best you can do?! Without your sword, you're nothing!
jap: ギャハハ、どうしたあ もう終わりなのかあ？ 伝説の剣がおれてしまっては 手も足も出まいがあ！！
re: Kya, ha, ha, what's the matter, are you done already? Now that the legendary sword's broken, I doubt you can do a thing!!

eng: Arrgh! You haven't beaten me yet!
jap: クッ、まだだ……！
re: Kh, not yet......!

eng: C, Cyrus... I'm a g...goner.
jap: サ、サイラス…… 俺は、もう……。
re: C, Cyrus...... I, can't......

eng: Glenn, escape while I keep them at bay.
jap: 聞け、グレン。 俺がヤツらの足をとめる。 そのスキにお前だけでも逃げろ。
re: Listen, Glenn. I'll hold them off. Run away then, even if it's by yourself.

eng: B, but...!
jap: し、しかし……！

eng: If you stay, they'll get us both. Go on, Glenn!
jap: このままでは、ニ人とも やられる……。 行くんだ、グレン。
re: At this rate, we'll both be done in...... Go, Glenn.

eng: You'd better worry more about yourself, Cyrus!
jap: よゆうだな、サイラスとやら。 人の心配などしている場合か……？
re: You've sure got time to spare, Cyrus, was it? Is this any time to be worrying about someone......?

eng: Come on, Glenn! GO!!
jap: いいか、グレン。 行くぞ！！
re: All right, Glenn? Here I go!!

eng: Aaahhh...!
jap: うおお……ッ！
re: Uoooooh......!

eng: C, Cyrus!
jap: サ、サイラスーッ！
re: C, Cyrusss!

eng: R...run...Glenn... The Queen. Take care...of...Leene... .........
jap: に……、逃げろ…… 王妃を…… たの…… …………

eng: C, Cyrus!? Cyruuus!!
jap: サ……、サイラス！？ サイラスーッ！！
re: C...... Cyrus!? Cyrusss!!

eng: Harumph! What's the matter? Aren't you going to try your luck?
jap: フン、どうした……。 きさまは来ないのか？
re: Hmph, what's wrong......? Aren't you going to come?

eng: Err...!
jap: くッ……！

eng: Gyah, ha ha... Cat got your tongue kid?
jap: ギョヘヘ……。 ヘビににらまれたカエルってとこだな。 わかぞう。
re: Gyo, heh, heh..... Like a frog glared at by a snake. Youngsters these days.
RetranslatorComment: The expression is comparable to a deer caught staring into  headlights.

eng: How about it, Magus? Can't you give him a more fitting form?
jap: 魔王様、どうです？ このこしぬけを、にあいの姿に 変えてやるってのは？
re: How about it, Magus-sama? Changing this coward into a suitable form?

eng: All right, why not? There's always time for a little fun.
jap: フッ、よかろう……。 わが前に立ちはだかる者は 一人残らず消す。
re: Hmph, very well...... I abolish all those who block my way, without exception.
RetranslatorComment: Magus rules, eh?

eng: A...augh!!
jap: う……、うわーッ！！
re: U...... uwaah!!

eng: Aaaaack!
jap: ぐあああああ……ッ！！
re: Guaaaaa......h!!

eng: Gyah ha ha...! You spineless wimp!
jap: ギャーハハハハ……！ いーくじなしの虫ケラめがあ……！
re: Gyaaa, ha, ha, ha, ha......! No problem, you damn worm......!

eng: 10 years hath passed... Can I do it? I've changed so much. Alas, poor Cyrus...!
jap: あれから、もう やれるか……　この俺に……？ サイラス……。
re: Has it already been 10 years since Can I do it......? Me......? Cyrus......

eng: Awaketh, Crono.
jap: おきろ、クロノ。
re: Get up, Crono.

eng: Though we may fail... ...let us go to Magus's lair.
jap: 俺にどこまでやれるのか わからないが……　行ってみよう 魔王城へ……。
re: I don't know how much I'll be able to do, but...... Let's try going. To Magus Castle......

eng: Thou knowest his power?
jap: ヤツは強いぞ……。 かくごはいいか……？
re: He's strong...... Are you ready......?

eng: Nothing can beat science!
jap: サイエンスの前に敵はないわ！
re: There's no enemy in the face of science!

eng: We won't be beaten by a bad guy!
jap: 悪いヤツには負けないぞー！
re: We won't lose to a bad guy!

eng: We must do it to save our future!
jap: 未来を見つけだすタメニ……！
re: FOR the SAKE of seeking out the future......!

eng: Magus' Castle
jap: 決戦！　魔王城！！
re: Decisive Battle! Magus Castle!!

eng: Dear me...! Crono! How many times have I told you to keep your pets outside!!
jap: ………。 クロノ…… うちでは、そんな大きなペットは かえませんよ。
re: ......... Crono...... We can't keep such a large pet in our home.
RetranslatorComment: kaeru-frog/kaeru-can keep pun

eng: M, madam...! I am NOT a pet! Though I am...odd of figure, I am a master swordsman!
jap: お……、奥方。 私はペットではありません。 姿はこうでも、れっきとした武人です。
re: G...... good lady. I am not a pet. Though my form is like this, I'm a full-fledged soldier.
RetranslatorComment: A respectful term for a lady.

eng: It TALKS...! Er...I just thought, I mean... I'm terribly sorry, uh, Mr. Toad!
jap: あら、ごめんなさい、ブジンさん。 私ったら、てっきり……。 本当にごめんなさいね、ブジンさん。
re: Ah, I'm sorry, soldier-san. I'm sure I didn't mean...... I'm truly sorry, soldier-san.

eng: NO! Mine name is...
jap: いや、私の名は……
re: No, my name is......

eng: ...... «Toad» will do for now...
jap: …… ブジンでけっこうです……。
re: ...... Soldier is good enough......

eng: Aaahhhh!
jap: 「うわーん！
re: Uwaan!

eng: Hey you-!
jap: 「お前らーッ！
re: You guuuys!

eng: It's Cyrus! Run for your lives!
jap: 「やべえ、サイラスだ、逃げろーッ！
re: Look out, it's Cyrus, run awaaay!

eng: Sniffle...thanks, Cyrus...Hic...!
jap: 「ヒック……、ありがと…… サイラス……、ヒック。
re: hic...... thanks...... Cyrus...... hic.

eng: Glenn, there're times when people simply have to grit their teeth!
jap: グレン、男はな、立ち向かって 行かなきゃいけない時もあるんだぞ。
re: Look, Glenn, a man's got times when he has to fight back, too.

eng: But...it hurts when I get hit. They...
jap: でも……、ぶたれたらイタイよ。 アイツらだって……
re: But...... getting hit hurts. Even for them......
RetranslatorComment: In the English version, Frog remarks that it hurts when the mean kids hit him. In the Japanese version, it is revealed that he actually meant to say he was afraid to hit them, because it would hurt for them as well.

eng: You're a marshmallow, Glenn...
jap: 優しすぎるよ、グレンは……。
re: You're too gentle, Glenn......

eng: Hey Glenn... I've been thinking about becoming a Knight...
jap: なあ、グレン…… 俺、騎土団に入ろうと思うんだ。
re: Hey, Glenn...... I'm thinking I'll join the Knights.

eng: I knew you were going to enlist! You'll make a great warrior!
jap: やっぱり！ 君なら、きっとりっぱな騎土になれる。 僕がほしょうするよ。
re: I knew it! I'm sure you can become a great knight. I guarantee it.

eng: Why don't you join, too?
jap: お前もいっしょに来ないか？
re: Won't you come with me too?

eng: I...don't think I'd make the cut.
jap: ……、僕には無理だよ。
re: ......I couldn't do it.

eng: But, why? You're better with a sword than I am!
jap: そうかな。 剣の腕はお前の方が上だと 思うんだがな。
re: Really. I think your sword skill is the better.

eng: I don't know... I think I'd really lose it if I had to hurt someone.
jap: ダメさ、僕は。 実戦だと、きっと震えあがっちゃうよ。
re: I'm hopeless. I'm sure I'd be scared stiff in a real battle.

eng: The...Medal. ...The Hero's...Medal...
jap: バッジ…… ……勇……者の……
re: Badge.… ....the....Hero's.…

eng: Hand'eth over the Masamune!
jap: グランドリオンをよこせ。
re: Hand over the Grandleon.

eng: Mine name is Glenn! Cyrus's hopes and dreams... And now the Masamune...
jap: 我が名はグレン！ サイラスの願いと、こころざし そしてこのグランドリオン……
re: My name is Glenn! Cyrus's wishes and aspirations, and this, the Grandleon......

eng: Forthwith I shall slay Magus and restore honor!
jap: 今ここに受けつぎ 魔王をうつッ！
re: I here and now inherit them, and will strike down Magus!

eng: Be that magic you use? I hath heard only magicians wield it now.
jap: お前達の使っているのは もしや魔法と言うものか？ 今では魔族しか使えないと 聞いていたが。
re: Could what you're using be what they call magic? I heard that none but the Demons could use it now.

eng: Travel to the End of Time, and you, too, may learn to use magic.
jap: 「時の最果てに行けば あなたも使えるようになるかも しれないわね。
re: 'If we go the Farthest Reaches of Time, you might become able to use it too.

eng: Travel to the End of Time, and you may gain the use of magic.
jap: 時の最果てに行けば あなたも使えるようになるかも シレマセン。
re: If we go to the Farthest Reaches of Time, you MAY become able to use it as well.

eng: What a strange new guest! Are YOU from the Middle Ages?
jap: おや、変わった客人だ。 あんた中世から来なすったか？
re: Oh my, a peculiar guest. You came from the Middle Ages?
RetranslatorComment: Unusual conjugation on  the 'come' verb, not sure if the meaning's quite right

eng: What a weird fellow. Being a frog, let's give him «Water!»
jap: こりゃまたヘンなの つれて来た。 こいつ、カエルだけに『水』の力 持ってる。
re: This's another weird one you've brought. As you might guess since this guy's frog, he's got "Water" power.

eng: Frog learned to use magic!
jap: カエルが魔法を使えるようになった！
re: Frog became able to use magic!

eng: A note written in blood!
jap: 血文字が……
re: Lettering in blood......

eng: «The Juggler in Magus's castle... strengthens his guard when attacked. Beware!»
jap: 『魔王城のジャグラーは… こちらがなぐれば、なぐりの防御をかため 魔法をはなてば、魔法の防御をかためる ガードのきびしいやつだ……』
re: “The Juggler in Magus Castle... strengthens striking defense if you strike him, and strengthens magical defense if you unleash magic. His guard is harsh......”

eng: This can only be...
jap: ここが……
re: This place......

eng: Magus's castle...!
jap: 魔王城だ……！
re: It's Magus Castle......!

eng: Ha, ha...
jap: フフ……。

eng: Wanna play...
jap: あそぼ……。
re: Let's play......

eng: Our treasure...
jap: 僕達の宝物……。
re: Our treasure......

eng: Ozzie!
jap: ビネガー！
re: Vinnegar!

eng: Welcome, Glenn! Or should I say, Sir Froggy! Mwa, ha! Say, looks like you got some replacements for Cyrus! Magus is a tad busy right now. You'll have to take up your business with me... ...the swordsman, Slash, and Flea, the magician... And...!
jap: よ～く来たグレン、いや 今はただのカエルだったな。 今度はそやつらが、サイラスのかわりと いうワケか？ だが魔王様は今大事なぎしきの 最中だ。 このワシが相手をしてやる。 外法剣土ソイソー、空魔土マヨネー。 そして！
re: Well done to come here, Glenn. No, wait, you're just a frog now. Does that mean those guys are your substitutes for Cyrus this time? But Magus-sama is in the middle of an important ritual at the moment. I'll take you on. If you can beat the Dark Arts Swordsman Soysaw, and the Void Mage Mayonnay. And!
RetranslatorComment: Soysaw is literally  termed 'outside method sword fighter'. Two dictionary entries might apply to  外法: one is a Buddhist term for heresy, the other is a sort of  demonic arts linked to tengu or using skulls.

eng: You'll have to defeat all 100 of the beasts in Magus's castle...!
jap: この魔王城の 100の魔物を倒せたならばな！
re: The hundred monsters here in Magus Castle!

eng: Dance, DANCE!! For tonight our leader is to be born! Ah! Here comes the sacrifice!
jap: おどれ、おどれ。 こよいはわれら魔族の神がこうたんなさる。 お、いけにえが来たか！
re: Dance, dance. Tonight, the god of we Demons will be born. Oh, so the sacrifice has come!

eng: Please let me go...
jap: 死なせてくれ……
re: Let me die......

eng: Put me out of my misery...
jap: 殺してくれ……
re: Kill me......

eng: Oh...
jap: ああ……

eng: Please, put a stop to this...!
jap: 止めてくれ……
re: Stop it......

eng: Only a moron would try to kill something that's already dead! H...humans!
jap: ホネとなっても殺しあうとは、おろかな 生き物よ。 お前ら人間はな！
re: To kill each other even though they've turned to bone, foolish creatures. You humans!

eng: Please help... Relieve us of this misery!
jap: 助けて下さい……。 このくるしみから！
re: Please save us...... From this agony!

eng: Hmmm... How did you get past my...cadaver pals?
jap: 「ほお…… 俺がやったムクロどもを たやすく……。
re: 'Oh......? The corpses I sent, easily......

eng: It's been ages, Sir Slush!...
jap: ひさしぶりだな。 外法剣土ソイソー……！
re: It's been a while. Dark Arts Swordsman Soysaw......!

eng: That's SLASH, you slimy dolt! Still playing the comedian, eh Glenn? You'd be singing a different tune if Cyrus hadn't been there with you last time!
jap: お前がここまで来るとは 思いもしなかったぞ、グレン。 お前もあの時、サイラスがいなければ 同じ運命になっていたのだ。
re: I never even thought that you would come this far, Glenn. If Cyrus hadn't been there back then, you would have had the same fate as well.

eng: You'd have fit right in with those boney fellows you just busted up!
jap: 先ほどのムクロ達とな！
re: Same as the corpses earlier!

eng: Now, let's get to business. This is going to do me a world of good!
jap: やるやる。 ひさかたぶりに、本気で行くか。
re: Pretty good. Guess I'll get serious for the first time in a while.

eng: And with no Cyrus to protect you, you're mine!
jap: だがサイラスぬきのお前に……
re: But without Cyrus, will you......

eng: You dare to oppose me?!
jap: 私がやれるかッ！？
re: Be able to take me!?

eng: Unbelievable...! But falling in the line of duty for Magus...
jap: 見事……！ だが魔王様のため戦いやぶれ……
re: Well done......! But being beaten fighting for Magus-sama......

eng: ...leaves me with few regrets...!
jap: わが人生にくいなし！
re: My life is without regrets!

eng: Do you want our treasure...? Yes. No. It's good stuff... In that case, will you... Play with us! Please! Pretty please!
jap: ほしい？　僕達のたからもの……。 はい いいえ いいモノなのに……。 そのかわり、僕達と…… あそんで！　あそんで！　あそんで！
re: Want it? Our treasure...... Yes No But it's good stuff...... In exchange, with us...... Play! Play! Play!

eng: Crono! So THIS is where you've been since the Festival! You had me worried sick! Children THIS naughty... ...deserve to be punished!
jap: クロノ、お祭りから帰らないと思ったら こんなトコにいたのね。 そんな悪い子は…… 死になさい！
re: Crono, I was wondering about you not coming back from the festival, and here you are in a place like this. Such a bad boy...... Die!

eng: Princess Nadia... I was wrong! Please return to the castle... ...as road kill, my dear...!
jap: マールディア…… 私が悪かった、城にもどってくれ……。 死体となってな！
re: Marledia...... It's my fault, come back to the castle...... As a corpse!

eng: Well, if it isn't Lucca! You're STILL alive, my dear?!
jap: おお、ルッカじゃねーか。 まだ生きてたのか！
re: Oh, if it isn't Lucca. You're still alive!?

eng: Robo, don't waste your strength! No matter what you do, I'll break you!
jap: ロボ、あんまりムチャしちゃダメよ。 どのみち私がこわしちゃうけどね！
re: Robo, you mustn't overdo it. I'll break you regardless, though!

eng: Frog, you're safe! I guess we'd better do something about that!
jap: カエル、ぶじでしたか。 ならば、私が殺してあげます！
re: Frog, you were safe? In that case, I'll do you a favor and kill you!

eng: The magician, Flea, I presume?
jap: 空魔土マヨネー！？
re: The Void Mage Mayonnay!?

eng: Wait! That isn't Flea... Where's the REAL Flea?!
jap: 今のはマヨネーではない……。 本物は！？
re: The one just now wasn't Mayonnay...... Where's the real one!?

eng: Mwa ha... Here, over here...
jap: 「フフ、ここよ、ここ……。
re: 'Hu, hu, here, here......

eng: Giving up, little tadpole?!
jap: 「お見限りネ、カエルちゃん！
re: 'Give it up, Frog-chan!

eng: Who IS this person?
jap: 何、このコ？
re: Who's this girl?

eng: Hey! Who ARE you?!
jap: 誰よ、アンタ！
re: Who're you!?

eng: Who is this fiend?
jap: コノ方は？
re: THIS person is?

eng: Keep your guard up! This is no ordinary woman! Meet Flea, the magician!
jap: ゆだんするな！ こいつが空魔土マヨネー！ ただの女ではない。
re: Don't get careless! This one's the Void Mage Mayonnay! She's not a normal woman.

eng: What the...?! Hey, I'm a GUY!
jap: ムキーッ！ ど～せ、あたいは男ヨ！
re: Mukiiii! Anyhow, I'm a guy!

eng: THAT is a GUY?!
jap: 男なの、このコ！
re: A guy, this girl!

eng: Say what?! That's a guy?!
jap: ゲ！　男なの、アンタ！？
re: Geh! A guy, YOU!?

eng: But its exterior is that of a female...
jap: 外見はあきらかに女性としか 思えマセンガ……。
re: I CAN think nothing BUT that the appearance is obviously female......

eng: Male...female......what's the difference? Power is beautiful, and I've got the power!
jap: (フフン)、けど女でも男でも 強い者は美しいのヨネ～。
re: (giggle), but male, female, either way, the strong are beauuuutiful.
RetranslatorComment: Flea ends all his speech with "yo ne," which sounds like the end of his Japanese name "Mayone," or Mayonnaise. It's intended to be sickingly cutesy. He also uses the tough female tone of dialogue, like Ayla (without Ayla's tendency to talk like a cavewoman).

eng: Poor little Froggie! You must be lonely now that Cyrus is gone. And to be turned into something so hideous! Dreadful!
jap: サイラスちゃんがいなくなって さみしーのヨネ、カエルちゃんは。 オマケに、そんなにみにくい姿に されちゃって……や～ヨネ！
re: With Cyrus-chan gone, you must be lonely, Frog-chan. And to make things worse, to be made into such an ugly form......yuk!

eng: But since you've brought your new friends over to play...
jap: けど、せっかく新しいお友達と あそびに来てくれたんですもの……
re: But you've gone to so much trouble to come play with me with your new friends......

eng: ...I'll show you all a good time!
jap: み～んなまとめて おもてなししてあげるのヨネ～！
re: I'll settle everything and entertain you!

eng: How can this be... Sir Magus...
jap: あ、あたいがやられるなんて…… 魔王様～ッ([heart])
re: H, how could I be beaten......? Magus-samaaaaa (heart)

eng: I grow tired of this!
jap: 来たか……
re: You've come......?

eng: Flea!
jap: マヨネーッ！
re: Mayonnay!

eng: Slash!!
jap: ソイソ～ッ！！
re: Soysaw!!

eng: Sorry, Ozzie, but they can't help you now...
jap: ざんねんだったなビネガー。 ヤツらはもう助けには来れん。
re: Too bad, Vinnegar. Those guys can't come help any more.

eng: You fly eating, tongue flicking...!
jap: こ、このケロケロ野郎……
re: Y, you ribbit bastard......

eng: Oz... Ozzie's in...a jam!!
jap: ビ…… ビネガー　ピ～ンチッ！！
re: V...... Vinnegar piiinch!!

eng: Thou can'st not run!
jap: 逃がさん！
re: I won't let you get away!

eng: Welcome...!
jap: ウエ～ルカム……！
re: Weeelcome......!

eng: Mwa, ha... How's this ?
jap: フフ、やりおる。 だが、これではどうかな？
re: Hu, hu, not bad. But I wonder how this is?

eng: Urghhhhhh...
jap: ぜ～は～ぜ～は～ぜ～は～……
re: gasp pant gasp pant......

eng: What the...?! Impossible...!
jap: ぬうッ！　バカな……！
re: Nhuu! It can't be......!

eng: Grr...This takes the cake!
jap: ちいッ！　うちどめか！
re: Dammit! Is this the end!?

eng: Thy time hath cometh, Ozzie.
jap: ねんぐのおさめ時だな ビネガー。
re: It's payback time, Vinnegar.

eng: Harharhar... I'm sure Sir Magus has already called for reinforcements...! Wait until Lavos arrives!!
jap: グゲゲ…… だが魔王様は、すでに 呼び出しているだろうよ…… ラヴォス様をな！！
re: Ghgehgeh...... But, Magus-sama is most likely already summoning...... Lavos-sama!!

eng: I shan't be defeated! No form of attack will break MY barrier!
jap: やられはせん、やられはせんぞ！ ワシのバリアーはあらゆる攻撃を うけつけぬのだ！
re: I won't be beaten, I won't be beaten! My barrier rejects all attacks!

eng: Hahahahahaha!!
jap: ギエ～ッヘッヘ！！
re: Gyehh, heh, heh!!

eng: Watch where you're aiming! Guwa, ha, ha...
jap: どこをねらっておる！
re: Where're you aiming!?

eng: Mwee, hee, hee...
jap: ギエ～ッヘッヘ……
re: Gyehh, heh, heh......

eng: Eh?!
re: Huh?

eng: That was a breeze!
jap: な～んだ、たいした事 なかったね！
re: Heeey, that was no big deal!

eng: That guy was totally bent...
jap: 何だったのよ、あいつ……
re: What was that guy's problem......?

eng: What was that guy's problem? That Ozzie...
jap: 何だったんデショウ？ あのビネガーは……
re: What COULD his problem have BEEN? That Vinnegar......

eng: We must hurry to Magus's place!
jap: いっこくをあらそう！ 急ぐぞ、魔王のもとへ！
re: We're fighting over the whole country! Hurry, to where Magus is!

eng: Neuga, ziena, zieber, zom... Now the chosen time has come... Exchange this world for...!
jap: 「ダ・ズマ・ラフア・ロウ・ライラ…… 「つむがれよ、天と地のはざまに…… 「この大地の命と引きかえに……！
re: 'Da zuma lafwa roh laira...... 'Be spun, betwixt heaven and earth...... 'In exchange for this earth's life.......!

eng: Magus!!
jap: 魔王ッ！！
re: Magus!!

eng: I...it's that stupid frog! Kissed any princesses lately?!
jap: いつかのカエルか……。 どうだ、その後の人生は？
re: The frog from that other time......? How's your life been after that?

eng: I rather enjoy this form. And I oweth it all to you!
jap: かんしゃしているぜ。 こんな姿だからこそ……
re: I'm grateful. It's because of such a form......

eng: I have something for you!
jap: 手に入れた物もある！
re: That I have what I've got!
RetranslatorComment: In the NA version, Frog notes that he loves his new amphibian form, and owes it all to Magus. In the Japanese original, Frog actually gave a reason for this, noting that because of his status as a Frog, he was able to obtain the Masamune.

eng: Ah...! The Masamune!!! I bet you're just dying to use it!
jap: ほう……。 きさまがグランドリオンを……。 だが今度は他の者達が、足手まといに ならねばいいがな。
re: Oh......? The Grandleon, you...... But this time, those of the earth would do better not to hinder me.
RetranslatorComment: Sounds like a reference  to the People of the Earth (Earthbound Ones).

eng: The black wind begins to blow... Okay...give me your best shot...
jap: 黒い風が、また泣き始めた……。 よかろう、かかって来い……
re: The black wind has again begun to howl...... Very well, come at me......

eng: If you're prepared for the void!
jap: 死のかくごが出来たのならな！
re: IF you're prepared for death!

eng: W...what have you done to the Masamune...?
jap: くッ、きさまグランドリオンを そこまで……
re: Y, you, the Grandleon, that far......

eng: What the...?!
jap: な、何！？
re: Wh, what!?

eng: What's happening!
jap: こ、これは！？
re: Th, this is!?

eng: It's a large-scale energy reaction!
jap: 強大なエネルギー反応デス！
re: It IS a powerful energy reaction!

eng: Could it be...Lavos?!
jap: ラヴォスってヤツか！？
re: That Lavos thing!?

eng: Bad timing...! Don't wake up on me now...!
jap: まずい！ 今、眠りからさめられては……
re: Damn! Being awakened from its sleep now......

eng: Wake up? YOU'RE the one who CREATED him!
jap: 眠り？ あなたが生み出したんでしょ！？
re: Sleep? You brought it forth, right!?

eng: What do you mean?! Didn't you CREATE him?!
jap: 眠りって！？ あんたが作ったんじゃないの！？
re: Sleep!? Didn't you make it!?

eng: What do you mean? According to my records, Lavos was born here, at THIS precise moment...
jap: 眠り？ 記録によれば、ちょうどこの時 ラヴォスはたんじょうしたと……
re: Sleep? According to the records, Lavos was born right at this time......

eng: You fools! I only «summoned» him! He lives in the inner earth, absorbing the land's power and growing ever stronger!
jap: おろか者どもが！ 私は呼び出したにすぎん！ あれは太古の時より地中深く存在し この大地の力を吸いながら ゆっくりと成長を続けているのだ！
re: Foolish ones! I did nothing more than summon it! It has existed deep underground since ancient times, and is leisurely continuing to mature as it absorbs this earth's energy!

eng: What?!
jap: 何ですって！？
re: What did you say!?

eng: So, he wasn't born in this period...
jap: じゃあ、この時代に 生まれたわけじゃ……
re: Then, that means it wasn't born in this era......

eng: Then my data must be incorrect...
jap: では、ワタシの時代の記録は 事実ではないと……
re: Then that means the records of MY era are not factual......

eng: What's going on?!
jap: 何だ、この感じは！？
re: What's this feeling!?

eng: Th, the Gate?!
jap: ゲ、ゲート！？
re: A, a Gate!?

eng: A g, Gate?! It's huge...!
jap: ゲ、ゲート！？ それも巨大な……！
re: A, a Gate!? And how enormous......!

eng: Impossible! A Gate this large should not exist!
jap: ありえマセン！ ありえないサイズのゲートの反応デス！
re: This canNOT be! This Gate reaction IS of impossible size!

eng: You! If you hadn't shown up...!
jap: おのれ、きさま達さえ 現われなければ……！
re: You, if only you bastards hadn't appeared......!

eng: Crono!!
jap: クロノッ！！
re: Cronoo!!

eng: We're being drawn in!
jap: す、吸いこま……！
re: W, we're being suc......!

eng: It's an enormous gravity well!
jap: 強大な重力デス！
re: The gravitation IS very strong!

eng: Whoa...!! Forward to the Past
jap: うおおーッ！！ 気がつけば　原始
re: Whoooooah!! Before You Realize It, Primeval
RetranslatorComment: Somewhat less literal, but probably more accurate.

eng: Honey...you'll be late for work!
jap: いつまでねてるの？ しごとおくれるよ。
re: How long are you sleeping? You'll be late for your job.

eng: I'd forgotten how beautiful Leene's Bell could sound!
jap: ああ、リーネの鐘があんなに 気持ちよさそうに歌ってる。
re: Ahh, Leene's Bell is singing so pleasantly.

eng: Crono! We can't keep sponging off my dad! Go out and get a job!
jap: クロノ！ これ以上父上のお世話にも なってられないんだから ちゃんとはたらいてよね！
re: We can't get help from my father any more than this, so work like you're supposed to!

eng: Crono! Crono! Crono! Crono! Crono! Crono! Crono! Crono! Crono!!
jap: 「クロ！！ クロ！　クロ！ クロ！　クロ！ クロ！　クロ！ クロ！　クローッ！！
re: 'Cro! Cro! Cro! Cro! Cro! Cro! Cro! Cro! Crooo!!

eng: Crono awake?!
jap: クロ　気付いたか！
re: Cro came to!?

eng: Ayla!
jap: エイラ！
re: Ayla!

eng: Ayla?!
jap: エイラ！？
re: Ayla!?

eng: Ms. Ayla! Which means we're...
jap: エイラさん。 という事はここは……。
re: Ayla-san. Which means this is......

eng: Ayla had strange dream. Went to Mystic Mountains. Everyone lie there, hurt. I carry back to hut.
jap: エイラ　会いたかった。 不思議山　行った。 お前達　倒れてた。 エイラ　一人で　みな　かついで テント　連れて来た。
re: Ayla wanted meet. Went Mystery Mountain. Yous were fallen. Ayla carried everyone by herself, brought to tent.
RetranslatorComment: Ayla did not have a "strange dream" that told her of her friends' placement on Mystic Mountain, but instead merely wanted to meet them and coincidentally found them there. This revelation was completely invented by the NA translation.

eng: Magus!
jap: ま、魔王ーッ！
re: M, Magus!

eng: Yummy frog! For Ayla eat?
jap: このカエル　デカい。 みやげか？　エイラ　食って いいか？
re: This frog huge. Present? Can Ayla eat?

eng: P, perish the thought, lass! By the way, whither the blue-haired one?
jap: バ、バカヤロー！ それより、あお白いツラした マントのヤローは、いなかったか！？
re: Wh, why you! More importantly, that pale-faced caped bastard wasn't there!?
RetranslatorComment: “Stupid b****” might be closer to his sentiments, or perhaps a “f*** you”

eng: Only find you there. Blue-hair one more tasty?
jap: いや　お前達だけ。 そいつ　お前より　ウマイか？
re: No, just yous. That one tastier than you?

eng: We hath lost him...
jap: ……逃がしたか。
re: ......we've let him get away?

eng: Lavos? Not worry now. You rest. Hurt bad.
jap: ラヴォス？ それより　ゆっくり休め。 お前達　傷だらけ。
re: Lavos? More important, rest good. Yous full of wounds.

eng: But if Magus didn't create Lavos, where did...it...come from?
jap: でも、魔王がラヴォスを 生み出したんじゃないなら…… ラヴォスは、一体いつから……
re: But if Magus didn't bring forth Lavos...... Just how long has Lavos......?
RetranslatorComment: Literally 'since when', but this phrasing sounds more natural.

eng: If Magus didn't create Lavos, then in what era was it...born?
jap: 魔王がラヴォスを生んだという 記録は、間違いだったのデスネ。 では、せいかくなラヴォスたんじょうの 時はいつなのデショウ？
re: The records that say Magus produced Lavos WERE mistaken. Then, when MIGHT the actual time of Lavos's birth be?

eng: Magus said that Lavos was born in the distant past...
jap: そういえば、魔王が 言ってたわね。ラヴォスは、はるか
re: Come to think of it, Magus was saying. Lavos has existed since ancient times

eng: Crono, ok now? Ayla busy, look for Laruba village. Fight Reptites together. Destroy Reptites or we no survive.
jap: 元気か　クロ達。 エイラ　今　大変。 ラルバの村　探してる。 ラルバの村と　力あわせ　恐竜人と 最後の戦い　やる！ 恐竜人　ほろぼさなければ　キーノ達 ほろぶ。
re: Healthy, Cros? Ayla hard time now. Searching Laruba Village. Join power with Laruba Village, have final battle with Dinomen! If not destroy Dinomen, Kinos destroyed.

eng: Kiiiiiiiiino!
jap: キーノ！
re: Kino!

eng: What happen? Quiet! Crono rest.
jap: どした！　クロ達　休んでる。 しずかにする！
re: What wrong!? Cros resting. Make quiet!

eng: North wood burning!!!
jap: 北の森　メラ！　メラ！！　メラ！！！
re: North wood flaming! Flaming!! Flaming!!!

eng: Chief look for Laruba village in north wood!! Chief okay?
jap: 酋長　ラルバさがしに　北の森　むかった！ 酋長　だいじょうぶか？
re: Chief went north wood, look for Laruba! Chief okay?

eng: Trader has new weapons! Go see.
jap: 交換屋　武器　新しくなった いってみるといい。
re: Trade hut weapons new. Should try looking.

eng: Saw Reptites follow chief! Went north wood!
jap: 俺　見た　恐竜人！ 酋長の後　つけてた！ 北の森　むかってった！！
re: Me saw Dinomen! Went after chief! Headed for north wood!!

eng: Red star in sky. See during daytime!
jap: 空　ひるでも　見える　赤い星ある！
re: Can see red star in sky, even daytime!

eng: Red star grow strong! Bad sign...
jap: 赤い星　だんだん　光　強くなる！ ふきつ……
re: Red star light keep getting stronger! Bad sign......

eng: Weird thing appear in lava field. Must be Azala! But flying Dactyl go anywhere.
jap: ようがんちたい　へんな物　出来た。 きっと　アザーラ！ けど　山こえる　プテランいる。
re: Weird thing made in lava zone. Must be Azarla! But need Pteran cross mountain.

eng: Hear weird cry in lava field to east. Never hear before.
jap: 東の　ようがんちたい。 不気味な声　聞こえる……。 聞いたことない　動物　声……
re: East lava zone. Can hear creepy voice...... Never heard before animal voice......

eng: «Petal» and «Fang» = Dream Gun «Petal» and «Horn» = Dream Bow «Petal» and «Feather» = Magma Hand «Fang» and «Horn» = Aeon Blade «Fang» and «Feather» = Ruby Vest «Horn» and «Feather» = Rock Helm for trade. I tell you something good. «Ruby Vest» strong against fire. No get burn while wear!
jap: 『はなびら』と『きば』　ドリストンガン 『はなびら』と『つの』　ドリストンボウ 『はなびら』と『はね』　マグマハンド 『きば』と『つの』　　　たいこのつるぎ 『きば』と『はね』　　　ルビーベスト 『つの』と『はね』　　　ストーンメット と　それぞれ　交換。 一つ　良い事　教える。 『ルビーベスト』　火　強い。 着てる　あまり　熱くない。
re: “Flower Petal” and “Fang”: Dreamstone Gun, “Flower Petal” and “Horn”: Dreamstone Bow, “Flower Petal” and “Feather”: Magma Hand, “Fang” and “Horn”: Ancient Sword, “Fang” and “Feather”: Ruby Vest, “Horn” and “Feather”: Stone Helm, that how trade. I teach good thing. “Ruby Vest” strong fire. Not too hot when wearing.

eng: Trade for «Rock Helm?»
jap: 『ストーンメット』と交換　いいか？
re: Trade for “Stone Helm”, okay?

eng: Yes
jap: はい
re: Yes

eng: You got a Rock Helm!
jap: ストーンメットを手に入れた！
re: Got a Stone Helm!

eng: No
jap: いいえ
re: No

eng: Trade for «Aeon Blade?»
jap: 『たいこのつるぎ』と交換　いいか？
re: Trade for “Ancient Sword”, okay?

eng: Yes
jap: はい
re: Yes

eng: You got an Aeon Blade!
jap: たいこのつるぎを手に入れた！
re: Got an Ancient Sword!

eng: No
jap: いいえ
re: No

eng: Trade for a «Magma Hand?»
jap: 『マグマハンド』と交換　いいか？
re: Trade for “Magma Hand”, okay?

eng: Yes
jap: はい
re: Yes

eng: You got a Magma Hand!
jap: マグマハンドを手に入れた！
re: Got a Magma Hand!

eng: No
jap: いいえ
re: No

eng: Trade for a «Dream Bow?»
jap: 『ドリストンボウ』と交換　いいか？
re: Trade for “Dreamstone Bow”, okay?

eng: Yes
jap: はい
re: Yes

eng: You got a Dream Bow!
jap: ドリストンボウを手に入れた！
re: Got a Dreamstone Bow!

eng: No
jap: いいえ
re: No

eng: Trade for a «Dream Gun?»
jap: 『ドリストンガン』と交換　いいか？
re: Trade for “Dreamstone Gun”, okay?

eng: Yes
jap: はい
re: Yes

eng: You got a Dream Gun!
jap: ドリストンガンを手に入れた！
re: Got a Dreamstone Gun!

eng: No
jap: いいえ
re: No

eng: Reptites take Kino! Reptites hurt all who fight! What do now?!
jap: キーノ　恐竜人　さらわれた！ 恐竜人　さからった者　みな殺しする！ たいへん！　たいへん！
re: Kino kindapped by Dinomen! Dinomen massacre ones who oppose! Awful! Awful!

eng: Reptites come! Burn village!!
jap: 恐竜人　突然　現われた。 恐竜人　村　やいた。
re: Dinomen suddenly appeared. Dinomen burned village.

eng: Those who fight, killed!
jap: さからった者　殺された……
re: Those who defy, killed......

eng: Reptites follow Ayla. Ayla bad luck!
jap: エイラ　恐竜人につけられた。 エイラ　やくびょう神！
re: Ayla followed by Dinomen. Ayla bringer of death!
RetranslatorComment: Literally 'plague god'

eng: You disobey, so Reptites mad!
jap: オマエ達　さからうから 恐竜人　おこった！
re: You defy them, so Dinomen mad!

eng: Ayla...This your fault! Look at mess...
jap: エイラ……、これ　みな お前のせい…… 見ろ　この　ありさま……
re: Ayla...... this all your fault...... Look, how this is......

eng: Reptites followed you! So village now ruined!
jap: お前の後　恐竜人　つけてた！ だから　この村　こんな目にあった！
re: Dinomen followed after you! That why this village suffer like this!

eng: ... Ayla feel bad.
jap: …… すまん……、エイラ　うかつ……
re: ...... Sorry...... Ayla careless......

eng: Reptites strong! They live long time before us, they smart so we hide. But Ayla say fight together... Ayla still fight?!
jap: 恐竜人　たてつく　おろか！ 恐竜人　ワシらより　昔から この地いる。 だから　ワシら　かくれてた。 だが　エイラ　いっしょに戦え 言う…… エイラ　こんな目　あっても 戦え　言うか！？
re: Opposing Dinomen foolish! Dinomen on this earth from more long ago than us. That why we were hiding. But Ayla say fight together...... Ayla say fight even if suffer like this!?

eng: Ayla fight while alive! Win and live. Lose and die. Rule of life. No change rule. Old man breathe, but dead on inside.
jap: 生きてるなら　エイラ 戦う！ 勝った者　生きる。　負けた者　死ぬ。 それ　この大地のおきて。 恐竜人も　エイラ達も　生き物 みな　このおきて　さからえない。 長老　お前達　生きてない。
re: If alive, Ayla fight! Winners live. Losers die. That Law of this Earth. Dinomen too, Aylas too, all living thing no can defy this law. Elder, yous not alive.

eng: Ayla, you strong, can make big talk. We no have power...
jap: エイラ　お前　強い…… だから　そう言える。 ワシら　力　ない……
re: Ayla, you strong...... That why can say that. We not have power......

eng: No! Have power! We fight, gain more power! Ayla help you, but need Dactyl. Give Dactyl.
jap: それ　違う！ 力あるから　戦う　違う。 戦うから　力つく！ エイラ達　力　かす。 だから　プテラン！ プテラン　今　必要。 プテラン　かしてくれ。
re: That wrong! Fight because have power, wrong. Power come because fight! Aylas lend power. That why Pteran! Need Pteran now. Lend Pteran.

eng: Need Dactyl?
jap: プテラン……？
re: Pteran......?

eng: Go to Tyrano lair?! That Reptite's place. Dangerous! Ayla want die?
jap: ティラン城　乗り込む気か！？ あそこ　恐竜人の城。 キケン！　いくらエイラでも！ 死にたいか？
re: You want go in Tyran Castle!? Over there Dinomen's castle. Danger! Even if Ayla! Want to die?

eng: Want to live, so go there! Ayla be OK. Give Dactyl!
jap: 違う　生きたいから　行く。 エイラ　だいじょぶ。　たのむ！
re: Wrong, want to live, so go. Ayla fine. Depend on you!

eng: ...OK. Go to Dactyl's nest and keeper will help. Careful, Ayla!
jap: ……わかった。 プテランの世話してる者　伝えておく。 プテランの巣　行く。 気をつける　エイラ！
re: ......got it. I tell those who care for Pteran. Go Pteran nest. Ayla take care!

eng: Thank you, Old man!
jap: 長老　助かる！
re: Elder helpful!

eng: You! Take care Ayla.
jap: エイラの事　たのむ……
re: Take care of Ayla......

eng: Crono!!
jap: クロ！！
re: Cro!!

eng: You can't be serious about going alone!
jap: 一人で行くなんて みずくさいんじゃない？
re: Isn't it awfully cold of you to go on your own?

eng: Don't even THINK about leaving us behind!
jap: 私達をおいていこうったって そうはいかないよ！
re: Trying to go and leave us behind, you can't do that!

eng: Thou goest forth alone? I know not thine quest, but a comrade of Crono's is also mine. I will not allow thee to meet thy demise alone.
jap: 一人で行くつもりか？ 事情はよくわからんが クロノの友人なら 俺の友人だ……。 一人で死地に向かうような マネはさせられんぞ。
re: You plan on going alone? I don't understand the situation too well, but if you're Crono's friend, you're my friend...... I can't let you do such a thing as facing death alone.

eng: No! Tyrano lair dangerous! Maybe all perish!
jap: ダメ！　ティラン城　危険！！ みな　死ぬかもしれない！！！
re: No! Tyran Castle danger!! All might die!!

eng: Listen, we owe you one!
jap: …… おんの売り逃げってのは 気に入らないわ。
re: ...... I don't like the idea of skipping out on owing someone a favor.

eng: Right, Crono?
jap: ね、クロノ？
re: Right, Crono?

eng: We can't let you go alone! Ayla, you saved us. Now it's payback time!
jap: ダメ！ ますます一人じゃいかせられないよ！！ エイラには、ずいぶんおせわに なったし…… 今度はこっちが返す番だよ。
re: No! We can't let you go alone even more!! You're really helped us out for one thing...... This time it's our turn to repay you.

eng: Right Crono?
jap: ね、クロノ。
re: Right, Crono?

eng: You desire to perish? I refuseth to be party to yet another demise!
jap: それで一人で死ぬつもりか？ 先ほども助けられた…… 俺のせいで人が死ぬのは もうたくさんだ……。
re: Then you intend to die alone? We were saved by you earlier...... Many times already people have died thanks thanks to me......

eng: Let us proceed, Crono.
jap: いくぞ、クロノ。
re: We're going, Crono.

eng: Ayla have strong friends!
jap: オマエら……
re: Yous......

eng: We're all going to the Tyrano Lair!
jap: さ、行くわよ！ いざ、ティラン城へ！！
re: Come on, we're going! Now, on to Tyran Castle!!

eng: Ayla, let's go! Next stop, the Tyrano Lair!
jap: 行こう　エイラ！ ティラン城へ！！
re: Let's go, Ayla! To Tyran Castle!!

eng: Let us proceed to the Tyrano Lair! Unnatural Selection?
jap: では行きマショウ！ ティラン城へ！！ 大地のおきて
re: Well then, LET US go! To Tyran Castle!! Law of the Earth

eng: Thanks for bringing, er, being the main course!
jap: われら、これから　ウタゲ！ お前ら料理されて、さらの上グゲゲ。
re: We're having a banquet after this! You guys'll be cooked, on a dish, gu, ge, ge.

eng: It's the apes!!!
jap: ！！　サルどもぎゃ！！
re: !! It's the monkeys!!

eng: Ayla!
jap: エイラ！
re: Ayla!

eng: Kino get back! Ayla save you!
jap: キーノ　下がる！ エイラ　助ける！
re: Kino get back! Ayla rescue!

eng: Wow!
jap: スッゴーい！
re: Amaaazing!

eng: What are you doing in there?!
jap: あんたも入って どうすんのよ！
re: What's the point of you going in too!?

eng: That method does not appear to be rational.
jap: その方法は合理的では ナイような気がするのデスガ……。
re: I do NOT feel that method is logical......

eng: Hmmph.
jap: うぬ。
re: Um.

eng: Sorry Ayla. All Kino's fault.
jap: エイラ　ゴメン。 キーノのせい。
re: Ayla, sorry. Kino's fault.

eng: No matter. Kino escape with Laruba villagers!
jap: そんな事　いい。 それより　キーノ　ラルバの村人と 先　逃げる！
re: That stuff fine. More important, Kino escape ahead with Laruba villagers!

eng: What Ayla do?
jap: エイラ　どーする？
re: What Ayla do?

eng: Put end to this!
jap: 大地のおきて通り　ケリ 付け　行く。
re: Go settle things by Law of Earth.

eng: Kino go too!
jap: キーノ　いっしょ　行く！
re: Kino go together!

eng: Kino no come. If Ayla dead, Kino new chief of Ioka!
jap: キーノ　来る　ダメ。 エイラ　負けたら　キーノ イオカ　酋長……！
re: Kino come, no good. If Ayla lose, Kino Ioka chief......!

eng: Ayla...
jap: エイラ……。
re: Ayla......

eng: Ayla strong. No lose!
jap: エイラ　強い。 負けない！
re: Ayla strong. Not lose!

eng: Kino understand. And show you something! You strong, me weak. Ayla good chief!
jap: わかった　エイラ キーノ　いいこと　おしえる！ オマエ達強い。　オレ弱い。 うらやましい。
re: Got it, Ayla. Kino teach good thing! Yous strong. Me weak. Jealous.

eng: Well, well! Out for a little stroll, are we?
jap: おいおい。 このニズベール様を無視するとは いい度きょうだぜ！
re: Hey, hey. You've got plenty of guts to ignore me, Nizbel-sama!

eng: Azala's in the back.
jap: アザーラなら、この奥だぜ。
re: If you're looking for Azarla, head just past here.

eng: Hold it. This is a special place. The great Nizbel was defeated here!
jap: まちな。 ただの奥じゃねえよ。帰ってきた このニズベール様を倒した奥だぜ！
re: Wait. It's not simply just past here. It's just past having beaten me, Nizbel-sama, who has returned!
RetranslatorComment: Rephrased so that the wordplay sort of works.

eng: So...you are here at last. This is it, then. The showdown. Today there shall be a conclusion. Will it be the Reptites, or you silly apes who end up ruling the world?
jap: やはり来たか……。 これが、最後の勝負になりそうだな。 おそかれ早かれ、決めなければ ならぬのだ……。 我々恐竜人か、きさま達サル共か。 この地に生き残る方をな。
re: So you really did come...... It looks like this will be the last match. Sooner or later, we must decide it...... We Dinomen, or you monkeys? Which will survive on this earth.

eng: Strong survive. Ayla strong. Ayla fight!
jap: それ　決める　大地のおきて。 エイラ　戦うだけ！
re: Law of Earth decide that. Ayla just fight!

eng: Hear that lovely voice? You'll soon become the best of friends!
jap: 今の声が聞こえたか？ フフ、後でたっぷり聞かせてやるわ！
re: Did you hear the voice just now? Hu, hu, I'll let you listen in plenty after this!
RetranslatorComment: Or Azaala. The second 'a' is an extended sound.

eng: Red star... Fall!!!!! Stain the earth...RED!
jap: 赤い星め……。 ふるがいい。 そして、大地を赤くそめるがいい！
re: Damned red star...... May you fall. And may you dye the earth red!

eng: Though it may be our fate to perish, we will not simply hand this world over to you!
jap: 我々がほろぶ運命だとしても サル共なぞに道をゆずるわけには いかぬ！
re: Even assuming our destiny is to perish, we simply cannot afford to make way for the likes of monkeys!

eng: Mwa ha ha! With this Black Tyrano I can finally exterminate those filthy apes!
jap: フフフ。 このブラックティラノが お前達サル共を、永遠に歴史から 消し去るのだ！
re: Hu, hu, hu. This Black Tyrano will wipe you monkeys from history permanently!
RetranslatorComment: Monkeys, apes, same thing, I just think monkeys sounds better.

eng: No...It can't be...! Could the heavens truly have sided with the apes? Listen, primates, and let it be known. We Reptites fought bravely to the bitter end!
jap: うう……。 天は、お前達サル共をえらんだと いうのか…… クッ、サル共よ聞け。　そして伝えよ。 我等が恐竜人は、運命に戦いをいどみ ほこり高くほろびたと……！
re: Uuu...... Does this mean the heavens have chosen you monkeys......? Kh, monkeys, listen. And pass it on. We Dinomen challenged fate to battle and perished proudly......!

eng: Ayla understand...
jap: わかった……。
re: Got it......

eng: Soon, stones of fire will rain down. Flames shall scorch the land. The burned out plains will slowly freeze, ushering in a long, cruel ice age. Mwa, ha ha...what a treat! You will wish you went along with us! Mwa ha!
jap: 始めに、ほのおをまとった大岩 がふってくる……。 しゃく熱の火球は、万物をやきつくす。 やきつくされた大地は やがて冷え始め、すべてがこおりつく 長くきびしい時代が来る……。 フフ、我等が時代のまく引きに ふさわしいではないか…… フハハハハ……！
re: To begin with, the great rock clad in flames will come falling...... The red-hot fireball will burn all things to nothing. The scorched earth will at length begin to cool, and a long, harsh era will come when everything freezes...... Hu, hu, is it not appropriate that we should be the ones to bring the era to a close......? Hu, ha, ha, ha, ha......!

eng: Lavos...
jap: ラヴォス……。
re: Lavos......

eng: Pardon?
jap: え？
re: Huh?

eng: La...Lavos!?
jap: ラ　ラヴォス！？
re: L, Lavos!?

eng: Lavos...Impossible!
jap: ラヴォス……、まさか！
re: Lavos...... it cannot be!

eng: Ayla's word. «La» mean fire. «Vos» mean big...
jap: エイラ達の言葉。 ラ　火の事。 ヴォス　大きい事……。
re: Aylas' word. La, fire. Vos, big......

eng: Ayla!
jap: 「エイラーッ！
re: 'Aylaah!!

eng: Kino!
jap: キーノ！
re: Kino!

eng: Hurry! Lavos come soon!
jap: 急ぐ！ ラヴォス　おりて来る！
re: We hurry! Lavos come falling!

eng: All ride Dactyl!
jap: みな　プテラン　乗る！
re: All ride Pteran!

eng: Kino! Hurry!!
jap: キーノ！　いそげ！！
re: Kino! Hurry!!

eng: Ayla! What you do?!
jap: エイラ！ なにしてる！
re: Ayla! What you doing!?

eng: Come! Azala! Come!
jap: こい！　アザーラ！　こい！
re: Come! Azarla! Come!

eng: Absolutely not! The powers that be have spoken.
jap: だめだ！ これは、大地が決めたことだ！
re: No! This is what the earth has decided!

eng: Ayla! Hurry!!!
jap: エイラ！　はやく！！！
re: Ayla! Quick!!!

eng: Azala... ...me not forget...
jap: アザーラ わすれない……
re: Azarla I not forget......

eng: The future...
jap: 未来……
re: Future......

eng: Future? What about future?
jap: 未来？ 未来がどうした？
re: Future? What about future?

eng: We...have no future...
jap: 未来を……
re: The future......
RetranslatorComment: Possibly the most frustratingly ambiguous line in the entire game. The only definite thing is that 'future' is involved, and that it's a direct object, or (depending on the verb), something that is moved through (like “ocean” in “sail the ocean”)

eng: So Lavos arrived in this period.
jap: ラヴォスは、この時代に まいおりて来てたのね……
re: Lavos came flying down in this era......

eng: So Lavos was «born» here...
jap: ラヴォスたんじょうは 王国歴600年ではなく、この時代 だったのデスネ。
re: Lavos's birth was not Kingdom Year 600, but this era.

eng: So! Lavos descended in this era!
jap: ラヴォスは、この時代に ふって来てたのね……！
re: Lavos came falling in this era......!

eng: Through no fault of Magus does Lavos live! Lavos hath fallen from the sky in ancient times.
jap: 魔王のヤツが 生んだんじゃなく空から ふって来たってのか。 こんな昔に……。
re: It's not that Magus gave birth to it, but rather that it fell from the sky? In such an ancient time......

eng: Lavos huge! Crono fight it?
jap: ラヴォス　スゴいな。 クロ達　あれと　勝負するか？
re: Lavos amazing. Cros have match with that?

eng: Crono! We go where Lavos fall!
jap: クロ！ ラヴォス　おりた所 行ってみる！
re: Cro! Try going place where Lavos fell!

eng: We may be able to do something now! Let's go find out!
jap: そうね、今なら何とか 出来るかも……。 行ってみましょう！
re: Right, if we go now, we might be able to do something...... Let's try going!

eng: Lavos should be weaker now. Perhaps we can put an end to him?!
jap: 今なら大した力も ないはずデス。　行きマショウ！
re: If we go now, it should not have considerable power either. LET US go!

eng: It just arrived so there may be something we can do! Let's go see!
jap: まだ、ふって来た ばかりだからどうにか出来るかも！ 行ってみようよ！
re: It's only just fallen, so we might be able to do something! Let's try going!

eng: Left unscathed, it will burrow deep within the earth. Best to defeat it now!
jap: ほっとくと地面の奥で 育っちまうってワケか。 何とかするなら、今のうちだな！
re: This means if we leave it alone, it'll grow up inside the ground? If we're doing something, now's the time!

eng: Th, there's a Gate!
jap: ゲートが出来てる！
re: A Gate's formed!

eng: Why is there a Gate here?!
jap: ゲート！？　こんな所に？
re: A Gate!? In a place like this?

eng: A Gate has formed!
jap: ゲートが出来ていマス！
re: A Gate HAS appearED!

eng: 'Tis a Gate?
jap: ゲートか？
re: A Gate?

eng: Lavos very fast! Deep under earth already.
jap: ラヴォス……、すごく　早い！ 大地の奥　深く　もぐってる。
re: Lavos...... awesome fast! Is dived deep into earth.

eng: This Gate was made by Lavos. Maybe Lavos is the source of all Gates?
jap: このゲート ラヴォスのせいで出来たのよ。 きっとすべてのゲートもラヴォスの 力がえいきょうして。
re: This Gate appeared because of Lavos. I'll bet Lavos's power is affecting all Gates too.

eng: Now I understand! The immense energy that Lavos gives off alters time and creates Gates.
jap: そうか……、わかったわ！ ラヴォス自体の、巨大なエネルギーが 時空間をゆがめてゲートを生むんだわ。
re: Let's see...... I got it! The enormous energy of Lavos itself warps spacetime and gives birth to Gates.

eng: It appears that the immense energy that Lavos radiates alters time and creates Gates.
jap: ゲートは、おそらく ラヴォスのエネルギーが空間をゆがめて 生じるのではないデショウカ？
re: The Gates, DOES NOT Lavos's energy perhaps distort spacetime and produce them?

eng: M, mayhap Lavos be the cause of this warp? The one in Magus's Castle was immense.
jap: お、おい、こりゃアイツの せいで出来たんじゃねえか？ 魔王城の時は、バカみたいに デカかった。
re: H, hey, didn't this appear because of THAT?

eng: What wrong, Crono? Fight Lavos! Go in here. Yes?
jap: どした　クロ。 ラヴォス　戦うなら　ここ入る 違うか？
re: What wrong, Cro? If fight Lavos, go in here, right?

eng: Reptites gone. Thank Ayla...
jap: 恐竜人　いなくなった。 これ、エイラのおかげ。
re: Dinomen gone. This thanks to Ayla.

eng: You strong. I strong now too.
jap: オマエ達　強い。　オレも　強くなる。
re: Yous strong. Me get strong too.

eng: Reptites burned. Good!
jap: 恐竜人　ほろんだ。 恐竜人　いいきみ！
re: Dinomen destroyed. Serves Dinomen right!

eng: No more fear. No more run away!
jap: これから　オレが正しい思うこと　する。 かくれる　逃げる　もうイヤ！
re: I do what I think right from now on. Not want more hide, run!

eng: Reptites gone! We happy!
jap: 恐竜人　いなくなった。 ボク達　うれしい！
re: Dinomen gone. We happy!

eng: Reptites gone!
jap: 恐竜人　ほろんだ！　うれしい！！
re: Dinomen destroyed! Happy!!

eng: Praise strong chief, and Crono!
jap: 酋長と　クロ達の　強さ　たたえる！
re: Chief and Cros strong, praise!

eng: Red star fall...bad omen. But Reptites gone! Happy!
jap: 赤い星　落ちた！ とても　ふきつ…… けど　恐竜人　全部　ほろんだ。 うれしい。
re: Red star fell! Very bad sign...... But Dinomen all destroyed. Happy.

eng: No more Reptites! Happy happy, joy joy.
jap: これで　恐竜人　出てこない！ うれしい　うれしい。
re: Now Dinomen not come out! Happy, happy.

eng: Red Star! Me saw! Big fire where Lavos fall. Me scared!
jap: 俺　見た　赤い星！ 大きな火　ラヴォス　落ちるとこ。 すごかった。 オレ　ちょっと　ちびった。
re: Me saw red star! When big fire Lavos fall. Was awesome. Me a bit scared.

eng: Reptites gone! Happy happy!
jap: 恐竜人　ほろんだ！ うれし！　すぎる！
re: Dinomen destroyed! Happy! Beyond!

eng: All relieved. Peace good. Everyone happy.
jap: みな　安心。 平和　来た。 みな　この日　待ってた。
re: Everyone relief. Peace came. Everyone waited this day.

eng: Go to «Tyran Fortress» 65,000,000 B. C.? Yes. No.
jap: B．C．6500万年『ティラン城跡』へ 行きますか？ はい いいえ
re: Go to B.C. 65 million, “Tyran Castle Ruins”? Yes No

eng: Go to «Earthbound Island» 12,000 B. C.? Yes. No.
jap: B．C．1万2千年『地の民の大陸』へ 行きますか？ はい いいえ
re: Go to B.C. 12,000, “Continent of the People of the Earth”? Yes No

eng: Gracious! Who're you?
jap: あらあら、あなた！　お名前は？
re: My, my, you! Your name?

eng: Me Ayla.
jap: エイラ　いう。
re: Called Ayla.

eng: Ayla... A young lady doesn't dress like that, dear!
jap: エイラさん……。 わかい女の子がそんな姿で あるきまわっちゃダメじゃない。
re: Ayla-san...... It's no good for young girls to walk around looking like that, isn't it.

eng: But, Ayla like...
jap: エイラ　コレ……
re: Ayla, this......

eng: Say «Yes, ma'am!»
jap: 返事は『はい』です！
re: The answer is "yes"!

eng: Crono strong... Crono mother strong, too!
jap: クロ……。 クロ　母親も強いな……。
re: Cro...... Cro mother strong too......

eng: Please, do not disturb my slumber.
jap: セッカク　キモチヨク　ネテ イタノニ　オコサナイデ　クダサイ。
re: I WAS AT LONG LAST SLEEPING PLEASANTLY, SO PLEASE DO NOT WAKE ME.

eng: The Magic Kingdom
jap: 魔法の王国　ジール
re: Kingdom of Magic: Zeal
RetranslatorComment: Ditto the above comment on the  hero chapter

eng: Boy, this is exciting!
jap: ドキドキするね。
re: My heart's pounding.

eng: Well it IS the Gate nearest to Lavos. We have no idea as to where it leads.
jap: なんたってラヴォスに一番 近いゲートだもの。 どこに来たか、わからないわよ。
re: There's no doubting this is the closest Gate to Lavos. I don't know where we've come.

eng: The Time Gyro says... What!? 12,000 years in the past?! That was some trip!
jap: 時空ジャイロは ……王国歴前1万2千年！？ おそろしいほどの昔デス。
re: My spacetime gyro is ......12,000 years before the Kingdom Calendar!? This IS ancient to a terrifying extent.

eng: Wh, where art we? 'Tis strange...!
jap: ど、どこなんだ？ 一体ここは……。
re: Wh, where are we? Where on earth......

eng: Where this, Crono?!
jap: ここ　どこだ？　クロ！
re: Where this? Cro!

eng: Welcome to Enhasa, in the magical kingdom of Zeal. We find truth in the bliss of sleep. Dear me! And who might you be?
jap: ようこそ、エンハーサに。 エンハーサは、魔法王国ジールの しんりを探しているのです。 おや……？ しかし、あなた方は……。
re: Welcome to Enharsa. Enharsa is the Magic Kingdom Zeal's sleep. Hmm......? But, you people are......

eng: This is the eternal kingdom of Zeal, where dreams can come true. But at what price? Am I a butterfly dreaming I'm a man... Or a bowling ball dreaming I'm a plate of sashimi? Never assume that what you see and feel is real! I'm Doreen. Seek the hidden path, and open the doors of knowledge, each in turn.
jap: ここは永遠なる魔法王国ジール。 すべての望みのかなう場所……。 だけど、そのだいしょうが どのくらい高くつくかは 知らないけれどね……。 あなたの目に見えてる世界と まったくちがうものなのかもね。 いい？　宇宙は生命の数だけ存在するわ。 見えるもの、さわれるものだけが 本当と思っちゃダメよ。 アタシはドリーン。 閉ざされた道をもとめなさい。 じゅんじょよく、ちしきの扉を 開けてね。
re: This is the eternal Magic Kingdom Zeal. The place where all desires come true...... However, there's no telling how high the price for that will reach...... The world that you see with your eyes and the completely different things. Listening? All that exists in the universe are the destinies of lives. Don't think that only what you can see and touch are reality. I'm Doreen. Seek the way that was shut. Get the order correct and open the door of knowledge.
RetranslatorComment: The line about the  universe and lives is rather unusual. 生命 ('lives') refers what  makes living things living and not inanimate. I'm also going with a more  unusual meaning for 数 ('destinies') than the common one of 'amount',  because it makes more sense.

eng: Welcome, what can I do for you?
jap: いらっしゃいませ。 どんなご用でしょう？
re: Welcome. How might I serve?

eng: The Queen has sealed the Elemental Weapons in the north palace. You can see its entrance on the northern continent, but no one is allowed there.
jap: 天冥火水の、星の力により生みだされた 武器、防具が、かつて女王の命令で 北の宮に封印された。 北の大陸に見えるのがその入り口だが もう誰にも、近づけぬのだよ。
re: The weapons and armors brought forth from the planet's powers of sky, dark, fire, and water were since sealed in the northern shrine on the Queen's orders. What you can see on the northern continent is its entrance, but nobody can approach it any more.
RetranslatorComment: かつて  threw me off before. If it were  かつて_の_女王, it *would* be former  queen, but without the particle, it's just an adverb on the sentence as a  whole. Sorry about any confusion that may have caused.

eng: The door to the north palace is sealed with a mysterious energy. Even we, the Enlightened Ones, cannot open it.
jap: 北の宮の扉は、強力な術で 封印されています。 われら光の民ですら あの封印を解くことはできません。
re: The door to the northern shrine is sealed with powerful arts. Even we People of the Light cannot release that seal.

eng: What strange visitors! Welcome to Zeal! Is this part of a dream? Queen Zeal rules our magical kingdom. She is without peer in beauty and greatness.
jap: あら、ふしぎな旅の方達。 これも夢のつづきなのかしら……。 ようこそジールへ。 わが魔法王国ジールをみちびくのは 女王ジール様……。 この世にふたりといない 美しく、いだいなお方ですよ。
re: Oh my, mysterious travelers. I wonder if this too is a continuation of my dreams......? Welcome to Zeal. It is Queen Zeal who guides our Magic Kingdom of Zeal...... She is great and beautiful as no other in this world.

eng: The Queen has given us everything! After the King died, she nurtured magic, which has advanced the kingdom. Zzzz...
jap: こんにちのジールがあるのは 先王なき後、女王様がこの王国の 魔の力を高め、はってんさせたのです。 スヤスヤ……。
re: What we have in today's Zeal is all thanks to After the late ruler passed away, the Queen heightened this country's magical power, causing growth. Zzzz......

eng: This is a Spring of Recovery. Heal your mind and body here.
jap: ここは回復のいずみ……。 さあ旅人よ、心の傷をいやし 命のかわきをうるおしてお行きなさい。
