re: This is a recovery spring...... Come, travelers, heal the wounds of your hearts and water the thirst of life.

eng: The Queen's palace is at the center of Zeal. From there she protects the entire world. That's why we can sleep our days away. Yawn...
jap: 女王様の宮殿は、このジールの中心。 西の大陸のいただきから つねに世界を見守っていてくださる。 夢の中にやすらうことが出来るのだよ。 ムニャムニャ……。
re: The Queen's palace is in the heart of Zeal. She constantly watches over the world from the summit of the western continent. mind like this. mumble mumble......

eng: I wonder what's inside the north palace... I bet there's a key to it in the palace. But entry is strictly forbidden.
jap: 北の宮の中は一体 どうなっているのかなあ……。 あの封印を解くカギも 宮殿にはあるのだろうけれど…… 女王様のご命令じゃなあ……。
re: I wonder what's become of the inside of the northern shrine......? The key to release that seal is probably in the palace too, though...... Queen's orders......

eng: Do you believe in Fate? Which means our lives are all predetermined? Well?
jap: 運命というものは存在すると思いますか？ この世のすべては、あらかじめ 決められているのだと……。 どうでしょう？
re: Do you think that 'fate' exists? That everything of this world is already decided in advance...... How do you think it is?

eng: Yes, of course.
jap: まさにそう思う。
re: I think it's surely so.

eng: So! You're a believer! Yes, it is useless for us to fight destiny!
jap: そうですか、やはりあなたも……。 しょせん人の子の力では 運命にさからう事など 出来ないのでしょうか……。
re: I see, so you too...... I suppose you can't do such a thing as opposing fate with the power of the children of humans after all, can you......

eng: No such thing as Fate.
jap: ぜったい、そんな事はない。
re: There's absolutely no such thing.

eng: You're right! We're the masters of our own destinies! Speaking of which... I believe there may be a doorway of destiny somewhere around here!
jap: そうですよね、やっぱり！ 私達の道は、私達自身が 切り開いて行くのですよね。 いいですか？ そのための扉が一つ ここにもあるかも知れませんよ。
re: Yes, just as I thought! We go on cutting open our path for ourselves. Listen up. There may be a door for that purpose here as well.

eng: I don't have time for this!
jap: お前なんかの知った事じゃない。
re: It's not something the likes of you would know.

eng: The city of Kajar, where they study magic, lies on the edge of the western continent. The airship, «Blackbird,» is kept there. Zzz...
jap: 西の大陸のはずれにあるのが 魔術都市カジャール。 さまざまな魔術の研究を 飛行船黒鳥号もカジャールで せいびされるのですよ。 くー、くー。
re: On the edge of the western continent is the Magical City Kajarl. They carry out research on various magic arts. The Airship Blackbird is also maintained at Kajarl. Zzz, zzz.

eng: Zzz...zzz... Truths exist in dreams... Herbal tea...zzz...crystals...zzz...
jap: ぐー、ぐー。 夢の中にこそ、しんじつはある。 私の中にこそ、宇宙はある。
re: Zzz, zzz. It is within dreams that there is reality. It is within me that there is the universe.
RetranslatorComment: Much more profound.

eng: What's wrong with him? What a weird kid...
jap: なーに、この子？ ヘンな感じー。
re: What's up with this kid? Feels we-eird.

eng: Hey, what's wrong? You have something to say?
jap: どうかしたのかな、キミ？ おねーさんに、何かご用かしら？
re: Is something the matter, I wonder? Do you want something with onee-san, I wonder?

eng: How may I help you?
jap: ワタシ達に、なにかご用で ショウカ？
re: MIGHT you have some business with US?

eng: 'Tis a sullen lad...
jap: 何だ、ぶあいそなガキだな。
re: What's this, it's an antisocial kid.

eng: What wrong? That animal good food?
jap: どした　お前？ その動物　ウマイか？
re: What wrong, you? That animal tasty?

eng: The black wind howls...
jap: 黒い風が泣いてる……。
re: The black wind is howling......

eng: One among you... ...will shortly perish.
jap: あなた達のうち、誰か一人…… 死ぬよ、もうすぐ……。
re: One among you...... Will die, very soon......

eng: What?! And out of the blue, like that?
jap: な、何それ！？ いきなり何なの？
re: Wh, what's that!? What's that all of a sudden?

eng: H, hey! Explain yourself!
jap: ちょ、ちょっと！ キミ、どういうこと！？
re: H, hey! What do you mean!?

eng: Is, is it true? What are the percentages?
jap: ほ、本当デスカ？ よそうカクリツは……
re: IS, IS this true? The predicted probability......?
RetranslatorComment: No explicit question, but  it seems like he'd be asking about the probability.

eng: Urchin! Halt!
jap: おい、こぞう！ 待て……！
re: Hey, kid! Wait......!

eng: Crono... This is kinda creepy.
jap: クロノ…… なんだか気味悪いよ……。
re: Crono...... I've got kind of a bad feeling......

eng: It's only a bad joke! It's unscientific.
jap: たちの悪いジョーダンよ。 ひかがく的だわ。
re: A bad-natured joke. It's unscientific.

eng: Why did he say such a thing?
jap: アノ少年、ナゼ あんな事を……？
re: THAT boy, WHY, such a thing......?

eng: I knoweth not what this portends. What an unpleasant lad.
jap: なんだか知らんが 気に入らないガキだぜ……。
re: I don't know what it is, but I don't like that kid......

eng: Strange one... But not bad boy.
jap: あのチビ　ヘン……。 でも　悪いヤツ　ちがう。
re: That runt weird...... But not bad guy.

eng: The Guru of Reason, is gone. Challenge me?
jap: 理の賢者様、もう、いない、ここ。 お前達、力、ためすか？
re: Philosopher of Reason not here any more. You guys test power?

eng: Yes.
jap: はい
re: Yes

eng: Ok, here we go. Oh, okay... You're strong! Take this.
jap: よし、ならば、ゆくぞ。 そうか……。 お前達、強いな。 これ、やる。
re: Okay, then here I go. I see...... You guys, strong. I give these.

eng: You got a Magic Tab! You got a Speed Tab!
jap: マジックカプセルを手に入れた！ スピードカプセルを手に入れた！
re: Got a Magic Capsule! Got a Speed Capsule!

jap: ヌウ……。

eng: Okay, then here I go. I see...... You guys, weak. Nuu......
jap: マジックカプセルを手に入れた！ スピードカプセルを手に入れた！ ヌウ……。
re: Okay, then here I go. I see...... You guys, weak. Nuu......

eng: No.
jap: いいえ
re: No

eng: «The Mystery of Life» Vol. 841, Ch. 26 All life begins with Nu and ends with Nu... This is the truth! This is my belief! ...at least for now.
jap: 841かん　26しょう ヌウに終わる……。 まちがいあるまい。 たぶん。
re: "Mystery of Life" Volume 841, Chapter 26 All life began in Nu and will end in Nu...... unmistakable. Maybe.
RetranslatorComment: ***CHANGED

eng: Who're you guys?!
jap: 何だ、お前ら！？
re: What do you guys want!?

eng: Everything okay with the Blackbird?
jap: 「どうだ、黒鳥号の調子は？
re: How's the Blackbird's condition?

eng: Everything's A-okay, Sir Dalton!
jap: いじょうナシです、ダルトン様！
re: Nothing is wrong, Dalton-sama!

eng: Of course it is, you idiot! Hey you! What're you doing there!
jap: 当り前だ、異常があったら 困るだろが！ それより何だ、お前達は！
re: Naturally; if there were something wrong, you'd be in trouble! Never mind that, who are you guys!

eng: Aha...it was true then...! You're the ones the Prophet said would come and cause trouble!
jap: ム？　そのいでたち…… お前達が予言者の言っていた、計画を 邪魔する者か。
re: Hm? Those outfits...... Are you the ones the prophet spoke of, who will hinder our plans?

eng: Let's see how you handle THIS little situation.
jap: ここはヤツがどう出るか 様子を見るとするか。
re: I guess I'll go with watching to see how he plays his cards.
RetranslatorComment: The idiom fits the meaning well, so I'm using it, even if it's  less literal.

eng: I didn't think they'd make it so easy on me! HA!
jap: ま、ヤツが、そうかんたんに シッポを出してくれるとは思えんがな。 ハッ！
re: Well, it doesn't seem like he'd show his true colors so easily. Ha!

eng: The Blackbird's a symbol of how advanced Zeal's culture is.
jap: この黒鳥号はジール文明のしょうちょうだ。
re: This Blackbird is a symbol of Zeal's civilization.

eng: Never thought somethin' so big could fly, huh?
jap: こんなデカいモンが飛ぶとは お前らにはとても信じられんだろ。
re: It's completely unbelievable to you guys that such a huge thing flies, right?

eng: This is the magical city of Kajar. We do experiments for the Queen.
jap: ここは魔術都市カジャール。 王国ジールにさらなる光をもたらす 女王の計画のため様々な研究を行なって おります。
re: This is the Magical City Kajarl. We carry out various research for the Queen's plans to bring yet more light to Zeal Kingdom.

eng: Your power differs from ours... In you I sense a strange aura of...kindness...
jap: あら？　あなた方の力は 私達光の民のものとは少し感じが ちがうようですね。 なんでしょう……。 不思議な優しさを感じますわ。
re: Hm? Your power would seem to have a slightly different feel to it than that of we People of the Light. What could it be......? I sense a mysterious kindness.

eng: Combine the ancient Rainbow Shell and the Sun Stone to create incredible weapons and items. But now, only the Guru of Life has the skill. Elemental power usage is forbidden. Ah! Plants are so content! I wish I could be, too.
jap: なんでも原始時代にあったという 虹色の貝がらと、太陽石をあわせれば すばらしい武器やアイテムが つくれたそうだよ。 でも今じゃ、そんな技術をもつのは 命の賢者様だけだし…… それに星の力はすてさるようにって ジール女王のご命令もあるしね……。 ああ、はなはこんなにも美しく みちたりているというのに……。 私は、はなになりたい……。
re: I've heard that if you were to combine Rainbow-Colored Shell said to have existed in the primeval era with the Sun Stone, you could make magnificent weapons and items. But now, for one thing, the only one with such skill is the Philosopher of Life...... Besides, there's also Queen Zeal's order to abandon the planet's power...... Ahh, flowers are so beautiful and content...... I want to be a flower......

eng: That's the Sun Keep you see on the southern continent. A Sun Stone, once the source of this world's power, was kept there. But when we began using our new energy source, it was sealed up just like the north palace. They claim we don't need the energy of this tired, old planet.
jap: 南の小大陸に見えるのが かつての太陽神殿だよ。 星の力をひめた太陽石を まつっていたのだけれど…… 新しいエネルギーが 利用されるようになってから 完全に閉ざされてしまったんだ。 もう古い星のエネルギーなんか いらないんだってさ。
re: What you can see on the small southern continent is the former Sun Temple. We had enshrined the Sun Stone that stored up the planet's power there, but...... Ever since the new energy came to be used, it's been completely shut off. Just like the northern shrine. They say we don't need such a thing as the energy of the old planet any more.

eng: We've been seeing a lot of Janus lately. He appears upset and paces around.
jap: めずらしいことに 最近、ジャキ様の姿をよく見かけますね。 なんだか落ち着きなく、あちこち 出あるいているようですが……。
re: We've seen Jyaki-sama unusually often lately. It seems that he walks all around, unable to calm down about something.

eng: His only friend, other than his sister, is that stupid cat. What tempest rages in his head?
jap: 話し相手といったら、姉のサラ様と いつも連れてあるいている あのネコくらいのもの……。 いったいジャキ様は、何を見て 何を聞いていらっしゃるのか……。
re: After far as who he talks to, that's basically only his older sister Sara-sama and that cat he always takes walking around. Just what is it that Jyaki-sama sees and hears......?

eng: Queen Zeal has two heirs, Schala and Janus. Schala's an incredible child who has extraordinary magical powers. Being so gifted, she'll breeze through life.
jap: ジール女王にはニ人のお子がおられる。 サラ様とジャキ様だ。 サラ様はすばらしいお子であられるぞ。 人なみはずれたスゴイ魔力を あれだけの力があれば、人生はもう バラ色であろうなあ……。
re: Queen Zeal has two children, Sara-sama and Jyaki-sama. Sara-sama is a magnificent child. She possesses extraordinarily amazing magical With that much power, she'll have a glorious life.
RetranslatorComment: Literally, her life will be rose-colored.

eng: My, you've got an unusual aura! So, you must possess the skill, too! It must be very primitive compared to ours! You poor things!
jap: あら、かわった『気』を まとっておられますね。 けど私達のものとくらべると ずいぶんと原始的な術のようですわね。 ホッホッ。
re: Oh my, you have a peculiar “spirit”. I suppose you can use the arts as well? But they would seem to be quite primitive arts compared with ours. Ho, ho.

eng: How did we come by our skills? And why do others lack them? Who cares!
jap: そもそも、われらの力は どこから来たのであろうか？ なぜ術の力を持つ者と持たない者とが 存在するのか……？ うーむ……。
re: Where might our powers have come from in the first place? Why do both those with the power of arts and those without exist......? Hmm......
RetranslatorComment: The Zeal man in Kajar's  speech was more thoughtful in the Japanese version.

eng: Those lacking magic have always lived beneath the clouds, as the «Earthbound Ones.» After all, they lack what we have...
jap: 地の民と呼ばれる、魔力をもたぬ者達は 雲の下で昔ながらのくらしをしています。 しょせん彼らは、私達のような特別な力を 持った人間ではありませんものね。
re: Those called the People of the Earth who lack magical power have long since lived under the clouds. After all, they aren't people with special powers like we are.

eng: ...... ...... I've got Lode Shields, but I cannot sell them unless the Queen says it's okay.
jap: ……。 ……。 ここ、プラチナ製防具、ある。 でも、じょおう様のゆるし、ないと 売れない……。
re: …… …… Here, have platinum armors. But can't sell without Queen's permission......

eng: ...... Is that Schala's Pendant?
jap: ……。 お前達、もってるそれ サラ様のペンダント？
re: ...... That you have, Sara-sama's pendant?

eng: Yes.
jap: はい
re: Yes

eng: ...... I hate liars.
jap: ……。 ウソつき、きらい。
re: ...... Hate liars.

eng: No.
jap: いいえ
re: No

eng: ...... Welcome. Come again.
jap: ……。 いらっしゃい。 また来て。
re: ...... Welcome. Come again.

eng: The construction of the Ocean Palace is behind schedule. Eternal Palace, beneath the waves... It'll be a sight to see when it's done!
jap: 海底神殿は、まだけんせつ中です。 計画に少しおくれが出ておるのです。 あおい海の底の、永遠なる神殿……。 完成したらさぞ美しく、りっぱなものに なることでしょう！
re: The Ocean Floor Temple is still under construction. It's a bit behind schedule. Eternal temple on the floor of the blue sea...... I'm certain it will be beautifully splendid once it's done!

eng: Indeed! That great aeroplane «Blackbird,» which Belthasar built. When it soars in the sky, it looks alive! Belthasar is truly a genius!
jap: ごらんなさい。 あの巨大な鳥こそ、理の賢者ガッシュ様が 設計された黒鳥号です。 じゆうに空をまうさまは まるで生きているかのようです。 ガッシュ様はやはりすごい。
re: Behold. That huge bird is the Blackbird that the Philosopher of Reason Gasch-sama designed. The way it freely dances through the sky looks just like it's alive. Gasch-sama truly is amazing.

eng: The Earthbound Ones are being allowed to work on the construction of the Palace. So they do have a purpose after all.
jap: 多くの地の民達が、海の底で 神殿けんせつにあたっております。 あのような者達でも役に立つ時が あるのですね。
re: Many People of the Earth are assigned to the temple construction at the bottom of the ocean. Even that sort of people have times when they are useful.

eng: The Ocean Palace lies deep beneath the waves. It's a symbol of the Queen's power! The Palace is the source of light which sustains all living things. Queen Zeal, the great!
jap: ちゅうおうの海の底に見えるのが、 女王様のいだいさのあかし、 海底神殿です。 海底神殿は、あらゆる生命をみちびく 輝きの源となるのです。 おお、いだいなる、ジール女王よ！
re: What you can see in the depths of the central ocean is the proof of the Queen's greatness, the Ocean Floor Temple. The Ocean Floor Temple will become the source of the radiance that guides every life. Oh, Great Queen Zeal!

eng: The Gurus of Life, Time, and Reason, live in Zeal. Their skill and knowledge is supreme.
jap: このジールには、命・時・理の三賢者様が いらっしゃいます。 術や知恵で彼らにかなう者はおりませぬ。
re: Here in Zeal are the three Philosopher, of Life, Time, and Reason. There are none who can match them in wisdom and skill.

eng: Zeal's advances stem from a new energy source. Its power surpasses that of the elements.
jap: 天冥火水の星の力よりもはるかに強力な 新しいエネルギーの利用により ジールはここまでさかえたのです。
re: Zeal has prospered this much through the use of a new energy far more powerful than the planet's powers of sky, dark, fire, and water.

eng: I heard a strange prophet has come to the palace. I don't know the details...but I heard he has uncanny powers.
jap: 宮殿に不思議な予言者があらわれたという うわさを聞きましたよ。 くわしいことは知りませんが すごい魔力の持ち主だそうです。
re: I've heard rumors that a mysterious prophet appeared at the palace. I don't know the details, but I've heard he's the owner of an amazing magical power.

eng: I'm working on a tab that will boost magical skill. But my precious products have been disappearing lately... Must be the naughty Nu that hid them. They love pranks... What can I do?
jap: わしは術の力を高める 魔法のカプセルを研究しとるのじゃ。 しかし最近よく大切なカプセルが 消え失せてしまうんじゃが……。 きっとイタズラ好きのヌウめが かくしてまわっとるにちがいない。 まったく、こまったもんじゃわい。
re: I'm researching a magical capsule to boost the power of arts. But my precious capsules have been vanishing lately...... I've no doubt that that mischievous Nu's hiding them on me. Dagnabbit, it's annoying.
RetranslatorComment: “old-guy speech” is a  good excuse to use dagnabbit. That, and the word fits better than most.

eng: Oops, that's a defective item. Too bad, huh? Ha ha ha.
jap: おっと、そのカプセルは ザンネンじゃったな、ホッホッ！
re: Hold it, that capsule's an unfinished sample. Too bad, ho ho!

eng: I heard Schala's powers far exceed those of her mother. Then there's her step-brother, Janus. He's of royal blood, but he doesn't seem to have a speck of magic.
jap: うわさですが、サラ様の魔力は 母親である女王の力さえ はるかにしのぐという事です。 それにひきかえ弟のジャキ様は……。 王家の血すじであるというのに まったく魔力を持たないらしいのです。
re: This is just a rumor, but they say Sara-sama's magical powers far surpass even the powers of her mother the Queen. Her brother Jyaki-sama, on the other hand...... Even though he is of the royal lineage, it seems he has absolutely no magical powers.

eng: A Guru once told me that the Sun Stone could store the almost infinite energy of our sun. But if its energy were used up, it would lose its glow and change into a Moon Stone.
jap: むかし賢者様から教わったのですが 太陽石には、太陽の無限の力を たくわえることができたのだそうです。 ただし、力をつかいはたすと 輝きを失ってしまって、 暗黒石に変わったとか……。
re: I one learned from the Philosophers that they were able to store up the infinite power of the sun in a Sun Stone. However, when it used up its power, it lost its radiance and became a Darkness Stone, or something like that......

eng: Did you know a Moon Stone can be recharged if you leave it in the sun? But it takes aeons, so it's unlikely for us to see that gorgeous glow again.
jap: 知っておるかね、旅の人？ 暗黒石を陽のあたる場所にねかせておけば 失われた輝きをとりもどすことが できるのじゃ。 ただし、そのためには 気の遠くなるような長い時間が必要でな。 あの輝きを目にすることは もう二度とあるまい……。
re: Did you know, travelers? If you lay a Darkness Stone in a place where the sun hits, it can regain its lost radiance. However, you need a mind-bogglingly long period of time for that to happen. I doubt I'll ever again lay eyes on that radiance......

eng: Scratch, scratch... Oooh... Phew...! Tee hee...! ......
jap: こちょこちょ……。 うくっ…… はうっ……！ うきゃうきゃ……！ ………。
re: Koochie, koochie...... Ukuu...... Hauu......! Ukya, ukya......! .........
RetranslatorComment: These all look like  random noises, not language. This particular one made me think of “koochie,  koochie, koo!” though...

eng: Water summons wind... ...wind makes fire dance.
jap: 水は風を呼んで…… 風は火をおどらせる……
re: Water calls wind...... Wind makes fire dance......

eng: You've found something strange! But a «Black Rock» is inside!
jap: えたいの知れないものを と思ったら中から『黒の石』が出てきた！
re: Found something of an unknown nature!! Just then, a "Black Rock" came out from inside!
RetranslatorComment: ...と思ったら  (and と思うと) just means that two things happen one  right after another, or at the same time, and doesn't really have anything to  do with thinking despite the verb. Unless it's something like the second  thing happens before you have time to think about the first...?

eng: It all began aeons ago, when man's ancestors picked up a shard of a strange red rock... Its power, which was beyond human comprehension, cultivated dreams... In turn, love and hate were born... Only time will see how it all ends.
jap: 何千万年もの昔、人の祖先がふと手にした 不思議な赤い石のかけら……。 そこからすべては始まったのだ。 人の知を超えた力は夢をはぐくみ 愛とにくしみを生んだ……。 それがどのような終わりを見るか…… 時だけがそのこたえを知っていよう。
re: Tens of millions of years ago, the ancestors of humans happened to take a fragment of a mysterious red rock in hand...... Everything started from there. A power that surpassed human knowledge gave rise to dreams and gave birth to love and hate...... What manner of ending will that see......? Perhaps only time knows the answer.

eng: This is the Queen's Palace, the center of Zeal Kingdom. Which makes THIS, the center of the universe.
jap: ここは女王様の宮殿。 わがジール王国の中心…… ということは、すなわち まさに宇宙の中心という事です。
re: This is the Queen's palace. The heart of our Zeal Kingdom...... Which means, in other words, it's surely the heart of the universe.

eng: The source of our energy lies deep below the sea. Now that its exact location has been found, the Ocean Palace will be built.
jap: おおいなるエネルギーの源は 海底ふかくで眠っておる。 そのたしかな位置が判明したため 今回の海底神殿けんせつの計画が 実行にうつされたのじゃよ。
re: The source of our great energy sleeps deep in the ocean floor. As its exact position has been confirmed, the current Ocean Floor Temple construction project has been put into practice.

eng: Use the Queen's hall to get to the Ocean Palace, which is under construction.
jap: 海底神殿への入り口は 女王の間にあるらしいよ。 でも、まだ神殿は未完成なんだけどね。
re: I've heard that the entrance to the Ocean Floor Temple is in the Queen's hall. The temple is incomplete as yet, though.

eng: The wandering prophet is amazing! All his prophecies have come true. It's as if he knows the future! How eerie...
jap: あの旅の予言者は本物じゃぞ。 なんでもかんでもピタリとあてちまう。 まるで、これから起こる事を すでに知っているかのようじゃ……。 気味が悪いわい。
re: That traveling prophet is the real thing. He's dead-on with anything and everything. It's just like he already knows what's going to happen after this...... It's uncanny.

eng: My, what strange clothes! You must be travelers from afar? Use the Spring of Recovery to recuperate from your journey.
jap: まあ、ずいぶんかわったかっこうを なさっているのですね。 よほど遠くからいらしたのですか？ 回復のいずみで旅のつかれを いやして行かれるとよいでしょう。
re: Oh my, you look extremely unusual. Have you come from quite far away? You should use the spring of recovery to heal the fatigue of travel.

eng: Visitors, do you like plants?
jap: 緑はお好きですか、旅の方達？
re: Do you like green things, traveling persons?

eng: Yes
jap: 好き
re: Like

eng: Oh, you're just like me! But the Queen ordered me to burn this sapling I received from the Guru of Life. He said it was a magical sapling, with powers to cure the environment. What shall I do?
jap: まあ！　私も大好きなのです！ でも命の賢者様からいただいた このわかぎを、女王様は もやしてしまえと……。 緑を守る力を持った 不思議なわかぎだと賢者様は おっしゃっていたのに……。 ああ、どうしたらいいのでしょう？
re: Well! I also like them very much! But the Queen said to burn up this sapling that I received from the Philosopher of Life...... And yet the Philosopher said that it is a mysterious sapling with the power to protect greenery...... Ahh, what should I do?

eng: Burn it.
jap: もやしてしまえ
re: Burn it

eng: You're right... I must obey the Queen's command.
jap: そうですか……。 女王様のご命令ですもの しかたありませんよね……。
re: The Queen DID order it, so it can't be helped......

eng: Secretly plant it.
jap: どこかにこっそりうえる
re: Plant it somewhere secretly

eng: You're right! Even if it IS the Queen's command, the Guru of Life gave it to me. I can't burn it... I'm going to grow it with love. Someday it may save the environment. If I'm reborn, I hope it'll be in a land full of green forests.
jap: そうですよね！ いくら女王様のご命令でも 賢者様からいただいたものを もやしてしまうなど……。 わかりました。 このわかぎは、どこかに大切に うえておきましょう。 いつか緑を守る人のために 役に立ってくれるかもしれませんもの。 もし生まれかわることが出来るなら 大地の上で緑と共にくらしたい……。
re: You're right! Even if on the Queen's orders, such a thing as burning up what I received from the Philosopher...... Understood. I will plant this sapling with care somewhere. It may someday be of use for someone who protects greenery. If I can be reborn, I want to live on the earth along with greenery......

eng: No
jap: キライ
re: Dislike

eng: I see... You're like the Queen.
jap: そう……。 それでは女王様と同じね……。
re: I see...... Then you're the same as the Queen......

eng: Ask the Queen or the Gurus if you want to know about the Mammon Machine and the Ocean Palace. But just between us, she probably won't give you the time of day.
jap: 魔神器や海底神殿について知りたいならば 三賢者様か女王様にお聞きするのが 一番ですな。 じゃが、ここだけの話、今の女王様では どんなこたえが返ってくることか……。
re: If you want to know about the Demonic Vessel or Ocean Floor Palace, the Three Philosophers or the Queen are the best ones to ask. But, just between us, there's no telling how the Queen would respond as she is now......

eng: That man's a newcomer but his accurate prophecies earned the Queen's trust. He's a drifter... He's not one of us Enlightened Ones, nor of the Earthbound Ones either. Hmmm...
jap: あの男は少し前にふらりと宮殿にあらわれ たしかな予言で女王の信をえたのだ。 ヤツがどこから来たのか誰も知らない。 我ら光の民ではなし、むろん地の民である わけもない……。　う～む……。
re: That man wandered into the palace a little while ago and earned the Queen's trust with his reliable predictions. Nobody knows where that guy came from. He's not one of us People of the Light, and of course there's no way he's of the People of the Earth...... Hmmm......

eng: Did you know that Belthasar, the Guru of Reason, has secret rooms in Enhasa and Kajar?
jap: 知ってるかい、旅の人。 エンハーサやカジャールには 理の賢者ガッシュ様のヒミツの部屋が あるそうだよ。
re: Did you know of this, travelers? In Enhasa and Kajal, the Philosopher of Reason Gasch-sama has secret rooms, they say.

eng: The Queen's two heirs, Schala and Janus, get along so well. If only Janus would open up to others...
jap: 女王の二人のお子様 サラ様とジャキ様は、本当に 仲の良い姉弟ですわ。 これで、もう少しジャキ様が サラ様以外の人にも 心を開いてくだされば……。
re: The Queen's children, Sara-sama and Jyaki-sama, truly have a good relationship as siblings. If only Jyaki-sama would open his heart a little more to others apart from Sara-sama......

eng: That pendant of yours... It looks like Schala's, but it doesn't glow.
jap: あら、あなたの持っている そのペンダント……。 サラ様の物とよく似ていますわね。 でもサラ様のペンダントのような しんぴ的な輝きはありませんのね。
re: Oh, that pendant you're carrying..... It looks much like Sara-sama's. But it doesn't have a mystic radiance like Sara-sama's pendant does.

eng: I wanna be the wind, Masa!
jap: グラン兄ちゃん ボク、風になりたいな……。
re: Gran nii-chan, I wanna become the wind......

eng: Oh, you will some day.
jap: ああ、なれるさ。 いつか、きっと、な……。
re: Yeah, you'll be able to. Some day, for sure......

eng: Big sister Doreen's at Enhasa again
jap: ドリーン姉ちゃん、またエンハーサに あそび行っちゃったね。
re: Doreen nee-chan went to play in Enharsa again.

eng: Yeah... That's 'cause she likes dreams.
jap: ああ……。 姉ちゃんは夢が好きだからな。
re: Yeah...... It's cause nee-chan likes dreams.

eng: I like the wind better! Whoosh!
jap: ボクは風の方がスキだな。 ぴゅぴゅ～ん！
re: I like the wind better. whooshwhoooosh!

eng: I wonder how ol' man Melchior is... Humans are so odd...
jap: どーしてるかな 命の賢者のじーさん……。 やってらんないよな。 まったく人間てのは……。
re: Wonder what he's doing, old man Philosopher of Life...... Hasn't been around lately...... Sheesh, humans......

eng: Could you... Scratch my back?
jap: ちょっと、せなか…… してくれる、こちょこちょ？
re: My back...... Scratch for a bit?

eng: Sure!
jap: こちょこちょ　しちゃう
re: Scratch

eng: Umm! Thanks! Uhh... You got it... Phew... Phew... Thank you! You discovered the Nu's scratch-point!
jap: わーい、やったー。 うん…… そこそこ……。 はうっ……！ ふーっ…… ありがと……。 ヌウの、こちょこちょポイントを 見きった！！
re: Yaay, yippie. Yeah...... There, there...... haooh......! Phew...... Thanks...... Discovered the Nu's scratch point!

eng: No way! ......
jap: イヤッ！
re: No way!

eng: How cruel!
jap: ……… ケチンボ……。

eng: Beings that are born of dreams, must return to them... The power of Lavos can make hopes and dreams come true...
jap: 夢より生まれ、夢に帰って行く……。 そんな生命もありますわ。 時には、人のいのりや望みが ラヴォス様の力をかりて 実体化してしまうことがあるのです。
re: Born of dreams, returning to dreams...... Beings such as that exist as well. At times, human prayers and desires borrow the power of Lavos-sama and materialize.

eng: Even Belthasar is gone, after designing the Blackbird and the Ocean Palace. How strange that the 3 Gurus who guide Zeal have all disappeared.
jap: 黒鳥号や海底神殿の設計をなされた 理の賢者ガッシュ様も 行方がわからないのだ。 王国ジールをみちびいてきた賢者様達が 三人そろって姿をかくしてしまわれるとは ……。
re: The whereabouts of the Philosopher of Reason Gasch-sama, who designed the Blackbird and Ocean Floor Palace, are also unknown. To think that the Philosophers who guided Zeal Kingdom would all three together disappear on us......

eng: They say that Gaspar, the Guru of Time, continues his work on some deserted island. He's making a «Chrono Trigger» or «Time Egg,» or something. But no one has seen him for ages.
jap: 時の賢者ハッシュ様は、どこかの小島で ひっそりと時間の研究を続けていると いわれます。 『時の卵』をつくられるとか……。 しかし、もう何年もその姿を見た者は ありません……。
re: It's said that the Philosopher of Time Hasch-sama is quietly continuing to research time on a small island somewhere. He's making a "Time Egg", or something...... However, it has been many years now since anyone has seen him......

eng: This leads to the hall of the Mammon Machine.
jap: ここ、まじんきの間へつづく……。
re: This leads to the Demon Machine's hall......

eng: The prophet's aura is full of hatred and sorrow. He'll destroy himself, and those he loves.
jap: あの予言者の気は、にくしみと悲しみに みちております……。 あのままでは、いずれ自らを ほろぼしてしまうことでしょう。 自分の愛するものさえ みちづれにして……。
re: That prophet's spirit is filled with hatred and sorrow...... At the rate he's going, he'll destroy himself eventually. Taking even what he loves along with him......

eng: Beyond is the hall of the Mammon Machine. The incredible energy of Lavos pervades it!
jap: この先は『魔神器』の間じゃ。 う～む、すごい気のみなぎりじゃな。 さすがラヴォス・エネルギー！
re: Beyond here is the hall of the “Demonic Vessel”. Hmm, it's brimming with incredible spirit. That's Lavos Energy for you!

eng: The Mammon Machine? You came to see it?
jap: あなた方も魔神器を 見にいらしたのですか？
re: Have you also come to see the Demonic Vessel?

eng: Yes.
jap: はい
re: Yes

eng: I thought so! Feel the flow of the mighty Lavos's power? Oh...I feel faint.
jap: やっぱり！ いだいなるラヴォス様の パワーのうねり、ビンビン来ますよね。 ああ、うるうる……。
re: I knew it! Waves of the great Lavos-sama's power are vibrating out. Aah, my eyes are clouding......

eng: No.
jap: いいえ
re: No

eng: Oh, but you MUST feel them! The last of the great Lavos's emanations!
jap: あら……。　ダメですよ、感じなきゃー。 ラヴォス様のバイブレーション。 ファイナル・うるうるですわ！
re: What......? No, you HAVE to feel them. Lavos-sama's vibrations The ultimate eye-clouder!

eng: THIS is the source of Zeal's strength. The Mammon Machine...it draws and magnifies the infinite power of Lavos.
jap: これこそが、ジールの力の源。 ラヴォス様の無限エネルギーを引き出し ぞうふくする『魔神器』です。
re: THIS is the source of Zeal's power. The "Demonic Vessel" draws out and amplifies Lavos-sama's infinite energy.

eng: Magic strong enough to control the extraction of energy, is needed to control the Mammon Machine.
jap: 魔神器をコントロールするには 引き出すエネルギーを制御できるだけの 強い魔力が必要となります。 三賢者様以外で、魔神器をあつかえるのは 今ではもうサラ様だけです。
re: To control the Demonic Vessel, you need strong enough magical power to be able to regulate the energy it draws out. Now, the only one outside of the Three Philosophers who can handle the Demonic Vessel is Sara-sama.

eng: The 3 Gurus made the Mammon Machine from the royal family's red rock. Melchior, who has studied much about Lavos, was in charge of the plans. But then he disappeared...
jap: 三賢者様が、王家に伝わる赤き石より この魔神器を生みだされたのです。 計画のリーダーの命の賢者様は ラヴォス様についていろいろと 研究されておりました。
re: The Three Philosophers brought forth this Demonic Vessel from the red stone passed down in the royal family. The Philosopher of Life, who was the leader of the project, researched various things concerning Lavos-sama.
RetranslatorComment: There's nothing here  about him disappearing. It sounds more like he did his research, and then  they came up with this device.

eng: Melchior, who opposed the Queen's plans, has vanished. You're not thinking what I am, are you?
jap: 三賢者の一人、命の賢者様は 女王の計画に反対なさってから 姿が見られなくなってしまった……。 まさかとは思うが……。
re: Ever since one of the Philosophers, the Philosopher of Life, opposed the queen's plans, he hasn't been seen...... You don't suppose that......

eng: When the Mammon Machine was finished, the Queen changed almost over night. Just between us, I heard that ANYONE who opposes her, and not just the Earthbound Ones, vanishes.
jap: 魔神器が完成してから 女王は別人の様に冷たくなられてしまった。 ここだけの話ですが、女王にさからえば 地の民だけでなく光の民も 情けようしゃなく 消されてしまうといううわさが……。
re: Since the Demonic Vessel was completed, the queen has become cold, like a different person. Just between you and me, rumor has it that not just the People of the Earth, but also the People of the Light are mercilessly eliminated if they oppose the Queen......

eng: If the Mammon Machine is moved to the Ocean Palace, we can extract even more energy from Lavos. The ultimate dream of eternal youth and life, is now possible! Oh, almighty Queen, our kingdom of Zeal will reign forever!
jap: 魔神器を海底神殿にうつせば ラヴォス様から、より強大なエネルギーを えることができる。 われら光の民の最後の望み 不老不死も夢ではない！ おお、いだいなる女王よ！ わがジール王国は永遠なのだ！！
re: If we move the Demonic Vessel to the Ocean Floor Palace, we can get more powerful energy from Lavos-sama. The final desire of we People of the Light, never aging nor dying, is no dream! Oh, great Queen! Our Zeal Kingdom is eternal!!

eng: The completion of the Ocean Palace will allow Zeal to last forever! And there will be no fear or sadness, just eternal peace.
jap: 海底神殿が完成すれば わがジール王国は、永遠の光に つつまれる……。 もうそこには、おそれも悲しみもない。 ただ終わることのない安らぎだけが 待っているのだ。
re: When we complete the Ocean Floor Temple, our Zeal Kingdom will be enveloped in eternal light...... There, no longer will there be either fear or sorrow. Just endless tranquility awaits us.

eng: The Queen's aide, Dalton, was in charge of the Ocean Palace, until some traveling prophet took over. He's in a bad mood so you should avoid him.
jap: 以前は女王の右腕、ダルトン様が 海底神殿の計画をしきっていたのだが 今では旅の予言者が計画を進めている。 しばらくは、ダルトン様の近くには よらないようにしないとな。 ありゃ、かなりあれてるぞ。
re: Previously, the Queen's right-hand man Dalton-sama entirely managed the Ocean Floor Temple project, but now, the traveling prophet is advancing the plans. You'll have to make sure not to get near Dalton-sama for a while. He's really ticked off.
RetranslatorComment: No indication that the  prophet took over, just that he's speeding things up where Dalton was used to  running everything.

eng: The Queen must have borne pain and sorrow in silence. No pain, no gain... Zeal, too, was born out of much sacrifice and work.
jap: 女王様は、きっと人に言えぬ苦しみ悲しみに お一人でたえてこられたのでは ないでしょうか？ 大きなものをえる時は、失うものも また大きいもの……。 そのおかげで今日のジールが あるわけですけれど……。
re: Surely the Queen has borne suffering and sorrow by herself that she can tell no one of, don't you think? When you gain something great, the loss too is great...... The Zeal of today exists thanks to that......

eng: This will take you to the bedroom.
jap: ここ、おやすみの間へつづく……。
re: This leads to the bedrooms……

eng: Schala's pendant was made from the same red rock as the Mammon Machine. When she chants, the pendant glows.
jap: サラ様のペンダントは 魔神器と同じ赤き石から 作られたのだそうです。 サラ様がペンダントを手にして 魔神器にいのると、不思議な輝きを はなつそうですよ。
re: They say Sara-sama's pendant was made from the same red stone as the Demonic Vessel. I've heard that when Sara-sama takes the pendant in hand and prays to the Demonic Vessel, it gives off a mysterious radiance.

eng: Schala!!
jap: 「姉上！
re: 'Ane-ue!

eng: Oh, you're back Janus! Is something wrong?
jap: 「あら、お帰りなさい。 どうかしたの、ジャキ？
re: 'Oh, welcome back. Is something wrong, Jyaki?

eng: The black wind...
jap: 黒い風が……。
re: The black wind......

eng: You feel it too? Don't worry, it'll be alright.
jap: 感じるのね、ふきつな気を……？ だいじょうぶよ、心配いらないわ。
re: You feel it, the ominous spirit......? It's going to be fine, you don't need to worry.

eng: Now, hold onto this.
jap: さ、これを持っていなさい。
re: Here, take this.

eng: What is it?
jap: これ……？

eng: It's a kind of amulet. If something should happen, it'll protect you. I wish I could be with you always... But mother has other plans.
jap: お守りよ。 もしもの時ジャキを守ってくれるよう 私のいのりがこめられているわ。 いつでも私がそばにいて あげられたらいいのだけれど……。 でも母様の計画が……。
re: It's a charm. My prayers are held in it to protect you, just in case. I wish that I could always stay by your side...... But mother's plans......
RetranslatorComment: Prayer note was removed.

eng: She's NOT our mother! She looks like mother, but inside she [ has changed.
jap: あんなヤツ、母様じゃない！ 姿形は母様だけど 中身は別のモノだ……。
re: That bitch isn't our mother! The appearance is mother's, but she's something different on the inside......

eng: ...... Still I can't... Janus, I'm sorry.
jap: ………。 それでも私には……。 ゴメンなさい、ジャキ……。
re: ....... And yet, for me...... I'm sorry, Jyaki......

eng: Excuse me, Highness. The Queen asks for your immediate presence at the Ocean Palace.
jap: しつれいいたします、サラ様。 女王様がお呼びです。 しきゅう海底神殿の方におりて いただきたいとのことです。
re: Please excuse me, Sara-sama. The Queen calls. She would like to have you descend to the Ocean Floor Temple immediately.

eng: All right.
jap: ……わかりました。
re: ......understood.

eng: Well, Janus... I'll be going.
jap: それじゃ、ジャキ…… 行ってくるわね……。
re: Well then, Jyaki...... I'll be back later......

eng: Oh! Who might you be?
jap: あら……。 あなた達は……？

eng: Miss Schala, please hurry. If you're late, I'll be punished!
jap: サラ様、おいそぎください。 おくれると私が女王様に……。
re: Sara-sama, please hurry. If we are late, then the Queen will......
RetranslatorComment: Vague unspecified bad consequences for the servant.

eng: Oh yes, I'm sorry.
jap: ええ。　ごめんなさいね。
re: Yes. I'm sorry.

eng: ...... Go away.
jap: ………。 むこう、行きなよ。

eng: Don't waste your time. Alfador only likes me.
jap: ムダさ。 アルファドは、僕にしかなつかない。
re: It's useless. Alphard won't get attached to anyone but me.
RetranslatorComment: I've finally done some  checking on the name, and it seems to be Alphard, the brightest star in the  constellation Hydra. The name comes from Arabic and translates to “solitary  one”. Appropriate.

eng: The Earth is alive, and it has changed over the aeons. From flat lands into mountains... From mountains into oceans... You may find THE WAY... That is, if you could pass aeons of time at the forbidden palace, or the Sun Keep.
jap: よいかな、大地は生きておる。 長い時間をかけてゆっくり動き…… 平地は山に……、山は海に……。 今は誰も近づけぬ、北の封印宮や 太陽神殿ですら、何千何万もの年をへれば 道がみつかるようになるのかも知れぬな。
re: Listen well, the earth is alive. Over long periods of time, it gradually moves...... Plains to mountains...... mountains to oceans...... After many thousands, tens of thousands of years pass, ways may be found to places where none can now approach, such as the sealed northern shrine and the Sun Temple.

eng: This connects to the Queen's hall.
jap: ここ、じょおうの間へつづく……。
re: This leads to the Queen's hall……

eng: To open the door from outside, an item like Schala's pendant is needed to break the seal.
jap: この封印の扉は外からは開きません。 サラ様のペンダントのような 術をやぶる強力なカギでもないかぎり。
re: This sealed door will not open from outside. Not as long as you don't have a powerful key to break arts, such as Sara-sama's pendant.

eng: No one may enter while the Queen is away at the Ocean Palace. Y...your pendant!! It looks just like Schala's! I heard that when Schala communes with the Mammon Machine, her pendant starts to glow.
jap: 女王が海底神殿におりられるとかで……。 その間ここは誰ひとり通ることは 出来ませんよ。 あら、そのペンダントは……？ サラ様のものと、そっくりですね。 サラ様が魔神器にいのると、 ペンダントが不思議な輝きを はなつと聞きましたが……。
re: The Queen has descended to the Ocean Floor Temple...... During that period, none can enter here. Oh, that pendant......? It looks just like Sara-sama's. I have heard that whenever Sara-sama prays to the Demonic Vessel, her pendant emits a mysterious radiance......

eng: Hmm... Just as we thought, it won't budge.
jap: あれー？ やっぱり開かないねー。
re: Huh? It really won't open.

eng: Strange. How come?
jap: 不思議。なんでだ？
re: Mysterious. Why?

eng: This door has a strong defense mechanism.
jap: 強力な防御システムの 扉デスネ。
re: It IS a door with a powerful defense system.

eng: Hmm... There's something to this pendant.
jap: う～ん……。 やっぱり、そのペンダントに なにかあるんじゃないのかしら……。
re: Hmmm...... I wonder if there isn't something about that pendant after all......

eng: 'Tis a mere DOOR that keeps us bound, hand, foot...and tongue!
jap: チキショー、たかが こんな扉ひとつに、手も足も ベロも出ないとは……。
re: Dammit, to think we can't do a thing against a mere single door like this......
RetranslatorComment: *When Frog notes that he can't do anything about the sealed door, he uses the Japanese expression 手も足も出ない (te mo ashi mo denai), referring to a complete inability to do anything about a situation. Frog throws ベロ (BERO), tongue, in with 手 (te), hand, and 足 (ashi), foot, because he's a frog.

eng: That pendant... It looks like Schala's. When she chants to the Mammon Machine, the pendant glows... As if they were in union.
jap: おや、そのペンダントは……？ サラ様のものと似ていますね。 サラ様が魔神器にいのると、 あのペンダントは不思議な輝きを はなつのですよ。 まるで魔神器と、ひみつのことばを かわしているかのようです。
re: Oh, that pendant......? It looks just like Sara-sama's. When she prays to the Demonic Vessel, that pendant gives off a mysterious radiance. It's just as though it's exchanging secret words with the Demonic Vessel.

eng: That glow...?! That's the pendant the Gurus made for Schala!! How did you get it?
jap: おお、その輝きは……！？ まさしく賢者様達が サラ様のためにと作られたもの！！ どうしてあなた方が……！？
re: Oh, that radiance......!? That is without a doubt what the Philosophers made for Sara-sama!! How did you......!?

eng: That glow...?! That's the pendant the Gurus made for Schala!! How did you get it?
jap: おお、その輝きは……！？ まさしく賢者様達が サラ様のためにと作られたもの！！ どうしてあなた方が……！？
re: Oh, that radiance......!? That is without a doubt what the Philosophers made for Sara-sama!! How did you......!?

eng: Yea, we did it!
jap: わーい、開いた、開いた！
re: Yaaay, it opened, it opened!

eng: Heh, heh... Even a door of this caliber can't keep science at bay!
jap: フッフッフッ……。 このていどのシールドなんかじゃ サイエンスの前進はとめられないわよ！
re: Hu, hu, hu...... You can't halt the advance of science with the likes of this caliber of shield!

eng: There is no doubt. Marle's pendant is made of the «Guru's Rock.»
jap: まさに『賢者の石』デスネ。 マールのペンダントは。
re: It IS surely the "Philosopher's Stone". Marle's pendant.

eng: What doth challenge us now?
jap: さーて、おにが出るか じゃが出るか？
re: Now then, will an ogre appear, or will a snake appear?
RetranslatorComment: *In the English translation, Frog asks "what doth challenge us now" after the door opens. In the original, he asked, "will an ogre appear, or will a snake appear?" Frog's line is a saying that basically means there's no telling what comes next. And, frogs don't get along with snakes.

eng: Ayla go! No fear, Crono!
jap: エイラ　行く！ ガンガン　行くぞ　クロ！！
re: Ayla go! Go full power, Crono!!
RetranslatorComment: ガンガン (gan gan) is a high-energy kind of “noise”.

eng: That glow...!? Is that Schala's pendant?
jap: まあ、その輝きは……！ サラ様のペンダントですか？
re: Oh my, that radiance......! Is that Sara-sama's pendant?

eng: Oh! So it's you!
jap: ほう、お前達か……。
re: Oh, you guys......?

eng: Who are you!? How did you get in here?
jap: 何者だ、お前達！？ どうやって、ここに入った？
re: Who are you!? How did you get in here?

eng: Your majesty... They are the evildoers I warned you of.
jap: 女王…… その者どもこそ、私のけいこくした わざわいをなす者達です……。
re: Queen...... THESE people are those I warned you of who will bring about catastrophe......

eng: How DARE you think you could oppose me, you...foreigners! You're worse than the Gurus!
jap: 何！？　異国の者よ。 お前達も賢者ども同様 このジールにたてつくと言うか！？
re: What!? Foreigners. Do you too mean to oppose me, Zeal, as the Philosophers did!?

eng: Fools! Dalton, take them away!
jap: たわけた連中めが！ ダルトン、そやつらをとらえろ！
re: Foolish lot! Dalton, seize them!

eng: Yes ma'am! By your leave...
jap: はッ！ こころえまして……。
re: Yes, ma'am! Certainly......

eng: Golem!
jap: ゴーレム！
re: Golem!

eng: My poor Golem! That was inexcusable!
jap: 俺様のゴーレムを……！ 許せんな、きさまら！
re: My golem......! I can't forgive you, you bastards!

eng: Mwa, ha, ha... Fear not! You won't die...immediately, that is! But by the time we're through with you, you'll be begging us to end your suffering. What a delicious diversion!
jap: フフフ……。 安心しろ、すぐには殺さぬわ……。 そしてきょうふを味わわせてやる。 わらわの計画にさからった事を たっぷりとこうかいするがいい。 フフフ……。 アーッハッハッ……！
re: Hu, hu, hu...... Relax, I won't kill you right away...... and terror. May you thoroughly regret opposing my plans. Hu, hu, hu...... Ah, ha, ha......!

eng: Hmph! Idiots... What will you do, Schala?
jap: フン、バカなヤツら……。 姉上、どうするつもり？
re: Hmph, idiots...... Ane-ue, what are you intending to do?

eng: Let us rescue them.
jap: この方達をお助けしましょう。
re: I shall assist these people.

eng: I think it's useless. Besides, if they escape, you'll be in trouble.
jap: ムダだと思うけどな……。 それに、こいつらを逃がしたりしたら 姉上が……。
re: I think it's pointless, though...... Besides, if you do something like letting them escape, you'll......

eng: Don't worry about me. They just might be able to rescue the Gurus.
jap: だいじょうぶよ、私は……。 それに、この人達なら 賢者様を助けだしてくれるかも しれない……。
re: It's all right, I...... Besides, these people might help the Philosophers......

eng: Schala...
jap: 姉上……。
re: Ane-ue......

eng: Are you all right? Quickly, escape from the palace! And if you can, please rescue Melchior!
jap: だいじょうぶですか？ さあ、いそいで宮殿から そして、出来ることなら 命の賢者様をお助けして いただきたいのです……。
re: Are you all right? Now, please hurry and escape from the palace. And then, if it is something you can do, I would like to have you save the Philosopher of Life......

eng: He was sent to the Mountain of Woe for opposing the Queen. Please! You have to help him!
jap: 命の賢者様は、計画に反対したため なげきの山にゆうへいされて…… お願いです、どうか賢者様を……
re: The Philosopher of Life was imprisoned on Grief Mountain for opposing the plans...... Please, the Philosopher......

eng: I'm afraid I can't allow that...
jap: 「そうはさせぬ……。
re: 'I won't let you do so......

eng: Your meddling tires me. You'll...just have to disappear!
jap: これ以上、お前達に 私のジャマはさせぬ……。 ここいらで消えてもらうとしよう。
re: I won't let you hinder me any further...... I'll have you disappear right here.

eng: You mustn't!
jap: いけません！
re: You must not!

eng: Stop!
jap: やめろッ！
re: Stop!

eng: Okay...I'll spare them. But in return, you WILL cooperate, Schala!
jap: ……フッ。 助けてやる。 そのかわり、あなたには 力をかしてもらうぞ。 サラ……。
re: ......hm. In exchange, I will have you assist me. Sara......

eng: Now, show me how you came here.
jap: さあ、お前達がどうやって この時代へ来られたのか 教えてもらおうか……
re: Now, can I get you to tell me how you all were brought to this era......?

eng: Hmm...so you came in through here.
jap: ほう、こんな所から……。
re: Oh? From such a place......

eng: Now Schala! After I throw them in, I want you to seal the portal shut.
jap: さあ、サラ……。 こいつらをその中に放りこんだら そこに結界をはるのだ。
re: Now, Sara...... When I throw them into that, erect a barrier there.

eng: N, no! You can't make me!
jap: い、いやです！
re: N, no!

eng: Obey me! Their lives are at stake!
jap: 私の言う通りにしなければ その者達の命はない……。
re: If you do not do as I say, these people's lives are forfeit......

eng: I...oh, all right...
jap: ……わかりました。
re: ....understood.

eng: Please forgive me...
jap: ごめんなさい。
re: I'm sorry.

eng: Break the Seal!
jap: とけよ封印　呼べよ嵐
re: Release the Seal, Call Forth a Storm
RetranslatorComment: “forth” added for stylistic  reasons

eng: Why did the Prophet let us go?
jap: あの予言者、なぜ私達を 殺さなかったのかしら……。
re: That prophet, I wonder why he didn't kill us......?

eng: The Prophet could have just done away with us.
jap: あの予言者、私達を殺そうと 思えば殺せたはずなのに……。
re: That prophet, if he meant to kill us, he should have been able to, yet......

eng: Why would the Prophet spare us?
jap: ナゼ、ワタシ達を消さなかった のデショウカ？
re: WHY did he not eliminate US?

eng: 'Tis true, he hath spared us. But something is amiss.
jap: あの予言者、命だけは助けて くれたが……、どうもクサイぜ。
re: That prophet let us off with our lives...... but I smell a rat.

eng: The key to defeating Lavos must exist in that period.
jap: けどラヴォスを倒す手が あの時代には、ありそうね。
re: But it seems like the means to beat Lavos are going to be in that era.

eng: The key to defeating Lavos must exist in that era.
jap: シカシ、ラヴォスのあの力を 利用している時代デス。 倒す方法も、あの時代に……。
re: HOWEVER, it IS an era that uses that power of Lavos. A way to defeat it, also in that era......

eng: Where hast Magus gone? I shan't allow him to get away.
jap: それにしても、魔王の ヤツは一体どうしちまったんだ。 この手でカタをつけない事には。
re: Anyway, what the hell happened to that bastard Magus? It's a question I just can't settle.

eng: They take energy from Lavos. Lavos not get weak?
jap: あいつら　ラヴォスの力 吸い取ってた。 吸い取られたら　ラヴォス　弱って ないか？
re: They were sucking out Lavos's power. If being sucked out of, Lavos weakened, right?

eng: But we can't get back to that time. What can we do?
jap: でも、もうあの時代には 戻れないよ。　どーする？
re: But we can't return to that era any more. What'll we do?

eng: But the Gate to that time has been sealed. Is there another way back?
jap: けど、あの時代のゲートは 封じられちゃったのよ。 何かいい方法は……。
re: But that era's Gate was sealed off. Some good method......

eng: But the Gate has been shut.
jap: シカシ、ゲートはふさがれて しまいマシタ。
re: HOWEVER, the Gate has BEEN shut.

eng: Yet Schala hast sealed the Gate. 'Tis not possible to returneth.
jap: けど、あのサラって娘が 封印してんだろ？ 戻れやしないぜ……。
re: But that Sara girl sealed it, right? We can't return......

eng: Door gone. No can return.
jap: でも　エイラ達　もう あそこ　行けない。
re: But Aylas no can go there any more.

eng: Wait a minute. I've seen the design on the doors this pendant opens, somewhere else...
jap: そういえば、このペンダントで 開くドアの紋章、あの時代以外で 見た気が……。
re: Come to think of it, the crest on the door that opens with this pendant, I feel like I've seen it outside of that era......

eng: The crest on those sealed doors... We've seen it elsewhere, haven't we?!
jap: ！！　ペンダントで開く ドアの紋章、どっかで見なかったっけ？
re: !! The crest on the door that opens with the pendant, haven't we seen it somewhere?

eng: Wait. The crest on the doors that the pendant opens... I have seen them in my own time!
jap: ペンダントで開けたドアの紋章 デスガ、ワタシの時代でも、いくつか ありマシタ！
re: About the crest on the door that we opened with the pendant, there WERE several in MY era as well!

eng: Thou hast seen elsewhere the crest on the doors that the pendant opens, correct?
jap: そういえば、このペンダントで 開いた紋章のついた扉… お前達、あれをどこかの時代で見たと 言っていなかったか？
re: Come to think of it, the crested door that opened with the pendant...... Didn't you say you saw them in some era?

eng: Let's check it out, Crono!
jap: 行ってみよう、クロノ！
re: Let's try going, Crono!

eng: We may yet find our way back to that era! Let's get cracking, Crono!
jap: あの時代に行くための 手がかりが、つかめるかも！ 行くわよ、クロノ！
re: We might be able to get a hold of a clue to go to that era! We're going, Crono!

eng: Let us return to my time!
jap: 行ってみマショウ。 ワタシの時代へ！
re: LET US try going. To MY era!

eng: 'Tis time to depart, eh, Crono?!
jap: 行ってみるしか手はないな。 クロノ？
re: Guess there's no means but to try going. Crono?

eng: Aha! So you've been to the Land of Magic... Now that the pillar of light is sealed, you'll be needing something that will transport you through time. I recall someone working on such a device. The Wings of Time, I believe he called it. I'm afraid he became a tad psychotic spending so much of his time doing research.
jap: ほう、お前さん達、あの魔法の国を 見てきたか……。 光のはしらが封じられては 時をじゆうに行き来できる翼が 必要じゃな。 時をわたる翼…… そんなものを研究していた男もおった。 研究にぼっとうするあまり、ちと正気を うしなってしまったみたいじゃが……
re: Oh? So you saw that land of magic before you came...... As the pillar of light has been sealed, you need wings that can freely come and go through time. Wings that Cross Time...... There was even a man researching such a thing. Though I'm afraid he's lost a bit of his sanity, immersing himself too much in his research......

eng: Need you not a swordsman?! Yes. No.
jap: 剣が立つヤツがいなきゃ 始まらねえだろ。 はい いいえ
re: Nothing's going anywhere if you don't have a guy who's good with a sword, right? Yes No

eng: OK, let's get going!
jap: よっしゃ、行くとするか！
re: All right, let's go!

eng: Mine blade and skill may rust...
jap: 腕がなまっちまうぜ。
re: My skill will dull.

eng: Ayla go. Big yawn here! Yes. No.
jap: エイラ　行く。 ここ　たいくつ！ はい いいえ
re: Ayla go. Boring here! Yes No

eng: Ayla fight for world!
jap: 今までの分も、エイラ あばれる！
re: Ayla go so wild it make up for up to now!
RetranslatorComment: In other words, she'll cause so much havoc it makes up for all the sitting around doing nothing.

eng: Take Ayla,  [crononick]!
jap: エイラ連れてけ　クロ！
re: Take Ayla, [cro]!

eng: Take Ayla, [member1]!
jap: エイラ連れてけ [pc1]！
re: Take Ayla, [pc1]!

eng: Got a Power Ring!
jap: パワーリングを手に入れた！
re: Got a Power Ring!

eng: Got a Speed Tab!
jap: スピードカプセルを手に入れた！
re: Got a Speed Capsule!

eng: I've been worried, Princess! I understand your pain. But the king really only cares about his realm... Yes, even when your mother, Queen Aliza passed away, he worked all day!
jap: 心配しましたぞ、マールディア様！ よくわかりますぞ。 国王は何よりも国を大事になさるお方。 なくなられた時も……
re: We've been worried, Marledia-sama! Marledia-sama. The King is a man who places his kingdom above all else. passed away......

eng: No one could do that! It's inhuman!
jap: 母様が！？
re: Mother!?

eng: Oh, child, it's ancient history now...
jap: いやいや、何でもありませぬ。
re: No, no, it's nothing.

eng: Tell me more!
jap: 話してよ！
re: Tell me!

eng: This may be difficult... Well, Queen Aliza's condition suddenly changed for the worst. She desperately wanted to see the king one last time, but he couldn't find the time to drop by...
jap: もうしあげにくいのですが…… もともと病弱だったアリーチェ様の よう態が急変した時です。 最後に一目国王にお会いしたいと おっしゃっていたアリーチェ様ですが 国王はなんと……
re: It is difficult to say this, but...... It was when Ariche-sama's condition, which had been sickly to begin with, took a sudden turn. Ariche-sama said that she wished to see the King one last time, but the King......

eng: Said he had some work to do... But knowing nothing about death, you waited faithfully by your mother's side...
jap: 国のしごとでおいそがしいとはいえ アリーチェ様のもとに来ず…… おさないマールディア様が 死という事もわからぬまま見守る中……
re: Even if he WAS busy doing work for the country, not coming to Ariche-sama...... As a young Marledia-sama watched over her, not knowing about death......

eng: Aliza passed away in sorrow... It's as if the king indirectly killed her... Such a shame...
jap: アリーチェ様は、おなくなりに なられたのですじゃ……。 いやはや、あれでは国王が アリーチェ様を殺したも同然……
re: Ariche-sama passed away...... Dear me, that makes it sound almost like the King killed Ariche-sama......

eng: WHAT...!! Father KILLED? ...MY MOTHER...?!!
jap: ……！！ 父上が……母様を……
re: ......!! Father did that...... to mother......

eng: But what do I know! There are reasons for everything, right dear?
jap: おやおや、私とした事が！ お気にしませぬようにマールディア様！
re: Oh dear, what have I done!? Don't worry yourself over it, Marledia-sama!

eng: Now...so glad to see you back again. Please go and visit the king.
jap: さ！　せっかく戻られたのです。 国王のもとへお立ち寄り下され。
re: Now! You've gone to all the trouble to come back. Please do pay the King a visit.

eng: It's locked.
jap: カギがかかっている。
re: It's locked.

eng: Since it IS our 1000th Anniversary, The King has, for the time being, ordered probation for Crono.
jap: めでたき千年祭でもある事だし クロノはとりあえず、しっこうゆうよに しておけとの王のご命令だ。
re: As it is the joyous Millennial Festival, the King has ordered a suspended sentence for Crono for the time being.

eng: The King awaits the return of his daughter.
jap: かんどうしたとは言いつつも 王は帰りを待っておられる。
re: Though he says he disowned her, the King is awaiting her return.

eng: Due to the King's orders, the court is adjourned.
jap: 裁判所は王の命によりふうさ中だ。
re: The courtroom is currently closed by the King's order.

eng: We're about to begin celebrating, but with the King like that...
jap: 建国千年パーティをとり行う予定だが 王があれでは……
re: We have plans to hold the National Founding Party, but with the King like that......

eng: Due to the King's orders, the court is adjourned.
jap: 王の命により、刑務所も今はふうさ中だ。
re: By the King's order, the prison is also currently closed.
RetranslatorComment: Prison, not courtroom.

eng: Getting ready for the Millennial Fair.
jap: 千年祭のしゅくがパーティのじゅんび中だ。
re: We're preparing the Millennial Festival celebration party.

eng: What? You want to be put on trial again or something?
jap: どうした？また裁判にかけられたいか？
re: What's wrong? Want to be put on trial again?

eng: The chef's ancestor had a cook-off with Magus's troops.
jap: コック長の先祖は料理で魔王軍との 戦いにこうけんしたらしい。
re: I hear the Head Cook's ancestor contributed to the war against Magus's army with cooking.

eng: Hey!! Leave it! Oh, dear! I didn't recognize you, Princess Nadia!
jap: 「コラーッ！！ 「手を出すんじゃない！ 「これはマールディア様。 しつれいしました！
re: 'HEY!! 'Hands to yourself! 'Oh, Marledia-sama. Excuse me!

eng: Hey, don't come in here without permission!
jap: ちゅうぼうに勝手に入ってくんじゃないよ！
re: Don't come in the kitchen without asking!

eng: Hey, sorry 'bout that. The old lady's handlin' the kitchen. Gotta tread softly around here! The gist of this is that she can cook...but she can yell, too.
jap: いや、すみませんな。 このキッチンは、にょうぼうが しきってるんですよ。 にょうぼう・イン・ちゅうぼう！ なんてね…… 料理の腕はピカ一だが気性があらくって…… 何でも血すじらしいんですがね。
re: Oh, I'm sorry. My wife does everything in this kitchen. Wife In Kitchen! Something like that...... Her cooking skills are top-notch, but she's got a rough disposition...... I hear it runs in the family.
RetranslatorComment: Weak wordplay. Wife =  nyoubou, kitchen = chuubou. English adaptation is probably appropriate, maybe  something like... bitchin' in the kitchen...?

eng: I'm in charge of the Princess' education!
jap: ワシャ姫様の教育たんとうじゃ！
re: I'm responsible for the Princess's education!

eng: I'm in charge of her physical education!
jap: や！　ぼかあ姫様の体育たんとうだ！ ガルディア体育大出のバリバリの スポーツマンさ！
re: Hey! I'm in charge of the Princess's athletics! The great active sportsman of Guardia's athletics!

eng: I'm in charge of discipline. And she's missed almost every lesson this year!
jap: 私は姫君のしつけたんとう。 今回のけんは、私がいたらなかったばかりに ……
re: I'm responsible for the princess's discipline. The current incident is due to my inadequacy......

eng: Mr. Pierre awaits downstairs.
jap: ピエールさんが下でお待ちです。
re: Pierre-san awaits you below.

eng: The Chancellor lost it right around the time he ordered that Dragon Tank to be built!
jap: ドラゴンせんしゃを作るよう命じたり…… あのころから大臣殿は変わってしまった。
re: Giving orders to make the Dragon Tank...... The Chancellor's been different since about that time.

eng: The Chancellor hired all those soldiers that work in the jail.
jap: 刑務所にいた兵達は大臣殿の口聞きで 城に来た者達だ。
re: The soldiers that were in the prison all entered the castle on the Chancellor's orders.

eng: Those jail guardians were an odd bunch. We got cold stares from them. It's like they weren't even human!
jap: 刑務所の兵達はどうにも いけすかなかった。 時々、俺達を冷たい目で見やがった。 まるで人間じゃない目つきでな。
re: The prison soldiers were really disturbing. Sometimes they'd stare at us with cold eyes. With looks as though they weren't human.

eng: I heard the Chancellor really gave it to the King in court.
jap: 裁判で王様をたきつけたのも おそらく大臣殿……
re: It was probably the Chancellor who stirred up the King at the trial too......
RetranslatorComment: This sounds like he's talking about Crono's trial.

eng: I'm your lawyer, Pierre. The King has been so gloomy since Princess Nadia's disappearance... Listening to my story, he has concluded that it was NOT a kidnapping... It's taken time, but I think he understands. Still, the Chancellor's acting weird. He may give us some trouble...
jap: ベンゴシのピエールです。 マールディア様が城を出られてから 国王はすっかりふさぎこんでしまい…… 私の話も聞いて下さり、王女ゆうかいの 罪はなかった事と…… 時間はかかりましたが、ようやっと 使命をはたせました。 それにしても大臣殿の様子がおかしい。 我々はそのけんにかんして話し合って いるんです。
re: I'm the lawyer Pierre. The King has been thoroughly dejected ever since Marledia-sama left the castle...... He has also listened to what I had to say, that there was no crime of abducting the princess...... It took time, but I have finally carried out my mission. Even so, the Chancellor seems funny. We are talking things over as regards this matter.

eng: Only the Chancellor thought Crono was guilty.
jap: 大臣殿だけは、クロノ有罪を最後まで 決めこんでいました。
re: Only the Chancellor took Crono's guilt for granted to the end.

eng: Without Princess Nadia, this castle's dead.
jap: マールディア様がいないと、この城も 火が消えたようだ。
re: When Marledia-sama isn't here, it's as though the flame has gone out in this castle.

eng: I, too, hope Princess Nadia returns.
jap: 私もマールディア様が、城にもどる事を 願っています。
re: I also wish for Marledia-sama's return to the castle.

eng: Princess Nadia's a dead ringer for her mother. That's why the King's so strict with her.
jap: マールディア様は、母君のアリーチェ様に 生きうつしだ。　だからこそ王もきびしく されてしまうのだろう。
re: Marledia-sama is like a living copy of her mother Ariche-sama. That's probably exactly why the King is so hard on her.
RetranslatorComment: Hard on her, strict with  her, whichever. I think the first sounds better, but that's just me.

eng: The King is deeply concerned about Princess Nadia.
jap: 王はマールディア様の事でだいぶ おなやみのご様子。
re: The King appears to worry quite a bit about Marledia-sama.

eng: But being a King, he keeps it all locked up inside.
jap: 一国の王ともなれば、そうだん出来る者も ありますまい。
re: But, as he is the country's king, it is unlikely that there is anyone he can talk it over with.

eng: After his wife's death, he only lived for Princess Nadia.
jap: 王はアリーチェ様がなくなられてから マールディア様だけを大事にされて いたのですよ。
re: Ever since Ariche-sama passed away, the King has valued only Marledia-sama.

eng: Urgh...! You'll see, you'll be put on ice!
jap: うぬぬ…… きさま、かならずや処刑してやる！
re: Unnngh...... I'll make sure to execute you, damn you!

eng: It's you! Where's Princess Nadia? Tell her to return to the castle, please.
jap: おお、お前は……！ マールディアはどこにいるのだ？ 城にもどるよう、お前からも 言ってくれぬか？
re: Oh, you're......! Where's Marledia? Could you, as well, tell her to return to the castle?

eng: Come, Princess Nadia...
jap: さ、マールディア様……
re: Come on, Marledia-sama......

eng: Oh! Nadia...
jap: おお、マールディア……
re: Oh, Marledia......

eng: W, what do you want! I'm not giving in to your demands!
jap: な、何しにもどった！ この私に用などないはずだ！
re: Wh, what did you come back for!? You shouldn't have any business with me!

eng: It's your fault for leaving the castle! And letting these...hoodlums in here. You might as well beg for bread on the street corner!
jap: 何だその目は！ お前が勝手に城を飛び出すからだぞ！ そうかと思えば、そんなキテレツな チンドン屋でもはじめるつもりか！
re: What's with that look! You rushed out of the castle on your own! And, come to think of it, brining such a bizarre Are you trying to start a circus or something?!
RetranslatorComment: Not actually circus.  He's referring to an over-the-top form of public advertising involving flashy  outfits and various instruments. You could probably compare it to having a  guy in a hot dog suit to advertise a new diner.

eng: Stop it! They're my friends!
jap: 何て事言うの！　私の友達に！
re: How can you say that! To my friends!

eng: They're a disgrace to this family!
jap: その様な者が友達とは ガルディア王家のご先祖様に もうしわけが立たぬわ！
re: People like that as friends, I could never justify that to the Guardia royal family ancestors!
RetranslatorComment: You mean the ones who  call them friends and consider Crono and Frog heroes? Yay for irony!

eng: Father, you, you...
jap: 父上は私よりも……
re: More precious than me......

eng: You care more about your country than me...or mother!!
jap: 私や母様よりも大事なのね！ このガルディア王国が！！
re: It's more precious than me OR mother to you! This Guardia Kingdom!!

eng: What...?
You, ...you killed mother!
jap: 母様を殺したのは父上よ！
re: You're the one who killed mother!

eng: Get... OUT OF HERE this instant!!! I never want to see your face again!
jap: 出て行け！ 二度と私の前に姿をあらわすでない！
re: Get OUT! Never show yourself in front of me again!

eng: Good riddance!
jap: いわれなくったって 来ないわ！
re: I wouldn't come even if you hadn't said so!

eng: We're no longer family! Do as you wish!!
jap: お前とは親でも子でもない！ 勝手にするがいい！！
re: I consider us neither parent nor child any more! Do as you please!!
RetranslatorComment: This needed some tweaking. Literally it's closer to: with you, neither parent nor child

eng: Oh, woe is me...
jap: おお、何という事でしょう……
re: Oh, how terrible......

eng: All right, forget it! Beat it, you guys!!
jap: ええい、もういい！ お前達も消えるがいい！！
re: Argh, enough already! All of you, get out of my sight too!!

eng: ...... I've got nothing to say!
jap: ……。 今さらこの私に用などないはずだ！
re: ...... You shouldn't have any business with me now!

eng: Why not give the King a present? He's been known to love jerky...
jap: そうですな、王のお好きな物でも 持ってプレゼントしてはいかがです？ 王は最近、ハイパーほしにくに 目がなくておいでです。
re: Oh yes, how about bringing something the King likes as a present? The King has developed a fondness for Hyper Dried Meat recently.

eng: Jerky? Seems one of his ancestors first made it, but I don't know the recipe.
jap: ハイパーほしにく？ ああ、遠い祖先が作ったらしいけど あたいはレシピがわかんないねえ。 今じゃパレポリの名物になってるよ。
re: Hyper Dried Meat? Oh right, I hear a distant ancestor made it, but I don't know the recipe. It's Parepoley's specialty now.
RetranslatorComment: Hey, useful information!

eng: Yo! What? You want some Jerky? Sorry, I'm out of the ingredients right now. Besides, it's a tad spicy for most people.
jap: おう！ 何？　ハイパーほしにく？ あいにくと、ざいりょうがな…… だいいち、なみの人間にはキョーレツ すぎっぞ。
re: Heya! What? Hyper Dried Meat? Sorry, but the ingredients...... And it's too intense for the average person in the first place.

eng: Oh, my... That Crono, he'll be strung up!
jap: うぬぬ…… クロノのヤツ、かならずや 処刑してやる！
re: Unnngh...... I'll make sure to execute that damn Crono!

eng: W, what's that?
jap: そ、それは？
re: Wh, what's that?

eng: Your... favorite.
jap: 父上の……好物だよ。
re: Father...... your favorite.

eng: ...... For me?
jap: …… お前が私に？
re: ...... You're giving me this?

eng: Let's see...
jap: どれ……
re: Let's see......

eng: What is it, sir?!
jap: ど、どうされました！？
re: Wh, what is wrong!?

eng: What...!!
jap: はうう……！！
re: Hauggkk......!!

eng: How dare you...?! Giving me something this rich when you KNOW I have high cholesterol...!
jap: うう…… 私の血あつが高い事を知っていながら こんなゲキカラな物を……！
re: Oohh...... Giving me something so extremely spicy, when you know I have high blood pressure......!

eng: But...it's your favorite!
jap: え！？　それ大好物じゃ……
re: Huh!? Isn't that your favorite......?

eng: This is the last straw! Now I know how you REALLY feel!
jap: 今度という今度は、カンベンならん！ お前が私をここまでキライなのが よくわかった！
re: This time, I will not tolerate this! Now I know quite well that you hate me this much!

eng: Father, NO...!
jap: ちがうよ、父上……
re: That's not it, father......

eng: Leave! NOW!!!! Never show your face here again!!
jap: どこへでも行け！ 二度と姿を見せるな！！
re: Go, I don't care where! Never show yourself again!!

eng: Father!!
jap: 父上！！
re: Father!!

eng: The King does not wish to see anybody.
jap: 王は誰にも会いたくないとの事です。
re: The King does not wish to see anyone.

eng: If you must know, he's been bedridden since then. He's emotionally drained.
jap: あれ以来、王はねこまれてしまって…… お体よりも、気持ちがふさぎこんで おられるようです。
re: The King has been bedridden ever since that...... It seems it's more emotional dejection than his body.

eng: It's sealed with a mysterious energy...
jap: 不思議な力で封印されている……。
re: It's sealed with a mysterious power......

eng: Huh? There's something else in here. Wh...what in the world...!
jap: ん？ 奥の方に、まだ何かある…… な、なんと！
re: Hmm? There's something else further in...... Wh, whoa!

eng: Sealed by a mysterious force… [Bangor/Arris/Trann Dome, 2300 A.D.]
jap: 不思議な力で封印されている……。
re: It's sealed with a mysterious power......

eng: A curious crest is engraved here. Some unknown power keeps it sealed. The pendant shimmers...! The pendant begins to glow…
jap: ふしぎな紋章がきざまれている。 何かの力によって封印されているようだ。 ペンダントが輝き出す……！ ペンダントが輝き出す……！
re: A mysterious crest is engraved. It seems to be sealed by some sort of power. The pendant starts shining......! The pendant starts shining......!

eng: Hey! It's those people again!
jap: あ！　お兄ちゃん達！
re: Ah! Bro, it's you guys!
RetranslatorComment: literally 'big brother and other(s)', used if Crono is in the  group

eng: Hey! It's them!
jap: あ！　お姉ちゃん達！
re: Ah! Sis, it's you guys!
RetranslatorComment: literally 'big sister and  other(s)', used if Marle or Lucca is in the group but Crono isn't

eng: Daddy's on a trip.
jap: お父さん、遠くにいるんだって。
re: I heard dad's far away.

eng: But I haven't given up. This child, and this seed are still growing.
jap: 私もあきらめませんわ。 この子も、あのめも育ってるんですもの。
re: I won't give up either. I'm raising both this child and that sprout.

eng: Wonder what kind of fruit this is going to bear?
jap: どんな実がなるんだろうな。
re: Wonder what kind of fruit it's gonna be?

eng: Since you've come, we've gained the courage to live.
jap: あんたらが来てから、みんな生きようという 力がわいて来たみたいだ。 これが『元気』ってヤツか？
re: Ever since you guys came, it seems like everyone's strength to live on is boiling up. Is this that "healthy" thing?

eng: Hey fellas! Look! The seed's sprouted!
jap: おお、お前さん達！　見てくれ！ あの種子がめを出したんじゃ！
re: Oh, it's you guys! Look! Those seeds have sprouted!

eng: So, there are people in Arris Dome, too!
jap: やっぱアリスドームにも人がいたのか！
re: So there really were people in Arris Dome!

eng: This edible?...
jap: コレ食えるのか……？
re: Can we eat this......?

eng: Wheeze...pant... Finally got through the ruins. I brought the sapling that sprang from the seed! Amazing what you can do when you think you're gonna expire...
jap: ハアハア…… 何とか廃墟をぬけて、あの種子から出た めを持って来たんだ。 死ぬ気になれば何とかなるもんだな……。
re: haa, haa...... I somehow made it through the ruins and brought a sprout budded from those seeds. Things work out somehow when you're worried about dying......

eng: What's this? A plant? What's that?
jap: 何だコレは？ ショクブツ？　何だそれは？
re: What's this? A plant? What's that?

eng: Never seen anything like this...
jap: こんな物見るの、はじめて……。
re: First time I've seen anything like this thing......

eng: The professor's programming was, in a sense, his own eulogy. Soon, I, too, will be able to sleep forever. But first... There is one thing I must do. ...... ...... ...... Program error... ...my memory banks have failed...
jap: ワタシニ　オコナワレタ サイゴノ　プログラムハ　ハカセ ジシンノ　マイソウ　デシタ。 コレデ　ワタシハ　エイキュウニ ハカセト　オナジ　ジカンヲ スゴスコトガ　デキルノデス。 アレ…… モウヒトツ　ヤラナケレバ　ナラ ナイコトガ　アッタヨウナ…… ザセキヲ…… …… …… …… ワスレマシタ。
re: THE FINAL PROGRAM CARRIED OUT BY ME WAS THE BURIAL OF THE WISE ONE HIMSELF. NOW I CAN ETERNALLY PASS THROUGH THE SAME TIME AS THE WISE ONE. HUH......? IT FEELS AS THOUGH THERE WAS ONE MORE THING THAT I MUST DO...... SEATS...... ...... ...... ...... I FORGOT.

eng: Huh...?

To those who opened the door... I am Belthasar, the Guru of Reason. I once lived in the kingdom of Zeal. A great disaster in Zeal somehow threw me into this era. To my surprise, Lavos exists here, and, I suspect, in other periods as well. Aeons ago, Lavos descended from the heavens. Burrowing deep into the the world's core, he began to consume our planet's energy, and grow stronger. Lavos disappeared briefly when he was summoned away by a mighty wizard who lived in Guardia, in the year 600. In 1999, Lavos claims this area, and reigns from high atop Death Peak. Lavos continues to replicate...... like a giant parasite, he is consuming our world. Forced to live here, I continued to conduct research on Lavos. But I am growing old. And it's impossible to keep sane in such trying times. So before I lose it completely, I shall safeguard my data, and my ultimate creation... How I long to return home... But I have grown frail... So you...YOU, who have opened the door! I leave things in your hands. Only by mastering time, itself, do you stand a chance against Lavos. The odds will be against you... But you are true heros. The world is in your hands. Open, now, the last door, and take what you find there. My last invention... My «Wings of Time» ...
jap: 「扉を開けた者達へ…… 私は、理の賢者、ガッシュ。 魔法王国ジールの、ガッシュ。 私はジールの大災害のおり この時代へ、とばされた……。 おどろいた事に ラヴォスが現われるのは 私の時代だけではなかった……。 はるか太古の時代に、空より落下し ジールに出現し、地中深くひそみ この地球のエネルギーを吸いながら 成長を続けた……。 時は、ガルディア王国暦600年 魔王が呼び出し、一時その姿を現わす。 王国暦1999年 ついに地表をもそのテリトリーにする。 そして、まるで卵を生むかのように 私が死の山と名付けた場所から 自らの分身を次々とたんじょう させるのだ。 ラヴォスとは、星自体に巣くう 巨大な寄生虫なのだ。 私は、ここでラヴォスの監視と研究 を続けて来た。 だが、すでに限界じゃ。 こんな時代に正常な精神をたもつのは 不可能なのかもしれぬ……。 私の精神が死をむかえる前に この記録を残しておく事にする。 私の生がい最後の発明と共に……。 私は自分の時代になんとか帰ろうと 研究を続けた。 しかし、この研究が完成するころには 私自身、じゅ命を感じていた。 だから、たくすのだ。 ここを開く者に。 時間を行き来出来れば…… 時代を超えて人間が、この星そのものの ために一つになれば…… あのラヴォスをどうにか出来るかも 知れぬ……。 可能性はゼロに等しい……。 しかしゼロでない限り、かけてみる。 この扉を開く者に、この地球のすべて をかけて……。 さあ、開けるがいい、最後の扉を。 そして手に入れるのだ。 私の最後の発明…… 時をわたる翼を……。
re: To those who opened the door...... I am the Philosopher of Reason, Gasch. Gasch, of the Magic Kingdom Zeal. I was flung to this age at the time of Zeal's great disaster...... To my surprise, Lavos's appearance was not just in my era...... It fell from the sky in a distant ancient era, appeared in Zeal, lay dormant deep underground, and continued to grow while sucking up this earth's energy...... The time is Kingdom Year 600. Magus summons it, and it briefly appears. Kingdom Year 1999 It at last makes the surface its territory too. And then, just as if laying eggs, it gives birth to its own offshoots, one after another, from the place I named Death Mountain. Lavos is an enormous parasite that nests in the planet itself. I have continued the observation and study of Lavos here. But I'm already at my limits. Maintaining a normal mind in an era like this may be impossible...... I have decided to leave behind this record before my spirit accepts death. Together with the final invention of my life...... I continued researching so as to somehow return to my own era. However, by the time that research was complete, I was feeling my own lifespan. That is why I entrust it. To those who open this place. If you can come and go through time...... If, crossing time, humans can become one for the sake of this planet itself...... Perhaps they can do something about that Lavos...... The probability is equivalent to zero...... However, as long as it's not zero, I'll try taking the chance. I'll wager everything of this earth on those who open this door...... Now, the last door, open it. And then, take it. My last invention...... The Wings that Cross Time......
RetranslatorComment: offshoots = 'bunshin',  one of those words that doesn't translate well. Sort of, but not exactly,  'clone'. While in the NA version  Belthasar simply states that he longs for Zeal in his pre-Epoch speech, in  the Japanese version he directly states that he was building the Epoch  precisely to take him home. Sadly, he died before he could accomplish this.

eng: Wow...this is amazing... How do you tell the front from the back?
jap: すごい……、これが…… でも、どっちが前なのかしら……？
re: This is...... awesome...... But I wonder which side's the front......?

eng: This must be the invention Belthasar spoke of.
jap: これが、理の賢者ガッシュの 最後の発明……。
re: This the the Philosopher of Reason Gasch's last invention......

eng: The Wings of Time... I believe I have heard of this device.
jap: コレが、先ほどの記録に あった時をわたる翼……。
re: THIS is the Wings that Cross Time, that was in the record earlier......
RetranslatorComment: “This is” and not “these are”, here and elsewhere, because it's the name for a single device.

eng: This...moves through time?
jap: こ、こいつが時をわたる翼！
re: Th, this is the Wings that Cross Time!

eng: !! What this thing?

Scared you, didn't I? It's me......BELTHASAR I copied my memory into this thing. What do you think? Anyway, there's something I need to explain. Namely, how to transcend time! Press the Y Button for the time gauge. Then use the L&R Buttons to select an era.
jap: おどろいたようだな。 私だよ……。 そう、ガッシュだ。 この物体に、私の頭脳をコピーしてお いたのだ。 この物体、気に入ってくれたかな？ 君達に説明をしておかなければなら ないことがある。 それは、他の時代への行き方じゃ。 緑色のボタンで、タイムゲージが 現われる。 LRで行きたい時代をえらぶと よいじゃろう。
re: You seem surprised. It's me...... That's right, Gasch. I copied my brain into this object. Are you pleased with this object, I wonder? There is something that I must explain to you. That is, how to go to another era. The time gauge appears with the green button. Choose the era you want to go to with L and R.
RetranslatorComment: Notice the suddenly normal speech.

eng: Oh, yeah! Before you go, why don't you...
jap: あっ！　そうだ！ 出発の前に、このタイムマシンに……
re: Ah! That's right! Before leaving, give this time machine......

eng: ...name my time machine!
jap: タイムマシンに、名前をつけて みてはどうかな。
re: Why not try giving the time machine a name?

eng: Hop aboard! No dozing off, now!
jap: さあ、乗った乗った！ 「ねるなーっ！
re: Go on, get in, get in! Don't fall asleep!

eng: I will now deliver a message from the professor.
jap: ハカセカラノ　メッセージヲ オツタエシマス。
re: NOW CONVEYING A MESSAGE FROM THE WISE ONE.

eng: Instructions for the time machine are as follows. The Y Button displays the time gauge. Use the L & R Buttons and Control Pad to select a destination in time. Press the A Button to board and get off the device, and to warp through time. End Professor's message.
jap: タイムマシン シヨウジョウ　ノチュウイ。 ミドリボタン タイムゲージヲダス。 LRキー　/　ジュウジキー　サユウ タイムゲージノ　イキサキヲ　エラブ。 アカボタン ノル　オリル　タイムワープ。 イジョウ ハカセカラノ　メッセージヲ シュウリョウシマス。
re: ADVICE FOR TIME MACHINE USAGE. GREEN BUTTON BRING UP THE TIME GAUGE L AND R KEYS / CROSS KEYS LEFT AND RIGHT SELECT TIME GAUGE DESTINATION. RED BUTTON RIDE, GET OFF, TIME WARP THAT IS ALL. CONCLUDING THE MESSAGE FROM THE WISE ONE.

eng: Enter name of time machine.
jap: タイムマシンノ　ナマエヲ ニュウリョク　シマス。
re: INPUTTING THE TIME MACHINE'S NAME.

eng: Mumble, mumble? Take off. Get off.
jap: ムニャ　ムニャ？ 作動 おりる
re: Mumble mumble? Operate it Get off

eng: Awesome!
jap: ス、スッゴーい！
re: Aweeesooome!

eng: Traveling at warp speed!
jap: 次元空間をこんなスピードで！
re: Dimensional space, at such speed!

eng: Even in my time, we did not have such devices!
jap: ワタシの時代の文明でも 時空間の乗り物などは なかったというのに……！
re: Even though there was no such thing as a vehicle that travels timespace even in MY era......!

eng: Whoa!
jap: ひええ～ッ！
re: hyeeeiih!

eng: It great! It fast!!!
jap: こいつ　すごい！ こいつ　強い！！！
re: This awesome! This strong!!!

eng: Epoch's capable of THIS?!
jap: 「こ、これがシルバードの力！？
re: 'Th, this is the Sylbird's power!?

eng: We're outta here!
jap: 行っけえーッ！
re: Go—!

eng: Let's go, Epoch!
jap: 出番よ、シルバード！
re: It's your turn, Sylbird!

eng: Forward, Epoch!
jap: シルバード発進シマス！
re: Sylbird takING off!

eng: Hi ho, Epoch!!
jap: ハイヨー！　シルバード！！
re: Hi ho! Sylbird!!
RetranslatorComment: The Lone Ranger reference works better with the original name

eng: Epoch, GO!
jap: シルバード！　行く！！
re: Sylbird! We go!!

eng: We're off.
jap: 行くぞ……。
re: Here we go......
RetranslatorComment: Once he's in the party, that is.

eng: Interesting. So he actually finished the Wings of Time. In fact, gave his life for it! Why not put that device to good use? Take it to the ancient Land of Magic!
jap: そうか、あの男、完成させたのか 時をわたる翼を…… その命とひきかえに……。 その翼で今一度行ってみてはどうかな？ そのいにしえの魔法の国にな。
re: I see, so that man completed it. The Wings that Cross Time...... In exchange for his life...... Why don't you try going on those Wings now? To that ancient land of magic.

eng: Full speed ahead! Disembark
jap: 作動 おりる
re: Operate Get out

eng: Let's go!
jap: 行っけえーッ！
re: Go!!!
RetranslatorComment: Command form, and elongated for emphasis or (more likely) excitement. Romanized, it would normally be 'ike', but she's saying it like 'i (abrupt cutoff, dramatic pause) keeee!' Basically, she's putting an obscene amount of energy into it.

eng: Time for action, Epoch!
jap: 出番よ、シルバード！
re: It's your turn, Sylbird!

eng: Epoch ready for takeoff!
jap: シルバード発進シマス！
re: Sylbird IS departing!

eng: High ho, Epoch!!
jap: ハイヨー！　シルバード！！
re: Heigh-ho, Sylbird!!
RetranslatorComment: blatant Lone Ranger reference

eng: Epoch! Go!!
jap: シルバード！　行く！！
re: Sylbird! We go!!

eng: Forward... Board the Epoch?
jap: 行くぞ……。 シルバードに乗りますか？
re: Here we go...... Board the Sylbird?

eng: Yes.
jap: はい
re: Yes

eng: No.
jap: いいえ
re: No

eng: The power is sealed...
jap: 力は封印されている……。
re: The power is sealed......

eng: This is Algetty, the village of the Earthbound Ones.
jap: ここはアルゲティ。地の民の村だ。
re: This is Algetty, village of the People of the Earth.

eng: Many inhabitants of this land were taken to build the Ocean Palace, and were never seen again.
jap: ここに住む地の民の多くが 海底神殿けんせつのために連行され ニ度と帰ってきませんでした……
re: Many of the People of the Earth who lived here were hauled off for construction on the Ocean Floor Temple and never again returned......

eng: Wanna buy something? Yes. No.
jap: 何か買ってくかい？ はい いいえ
re: Buy something? Yes No

eng: We Earthbound Ones lack magical powers. That's why we were banished from Zeal.
jap: 我ら地の民は、魔力を持たないがために 天空の王国ジールを追放されたのだ。
re: We People of the Earth were banished from Zeal, the kingdom in the heavens, because we don't have magical powers.

eng: The Queen put the Mammon Machine in the Ocean Palace to absorb Lavos's energy. Is that safe? She locked the Guru of Life up on the Mountain of Woe for opposing her. The situation's hopeless.
jap: 女王は海底神殿に魔神器を設置して ラヴォスからさらなるエネルギーを 取り出そうとしているが 果たして、だいじょうぶなのだろうか？ 危険だと反対した命の賢者様は なげきの山にゆうへいされてしまった。 我らではもう、どうする事も出来ない……。
re: The Queen intends to set up the Demonic Vessel in the Ocean Floor Palace and extract yet more more energy from Lavos, but is that really going to be okay? I'm afraid that the Philosopher of Life, who opposed it as dangerous, was imprisoned on Grief Mountain. There's nothing we can do any more......

eng: The Guru of Life said that Sir Janus has stronger powers than even Miss Schala! Janus must be using her and the Queen to get to Lavos...
jap: 賢者様から聞いたのじゃが ジャキ様はサラ様をもこえる すごい魔力をひめているらしい。 しかし、女王をくるわせ、サラ様を 苦しめるその力をきらい、心ごと…… その力を閉ざしてしまっているのじゃ。
re: I heard from the Philosophers that Jyaki-sama hides an incredible magical power that surpasses even Sara-sama. However, he hates that power, which drives the Queen mad and torments Sara-sama, and along with his heart...... he has shut that power away.
RetranslatorComment: Big difference. Janus  searching for Lavos didn't make much sense. This means Janus was reluctant to  use the magic that drove the wild and unchecked ambitions of Zeal.

eng: Long ago, the Enlightened Ones and the Earthbound Ones lived as one.
jap: かつては、光の民も地の民も ともにくらしていた一つの種族だったのよ。
re: Once, both the People of the Light and the People of the Earth were one people that lived together.

eng: Now, only the 3 Gurus and Miss Schala treat us as equals.
jap: 三賢者様達とサラ様くらいですよ。 われらを同等にあつかってくださるのは。
re: It's just about only the Three Philosophers and Sara-sama who deign to treat us as equals.

eng: I wonder when Miss Schala's gonna come and play with us?
jap: サラ様、今度はいつあそびに きてくれるのでちゅかね～？
re: Wonder when Sara-sama's gonna come play with us again?

eng: The Beast's nest is dangerous. Better stay away, okay?
jap: ドロクイの巣は、とってもキケンでちゅ。 行かないほうがいいでちゅ。
re: The Mud-Eater nest's real dangerous. You'd better not go.

eng: Spend the night? Yes. No.
jap: とまって行くかい？ はい いいえ
re: Stay over? Yes No

eng: Our Hero, the Guru of Life, rejected the Queen's plan, so he was banished to the Mountain of Woe.
jap: 命の賢者様は、女王の計画に反対したため なげきの山に閉じ込められてしまいました。
re: The Philosopher of Life was imprisoned on Grief Mountain because he opposed the Queen's plans.

eng: This hole leads to the Beast's nest. Through the nest you'll reach the place of chains, which anchors the Mountain of Woe.
jap: このアナは、ドロクイの巣に続いている。 ドロクイの巣はなげきの山を大地につなぐ くさりの所まで通じているはずだ。
re: This hole continues into the Mud-Eater nest. The Mud-Eater nest should lead to where the chain that ties Grief Mountain to the earth is.

eng: You can't pass through here! The Guru on Mt.Woe
jap: ここから先は、と～さないもんね～！ なげきの山の賢者様
re: I won't let you pass through here! The Philosopher on Grief Mountain

eng: The Guru of Life's trapped in here.
jap: ここに命の賢者が 閉じ込められているのね……。
re: The Philosopher of Life is being imprisoned here......

eng: The Guru of Life's trapped in here.
jap: ここに命の賢者が 閉じ込められているのね……。
re: The Philosopher of Life is being imprisoned here......

eng: Here we will find the Guru of Life!
jap: ココデスネ。命の賢者が ユウヘイされているのは。
re: It IS HERE. The place where the Philosopher of Life is being CONFINEd.

eng: Ah, 'tis where the Guru of Life remains imprisoned.
jap: ここか……、命の賢者が 閉じ込められてるってのは……。
re: So it's here...... the place where the Philosopher of Life's being imprisoned...…

eng: This big cage?
jap: これ　デッカい　オリか？
re: This is huge cage?
