re: Grateful to Ioka. Took us in when village gone.

eng: I peek inside trader shop. New item there!
jap: 交換屋　のぞいた。 新しい　防具　出来た。
re: Peeked in trade hut. New armor made.

eng: Found strange rock! But feel icky when touch, so throw away.
jap: ヘンな石　見つけた！ 持ってると　気持ち悪かった…… すぐ　すてた。
re: Found weird rock! Felt sick when have...... Threw away soon.

eng: Ayla quit chief. Kino now chief.
jap: エイラ　酋長　やめた。 今　キーノ　酋長。
re: Ayla quit chief. Now Kino chief.

eng: Bright fire, Lavos, fall. Get cold now.
jap: おおきな火　ラヴォス。 あれ　落ちてきた。 さむくなった……
re: Big fire Lavos. It fell. Got cold......

eng: No more Sweet Water. Never happen before.
jap: 元気の水　取れなくなった。 こんな事　はじめて。
re: No can get healthy water no more. First time this happen.

eng: Less monster, now cold. Less animal too.
jap: さむくなった　モンスター　へった。 動物も　へった。
re: Got cold, less monsters. Less animals too.

eng: Made armor from many rubies. 10 each of «Petal,» «Fang,» «Horn,» and «Feather» for trade. You want trade?
jap: ルビー　いっぱい　かためて よろい　作った。 『はなびら』『きば』『つの』『はね』 10コづつ　あわせて40コと交換。 オマエ　交換　するか？
re: Hardened much ruby, made armor. “Flower Petal”, “Fang”, “Horn”, “Feather”, 10 each, 40 total, trade. You trade?

eng: Yes
jap: はい
re: Yes

eng: You want more?
jap: オマエ　まだ　ほしいか？
re: You still want?

eng: Yes
jap: はい
re: Yes

eng: You got a Ruby Armor!
jap: ルビーアーマーを手に入れた！
re: Got a Ruby Armor!

eng: No
jap: いいえ
re: No

eng: No
jap: いいえ
re: No

eng: Caution. The Time Axis is out of order.
jap: コノサキ　キケン ジカンジクガ　ミダレテイマス。
re: DANGER BEYOND HERE. THE TEMPORAL AXES ARE DISORDERED.

eng: Hey, where's that healthy kid with the radical haircut?
jap: おや、あの元気のいい お兄ちゃんは、どうしたね？
re: Huh, what happened to that energetic boy?

eng: ... This is terrible news... I have nothing to give you but this song. It's called ... «Memories of Crono»
jap: …… そうか……。 大した事は出来んが、このきょくを おくらせてもらうよ。 だいして…… 『クロノ・リメンバー』……。
re: ...... I see...... I can't do much of anything, but I'll let this tune play for you. I call it...... "Crono Remember"......

eng: I wish I could lend a hand...
jap: 私にできる事があれば、力になって あげたいのだが……
re: I'd like to help you if there's anything I can do, but......

eng: We're looking for the Guru of Time...
jap: 時の賢者を探してるの……。
re: We're looking for the Philosopher of Time......

eng: Only the Guru of Time can help us now...
jap: 時の賢者にしか出来ぬ事が あるのだ……。
re: There is something none but the Philosopher of Time can do......

eng: Ayla need Guru of Time. Search now!
jap: エイラ達　時の賢者 あいたい。　探してる！
re: Aylas want meet Philosopher of Time. Searching!

eng: We are looking for the Guru of Time...
jap: 時の賢者という方を 探しているのデスガ……
re: We ARE searching for the one known as the Philosopher of Time, but......

eng: Hey, where have you been?
jap: おや、あんた、どっかで……
re: Oh, you, where have I......?

eng: So that's your story... And just LOOK at you now... You've become quite formidable!
jap: そうか……。 りっぱになったな。 ずいぶんとヒネてはいるがな。
re: So that's it...… You've gotten imposing. Aged quite a bit, though.

eng: Heh?...
The Guru of Time, eh...? Heard of him, of course, but what do you want with him?
jap: 時の賢者か……。 はてさて、聞いた事がある気もするが その時の賢者に何用だね？
re: The Philosopher of Time......? Well yes, I feel as though I've heard of him, but what did you want with the Philosopher of Time?

eng: He knows how to bring Crono back...
jap: クロノを生き返らせる 方法を知っているらしいの……。
re: We've heard he knows a way to make Crono come back to life......

eng: We've heard he might be the one to bring our Crono back...
jap: なんでも、クロノを 生き返らせる事が出来るって話だが あまり信用は出来ん話だな。
re: It's said he can make Crono come back to life somehow, though I can't put much faith in the story.
RetranslatorComment: Hardly surprising that he's dubious, considering who they heard it from.

eng: He bring Crono back to life! He strong.
jap: そいつ　クロ　生き返らせる 出来る　いう。
re: Is said he can make Cro come back life.

eng: We believe he knows how to bring Crono back to life.
jap: その人に会えば、クロノを 生き返らせる方法がわかるらしいのよ。
re: We've heard that we can find out a way to make Crono come back to life if we see him.

eng: To bring back lost loved ones... It's what everyone wants... Crono must be proud... ...to have friends like you...
jap: 死んだ者を生き返らせる…… 今まで何人の人が、望んだ事だろうね。 しあわせですな。 クロノさんは……。 こんなにも思ってくれる人達が いる……。
re: Make the dead return to life...... How many now have wished that? He is fortunate. Crono-san...... He has people who think of him so......

eng: Here. Take this with you.
jap: これを持って行きなさい。
re: Take this with you.

eng: Egg! Ayla hungry, want eat!
jap: これ　卵！ エイラ　食って　いいか？
re: This egg! Okay if Ayla eat?

eng: What be this? Me thinks...an egg?
jap: 何だい、こりゃ？ 何かの卵か？
re: What's this? Some kind of egg?

eng: This is... an egg of some sort?
jap: コレは……、卵デスカ？
re: THIS IS...... an egg?

eng: An egg? Is it hardboiled or 3-minute?
jap: 何これ、卵？
re: What's this, an egg?

eng: Let us call that the Chrono Trigger. It is pure potential. By unleashing a specific course of events, it can have a powerful effect on time. Ask the one who made the Epoch, your Wings of Time, how to hatch it... Like any egg, it represents a possibility... It may or may not...hatch. But the Chrono Trigger gives you the potential to get your friend back... The egg will have an effect equal to the effort you put into your search. No more, and no less. Don't forget that. As long as you keep Crono in your heart, the day you are dreaming of shall arrive...
jap: それは、クロノ・トリガー……。 時の卵だ。　その卵をかえす方法は あの時の翼を作った男に聞きな……。 ただし、うまくいくとはかぎらない。 だが結果のために行動するわけじゃ あるまい？ 行動するから結果がついて来る……。 そのはずじゃ。 そいつをわすれん事じゃな。 お前さん達のクロノを思う気持ちが あれば、あるいは……。
re: That is the Chrono Trigger...... An egg of time. Ask that man who built the Wings that Cross Time how to hatch that egg...... However, it will not necessarily go well. But will you not act for the sake of results? The results will follow because you act...... It ought to be so. Don't forget that. If you have feelings for Crono, possibly......

eng: I get it...it's you, isn't it...?
jap: そうか、お前か……。
re: I see, so it's you......

eng: Wait a sec... Are YOU Gaspar, the Guru of Time?
jap: じゃあ…… もしかして、あなたが 時の賢者……　ハッシュ？
re: Then...... Would you by any chance be the Philosopher of Time...... Hasch?

eng: It's you, isn't it?!... You're Gaspar, the Guru of Time!
jap: じゃ……！ あなたが時の賢者……　ハッシュ！？
re: Then......! You're the Philosopher of Time...... Hasch!?

eng: This can only mean... ...you are the Guru of Time... Mr. Gaspar, I presume?!
jap: という事は…… アナタが時の賢者…… ハッシュサンデスカ！？
re: That means...... Are YOU the Philosopher of Time...... Hasch-SAN!?

eng: Wh...what? So...... Thee art Gaspar, the Guru of Time!
jap: ヘ！？ ってこたあ…… あんたが時の賢者…… ハッシュかい！？
re: Wha!? That means...... You're the Philosopher of Time...... Hasch!?

eng: Um...well... ...I believe that's what they used to call me... ...ages ago...
jap: フフ……。 そう言われた事もある様な気も するよ……。 そう、はるか昔……な。
re: Hu, hu...... I also feel as though I've been called that...... Yes, long ago......

eng: Crono! Let's go get Crono!
jap: クロノを！ クロノをむかえに行こうよ！
re: Crono! Let's go get Crono!

eng: ... He was a pain, but now that he's gone... Now don't go getting any stupid ideas! He was like a brother to me!
jap: ……。 世話のかかるヤツだったけど いなくなってみると…… カ、カン違いしないでよ。 あいつは弟みたいなモンなんだから！ ……。
re: ...... He was troublesome, but when you see what it's like when he's not here...... D, don't get the wrong idea. It's like he's my little brother, all right! ......

eng: Without Crono, everyone is depressed...
jap: クロノがいないと ミナサン、おとなしいデスネ……。
re: When Crono is not here, EVERYONE IS quiet......

eng: That fool... No one that young is supposed to leave this mortal coil...
jap: あのバカ…… 死ぬなら年のじゅんだ……。
re: That idiot...... If you're going to die, do it order of age......

eng: Crono strong! Not gone yet! Ayla find Crono!!
jap: クロ　強い！ クロ　死んだ　ウソ！！ エイラ　クロ　探す！！！
re: Cro strong! It lie that Cro dead!! Ayla search for Cro!!!

eng: Doesn't matter if HE's here or not. My attention is focused elsewhere...
jap: あいつがいようが いまいが、どうでもいい……。 ヤツさえ倒せればな。
re: I don't care either way whether he's here or not...... Just as long as I can beat IT.

eng: All right! Sweetheart! Unfortunately, you were born before magic existed! But you seem to have other skills that will get you by.
jap: こ、こりゃセクシーな ネーちゃん！ けど、ネーちゃん、魔法のあった時代 以前の生まれだな。 ダイナマイツだが、魔法ムリ。
re: Th, this's one sexy babe! But, babe, you were born before an era that had magic. You're dynamite, but magic's a no-go.

eng: Ayla can't use magic!
jap: エイラは魔法を使えない！
re: Ayla can't use magic!

eng: ...Phew...!! You hauled in a marlin here, kids! He can use «Shadow»... And he could probably teach me a thing or two!
jap: ……！！ こ、こいつはまた どエラいヤツ連れて来た！ たぐいまれな『冥』の力……！ オレ、こいつにおしえる事ない。
re: ......!! Th, this guy you've brought's really something else! The incredibly rare "Dark" power......! I've got nothing to teach him.

eng: Hey? That punk rocker hasn't been coming around, lately.
jap: ん？　あのツンツン頭 最近来ないな。
re: Hm? That pointy-head hasn't come by lately.

eng: Going my way? Yes. No.
jap: 私の力が必要だろう……？ はい いいえ
re: You need my power, right......? Yes No

eng: Now we've got a winning team!
jap: 足手まといになるようなら 殺すぞ……。
re: If it seems as though you're going to hinder me, I'll kill you......
RetranslatorComment: Friendly, isn't he?

eng: The weak always strive to be weaker...
jap: フン、弱い者ほど強がる……。
re: Hmph, weaker they are, tougher they act......

eng: Where's spike head? I only ride with him.
jap: アイツトデナケリャ、勝負ハシネエゾ。
re: NO Match IF IT'S NOT WITH HIM.

eng: A, are you one of Crono's friends?
jap: あら、あなたもクロノのお友達？
re: Oh my, are you one of Crono's friends too?

eng: Another quiet one?! Don't be shy, dear!
jap: 無口な人ね……。 はずかしがりやさんなのかしら？
re: A quiet person...... I wonder if you're shy?

eng: What a beautiful day! The Black Omen sure sparkles in the sun! What a great day for laundry!
jap: 今日もいい天気ね 黒の夢がお日様にてらされて ピカピカ光ってるわ。 いいせんたくびよりになりそうね。
re: Nice weather again today. The Black Dream is glittering, illuminated by the sun. Looks like it's going to be good laundry weather.

eng: The Black Omen which floats in the sky. ...made by neither the Mystics nor humans... What does it portend...?
jap: 空にうかぶ黒の夢。 魔族が作ったものでもなく ましてや人間が作ったものでもない。 あれは一体……？
re: The Black Dream that floats in the sky. It is not something the Demons made, much less something that humans made. What on earth......?

eng: Oh, the Black Omen, the Black Omen [note] [note] We will smile on the Black Omen [note] [note] Always [note]
jap: 今日も　おいのり　黒の夢[note]
re: We pray again today, Black Dream[note]

eng: On «Death Peak» you will find the power to restore life. But to activate this power, the deceased must be important to the space-time continuum. And you MUST have a clone identical to that person. Only then, can a Chrono Trigger work its magic...
jap: 『死の山』は、人を生き返らせ る力を持っておる。 ただし、その力を引き出すには 本当にその人が大切で 必要でなくてはならない存在である事。 それには、その人ソックリの人形が 必要じゃ。 ならば、卵はかえるじゃろう。
re: "Death Mountain" holds the power to make a person come back to life. However, in order to draw out that power, that person must be a truly important and necessary existence. Furthermore, a doll identical to that person is essential. In that case, the egg should hatch.

eng: Need a Clone? The magician, Nolstein Bekkler could whip one up in the wink of an eye. Bekkler loves festivals. Find a festival, and there, too, you shall find Bekkler!
jap: ドッペルの人形！ ノルシュテイン・ベッケラーという マジシャンさえいれば、すぐに作って しまうのにのう…… えっ、ベッケラーを知らないのか？ あいつは、お祭りが好きでのう、そこ に行けば会えるはずじゃが……。
re: A dopple-doll! If only the magician Norstein Bekkler were here, he'd make one in an instant...... Huh, you don't know Bekkler? He likes festivals, so if you go there, you should be able to meet him......

eng: It's not my lucky day.
jap: ドッペらない
re: Don't dopple
RetranslatorComment: The -ru ending on 'dopple' makes it look like a Japanese verb.

eng: Take the challenge!
jap: ドッペる
re: Dopple

eng: You're out of cash. Play longer, spend less!
jap: お金がたりないね。もうちょっとねばれば安くなるのにね
re: Not enough money. Would've been cheaper if you'd held out a bit longer.

eng: I'll take 60,000 G.
re: I'll take 60,000 G.

eng: I'll take 30,000 G.
re: I'll take 30,000 G.

eng: I'll take 10,000 G.
re: I'll take 10,000 G.

eng: I'll take 5,000 G.
jap: 5,000もらうよ。
re: I'll take 5,000 G.

eng: I'll take 2000 G.
jap: 2000もらうよ。
re: I'll take 2000 G.

eng: I'll take 1000 G.
jap: 1000もらうよ。
re: I'll take 1000 G.

eng: The Clone will be at Crono's house.
jap: このドッペル人形 クロノの家に送っておくよ。
re: I'll send this dopple-doll to Crono's house.

eng: Without the Clone, there's no point in going to «Death Peak!» Now, scram!
jap: ドッペル人形を持って来なければ 『死の山』へ行く意味はないぞ！ さあ、置いてある所に急ぐのじゃ！
re: If you don't bring the dopple-doll, there's no point in going to “Death Mountain”! Now, hurry to where it was left!

eng: Oh, hello! Is Crono okay?
jap: あら、いらっしゃい。 クロノは元気？
re: Ah, welcome. Is Crono well?

eng: Uh, he's ok. Fine actually.
jap: う、うん。 元気……、元気です。
re: Y, yeah. He's...... he's fine.

eng: Yeah... ... Just fine.
jap: え、ええ……。 ……。 元気に…… 元気にやっています……。
re: Y, yes...... ...... He's...... He's doing fine.

eng: Uh...aye! He be in fine health!
jap: あ……、は、はい！ 元気で…… 元気でやっております。
re: Uh...... y, yes! He...... He is doing fine.

eng: Madam... Crono is...quite well.
jap: ジナさん……。 クロノは…… エイラ「……。
re: Jina-san...... Crono is...... Ayla: ......

eng: ... Crono... okay.
jap: クロ……　元気……。

eng: I hope he's behaving. Tell him to be good, all right?
jap: そう、あんまり元気すぎて あなた達にめいわくかけなきゃ いいけど……。 クロノにも言っておいてね。 『あんまり、めいわく かけるんじゃないよ』って。
re: Yes, well I hope he's not being too energetic and causing you trouble...... Tell Crono too. "Don't cause too much trouble."

eng: ... Listen, um...
jap: ……。 ジナさん……。

eng: ... Um, listen, I...um, I mean...
jap: ……。 ジナおばさん……。
re: ...... Jina oba-san......

eng: ... Madam...
re: ...... Good lady......

eng: We'll just borrow this doll, okay?
jap: このクロノの人形 ちょっと、かりて行きますね！
re: We're going to borrow this Crono doll for a bit!

eng: We'd like to borrow this doll for a bit.
jap: おばさん……。 このクロノの人形 かりていきます。
re: Oba-san...... We're going to borrow this Crono doll.

eng: By thy leave, mayhap we taketh this doll?
jap: このクロノ人形…… しばし、おかし下さい……。
re: This Crono doll...... Please lend it to us for a short while......

eng: This, Crono's doll! Ayla borrow! Okay? Crono's Mom: Go right ahead, dear. You got the Clone! Crono's Mom: Stay out of trouble, now!
jap: コレ！　クロの人形！ エイラ　ちょっと　かりるぞ！ ジナ「ええ、どうぞ。 ドッペル人形を手に入れた。 ジナ「気をつけて、行ってらっしゃい。
re: This! Cro doll! Ayla borrow a bit! Jina: Sure, go ahead. Got Dopple-doll. Jina: Take care, I'll see you later.

eng: Enough. The time has come for you to attempt «Death Peak.» It's the only chance you have of reviving your friend. The last program I've implanted in this creature's memory banks will help you up the mountain. Stand back.
jap: うむ、よいじゃろう。 『死の山』がお前達を受け入れる時が 来たようじゃの。 大切な仲間を生き返らせる最後の チャンスじゃ。 私がこの物体に入力した、本当に最後の プログラムは、お前達をあの山へ みちびくサポートなのじゃ！ ちょっとさがってなさい。
re: Yes, it should be fine. It seems the time has come when "Death Mountain" will accept you. It's the last chance to make your precious companion come back to life. The truly final programs I input into this object are support to guide you to that mountain! Stand back a little.

eng: Executing program!
jap: プログラム　スイコウ　カイシ！
re: EXECUTING HIGHEST PROGRAM!

eng: The 3 entities you saw will help you climb «Death Peak.» This ends my message. Now I must ask you for a favor. This creature has executed its program. Please let him sleep. The switch is on his stomach.
jap: 今、旅だった3つの分身が お前達を『死の山』から、守ってくれる じゃろう。 わしからのメッセージは、これで全て じゃ。 最後にお願いしてもよいかな？ この物体のプログラムもこれで 終わりじゃ。 コイツを休ませてやってくれ。 電源スイッチは、おなかについている。
re: The three offshoots that just now departed should protect you from "Death Mountain". The message from me is now complete. Finally, may I make a request? With this, this object's program is also finished. Let it rest. The power switch is on the stomach.
RetranslatorComment: Here's 'bunshin' again. The most likely meaning here is that the dolls are parts of the programming that split off and act on their own.

eng: Switch the creature off? Yes. No.
jap: なぞの物体のスイッチを、押しますか？ 押す 押さない
re: Press the enigmatic object's switch? Yes No

eng: This creature sleeps beyond the flow of time.
jap: この物体には時間がながれていないようだ。
re: It seems that time does not flow for this object.

eng: Walk when the wind dies and hide behind trees when it blows.
jap: 風の弱いうちに前へ進み、強くなったら 木のかげにかくれろ。
re: Proceed forward while the wind is weak, and hide behind trees when it becomes strong.

eng: Be careful! It's slippery. Fall, and you'll have to start over.
jap: すべるから気をつけろ。 落ちたら戻されるぞ。
re: Be careful, it's slippery. If you fall, you'll be sent back.

eng: Push the shell... Climb the shell...
jap: ぬけがらを押せば…… ぬけがらをのぼれば……
re: If you push the husk...... If you climb the husk......

eng: So, this is the summit of Death Peak!
jap: ここが……死の山のいただき。
re: This is...... the summit of Death Mountain.

eng: All who fear the night and stand against the darkness... Please give us strength!
jap: お願い、私に力をかして。 夜にふるえる、すべてのおもいよ。 やみに立ち向かう、すべての生命……。
re: Please, lend me your power. All feelings that tremble in the night. All life that stands against the darkness......

eng: You who fear the night and fight the coming of darkness... Give us strength!
jap: 夜にふるえる すべてのおもいよ。 やみに立ち向かう、すべての生命……。 さあ、私に力をおかし！！
re: All feelings that tremble in the night. All life that stands against the darkness...... Now, lend your power to me!!

eng: You who fight the onslaught of night and darkness... Please lend us your power.
jap: お願いシマス。 私に力をかしてクダサイ。 夜にふるえる、すべてのオモイ。 やみに立ち向かう、すべてのセイメイ。
re: I requEST. PLEASE lend me your power. All FEELINGS that tremble in the night. All LIFE that stands against the darkness.

eng: We ask for your strength... Thee who fear'eth the night and stand 'gainst the darkness.
jap: 願わくば、我に力を…… 夜にふるえる、すべてのおもいよ。 やみに立ち向かう、すべての生命よ。
re: My wish is for your power upon me...... All feelings that tremble in the night. All life that stands against the darkness.

eng: Crono!
jap: クロノ！
re: Crono!

eng: Crono!
jap: クロノ！
re: Crono!

eng: Crono!
jap: クロノ！
re: Crono!

eng: Crono!
jap: クロ！
re: Cro!

eng: The pendant's reacting! It, it shattered!!
jap: ペンダントがきょうめいしている……。 く、くだけた……。
re: The pendant's resonating...... It, it shattered......

eng: But... We've come so far!
jap: そんな…… 何のためにここまで……。
re: No way...... What did we come this far for......?

eng: Please answer me! Don't leave me!!! Crono--!!
jap: 返事をして…… 私をおいて行かないで……。 クロノーーー！！
re: Answer me...... Don't leave me behind...... CRONOOOOO!!

eng: It can't be! What use was it to come so far?
jap: そんな…… 何のためにここまで……。
re: No way...... What did we come this far for......?

eng: Crono! Say something! Don't ignore us!
jap: クロノ！ 返事をしなさい！！ 私達を無視しないで！
re: Crono! Answer me!! Don't ignore us!

eng: 'Tis folly... To hath travelled so far.
jap: そんなバカな…… 何のためにここまでして……。
re: It can't be...... What did we come this far for......?

eng: Crono! Giveth an answer!
jap: クロノ！ 返事をするんだ！
re: Crono! Answer me!

eng: That can't be it! We've worked so hard.
jap: そんな…… 何のためにここまでシテ……。
re: Impossible...... For what purpose did we come this far......?

eng: Crono! Please answer us!
jap: クロノ！ 返事を！
re: Crono! Respond!

eng: Don't be sad. It was silly to think we could get him back...
jap: 気をおとさないで。 やはり……人間の命までもとりかえす なんて事……
re: Don't get depressed. After all...... going so far as taking back a human life......

eng: Do not dispair. We placed too much hope in bringing Crono back.
jap: 気をおとさないで クダサイ。 やっぱりヒトの命までも とりかえす事は……
re: PLEASE do not become depressed. After all, going so far as to take back a person's life......

eng: Despair not... Fate be not malleable.
jap: 気を落とすな… 人の命のさだめまで俺達にかえる事は 出来ないという事か……。
re: Don't get depressed... I guess this means we can't go so far as to change the fate of a person's life......

eng: No sadness! Ayla lonely too! Sad Crono not come back.
jap: 気　おとすな！ エイラも　さびしい！ クロ　かえらない　さびしい……。
re: No get down! Ayla lonely too! Lonely Cro not come back......

eng: Crono...!
jap: クロノ……！！

eng: The Chrono Trigger... ...the Guru's Time Egg...! And there we all are! We're back at that instant!
jap: クロノ・トリガー…… 時の卵……！ すぎさった時間の私達！？ ホントに、もどって来られたのね！ このしゅんかんに……！
re: The Chrono Trigger...... The egg of time......! Ourselves of a time that has passed!? We were really taken back! To that instant......!

eng: It appears that time has been suspended!
jap: ワタシ達以外の時間は 止まっているようデス！
re: It SEEMS that time is stopped except for OURS!

eng: A time freeze... I never thought it possible.
jap: タイム・フリーズか……。 本当に可能だとはな……。
re: A time freeze......? To think it's actually possible......

eng: Like stone statues. 'Tis eerie...
jap: みんな、石ぞうのようだな。 気味悪いぜ……。
re: Everyone seems like stone statues. It's creepy......

eng: Only us move?
jap: 動けるの　エイラ達だけ？
re: Only Aylas can move?

eng: We'll just exchange the Clone for Crono.
jap: 「それじゃ、ドッペルくんと すりかえて……
re: "Well then, substitute dopple-kun, and......

eng: Crono? It's Crono...! Crono?! You're alive!!!!
jap: クロノ……？ クロノだ……！！ 生きてるよね、クロノ！？
re: Crono......? Crono......!! You're alive, right, Crono!?

eng: We've got to hurry!
jap: さ、急ぐわよ、みんな！
re: Come on, let's hurry, everyone!

eng: What a relief! Crono, you're all right!
jap: アア、よかった……！ クロノ、ご無事デ何ヨリ！
re: AHH, thank goodness......! Crono, it is WONDERFUL that you are safe!

eng: 'Tis an eerie place. Let us withdraw quickly.
jap: ここは、ゾッとするな。 さっさと引きあげようぜ。
re: This place gives me the creeps. Let's pull back quickly.

eng: Hurry! We take Crono!
jap: 早く！ クロ　連れてく！！
re: Quick! Taking Cro along!!

eng: Save the hellos for later! We've got work to do.
jap: 感動の対面は後にしろ！ 用がすんだら帰るぞ。
re: Leave the touching meeting for later! If our business is done, we're going back.

eng: What a pity... We weren't able to change a thing.
jap: ブザマなものだ……。 けっきょく、何一つ変える事も 出来ずに……。
re: Pitiful...... Unable to change even a single thing in the end……

eng: Crono! Welcome back Crono!!
jap: クロノ…… お帰り、クロノ！！
re: Crono...... Welcome back, Crono!!

eng: Crono! It's about time!!
jap: クロノ…… お帰り、クロノ！！
re: Crono...... Welcome back, Crono!!

eng: Crono! 'Tis good of you to return, Crono.
jap: クロノ…… よく帰ってきた…クロノ。
re: Crono...... Glad you came back... Crono.

eng: Crono! Welcome back!!
jap: クロノ…… お帰りナサイ、クロノ！！
re: Crono...... Welcome BACK, Crono!!

eng: I'm so glad you're back, Crono!
jap: よかった。クロノ…
re: Thank goodness. Crono...

eng: How art thou feeling, Crono?
jap: よお、クロノ！ 気分はどーだ？
re: Heya, Crono! How do you feel?

eng: Oh... Crono! What a relief to have you with us again.
jap: オオ……、クロノ。 良かったデス、良かった……。
re: OH...... Crono. Thank goodness, thank goodness......

eng: Crono back!! Crono okay?
jap: クロ　生き返った！ クロ　元気か！？
re: Cro came back to life! Cro well!?

eng: We... We knew this day would come.
jap: みんな…… みんな、待ってたんだよ。
re: Everyone...... Everyone was waiting.

eng: You mustn't... You can't do that ever again!
jap: もう…… 遠く行っちゃあ……、ダメだよ…
re: Don't...... Don't...... go far away again...

eng: You dummy! You wouldn't believe what we had to go through for you!
jap: この大バカ者…… みんな、待ってたんだから！
re: You complete idiot...... Everyone was waiting!

eng: You mess up again... And we won't save you!
jap: 今度ヘマしたら…… もう助けてやんないから……！
re: If you mess up next time...... I won't save you again......!

eng: Thou art a lucky lad. Thy friends be loyal and true!
jap: お前はしあわせ者だぜ…… こんなにみんなに思われて…… しあわせ者め……
re: You're a lucky guy...... To be thought of like this by everyone...... Lucky bastard......

eng: We have all been waiting for you! Marle and Lucca and... Well, all of us!
jap: みんな待ってマス！ みんな待ってマス！
re: Everyone IS waitING! Everyone IS waitING!
RetranslatorComment: Seen only if Robo uses the Time Egg with Ayla and Magus backing him up.

eng: Hmph! Enough of this sappy stuff!
jap: ……フン。

eng: While you were away... A lot of things happened. First, we...and then... And after that we..., but... Crono! Are you even listening?! There's so much you have to know.
jap: クロノがいない間にね…… いろんな事が……のよ…… そして…… ……そこでね……私が…… …したの……でも…… ……ねえ、クロノ！ 聞いてるの？ まだまだ、ぜんぜん 話したりないんだから……
re: While you were gone, Crono...... Various things...... you see...... And then...... ......there, okay...... I...... ...did...... but...... ......hey, Crono! Are you listening? I've got lots more talking to do......

eng: While you were gone we had a terrible time! Marle had to......, and... So then we...and I had to... Hey! You listening, Crono? You can be so irritating sometimes!
jap: あんたがいない間…… すっごく大変だったんだから…… ……マールがね……とっても…… ……ねえ、クロノったら！ 聞きなさいよ！ ホントに……バカなんだから……
re: While you were gone...... We had a reeeally hard time...... ......Marle...... very...... ......hey, Crono! Listen! You're really...... such an idiot......

eng: The Fated Hour
jap: 運命の時へ……
re: To the Fateful Time......

eng: So! Looks like you were successful! No, don't thank me. I didn't do a thing. I just gave you a place to begin... If you really want to thank me, make me a member of your team! By the way, the Wings of Time has come looking for you. It seems to have a heart and mind of it's own...
jap: ほ、うまくいったようじゃな…… いやいや、私は何もしとらんよ。 ただ、きっかけをあたえたにすぎん。 かんしゃなら仲間達にするんじゃな。 この兄ちゃんを思った仲間達にな。 あの時をわたる翼も お前さん達を追って、ここに来とるぞ。 あれも心を持っているのかもな……。
re: Oh? It looks like things went well...... No, no, I did nothing. I did no more than give you a chance. If you're thanking someone, thank your companions. Companions who felt for this boy. The Wings that Cross Time has also followed you and come here. It, too, may have a heart......

eng: You wish to fight Lavos, correct? Many paths lay open to you. You may use that bucket. Or fly the Wings of Time to «The Day of Lavos»... Or there's the Black Omen, which floats in the sky above your world. Lavos is somehow connected with it. It's up to you to decide when and where to fight Lavos. By now you must realize you are the only ones who stand a chance against him... However, you will not be alone. I have had vague glimpses of events, people and places that will empower you...
jap: お前さん達、あのラヴォスと 戦うつもりじゃな……。 そこのバケツのゲートに飛び込むか。 時をわたる翼で『ラヴォスの日』に 行くか……。 あるいは、時代をまたがり現れた あの黒く巨大なもの…… あれもまたラヴォスを呼び起こさんと しておる……。 力にたより、力にとりこまれた おろかな心じゃ……。 あの黒い悪夢に行けばラヴォスとも 戦うはめになるじゃろう。 ラヴォスといつ、どこで戦うかは お前さん達しだいじゃ。 じゃが、くれぐれもお前さん達だけでは 戦わない事じゃ……。 おぼろげじゃが、お前さん達に力を かしてくれるものが見える……。
re: You intend to fight that Lavos...... Will you jump in the Gate in the bucket over there? Or go to the "Day of Lavos" with the Wings that Cross Time......? Or possibly, that enormous black thing that appeared across the eras...... That, too, is trying to wake Lavos again...... A foolish heart that relied on power and was consumed by power...... If you go to that black nightmare, you'll probably wind up fighting Lavos too. When and where you battle Lavos is up to you. However, I urge you not to fight just by yourselves...... It's vague, but I can see things that will aid you......

eng: In the Middle Ages, a woman's sheer determination brings a forest back to life... A fugitive in the Middle Ages, Ozzie, maintains an evil hideout... There's a task to be done in the Future, where machinery originated. And there's a very special stone that can shine its light on each generation, from the distant past to the far future... There's the ghost of a lofty knight, slain by Magus in the Middle Ages, who haunts the present... There's an object in the Middle Ages that sparkles like a rainbow...
jap: 中世の時代、一人の女性の心により よみがえる森……。 中世で逃げのびておる 魔王はいかの3悪の巣くう場所。 未来の時代、機械の生まれた ふるさと……。 原始から未来、すべての時をまたにかけ 陽の光をあつめ続ける石……。 中世で魔王にやぶれ 現代までさまよい続ける ほこり高き騎土のたましい……。 中世では、まぼろしと言われる 虹色に輝くもの……。
re: The Middle Ages, a forest revived thanks to one woman's heart...... The place where the three escaped evils who served Magus make their den in the Middle Ages. The Future era, the hometown where machines were born...... A stone that travels all times from Primeval to Future, continuing to collect the sun's light..... The soul of a proud knight done in by Magus in the Middle Ages that continues to linger to the Present...... In the Middle Ages, something called mythical that shines the colors of the rainbow......

eng: One of you is close to someone who needs help... Find this person...fast. Just as you touch the lives of every life form you meet, so, too, will their energy strengthen you. Fail to live up to your potential, and you will never win... I am sorry that I must simply witness the coming spectacle from my vantage point here...
jap: 自分の時代の事なら お前さん達の中にも知っている者が おるじゃろう。 聞いてみるがいい……。 この星のあらゆる時代の人々 いや、すべての生命の力をかりて 戦うのじゃ……！ でなければヤツは倒せん。 未来を変えるにはそれほどの大きな エネルギーが必要じゃ……。 この星の行くすえ…… 私はここで、ゆっくりと見物させて もらうよ……。
re: I expect that there are those among you, as well, who know about things where their own eras are concerned. You should try asking...... Battle with the aid of of the people, no, of all life from every era of this planet......! If you do not, you cannot beat IT. In order to change the future, you need that great of an energy...... The future to which this planet shall go...... I shall have you allow me to observe at leisure from here......
RetranslatorComment: The famously debated line is now translated once and for all.

eng: I can't believe this! I'm so happy!
jap: よかった、本当に……。
re: Honestly, thank goodness......

eng: Don't put us through that again!
jap: あんまり、女のコを なかせんじゃないわよ！
re: Don't make girls cry so much!

eng: Now that Crono's here, everyone's cheerful!
jap: やはりクロノがいると ミナサン、元気デス！
re: EVERYONE IS indeed lively when Crono is here!

eng: Look at you... Ladies weeping over you right and left...
jap: ヘッ、色男はツライな。 死ぬこともままならないなんて。
re: Heh, it's tough being a ladies man. Not even having things your way in dying.

eng: Crono! Crono!! Crono!!
jap: クロ！　クロ！！ クローーッ！！
re: Cro! Cro!! CROOOO!!

eng: ... You got whacked, 'cuz you're weak.
jap: ……。 お前が死んだのは弱さのせいだ。
re: ...... Your death was thanks to your weakness.

eng: ...... Cretins! And they're still alive!? By the way, Ozzie had a hideout much like my castle...
jap: ……。 ヤツらの事。 まだ死んではいまい……。 そういえばビネガーのヤツ 魔王城ににたアジトを持っていた……。
re: ...... About THEM. I doubt they're dead yet...... Come to think of it, Vinnegar had a hideout similar to Magus Castle......

eng: Whatcha up to... Father...
jap: 今ごろ、どうしてるかな…… 父上……。
re: I wonder how he's doing about now...... Father......

eng: The origin of machines...? You mean to tell me I have a birthplace?
jap: 機械のフルサト……？ ワタシにも生まれた場所が あるのデショウカ？
re: The BIRTHPLACE of machines......? MIGHT I too have a place where I was born?

eng: The knight spirit which wanders... It can't be...
jap: さまよう騎土のたましい…… まさか……な。
re: A knight's lingering soul...... It couldn't be......right?

eng: Fight Lavos! Ayla village have strong defense item! Go see!!
jap: ラヴォス　戦う！ エイラの村　強い防具あるぞ！ 行ってみろ！！
re: We fight Lavos! Ayla's village have strong armor! Go see!!

eng: Solar energy was used aeons ago, well before Lavos Energy existed... It might be just the thing we need to defeat Lavos...
jap: 古代でラヴォスエネルギー 以前に使ってたっていう 太陽エネルギー…… ラヴォスに立ち向かうには おあつらえ向きかもしれないわね。
re: The solar energy they say they used in the Ancient Era before Lavos energy...... It may be ideal for standing against Lavos.

eng: Will you take Crono? Yes. No.
jap: クロノをつれて行きますか？ はい いいえ
re: Take Crono along? Yes No

eng: Hey! Punk head! Where ya been?
jap: お！　ツンツン頭！ 元気か、何してた？
re: Oh! Pointy-head! How are ya, what's up?

eng: My pendant...?
jap: ペンダントが……
re: The pendant......

eng: Your pendant...it's glowing!
jap: ペンダントが光ってるの？
re: The pendant's glowing?

eng: This glow! What is it?
jap: コ、コノかがやきハ？
re: TH, THIS radiance?

eng: A torch comes from the pendant?!
jap: ペンダントから光が！？
re: Light from the pendant!?

eng: It shine like star!
jap: コレ　光ってる！
re: This, it shining!

eng: ...Pendant?
jap: ……ペンダント？
re: ......the pendant?

eng: The seal has been broken. I will give you the treasure of the Guru of Reason. To the right is a weapon which increases strength. To the left is protective gear which will guard your life. Choose whichever you feel you need, and take it with you. 13,000 years was a long time. Belthasar, I shall see you shortly...
jap: 封印ハ　解除サレタ。 理ノ賢者ガ　作リシ　宝物ヲ　アタエヨウ。 右ニハ　力ヲ　生ミ出ス　武器ガ…… 左ニハ　生命ヲ　守ル　防具ガ　アル。 ドチラガ　オノレニ　必要ナノカ ヨク　考エテ　持ッテ行クガ　ヨイ。 13000年ノ　時ハ　長カッタ…… ガッシュ様　今　オソバニ……
re: THE seal WAS releasED. I SHALL PRESENT YOU THE treasure THE Philosopher OF Reason mADE. ON THE right, A weapon THAT brinGS forth power...... ON THE left, armor THAT protecTS life. YOU SHOULD CAREFULLY consiDER WHICH YOU need BEFORE takING IT. 13,000 years OF time WAS long...... Gasch-sama, now TO YOUR SIDE......

eng: My dream has come true. Peace is ours!
jap: うれしいね。 ついに平和がやって来たんだね。
re: How pleasant. Peace has finally come.

eng: Let's wage peace from now on!
jap: 長き戦いもついに終わりが来ました。
re: An end has finally come to the long war.

eng: The Hero has brought us peace, and I have delivered the bell to the King. What more could we ask for? Hurrah for Guardia!!! Let's toast our land!
jap: 勇者様のおかげで平和がおとずれて リーネの鐘も王様にけんじょう出来たし いうことねえや。 ガルディアバンザイ！！ もう飮まずにはいられねえ！
re: Thanks to the Hero, peace has come, and I was able to present Leene's Bell to the King too. Long live Guardia! I've gotta get me a drink now!
RetranslatorComment: Literally, “I can no longer exist without drinking”

eng: Now we'll have peace and prosperity.
jap: 平和の足音が聞こえてきましたね。
re: I can hear the footsteps of peace coming.

eng: In our world, every storm has an end. Every night, brings a new morning. What's important is to trust those you love, and never give up...... We must all keep hope alive...
jap: この世界に、やまないあめはありません。 どんな夜にも、いつかは終りが 本当に大切なのは、 最後まであきらめないこと……。 あなたのことを大切におもう人が、 きっと世界のどこかで、 見守っていてくれますよ。
re: There is no rain in this world that does not end. No matter the night, its end will come in time...... That which is truly important is to believe in the end...... Those people who consider you precious are surely watching over you somewhere in the world.

eng: We've been expecting you! To the King's chamber, please!
jap: おお、待っていたぞ！ さ、王のもとへ！
re: Hey, we've been waiting! Now, go to the King!

eng: What a stroke of luck for you guys. Defeated Magus, huh?
jap: まったくラッキーだぜ…… 魔王を倒しちまうなんてな。
re: You're seriously lucky...... Beating Magus and all.

eng: The injured soldiers have all recovered.
jap: ケガを負った兵も、みな回復しました。
re: The wounded soldiers have all recovered too.

eng: See, they're all better!
jap: ホラホラ、みんなもう直ってんだよ！
re: Look, look, everyone's healed now!

eng: Please...be ...gentle...
jap: や…… やさしくして……
re: Be...... Be gentle......

eng: The Knight Captain and chef have finally made up!
jap: 騎土団長と料理長、やっと みとめあったんですよ。 まだ、テレてるみたいだけど。
re: The Knight Captain and Head Cook have finally accepted each other. It looks like they're still embarrassed though.

eng: Sorry, I don't have time right now.
jap: ゴメンね、たてこんでて それどころじゃないの。
re: I'm sorry, but it's crowded and this isn't the time for this.

eng: The chef's experimenting on a great dish.
jap: うちの人が考えたスゴい料理を けんきゅう中なんだよ。
re: My husband's in the middle of researching some amazing cooking he thought of.

eng: It's so complicated, who knows when he'll be done!
jap: あまりにスゴいんで、いつ完成するか……
re: It's too amazing, when's he gonna finish......?

eng: A great dish needs a great name!
jap: スゴい料理には、やっぱスゴい名前を つけなきゃね。
re: Gotta give amazing cooking an amazing name after all.

eng: We destroyed Magus's troops and we owe it all to Crono. Frog, you're magnificent...! I knew you'd do it... I was thinking 'bout making you «Knight Captain!»
jap: 魔王軍にうち勝ったのは 我々の団結と、そして何よりも クロノ殿達のおかげ。 カエル、お主もしや…… いや、そうにちがいない。 お主に騎土団長をまかせようと思うのだが。
re: Our overcoming of Magus's army was thanks to our unity and, above all else, to Crono-dono and the others. Frog, might you......? No, there's no mistaking it. I'm thinking about leaving the knight captaincy to you.
RetranslatorComment: Does he realize that Frog is actually Glenn?

eng: I'm afraid 'tis not for me...
jap: よしてくれ、ガラじゃねえ。
re: Forget it, it's not my style.

eng: Nonesense! YOU saved the day. I just cooked! I'm whipping up a victory meal! Something real fancy!
jap: なーに、おめーらのおかげよ。 俺は料理しただけだ。 魔王軍への勝利をいわう料理を 考えてんだ。　ゴージャスなヤツをな！
re: Whaaat, it's thanks to you guys. I just cooked. I'm thinking about some cooking to celebrate the victory over Magus's army. Something gorgeous!

eng: If they had broken through at Zenan Bridge, this castle would've been destroyed.
jap: ゼナンの橋がやぶられていたら この城もかいめつしたでしょう。
re: If Zenan Bridge had been beaten, this castle would probably have been wiped out too.

eng: Since you didn't come out of Magus's castle, I simply thought...
jap: 魔王城から出てこないと聞いて てっきり……
re: When I heard you hadn't come out of Magus Castle I thought for sure......

eng: Crono, my thanks extend for generations to come.
jap: クロノどのには、まごの代まで かんしゃいたしまするぞ！
re: Crono-dono, my thanks extend unto the time of my grandchildren.

eng: I don't know how to thank you... Frog! Where's Frog?
jap: いいか…… カエル！ カエルはどうしたのです？
re: How should I express my thanks to you all......? Frog! What happened to Frog?

eng: Frog! So, you've teamed up with Crono and the others! You've done a fine job. Please remain with us as long as you wish.
jap: カエル！ やはり、あなたもクロノ達と いっしょでしたか。 よくやってくれました。 あなたは何はばかる事なく、この城に いていいのですよ。
re: Frog! So you really were together with Crono and the others. You have done well. You need not hesitate to stay in this castle.

eng: ... My heart is glad...thank you, my Liege!
jap: …… そのお言葉だけでじゅうぶんで ございます……。
re: ...... Your words are enough in themselves......

eng: Y...you're ALIVE! Although we did sustain major casualties, we wouldn't have made it without you! Anyway, we all must work together to rebuild the Kingdom of Guardia! We're all in this together!
jap: おお、生きておったか！ そなたらのおかげで、我々は救われた。 大きなぎせいもあったが…… これからは騎土団長、料理長ともに この城を、いやガルディア王国を もりたててゆかねばな。 何かあったら力になるぞ。
re: Oh, so you're alive! We were saved thanks to you. Though a great many were sacrificed...... Now, we, along with the Knight Captain and Head Cook, must restore this castle, no, restore Guardia Kingdom. We will help you if something comes up.

eng: Frog, thanks again. You deserve the title, Knight!
jap: カエル、ごくろうであった。 お前のはたらきこそ、騎土の名に ふさわしい。
re: Frog, thank you for your efforts. Your achievements are exactly what are suited to the name of Knight.

eng: Waste not, such precious words on me.
jap: 私の様な者にもったいない お言葉……
re: Your words are more than one such as I deserves......

eng: Sealed with a mysterious energy... Something inside is reacting to the pendant. Take out what's inside?
jap: 不思議な力で封印されている……。 ペンダントに反応して、中の物が 光りだした。　なかみを取り出しますか？
re: It's sealed with a mysterious power. Something inside reacted to the pendant and began glowing. Remove the contents?

eng: Yes.
jap: はい
re: Yes

eng: No.
jap: いいえ
re: No

eng: Yahoooo!! Somebody STOP me!!! Hurrah to the Hero and Guardia!
jap: うおおおおおおおお！！！！ 俺はモウレツに感動してるぞ！！！ 勇者様バンザイ！　ガルディアバンザイ！！
re: Whoooooooa!!!! I am FURIOUSLY moved!!! Long live the Hero! Long live Guardia!!

eng: They've built a Town Square to celebrate peace.
jap: この平和がすえながく続くようにとの 思いをこめて広場を作るって話だ。
re: There's talk of building a square with the hopes that this peace will last a great many years.

eng: And they've named it after Queen Leene.
jap: なんでも王妃様の名前をとって 『リーネ広場』にするらしいぜ。
re: I hear they're taking the Queen's name and making it “Leene Square”.

eng: What a happy occasion! Let's get crazy!
jap: ガハハハハハハ！！ めでてえな。 こんなめでてえ日は飮むしかねえべ。
re: Ga, ha, ha, ha, ha, ha, ha, ha!! Good times. There's no choice but to drink on such a great day.

eng: Something is reacting to the pendant. Take the item inside? Yes. No.
jap: ペンダントに反応して中の物が光りだした。 なかみを取り出しますか？ はい いいえ
re: Something inside reacted to the pendant and began glowing. Remove the contents? Yes No

eng: Blue Vest powers up! Found Blue Mail! Found Blue Vest!
jap: ブルーベストがバージョンアップ！ ブループレートを手に入れた！ ブルーベストを手に入れた！
re: Blue Vest version up! Got a Blue Plate! Got a Blue Vest!

eng: Magus's troops are pretty tame when he's not leading them!
jap: 魔王のいなくなった魔王軍など ガルディア王国軍の敵ではありません。
re: The likes of Magus's army with no Magus is no match for the army of Guardia Kingdom.

eng: Peace at last, thanks to the Hero! Hurrah for the Hero! Hurrah for Guardia!
jap: ようやく平和な時がもどってきそうです。 これもみな勇者様のおかげです。 勇者様バンザイ！ ガルディア王国バンザイ！
re: It looks like a time of peace is finally returning. This is all thanks to the Hero. Long live the Hero! Long live Guardia Kingdom!

eng: The Hero has beaten the evil monsters! Yea!
jap: わるいまものを、りっぱなゆーしゃさまが やっつけてくれたんだってさ！ わーい、わーい！
re: They say a great Hero's beaten up the bad guys! Yay, yay!

eng: I heard the Hero was Sir Cyrus's friend. He must be a handsome knight. Sigh...
jap: 今の勇者様って、サイラス様の 知り合いだったのですってね。 きっと、ステキな騎土なのでしょうね。 うっとり……。
re: They say the Hero now and Cyrus-sama knew each other. He's got to be a dreamy knight. I'm enthralled......

eng: Uwa, ha! What irony!
jap: ニャヘヘ……。
re: Nya, heh, heh......
RetranslatorComment: Probably ironic laughter

eng: Magus survived, and is in hiding. We can't let him escape! Think of all the soldiers that fell...
jap: なんでも、魔王のヤツめは生きのびて 姿をかくしたそうじゃな……。 あやつを逃しては、ならんのじゃ！ なくなった多くの兵士達のためにも。
re: They say that Magus bastard survived and hid himself away...... We can't let him get away! For the sake of the many lost soldiers.

eng: The chief of Sandorino lives here. Finally, we'll have some peace!
jap: ここはサンドリノの村長の家だよ。 やっと平和がもどってくるんだね。
re: This is the house of Sandrino's village chief. Peace is finally returning.

eng: Magus's 3 henchmen ran off and are hiding on some island. Will we never get rid of those evildoers?
jap: 魔王の手下の、あの3人ぐみ……。 あいつら、まんまと逃げおおせて どこかの島にかくれてるって話だよ。 この世から悪い者がいなくなる日は ないのかねえ……。
re: Magus's subordinates, that group of three...... Word is they've managed to run away and are hiding on an island somewhere. Will the day never come when the evil ones are gone from this world......?

eng: Behold...! The legendary Hero, with sword in hand! Just once, I wish I could be in the Hero's shoes!
jap: 見よ…… 剣を手にした、かの伝説の勇者を！ ああ、一度でいいから そんな風に言われてみたいなあ 私も！
re: Behold...... The legendary Hero, sword in hand! Aaah, just once would be fine, but I wanna try having people talk about me like that too!

eng: That liar! He's a no good, useless... He took the money but can't find what I asked for! I've been duped!
jap: なにがいだいなる探検家じゃ！ あの、大ウソつきの、トンチキめが！ たのんだものは見つからぬし 前金はつかっちまっただと……？ とんだ、くわせもんじゃわい！
re: Legendary explorer, my ass! That damn lying numskull! He's not finding what I asked for and he says he's spent all the advance money......? What a horrible phony!

eng: The famous Denadoro Mountain winds have grown mild.
jap: さいきんはデナドロ山の風も おだやかで、のどかなもんです。
re: Even the Denadoro Mountain winds have been calm and quiet lately.

eng: We're saved! At least for now...
jap: ああ、世界はすくわれました！ 少なくとも今回は……。
re: Ah, the world have been saved! At least for now......

eng: Hah! Magus is gone! Now there's nothing to fear! Let's have a party!
jap: 魔王のヤツめ、ザマーみやがれ！ もんだぜ！ さあ、ガンガン行けい！
re: That damn Magus, serves him right! Come on, get to it with some gusto!

eng: They stopped Magus. Now that it's safe I'm enjoying my lemonade! Vitamin C builds strong bodies!
jap: 魔王が邪悪なものを生みだすのだけは なんとかぶじふせげたらしいよ。 これでみんなどこへ行こうが 何をしようが安全だよ！ ……ってなワケで 俺はこうして酒でパラダイスに 出かけるのさ。 ウヒック！
re: Sounds like they at least safely prevented Magus from bringing forth something evil. Now everyone's safe wherever they go and whatever they do! ......and that's why I'm heading for paradise with alcohol like this. u-hic!

eng: And I have plans of my own... Now that the boy's back, it's time to set my sights on his father, hee hee.
jap: 私もささやかな自分の夢を あの子のいいお母さんに なれるかしら？
re: I've got a modest dream of my own, I wonder if I could become a good mother for that boy?

eng: Tata's been working hard lately. Maybe he's growing up.
jap: 最近タータのヤツ、けっこーマジメに ガンバってるみたいなのよ。 あいつもちょっとは成長したのかな。
re: It looks like that Tarta's been doing his best to be pretty serious lately. Could even he have grown up a bit?

eng: A slimy frog man beat Magus? If I knew it was gonna be so easy, I'd have done it myself! Geez!
jap: なんでも魔王をたおしたのは マヌケなカエル男なんだってね？ そんなヤツにやれるのなら 私がやればよかったよ！ いや、ほんとに。
re: I hear it's some stupid frogman who beat Magus? If someone like that could do it, I should have done it! I mean, seriously.

eng: Yeah, he sure was weird. Ahem... Oh, I meant, such a magnificent frog! He'll be a hero or a chancellor...!
jap: ありゃほんと、うす気味…… (ゴホッ、ゴホホ)……！ い、いや、りっぱなカエル様でしたな。 すえは、勇者か大臣か……！
re: That was a really cree...... (cough), (cough)......! N, no, a fine frog-sama. He'll end up a hero or chancellor......!

eng: Many trees were destroyed in the war with the Magus's Army. I try to maintain the forest by replanting trees, but they all die.
jap: 魔王軍との戦いで この森に生えていた木々は 森の緑を守るために 木をうえているのですが すぐにかれてしまうのです……。
re: Most of the trees growing in this forest were lost in the battle with Magus's army. I'm planting trees to protect the green of the forest, but they soon wither......

eng: The desert monsters are draining the life out of the soil here.
jap: 何をうえても すぐにかれてしまう……。 砂漠のどこかに住みついた モンスターのしわざなのです。
re: Whatever I plant, it soon withers...... It's the doing of monsters that have settled down somewhere in the desert.

eng: This Mystic seedling could revive the forest, but I can't plant it. Too many hungry monsters lurking about.
jap: 代々伝わる、不思議な力を持った このなえ木をうえれば、この砂漠を 緑の大地に戻す事も出来るのですが…… 砂漠洞窟にモンスターが巣食っていて うえる事が出来ないのです……。
re: If I were to plant this seedling with mysterious powers that was passed down for generations, it could even restore this desert to green earth, but...... I can't plant it with monsters nesting in the desert cave......
RetranslatorComment: I managed to confuse two  kanji here before, mangling 'nesting' into 'fruit-eating'. Fixed now.

eng: My husband Marco is finally home! I...I'm so relieved!
jap: 兵士として、魔王軍との 戦いに出ていたおっとのマルコが 私、わたし……
re: My husband Marco, who, as a soldier, went to fight Magus's army, has returned to I, I......

eng: Don't worry. I'm home for good.
jap: 安心して。 これからはずっといっしょだよ。
re: Relax. From now on, we'll be together for good.

eng: The monsters in the desert cave hate water. But I can't defeat them by myself.
jap: 砂漠洞窟に巣食った モンスター達は水に弱いようです。 しかし、僕の力では あのモンスターを倒す事は……。
re: It seems that the monsters nesting in the desert cave are weak against water. But beating those monsters with my power......

eng: What was that?
jap: 何の音かしら？
re: I wonder what that sound is?

eng: Some tremor?
jap: じひびき？
re: A tremor?

eng: An unforeseen earthquake perhaps?
jap: トッパツ的な地震デショウカ？
re: IS IT a SPONTANEOUS earthquake?

eng: What, be this?
jap: な、なんだ？
re: Wh, what the?

eng: Ground shaking!
jap: ゆ、ゆれてるぞ！
re: Sh, shaking!

eng: So that's the monster responsible for this desert!
jap: あのモンスターのせいで 木がどんどんかれていくのね！
re: It's that monster's fault the forest is dying out so fast!

eng: The monsters are creating a desert here.
jap: あのモンスターが 砂漠化の原因みたいね。
re: It looks like that monster is the source of the desertization.

eng: The monsters are causing the desertification here.
jap: 砂漠化の進行ハ あのモンスターのせいデスネ。
re: The progressing desertization IS that monster's fault.

eng: So, THEY changeth the forest into the desert!
jap: あ、あいつが森を砂漠に かえちまったんだな！
re: Th, that thing turned the forest into desert!

eng: They make forest into desert!
jap: アイツが　森　砂漠にした！
re: That made forest desert!

eng: Retinite... He's behind this new desert.
jap: メルフィック…… あいつが砂漠化の原因か……。
re: Melfikk...... So that's the cause of the desertization...…

eng: But how can one find a monster that roams the inner earth?
jap: でも、地中を動き回る モンスターなんて…… どこで出会うか、見当もつかないわ！
re: But something like a monster that moves around underground...… You can't even guess at where you'll run into it!

eng: It will be hard to defeat a monster that travels underground!
jap: しかし、地中を進む モンスターとは、やっかいね。
re: But a monster that moves underground is a nuisance.

eng: But monsters that travel underground are impossible to find!
jap: シカシ、地中を行き来ガ 出来るモンスターとは……
re: HOWEVER, for the monster to be able to come and go underground......

eng: How to slayeth monsters within the earth... 'Tis a very difficult task.
jap: しかし、地中を動き回る ヤツが相手とは…… こいつは、面倒だぜ。
re: But for a bastard that moves around underground to be the opponent...... This guy's a pain.

eng: Hard to find monster in earth!
jap: 地中　動き回る　ホネ！ 見つける　たいへん！
re: Bones moving around underground! Big trouble to find!

eng: ...What a pain...
jap: ……、やっかいだな。
re: ......nuisance.

eng: At least Fiona will be happy!
jap: これでもう、木がかれる事も ないね。フィオナさん、よろこぶよ。
re: The trees won't die off any more either now. Fiona-san will be glad.

eng: We've neutralized the source of this desert. We should tell Fiona.
jap: これで、砂漠化の原因は とりのぞかれたわ。 フィオナさんに教えてあげるべきね。
re: The cause of the desertization has now been removed. We ought to tell Fiona-san.

eng: Now, the desertification should stop. Let us inform Fiona.
jap: コレデ、砂漠化の進行ハ オサマルはずデス。 フィオナさんにシラセテあげまショウ。
re: NOW, the progress of the desertization should SUBSIDE. LET US notify Fiona-san.

eng: It be settled then. Let us inform Fiona.
jap: これでもう、安心だ。 フィオナにしらせてやろうぜ。
re: Now there's nothing to worry about anymore. Let's let Fiona know.

eng: Bad bones gone. Fiona happy now.
jap: 森　こわした　ホネ　死んだ。 フィオナ　よろこぶ！
re: Bones that break trees dead. Fiona glad!

eng: Hmph!
jap: フン……。
re: Hmph......

eng: You killed the monsters?! How can I ever thank you?
jap: あのモンスターをたいじして いただけるとは！ あなた達には、なんとおれいを 言ったらいいのか……。
re: I can't believe you exterminated those monsters for us! How can we thank you......?
RetranslatorComment: Literally: What thanks should we say to you......?

eng: The war with the Mystics is over, but the battle to revive the forest is just beginning.
jap: モンスターとの戦いは 終わりました。しかしぼく達には 砂漠となったこの森をもとの姿に もどすという長い戦いが待っています。
re: The battle with the monsters has ended. However, a long battle awaits us to return this forest to its original form now that it has become a desert.

eng: Thank you for routing the beasts! Unfortunately, it'll take centuries to revive the forest. I wish I could live long enough to see my wish come true!
jap: モンスターをたいじしてくれて ありがとう。 私も、もう一度がんばってみるわ。 気のとおくなるような時間が 必要なの……。 ああ…… 何びゃく年でもはたらき続ける事が 出来るような人がいれば この砂漠を森に戻せるのに……。
re: Thank you for exterminating the monsters for us. I too will try doing all I can once more. we need an unimaginably long time...… Aaah...... If only there was someone who could keep working even for hundreds of years, we could turn this desert back to forest...…

eng: You can come for me when the job is done. May I stay behind and help Fiona? Alright No
jap: …… ワタシがココに残って、フィオナさんの オテツダイをするというのは。 ワタシをカイシュウしてくだされば よいのデスカラ。 ココに残って、オテツダイをしても よろしいデショウカ？ はい いいえ
re: ...... That is, I shall remain HERE and act as Fiona-san's HELPER. desert has been revived as forest. May I remain HERE and act as HELPER? Yes No

eng: With Robo's help, it seems my dream may finally come true. How can I ever thank you?
jap: ロボさんのおかげで この砂漠を森に戻すという私の夢も 実現出来そうです。 なんとお礼を言ったらいいのか……。
re: Thanks to Robo-san, it looks like my dream of returning this desert to forest will be realized. How can I thank you......?

eng: 400 years ago a strange metal creature helped a woman named Fiona revive the forest to the north. The creature was placed in a shrine within the forest.
jap: 400年前、フィオナという女性が 不思議な鉄の人形に手伝ってもらって 北の大地に森をよみがえらせたそうです。 神殿にその鉄の人形が安置されていますよ。
re: 400 years ago, a woman called Fiona had a mysterious iron doll help her bring the forest back to life in the land to the north. That iron doll is enshrined in a temple.[END]

eng: This is Fiona's Shrine. Here we give thanks to Fiona & Robo for replanting the forest 400 years ago!
jap: ここはフィオナの神殿。 400年前、魔王との戦いで 砂漠化した森をよみがえらせた フィオナ様とロボ様をまつった 神殿です。
re: This is Fiona's Temple. It is a temple dedicated to Fiona-sama and Robo-sama, who made revive the forest that was turned to desert in the war with Magus 400 years ago.

eng: The remains of the lofty Robo are enshrined in the inner sanctum.
jap: この神殿の奥には、ご神体である ロボ様が安置されています。
re: Within this temple, the holy relic of Robo-sama is enshrined.
RetranslatorComment: This is a bit of a loose  translation. 神体 (shintai) actually refers to an object in which  the spirit of a deity resides, and the line seems to indicate that they  consider Robo to be an inanimate object that was animated by a god.

eng: Here's a hat made from a magical bough filled with mystical forest powers.
jap: 森の不思議な力を持ったえだであんだ ぼうしです。
re: These are hats knit from branches with the forest's mysterious power.

eng: Systems reactivated. Wh, where am I?
jap: コ、ココハ……
re: TH, THIS PLACE is......

eng: Ahh... [member1], how nice to see you. For you, it was a quick hop, but for me 400 long years have passed. The effort was worth it! The forest has grown back! Now, let us celebrate our 400th year reunion.
jap: オ…… オオ…… [pc1]…… ナ……ナツカシイ……。 イヤ……、アナタ方にとってハ イッシュンの事だったのデスネ。 シカシ、ワタシニとっては 400年ハながい時間デシタ……。 シカシ、クロウのかいアッテ 森ハよみがえりマシタ。 …… サア、今夜ハ、400年ブリの サイカイをいわおうではアリマセンカ。
re: OH...... OHH...... [char1]...... I...... I MISSED YOU...... NO...... to YOU, it WAS a matter of an INSTANT. HOWEVER, for ME, 400 years WAS a long time...... HOWEVER, there ARE results from the HARDSHIPS, and the forest HAS BEEN revived. ...... NOW, tonight, SHALL WE NOT celebrate our 400-year REUNION?

eng: After 400 years of experience, I have come to think that Lavos may not be responsible for the Gates.
jap: 今回400年もの旅をして 気づいた事があります。 ワタシ達はゲートの出現は ラヴォスの力のゆがみだと思って イマシタが違うような気がして きたのデス。
re: Having now journeyed over 400 years, I have realized something. WE HAD thought that the emergence of Gates WAS from the distortions from Lavos's power, but the feeling HAS come upon me that we were mistaken.

eng: What do you mean?
jap: どういう事？
re: What do you mean?

eng: I have come to think that someone, or something wanted us to see all this. The different events over time, that we have witnessed. It is almost as if some entity wanted to relive its past.
jap: カクシンは持てませんが 誰かが何かを私達に見せたかったんじゃ ないかと……。 ゲートを通していろんな時代の何かを。 もしくは、その誰か自身が見たかったの かもしれマセン。 自分の生きて来た姿を 思い返すように……。
re: I cannot be CONFIDENT about it, but did someone not perhaps want to show us something......? Something in various eras, through the Gates. Or, MAYBE that someone wanted to see it personally. In order to think back upon the way his or her own life went......
RetranslatorComment: Changed  English to gender-neutral since no gender  is indicated... or even whether gender applies.

eng: Ayla know! When people die, elders say, see whole life pass by!
jap: エイラ　それわかる。 人　死ぬ時　今までの思い出 全部　見る　言い伝え！
re: Ayla understand that. Legend that people see all memories up to then when die!

eng: 'Tis true that mortals do relive their most profound memories before death claimeth them. Yet those memories most often are sad ones.
jap: 人は死ぬ時 生きていた時に深く心にきざんだ記憶が 次々とうかぶという。 それは楽しい思い出もあるが たいていは悲しい思い出さ。
re: They say that when people die, the memories that were etched deeply into their hearts when they were alive come to mind one after another. There are also happy memories, but generally they're sorrowful memories.

eng: Thinking things like, «If only I had done this,» or, «I shouldn't have done that...» triggers unpleasant, old memories.
jap: きっと 『あの時にもどりたい』 『あの時ああしていれば』…… という、つよい思いが記憶を 呼び起こすのでショウ。
re: Undoubtedly, "I want to go back to that time", "If I had just done like so then"...... Strong feelings such as these LIKELY call memories to mind.

eng: Will that happen when our time comes?
jap: 私も死ぬ時はそうなるのかな？
re: I wonder if I'll be like that too when I die?

eng: Probably...who knows?
jap: きっとそうよ。
re: I'm sure you will.

eng: Is there a point in time you'd want to return to, Lucca?
jap: ルッカはあるの？ もどりたい、いっしゅんが？
re: Do you have one, Lucca? A moment you want to return to?

eng: No...not really...
jap: ううん……。

eng: I'm sorry, was that something I shouldn't have asked?
jap: ごめん 聞いちゃ、いけなかった？
re: Sorry, should I not have asked?

eng: It's ok, it's just something I don't like to think about too much.
jap: なるべく考えないように しているの。 だってつかれちゃうもの。
re: I try to think about it as little as possible. After all, I could get obsessed.
RetranslatorComment: 憑かれる  (be obsessed) makes more sense than 疲れる (be weary) here.  Incidentally, it literally refers to demonic possession.

eng: Lavos playeth an integral role in the fortunes of this Entity...
jap: しかしだ…… この思い出の持ち主はよっぽど ラヴォスにえんがあるんだな。 どの時代もラヴォスにからんでる。
re: But...... The owner of these memories has quite a connection with Lavos. They're caught up with Lavos every era we go to.

eng: ...so who is this Entity?
jap: ……。 で、誰だというんだ、そいつは？
re: ....... Well, who do you say that person is?

eng: It is unknown, whose memories these are. It may be something beyond our comprehension. Our journey may come to an end when we finally discover the identity of the Entity. ... ...shall we turn in for the night?
jap: 誰の思い出かは わかりマセン。 もしかしたら人ではない…… もっと大きな存在かも知れマセン。 それがわかる日が、ワタシ達の旅の 終わりの時かもしれマセン。 ……そろそろ、ねマショウカ？
re: I do NOT know whose memories they are. Perhaps not a person...... MAYBE a larger existence. The day we understand that MAY come when OUR journey ends. ......SHALL we get to sleep soon?
RetranslatorComment: This certainly fits the planet = entity theory.

eng: Did I make it back...to that moment?
jap: こ、これは？
re: Th, this is?

eng: «6/24/990A.D. Dad promised to go hiking with me, but blew me off again, due to his work. I hate science! I loathe it!»
jap: 『AD990/6/24 ハイキングのやくそくをしたのに お父さんは研究ですっぽかし。 ルッカには全然わかんない…… でもいいの。　ルッカはふつうの およめさんになるからカガクなんて 知らなくていいんだもん！
re: "6/24, A.D.990 Even though dad promised to go hiking, he skipped out on it to do research. Lucca doesn't get it at all...... But that's fine. Lucca's going to become a normal bride, so she doesn't gotta know about science and stuff!

eng: Lucca... Lucca...
jap: ルッカ……、ルッカ……
re: Lucca...... Lucca......

eng: The password is... The name of my lovely wife. Use it in an emergency. -Taban
jap: 『機械をストップさせるパスコードは…… 我が最愛の人。 非常時にこれを入力しろ。 タバン』
re: "The passcode to make the machine stop is...... My most beloved person. Enter this in an emergency. Taban
RetranslatorComment: It's LALA in the  Japanese version. I've heard that even Japanese players got frustrated at it  since the ラs in her name can be rendered as either 'la' or 'ra', and  the controller has both an L and an R button.

eng: What IS this thing? Taban says to keep away from it, but it's so dusty. I'll just...
jap: まあまあ、何の機械だか… タバンは危ないから近づくなって 言うけど、こうよごしちゃあねェ。
re: My, my, what's this machine...? Taban says not to get close to it because it's dangerous, but he's gotten it so dirty.

eng: Dear me! My skirt...it's...I'm STUCK! Lucca! Lucca, HELP!
jap: あら？ スカートのすそがはさまっちゃったわ。 ルッカ、ね、ルッカ ちょっと手伝って。
re: Huh? The hem of my skirt got caught in it. Lucca, hey, Lucca, help me out a bit.

eng: I can't pull it out.
jap: 取れないよ。
re: It won't come out.

eng: !! Lucca! Enter the password! Stop this machine!
jap: ！！ ルッカ！　機械を止めて！ パスコードを入力して。
re: !! Lucca! Stop the machine! Enter the passcode.

eng: But I don't know it, mommie!
jap: わからないわ！
re: I don't get it!

eng: Oh no...! Help!!
jap: ララ「ああ、もうだめ…… あなた！！
re: Lara: Aah, it's no good...... Darling!!

eng: 7/1/990 A.D. I wish I hadn't heard what the doctor told dad. Mommie's legs...they're...
jap: 『AD990/7/1 お父さんと、おいしゃさんの話を 聞いちゃった。 でも聞かない方がよかった…… お母さん……足が……
re: "7/1, A.D.990 I heard the talk between dad and the doctor. But I wish I hadn't...... Mother...... her legs......
RetranslatorComment: One facet of her quest  to save her mother was lost in the English translation. Specifically, her  diary entry before the disaster was written in third person, suggesting  immaturity. The entries afterwards are written in first, representing  maturity. Additionally, Lucca's reason for not wanting to learn science  initially was that she'd be a "normal bride" and wouldn't have to  worry about stuff like that. Interestingly, if Lucca inputs the password, the  "good" journal entry is sort of in between first and third person,  suggesting she did not grow up as much as she would have had the tragedy  occurred and shocked her.

eng: 7/15/990 A.D. If only I knew more about machines. Then mom would still be okay. If only I...
jap: 『AD990/7/15 私が機械にくわしければあんな事に ならなかったのに…… 私さえ……
re: "7/15, A.D.990 If only I knew all about machines, nothing like this would have happened...... Even I......

re: Enter password.

re: "7/2, A.D. 990 Truly, thank goodness. I'm thinking about getting to know a little more in depth about machines so that it'll be okay even if something like that happens again.

re: Ah, Vinnegar-sama, Vinnegar-sama~[note] Our savior, Vinnegar-sama~[note] Ah, Vinnegar-sama, Vinnegar-sama~[note] However sunny and lonely the day,
RetranslatorComment: Apparently he stole his lyrics from the Magus statue room.

RetranslatorComment: In the Japanese version, when Ozzie first welcomes the party to his fort, he notes that it is the "Great Magus Ozzie's," meaning he's attached the same title of Magus to his name and an intensifier. How vain can he be? This was lost in the English translation, in which he was simply the "Great Ozzie."

eng: Who enters here unbidden? Oh... Welcome home R-66Y. Or should I say, Prometheus?! You dare to defile this place with humans? I haven't seen them in ages. Let me...welcome them. Come closer... Let's see just what you can do... Not bad...for humans. But can you find your way to me?
jap: 「ワタシの心に勝手に押し入ろうと しているのはドナタ……？ まあ…… お帰りなさいRー66Y……。 イイエ、プロメテス……。 あら？　後ろは生き物？ 生き物が来るなんて ずいぶんひさしぶりね……。 かんげいしますわ、さあ、どうぞ中へ。 クスクス……。 「それではアナタ達の性能を見せて いただきマショウ。 「人間にしては、やりマスネ……。 ワタシの所にたどりつくのを楽しみに していマスヨ……。
re: 'WHO is it that is trying to barge into MY heart without asking......? Oh my...... Welcome back, R-66Y...... NO, I mean Promethes...... Oh? Behind you are living beings? It's been quite a long time since any such thing as living beings coming here has happened...... I welcome you, come on inside now. (chuckle) ...... 'Now, LET'S have you show me YOUR ability. 'You'RE pretty good, for humans...... I AM looking forward to you making your way to where I am......

eng: 300 yrs. ago the Lavos disaster greatly changed the planet. At this rate, humans will die out from pure despair. Don't you understand? This planet would be peaceful if there were no humans around. And yet you still want to fight? Why?

re: '300 years ago, the great disaster of Lavos occurred, and this planet greatly changED. If things go on like this, humans WILL die out before long. Their hearts are consumed by the disease called hopelessness....... 'I wonder if you've noticed it yet? If YOU humans weren't here, this planet would BE peaceful. You WOULD fight even so? To what purpose?

eng: This computer can give us data about the Geno Dome. Door Conveyor Belt Guard Machine Doll
jap: このコンピューターで ジェノサイドームの情報を ひきだせマス。 トビラ ベルトコンベア ガードマシン 人形
re: I CAN pull up information on Genocidome with this computer. From where SHALL I investigate? Doors Conveyor Belt Guard Machine Doll

eng: What shall we examine first? To open locked doors, simply charge the energy pods beside them. Energize first, in the pod to your left, then enter the pod next to a locked door. The robot guarding the figurine will block anyone that tries to pass. But if you place 2 guards in front of each other, they will short circuit. Return the broken guard to the room upstairs. The belt conveyor to the right can be reversed with a switch above it. You must obtain the 2 figurines on this floor to fight the Mother Brain. Do not leave with them.
jap: 何から調べマショウカ？ ロックされている扉を開けるには そのヨコについているエネルギーポッドを ジュウデンする必要があります。 左のエネルギーポッドで電気をおびて 扉のヨコのポッドに入れば ジュウデンされ扉が開きます。 人形を守るガードマシンは カクジツに正面に立つものの進路をはばむ。 しかし2体のガードマシンをならべると 機能がテイシするのでチュウイ。 なお故障したガードマシンは 上の部屋におくこと。 右をながれるベルトコンベアは 上方にあるスイッチにより ギャクむきになります。 このフロア2ケ所にある人形は マザーにえっけんするのに必要です。 勝手にもちださぬように。
re: From where SHALL I investigate? In order to open the locked doors, it is necessary to electrically charge the energy pods installed next to them. If you take on energy at the energy pod to the left and enter the pods next to the doors, they will be electrically charged and the doors will open. The guard machine that protects the doll reliably obstructs the path of those who stand before it. However, when you line up two guard machines, they cease to function, so be careful. Also, you are to place broken-down guard machines in the above room. The conveyor belt that runs to the right will reverse direction by means of the switch at the upper end. The dolls found in two places on this floor are required to have an audience with Mother. They are not to be removed without permission.

re: SHALL I investigate further? Yes No

eng: Listen well, humans. Lavos's children will one day have to leave to seek new planets, and prey. This world COULD sustain them...if humans were not around... We robots will create a new order... A nation of steel, and pure logic. A true paradise! Our «Species» will replace you... So stop your foolish struggle, and succumb to the sleep of eternity...
jap: 「聞きナサイ、不完全でこわれやすく おろかな生き物よ……。 ラヴォスの子供達は、やがて宇宙に 帰って行くデショウ。 新たなエサを、星をもとめて……。 この星は持ち直シマス。 人間さえいなければ……。 そして私達ロボットの新しい世界が きずかれるのデス。 鉄の国……、にくしみも悲しみもない ユートピアが。 私達こそが人間にかわる新しい『種』 なのデス。 もうムダな事はやめナサイ。 あきらめて眠りナサイ……。
re: 'LiSTEN, foolish fragile defective living creatures...... Lavos's children WILL LIKELY return to space soon. Seeking new PREY, new planets...... This planet WILL recoVER. If only humans weren't here...... And the new world of we robots WILL be constructed. A country of iron...... a utopia with neither hatred nor sorrow. We are the new "species" that WILL take the place of humans. StOP your USELESS efforts already. Give up and sluMBER......

eng: You did well to come this far. I am the Mother Brain of the R-Y series factory. Come Prometheus, you must once again join us. I'll reset your circuitry and erase your memories. Then we'll dispose of these filthy humans.
jap: 「よくココまでたどりつきマシタ……。 ワタシがRーYタイプ製造工場の メインコンピュータデス。 いらっしゃいプロメテス……。 アナタの目をさまさせてあげマス。 メインの回路をリセットシマショウ。 これまでの記憶を全部消し去って あげマショウ。 それから、そこの目ざわりな人間どもを かたづけマショウ。
re: 'You HAVE done well to struggle on THIS far...... I AM the R-Y type manufacturing factory main computer. Welcome, Promethes...... LET US make YOU open your eyes. LET US reset your main circuits. LET US erase all of your memories up until now. And then, LET US take care of those eyesore humans there.

jap: 残ねんデスガ…… ワタシはもう失うわけには いかないノデス……。 ワタシの中の大切な記憶も かけがえのない仲間達も……。

jap: 「アナタ、ワタシまでも裏切って 人間につくと……？ すべてのロボットを敵にまわすと 言うのデスカ？

jap: ワタシは人間に…… クロノや、マール、ルッカ カエルサン、エイラサン…… ワタシの仲間達に…… かけてみたくなったのデス。

jap: 「フフ…… アハハ…… アーッハッハッ……！ わらわせないでプロメテス！ アナタには、かけるものなど 何もないのデス！ アナタの希望がどれほどちっぽけか 思い知らせてあげマス！ 「………プ……、プロメ……テス…… どう……シ………テ……
re: 'Hu, hu...... A, ha, ha...... Aaah, hah, hah......! Don't make me laugh, Promethes! YOU have no such thing as anything to take a chance with! I SHALL make you realize how minuscule YOUR hope is! '.........P...... Prome...... thes...... W......h.........y......

eng: This is the ancient Sun Stone? It doesn't seem to have an ounce of energy left in it. We could probably recharge it with sunlight, but that would take aeons.
jap: これは古代の太陽石？ 長い時間がたって 光を失ってしまったのね……。 もう1度、光をあてればエネルギーを とりもどせるかもしれないわ。 でもたぶん気の遠くなるほど 長い時間が必要ね。
re: This is the Sun Stone of the Ancient Era? It's lost its light as the long time passed...... If we expose it to light once again, it might be able to regain its energy. But it's probably going to need such a long time it makes me feel faint.

eng: This is the ancient Sun Stone? The years must have robbed it of its sparkle. But if we expose it to sunlight for approximately 65.2167 million years we just might be able to recharge it.
jap: これは古代の太陽石？ 長い時間がたって 光を失っているようデス。 しかしもう一度、光をあて続ければ エネルギーをとりもどせるかも しれません。 私のすいそくでは6500万年 以上は必要でしょう。
re: This is the Sun Stone of the Ancient Era? It SEEMS that it has lost its light as the long time passed. However, if we continue exposing it to light once again, it may be able to regain its energy. By my conjecture, it will probably require at least 65 million years.

eng: So this is the Sun Stone. Its power has been lost over time. With the sun's energy, it could be recharged. But it'll take over 65 million years.
jap: ほう、太陽石だな。 長い時のうちに 光を失ってしまったか。 しかしもう一度、太陽の光を あて続ければエネルギーを とりもどせるだろう。 6500万年以上は必要だろうがな。
re: Oh? It's the Sun Stone. So it's lost its light during the long time. But if we continue to expose it to the sun's light once more, it will probably be able to regain its energy. Probably needs at least 65 million years.

eng: Isn't this the ancient Sun Stone? But it no longer glows... Maybe it will regain its glow if we keep it in the sunlight! Might take a while, though.
jap: これって古代の 太陽石じゃない？ けど光らなくなってるよ……。 もう一度、光をあて続ければ 光をとりもどせるかも。 う～ん。　でも、きっと すっごい長い時間が必要ね。
re: Isn't this the Sun Stone from the Ancient Era? But it's stopped shining...... If we keep on exposing it to light again, it might be able to regain its light. Hmm. But, it's sure gonna need a reeaally long time.

eng: 'Tis the ancient Sun Stone! But it lacketh luster. Perhaps the sun can rekindle it! But how long will that take?
jap: これは古代の 太陽石ってやつか？ 全く光らなくなってるな。 もう一度光をあて続ければ 戻るかもしれないな。 けど、太陽の力をためるって どんくらいの時間が必要なんだ。
re: This is that Sun Stone thing from the Ancient Era? It's stopped shining entirely. If we keep exposing it to light once more, it might turn back. But how much time it would need to store up the sun's power.
RetranslatorComment: This isn't a question so much as a statement of awe.

eng: Wow, sunlight! This must be the sun's favorite spot.

re: The sun's light...... This has got to be the place most loved by the sun.

re: It, it is NOT here!! The Darkness Stone is NOT anywhere...... HOWEVER, it SEEMS that considerable time has passed since it disappeared. Let us try going back in bit in eras.

jap: な、ないぞ！！ 暗黒石が…… けど、なくなってから ずいぶんたっているみたいだな。 他の時代に行ってみようぜ。
