re: Got a Black Vest!

eng: You're interested in the Moon Stone? Well, someone simply left it here. Seems important to you folks. Why don't you take it!
jap: 暗黒石？　ああそれなら旅のわかものが ここに置いていったんですよ。 あなたがたには大切な物のようだ。 どうぞ持っていってください！
re: Darkness Stone? Ah, if you mean that, a young traveler left it here. It seems to be something important to you. Please feel free to take it with you!
RetranslatorComment: And who is this young traveler anyway?

eng: Share and share alike! Help the needy! Thinkin' about makin' THAT the town motto.
jap: 困っている人には手をさしのべる！ これをこの町のモットーにしようと 思うんですよ。
re: To those in trouble, we hold out a hand! I think I'll make this into this town's motto.

eng: The person I like most? My dad, of course!
jap: この世で1番好きな人？ もちろん父さんよ！
re: The person I like most in this world? My father, of course!

eng: I love my daddy!
jap: 僕、お父さん大好き！
re: I love my dad!

eng: I wish my husband were a little less generous.
jap: うちの人、よくがなくてねえ…… もう少し、がめつくてもいいのに。 ウチョよね？
re: My husband has no avarice...... It would be okay if he were a little more greedy.

eng: Everyone thinks DAD.'s generous. Does that mean they think he's cool? Who knows.
jap: うちのパパは、きまえがいいって みんなが言うの。 『きまえ』って『かっこう』のことかチラ。 だったら、ちがうわよね！
re: Everyone theth daddy'th generouth. I wonder if “generouth” meanth “cool”. If it doth, they're wrong!

eng: White Vest's power up! Received White Mail! Black Vest's power up! Received Black Mail!
jap: ホワイトベストがバージョンアップ！ ホワイトプレートを手に入れた！ ブラックベストがバージョンアップ！ ブラックプレートを手に入れた！
re: White Vest version up! Got a White Plate! Black Vest version up! Got a Black Plate!
RetranslatorComment: It's like level up, I guess.

eng: Amazing! With THIS much energy I can make a powerful weapon! Let's go back to my house now!
jap: すごい…… これだけのエネルギーがあれば 強力な武器が作れそうだわ！ さっそく私の家にいきましょう！！
re: Amazing...... If I have this much energy, I should be able to make a powerful weapon! Let's go to my house right away!!

eng: This really is the Sun Stone! With this energy, I can make an incredible weapon! Let's get back to my house quickly!
jap: まさに、太陽石ね…… これだけのエネルギーがあれば 強力な武器が作れそうだわ！ さっそく私の家にいきましょう！！
re: It sure is the Sun Stone...... If I have this much energy, I should be able to make a powerful weapon! Let's go to my house right away!!
RetranslatorComment: Ｉ think the use of まさに here means more that the name fits it perfectly than anything else.

eng: Acck! This is amazing! Lucca can surely put this to good use! Let's show it to her!
jap: キャッ！　すご～い！ ねえ、ルッカならこれ使って 何か作れるでしょ？ ルッカに見せてみよう！
re: Kyah! Amaaazing! Hey, if it's Lucca, she could use this to make something, right? Let's try showing Lucca!
RetranslatorComment: The use of  ルッカ_なら_ in most of these lines means that  while most people couldn't do a thing with it, Lucca could.

eng: My sensors read high energy levels. Lucca may be able to use this. Let us show it to her.
jap: スゴいエネルギー反応デス。 ルッカさんなら、コレを使えるかも 知れマセン…… ルッカさんを呼びマショウ。
re: It IS an AMAZIing energy reaction. If it is Lucca-san, she MAY be able to use THIS...... LET US call Lucca-san.

eng: T, 'tis amazing...! What might Lucca create with it? She must see this!
jap: こ、こりゃスゲえ…… ルッカなら、こいつを使って 何か作れるかもな…… ルッカに見せるか？
re: Th, this's amazing...... If it's Lucca, maybe she could use this and make something...... Are we going to show Lucca?

eng: Wow! The sun! Lucca maybe use? Bring Lucca here!
jap: すごい！　お日様！！ そうだ！　ルッカなら　これ 使えるかも。　ルッカ呼ぶ！
re: Wow! Sun!! Oh! If Lucca, maybe can use this. We call Lucca!

eng: The Sun Stone has regained its luster but... How might we harness its energy?
jap: 太陽石が輝きを 取り戻したか…… しかし、このエネルギー どう使う……？
re: So the Sun Stone has regained its radiance...... But how to use this energy......?

eng: I'll modify the Sun Stone to extract its energy...
jap: 太陽石エネルギーを あつかいやすいパワーにせいぎょし…
re: Regulate the Sun Stone energy into a power that's easy to handle...

eng: ...then, we'll just vacuum pack it into a cartridge...
jap: しんくうカートリッジに パッケージング……。
re: Package it into a vacuum cartridge......

eng: ...and it's finished!
jap: 完成したわ！
re: Finished!

eng: Sometimes I amaze myself!
jap: シビれるゥ……。
re: I'm going numb......

eng: Take a look Lucca! I borrowed a bit of the Sun Stone to create something nifty!
jap: 見ろルッカ！ わしも負けずにつくったぞ。 太陽石をちょっくらはいしゃくしてな。
re: Look, Lucca! I didn't lose either, and I've made this borrowing a smidgen of the Sun Stone's energy.

eng: He is resisting my attacks!
jap: ダメージヲあたえられマセン！
re: We canNOT inflict damage!

eng: It's like rock!
jap: こいつ　カタすぎる！
re: He too hard!

eng: What kind of shield IS THAT?!
jap: なんてケタ外れの防御力！
re: What extraordinary defense power!

eng: My sword hath no effect!
jap: チッ！　剣がきかないとは！
re: Damn! How can my sword not work!

eng: Nothing can touch it!
jap: 攻撃しても、はじかれちゃう！
re: However we attack, it's just repelled!

eng: Cyrus...
jap: サイラス……
re: Cyrus!?

jap: ……レン…… グ……レ…… グ……レ……ン…… グ　　　レ　　　ン　　！

eng: Cyrus?! 'Tis me, Glenn!!
jap: サイラス！？ 俺だ！　グレンだ！！
re: Cyrus!? It's me! It's Glenn!!

eng: ...Wh...what G...l...e...n...n? Grrrrrrr!
jap: ……、ウ…… グ…レ………ン……？ ヌグォォォォァァッ！

eng: There's an old structure to the north. It's been in ruins for ages.
jap: この町の北に、大昔のとりでのあとがある。 もう廃墟になってから 何びゃく年にもなるという話じゃ。
re: North of this town is what's left of an ancient fortress. They say it's been hundreds of years already since it went to ruin.

eng: Ghosts lurk in the ruins.
jap: 町の北にある廃墟には、ゆうれいが 出るんですって！
re: Ghosts show up in the ruins north of town, they say!

eng: They say some brain-dead ghost hangs out in the ruins to the north.
jap: ね～ね～、奥様、聞いたザマスか？ 北の廃墟に、ゆうれいが出るという ウワサざましょ？
re: Hey, hey, have you heard, ma'am? There's rumors that ghosts show up in the Northern Ruins, you know?

eng: Scary!
jap: アラ、コワい！
re: Oh my, that's scary!

eng: Spirits, still attached to the real world, live in places like that.
jap: この世に、みれんのあるゆうれい達が あつまるんザマスよ、ああいう場所には……
re: Places like that, ghosts with regrets in this world gather......

eng: The anguish of tormented spirits has created a negative energy that surrounds the ruins.
jap: 北の廃墟にはうずまいておる…… 400年もの間、ちくせきされ続けた おんねんが……
re: Suffusing the Northern Ruins...... A deep grudge accumulated over 400 years......

eng: I'd stay away from the ruins! The structural damage is severe.
jap: え？　北の廃墟にいくつもりなの？ あそこの地下は、あちこちいたみが はげしいから、危ないわよ。
re: Huh? You intend to go to the Northern Ruins? The basement there has severe damage all over, so it's dangerous.

eng: The Black Omen sparkles in the sun! Tomorrow should be clear, too.
jap: 黒の夢が、はっきりと見えるわい。 明日もはれるじゃろう。
re: I can see the Black Dream distinctly. Tomorrow should be clear too.

eng: 10G a night. Will you stay?
jap: いっぱく10Gになります。 おとまりになられますか？
re: One night's stay is 10G. Will you be staying?

eng: Yes
jap: はい
re: Yes

eng: No
jap: いいえ
re: No

eng: Not enough money.
jap: お金が足りませんね。
re: You don't have enough money.

eng: Come on in!
jap: いらっしゃい！
re: Welcome!

eng: All the young 'uns went to the Millennial Fair. Kids are just gluttons for fun.
jap: 町のわかものはみんな、ガルディア王国の 千年祭にあそびに行ってしもうた。 これだから最近のわかいもんは……
re: All the town's young ones went to Guardia Kingdom's Millennial Festival to have fun. That's why the young lately are so......

eng: The adventurer Toma's grave is on the western cape. He only failed to find the Rainbow Shell.
jap: 西の岬には、いだいな探検家トマの墓が あるんじゃよ。 だが、そんなトマも、虹の貝がらという 宝だけは、手に入れられなかったそうじゃ。
re: The great explorer Toma's grave is on the Western Cape. But it seems that even Toma just wasn't able to obtain the rainbow shell.

eng: Not a single sale! And I came all the way from Porre. You, will you please buy something ?
jap: さっぱり売れやしねェ。 わざわざパレポリから来たってのによォ。 あんた、何か買っていってくれよ。
re: Can't sell a thing. And I went to the trouble of coming from Parepoley. You there, buy something.

eng: Heard about the ghost?
jap: ねえ、あなた達、知ってる？ あの、ゆうれいの話……
re: Hey, did you guys know? About that ghost......

eng: Yes.
jap: はい
re: Yes

eng: Oh? Then beat it!
jap: なんだ、知ってるの。 つまんないなァ。
re: Oh, you knew. Boring.

eng: No.
jap: いいえ
re: No

eng: A Ghost Knight roams the Northern Ruins! Isn't that a trip?
jap: 北の廃墟に、昔の、りっぱな騎土の姿を したゆうれいが出るんですって！ ホラーな話よねェ、ワクワク。
re: They say a ghost in the form of a fine knight from the past comes out in the Northern Ruins! It's like a horror story, so exciting.

eng: Hey, bring some more soda!
jap: う～い～ もっと酒持ってこ～い！
re: Wheee Bring more sake!

eng: Sir, I think you've had enough sugar today.
jap: お客さん、ちょいと飮みすぎだよ。
re: Sir, you've had a bit too much to drink.

eng: Pipe down! I'll tell you when I've had enough! Can't you see I love soda pop? Nothing like soda pop to quench your thirst!
jap: うるせェ、人が気持ちよく飮んでんのに！ 大工が酒を飮んで、何が悪いってんだ！ このまったりとした、したがとろけるような コクと味わい…… く～ッ！　たまらんねェぜ！
re: Shaddup, a guys's drinkin and feelin good! What's wrong witha carpenter drinkin' sake!? This rich body and flavor that enchant the tongue...... Khuuu! Can' help m'self!

eng: When I grow up, I'm gonna be a carpenter, just like daddy!
jap: ボク、大きくなったら パパみたいな大工になるんだ！
re: I'm gonna become a carpenter like papa when I grow up!

eng: My husband's never around! I'm gonna show him who's BOSS. Next time, POW, right in the kisser!
jap: うちの亭主ときたら 酒場で飮んだくれてばかり！ 今度、ガツーンとおこってやらなきゃ。
re: That husband of mine is always getting drunk off his ass at the bar! I've gotta beat some sense into him this time.

eng: There's something eerie about the Northern Ruins.
jap: 北の廃墟…… あそこには、なにか不気味な ただならぬものを感じるのじゃ……
re: The Northern Ruins...... I can feel some uncommonly eerie something there......

eng: We're only trainees. The boss is at his favorite cafe.
jap: おいらは大工みならいさ。 親方なら、酒場でのんだくれてるよ。
re: We're apprentice carpenters. ass at the bar.

eng: My tools have been stolen! I can't get any work done now.
jap: だいくどうぐが、ぬすまれちまった…… しごとになんねーよ、これじゃ。
re: My carpentry tools got stolen...... Can't do my job, not like this.

eng: I wish Toma would stay put for a change.
jap: トマ…… ずっとこの村にいてくれればいいのに……
re: Toma...... I wish he would stay in this town forever......

eng: Toma's off to find the Rainbow Shell.
jap: トマは、虹色の貝がらを探すとか言って また旅に出たみたいじゃの。
re: It looks like Toma went on a trip again, saying he'd look for the Rainbow-Colored Shell or something.

eng: 10 years ago a beast was seen carrying something into the Northern Ruins. Treasure, perhaps?!
jap: 10年くらい前、この村の北にある廃墟に 魔物がなにか運び込んだらしいよ。 宝物じゃないかってウワサだけど……
re: I hear a monster carried something into the ruins north of this town about ten years ago. Rumor says it might be treasure......

eng: Hey  [member1], I've finally got a lead on the Rainbow Shell. But there's something odd going on... Oh, can you hang on to this for me?
jap: よう、[pc1]。 俺は、ついに虹色の貝がらの しかし、今度ばかりはヤバいかんじが するんだ。 そうそう、こいつをあんたに あずけとくぜ。
re: Yo, [char1]. I finally found a lead on the Rainbow-Colored But, just this once, I'm getting a dangerous sort of feeling. Oh yeah, I'll leave this with you.

eng: If I don't return, come to my grave and pour this on my headstone. Gee, isn't this morbid?
jap: もし俺が死んだら、俺の墓に この酒をかけてくれよ。
re: If I die, pour this sake on my grave.
RetranslatorComment: kanji for 'grave' fixed

eng: I wonder where Toma's off to now?
jap: ああ…… トマは今ごろ、どこを旅してるのかしら……
re: Ahh...... I wonder where Toma's traveling now......?

eng: You wanna borrow my tools? Be my guest! I'm busy here, so go get them from my wife.
jap: へ？　大工道具をかせ？ 別にかまわんが、どーする気だ？ ……、ま、いーや。 俺はもーちょい飮んで行くから 道具はかみさんから受け取ってくれや。
re: Huh? Lend my carpentry tools? I dun really care, but whatcha gonna do with em'? ......ah, never min'. I'm gonna drink summore before I go, so get an' the tools from my wife.

eng: What? His tools? Oh, hold on, they're right here.
jap: え、大工道具？ ちょっと待ってておくれ。
re: Huh, carpentry tools? Wait a sec.

eng: Careful with 'em.
jap: 大事につかっとくれよ。
re: Use them with care.

eng: You've got some tools there. Will you lend them to a buddy?
jap: おっ、あんた。 だいくどうぐを持ってるじゃねーか。 おいらにゆずってくれよ？
re: Oh, it's you. You got carpenter tools, doncha? You gonna give 'em to me?

eng: Yes.
jap: はい
re: Yes

eng: Thanks a lot. Now I can get to work!
jap: おっ、ありがとよ。 これでしごとが出来るぜ！
re: Oh, thanks. Now I can do my job!

eng: No.
jap: いいえ
re: No

eng: Sigh...
jap: がっくし……
re: Dammit......

eng: Thanks for lending me those tools. Now I can finally get to work! I guess I'll start with the ruins! C'mon, you lazy blokes!
jap: さっきはあんがとよ。 これでおいらも、しごとが出来るぜ！ よし！　手はじめに、北の廃墟でも 修理してくるかァ！ 野郎ども、行くぜ！
re: Thanks for before. Now I can do my job too! All right! To start with, I guess I'll fix up the Northern Ruins or something! We're going, ya maggots!

eng: Whatever you say boss!
jap: あいよ！　親方！
re: Gotcha! Boss!

eng: We're done for now.
jap: 修理しといたぜ。
re: We fixed it.

eng: We can't repair the spots where the monsters hide. Call us after you get rid of them. We'll do the rest.
jap: モンスターが巣食っている場所は 修理出来ねーんだ。 フロアのモンスターをぜんめつさせたら また、たのみにきな。 おいら達が修理してやるぜ。
re: We can't fix the places where the monsters are hanging out. When a floor's monsters are all wiped out, come ask us again. We'll fix it for ya.

eng: You want the Northern Ruins repaired? It'll cost you 2000 G.
jap: 北の廃墟の修理？
re: Fixing the Northern Ruins? It'll take 2,000G.

eng: Yes
jap: 2000Gかかるぜ。
re: Pay

eng: No
jap: はらう
re: Don't pay

eng: It ain't gonna happen without the cash.
jap: 金がねーんじゃ、無理だぜ。
re: If you ain't got the money, it ain't happening.

eng: Cyrus, the fool who challenged Magus rests here.
jap: 魔王に戦いをいどんだ、おろかな男 サイラス、ここに眠る。
re: Cyris, a foolish man who challenged Magus in battle, sleeps here.

eng: Cyrus. I hath returned. I shall honor my promise to thee!
jap: サイラス…… サイラスよ、俺は帰って来た。 おさなき日のちかいを、
re: Cyrus...... Cyrus, I've returned. To fulfill the oath of that youthful day,

eng: Glenn... Thank you...for making the journey here.
jap: グレン…… よく…… よくここまで、来てくれた……
re: Glenn...... Well...... Well done to have come so far for me......

eng: Dear Cyrus... Thou must...think ill of me.
jap: サイラス…… 俺を……、うらんでいるのだろう……
re: Cyrus...... You're...... feeling bitter towards me, aren't you......?

eng: On the contrary! You have come far, my friend. When Magus defeated me, I thought of all those whom I had left behind. King Guardia, Queen Leene, and of course, you...
jap: フフ…… なかった…… この体を魔王の炎にやかれた時 思い、千々にみだれた。 ガルディア王…… リーネ王妃…… 魔王…… そして…… 親友のお前の事を……
re: Hu, hu...... When my body was done in by Magus's behind in this world and was disturbed into pieces. Of King Guardia...... Queen Leene...... Magus...... And...... Of you, my best friend......

eng: Your skill and dedication is superior! I can rest now, knowing that everyone is in good hands. Good bye, my friend!
jap: だが、長い時間をかけてえた お前の強さは本物のはずだ…… これで心おきなく眠りにつける……
re: However, the strength you have won over this long time ought to be the real thing...... With this, I can reach sleep with no regrets......

eng: Cyrus, wait! I... I...!
jap: ま、待ってくれ、サイラス！ 俺は…… 俺は………！

eng: The Queen... Look after Queen Leene. Alas, and...farewell...G...le...n...n...
jap: 王妃を…… リーネ様をたのむ…… さらばだ…… 我が友　グ……レ………ン…………
re: The Queen...... Take care of Leene-sama...... Farewell...... My friend G......le.........nn............

eng: Cyyyruuus!!!
jap: サイラァーーーースッ！
re: Cyruuuuuus!

eng: I'm so sorry, Cyrus.
jap: すまなかった…… サイラス……
re: I'm sorry...... Cyrus......

eng: The Masamune?!
jap: グ、グランドリオンが？
re: Th, the Grandleon?

eng: 'Tis flowing with strength and vigor.
jap: この……みなぎる力……
re: This...... overflowing power......

eng: Heh heh That's it!
jap: 「フフ…… 「そうさ！
re: 'Hu, hu...... 'Right!

eng: That was special!
jap: あんたは、なやんでたろ。
re: You were troubled, weren't you.

eng: Quite. I guess it means that a Hero's power comes from within.
jap: 勇者の強さは、意思の強ささ！
re: A Hero's strength is strength of will!

eng: Mucho metaphysical, man.
jap: 罪ほろぼしのためなんかじゃない。
re: It's not to atone for sins or anything like that.
RetranslatorComment: Guess this was too religious. The willpower speech is much better.

eng: Like, MIND over matter, Mune!
jap: あんたの意思が、今、本当の強さを 持ったのさ！
re: Your will, just now, had true strength!

eng: My... mind?
jap: 俺の……意思……！

eng: Now for a yummy, full-on test!
jap: これで、心おきなくボクらも 力を出せるね、兄ちゃん！
re: With this, we can let out our power with no regrets too, nii-chan!

eng: It's thrashin' time!
jap: そうだな、リオン！
re: You got it, Leon!

eng: Ahh! 'Tis the true identity of the Masamune!!
jap: これが…… これが グランドリオンの本当の姿なのか！！
re: This...... So THIS is the Grandleon's true form!!

eng: Cyrus, I promise to fulfill your wishes!
jap: サイラスよ、俺は行く。 お前のこころざしをつぐため……。
re: Cyrus, I'm going. To fulfill your aspirations......

eng: 'Tis a sad farewell!
jap: お前への最後のはなむけだ！
re: My final parting gift to you!

eng: Onward, all!
jap: さ、行くぞ……。
re: Come on, we're going......

eng: Cyrus sleeps here, avenged by his friend Glenn.
jap: そのおもいを親友グレンにたくして 勇者サイラス、ここに眠る。
re: The Hero Cyrus, who entrusted his hopes to his best friend Glenn, sleeps here.

eng: That's it for now.
jap: もう、おいら達が修理出来る場所は 残ってないぜ。
re: There aren't any places left any more that we can repair.

eng: I await thee, Free Lancer!
jap: 見きったり フリーランサー！！
re: Saw right through it, Freelancer!!
RetranslatorComment: He knew it was coming!

eng: It starts glowing in Frog's hand! You got the Gold Rock!
jap: それは、カエルの手の中で さんぜんと光り輝いた……！！ 金の石を手に入れた！
re: It shone brilliantly within Frog's hand......!! Got the Gold Stone!

eng: A changed frog art I!
jap: 俺はもう、以前の俺とは 違うぜ……！！
re: I am now different from my former self......!!

eng: Kali Blade level up! Got 1  [item]! Level Up for Siren! Got 1  [item]! Nova Armor level up! Got 1  [item]! Something is reacting to the pendant. Take out the contents?
jap: おにまるがバージョンアップ！ [item]を手に入れた！ セイレーンがバージョンアップ！ [item]を手に入れた！ ノヴァアーマーがバージョンアップ！ [item]を手に入れた！ ペンダントに反応して中の物が光りだした。 なかみを取り出しますか？
re: Onimaru version up! Got Suzaku! Siren version up! Got Valkyrie! Nova Armor version up! Got Moonlight Armor! Something inside reacted to the pendant and began glowing. Remove the contents?

eng: Yes.
jap: はい
re: Yes

eng: No.
jap: いいえ
re: No

eng: Sir Cyrus, a Knight of the Square Table, is buried north of here.
jap: この村の北にある勇者の墓。 あそこには、ガルディア王国の騎土 サイラス様がほうむられておるのじゃ。
re: The Hero's Tomb is north of this town. Cyrus-sama, Knight of Guardia Kingdom, is entombed there.

eng: Cyrus's grave is up north. It's a great place for a picnic!
jap: この村の北には、あのサイラス様のお墓が あるのさ。　一度行ってみなよ。
re: THE Cyrus-sama's grave is north of this town. Try going some time.

eng: A Hero's grave is to the north. 400 years ago, the knight Cyrus fell while protecting our Kingdom from Magus.
jap: この村の北には、勇者の墓がある。 400年前、ガルディア王国を救わんとして 単身、魔王に戦いをいどんだ勇者 サイラス様が眠る場所だ。
re: North of this town is the Hero's Tomb. It's the place where the Hero Cyrus-sama, who challenged Magus to combat unaided in an attempt to save Guardia Kingdom, sleeps.

eng: The tale of Glenn, Cyrus and Magus is known to all.
jap: 400年前、魔王と戦った 勇者サイラスとその親友グレンの話…… 遠い昔の伝説です。
re: The story of the Hero Cyrus who fought Magus, and his best friend Glenn...... It's a legend from long ago.

eng: I'm bored... Maybe I'll check out the Millennial Fair!
jap: ヒマよねェ…… 私もガルディア王国の千年祭に 行ってみようかしら？
re: Nothing's going on...... Maybe I'll try going to Guardia Kingdom's Millennial Festival too?

eng: A peaceful world is a boring world...
jap: 平和すぎる世の中というものも ツマラないものザマスことよ、ホホホ。
re: If the world's too peaceful, that means it's boring, ho, ho, ho.

eng: Cyrus, our town's guardian angel, rests in a grave to the north.
jap: この村の北にある勇者の墓。 あそこにほうむられておるサイラス様は この町のまもり神じゃ。
re: The Hero's Tomb is north of this town. Cyrus-sama, entombed there, is this town's guardian deity.

eng: Huh? When do I work? That's none of your business!
jap: え？　いつも酒場にばかりいて いつ大工のしごとをしているのかって？ カタイことはいいっこなしだぜ！
re: Huh? When do I do my carpentry job if I'm always in the bar? Don't worry 'bout the hard stuff!
RetranslatorComment: Not sure about the last sentence.

eng: Hey, do you know the story about Cyrus and his best friend?
jap: ねえ、あなた達、知ってる？ あの、サイラス様とその親友の話……
re: Hey, did you guys know? About that Cyrus-sama and his best friend......

eng: Yes.
jap: はい
re: Yes

eng: No.
jap: いいえ
re: No

eng: Cyrus's best friend, Glenn, used a legendary sword to beat the Magus's troops.
jap: サイラス様には、グレンという名前の 親友がいたんですって！ そのグレンという人は、サイラス様が 魔王に殺された後、伝説の剣を手に 魔王軍と戦ったそうよ。 男の友情よねェ、うるうる。
re: Cyrus-sama had a best friend named Glenn! They say that Glenn took up the legendary sword and fought Magus's army after Cyrus-sama was killed by Magus. That's male camaraderie, how moving.

eng: Ancient scrolls tell us that if you combine the Rainbow Shell with a Sun Stone, you can make a fearsome weapon!
jap: 伝説の太陽石って知ってるか？ トマ1世が[pc1]ってヤツに 先をこされた虹の貝がらって宝と かけあわせると、すっげェ武器が 作れるらしいぜ。 古代の書物で見つけた情報だ。
re: Know about the legendary Sun Stone? Seems you can make an amazing weapon if you cross it with the rainbow shell treasure that Toma the 1st got beaten to by some [char1] person. Found that info in an ancient book.

eng: The Great Adventurer Toma Levine rests here... 3/6/634
jap: 王国歴　634．3．6 いだいなる探検家　トマ・レバイン ここに眠る……。
re: 3/6, Kingdom Year 634. The great explorer Toma Levine sleeps here......

eng: [member1], long time no see. I've located the Rainbow Shell.
jap: よう[pc1]、ひさしぶりだな。 ついに、虹色の貝がらを見つけたぜ。
re: Yo, [char1], long time no see. I finally found the Rainbow-Colored Shell.

eng: To the northwest of this cape is a large island called the Giant's Claw. You can find the Shell there.
jap: この岬から北西の海上に 巨人のツメと呼ばれる島がある。 虹色の貝がらは、そこにある。
re: There's an island called Giant's Claw on the ocean northwest from this cape. The Rainbow-Colored Shell is there.

eng: But beware! There are many beasts about!
jap: しかし、気をつけな。 あそこにゃ化け物がわんさといるぜ。
re: But be careful. There's hordes of monsters over there.

eng: Time to shove off.
jap: じゃあ、そろそろお別れだ。
re: Well, it's time I left.

eng: You guys are a riot a minute! See ya!
jap: やっぱり、お前と飮む酒は最高だぜ。 あばよ……。
re: The sake I drink with you really is the best. See ya......

eng: Toma's crumpled note: «Those holes! What if I jump into them on purpose? Yes! I'll start back at the beginning, and...»
jap: トマの書いたらしいメモが落ちている…… 『落としあな…もしかしてわざと落ちる？ ちっ…でなおしてくるか……』
re: A memo that it seems Toma wrote has fallen...... "The pit... maybe fall deliberately? Tch... start over......?"

eng: Is this the Tyrano Lair?
jap: ティラン城？
re: Tyran Castle?

eng: Is this the Tyrano Lair?
jap: ティラン城？
re: Tyran Castle?

eng: Looks like the Reptites' castle.
jap: ココハ恐竜人の 城のようデスネ。
re: THIS appears to BE the castle of the Dinomen.

eng: The Tyrano Lair?
jap: ティラン城か？
re: Tyran Castle?

eng: What!! Why Reptites' castle here?
jap: ゾワー！！ 恐竜人の城　なんでこんなとこ　ある？
re: Zowaa!! Why Dinomen's castle in place like this?

eng: A prehistoric castle?
jap: 原始時代の城か？
re: A castle of the Primeval era?

eng: This must have been pushed underground when Lavos fell to earth.
jap: ラヴォスが落ちてきたときに 地中深くうまって……　そのまま遺跡に なっていたのね。
re: When Lavos came falling it was buried deep underground...... and it stayed like it was and became an ancient ruin.

eng: When Lavos fell, this became buried beneath the earth.
jap: ラヴォス落下時に 地中深くにうまって遺跡化したのね。
re: When Lavos fell it was buried deep underground and became an ancient ruin.

eng: This must have been pushed underground when Lavos fell to earth.
jap: ラヴォス落下時に 地中にうまり、そのまま遺跡に なったのデスネ。
re: When Lavos fell, it was buried underground, then stayed as it was and BECAME an ancient ruin.

eng: When Lavos came hither, this place was buried beneath the land!
jap: ラヴォスが落ちてきた時 地中深くうまり…… そのまま遺跡になったってわけか……。
re: When Lavos came falling it was buried deep underground...... so this means it stayed like it was and became an ancient ruin......?

eng: Lavos fall and Tyrano Lair buried underground forever!
jap: ラヴォス　ふってきた時 ティラン城　うまった。 そのまま　ずーっと　地面の下……！
re: When Lavos rained down Tyran Castle buried. It stay same looong time under ground......!

eng: Prehistoric castle...
jap: 原始の城……
re: A Primeval castle......

eng: THIS's the Rainbow Shell!
jap: これが虹色の貝がら！
re: This is the Rainbow-Colored Shell!

eng: The Rainbow Shell!
jap: これが虹色の貝がら！
re: This is the Rainbow-Colored Shell!

eng: The Rainbow Shell.
jap: 虹色の貝がらデスネ。
re: It IS the Rainbow-Colored Shell.

eng: Behold! The Rainbow Shell!
jap: フム。これが虹の貝がらか。
re: Hmm. So this is the rainbow shell.

eng: Pretty! Big! This Rainbow Shell? Can eat?
jap: きれい！　大きい！ これ　虹色の貝がらか？ 食べられるか？
re: Pretty! Big! This Rainbow-Colored Shell? Can eat?

eng: Rather drab, isn't it?
jap: 私には、にあわぬ色だ……。
re: The color doesn't suit me......

eng: It's heavy! We won't be able to carry it. Better get some help at the castle!
jap: 重～い！ これじゃあ運べないよ。 城からおうえんを呼んでこよう！
re: Heaaaavy! We can't move it like this. Let's go call for support from the castle!

eng: It's too heavy. Let's get some help at Guardia Castle.
jap: 重すぎるわね。 ガルディア城からおうえんを呼んで きましょう。
re: It's too heavy. Let's go call for support from Guardia Castle.

eng: It weighs a ton! We must get help from Guardia Castle.
jap: 重すぎマス。 ガルディア城からオウエンを 呼ばないと。
re: It IS too heavy. We must call for SUPPORT from Guardia Castle.

eng: Heavy, it be! Let's seek the King's counsel!
jap: 重い！ 王にお願いし、城からおうえんを 呼んで来よう。
re: Heavy! Let's go make a request to the king for support from the castle.

eng: Heavy heavy! Can't carry. Castle people help?
jap: おもい　おもい！ 運べない。城に　誰か　いないのか？
re: Heavy, heavy! Can't move. Nobody at castle?

eng: Who's going to carry this for us?
jap: 誰かに運ばせるか？
re: Can we get someone to move it?

eng: Hello! You're always welcome here. What can I do for you?
jap: よくぞ来た！ 君らは、いつでもかんげいするぞ。 ん？　どうされた？
re: Well come! We welcome you at any time. Hm? What's wrong?

eng: Well...
jap: 実は……
re: Actually......

eng: Um, well, it's...
jap: あ、あのですね……
re: Ah, well you see......

eng: We would like to ask a favor...
jap: お願いがあるのデスガ……
re: We HAVE a request......

eng: We asketh a favor...
jap: おそれながら、お願いが ございます……
re: Most respectfully, we have a request......

eng: Ayla have favor.
jap: エイラ　たのみ　ある。
re: Ayla have request.

eng: I get it. You want me to keep that huge shell safe here until the next century, right?
jap: なるほど、その島にある 大きな貝がらを、後世までほかんして ほしいと？
re: I see, you want me to keep the large shell that's on that island safe unto future generations?

eng: I ask for the sake of  [member1]. Please carry out their request.
jap: 他ならぬ、[pc1]達の たのみです。 私からもお願いします。
re: The request from none other than {char1} and the others. I implore you as well.

eng: Done! I shall obtain the shell and store it in the castle, as a national treasure. Knight Captain!
jap: あいわかった！ その虹色の貝がらとやら、城に運ばせ 家宝として代々、宝物庫に 安置させよう。 騎土団長！
re: Understood! I shall have that Rainbow-Colored Shell object moved to the castle and kept in a treasure storehouse as an heirloom for generations. Knight Captain!

eng: Yes, Majesty!
jap: は！
re: Sir!

eng: Go and obtain the Rainbow Shell, and bring it back in one piece!
jap: 巨人のツメにわたり、虹色の貝がらなる 巨大な貝を、何としても城に 持ちかえるのだ！
re: Cross to Giant's Claw, and bring the huge shell, the Rainbow-Colored Shell, back to the castle, no matter what it takes!

eng: At once, Sire!
jap: は、ただちに！
re: Yes sir, right away!

eng: Thank you, your Majesty! And Queen Leene too, of course!
jap: ありがとう、王様！リーネ！
re: Thanks, King! Leene!

eng: Thank you very much!
jap: ありがとうございます！
re: Thank you!

eng: Thank you very much!
jap: アリガトウゴザイマス！
re: THANK YOU!

eng: Thanks to thee, from one so humble.
jap: 私の様な者のため ありがとうございます。
re: Thank you for doing this for such a person as myself.

eng: You, good man! Strong! Ayla like!
jap: お前　いいヤツ！ エイラ　気に入ったぞ！
re: You good guy! Ayla like!

eng: It's heavy... But we'll manage!
jap: お、重～い～ でも、必ず城へ運びます！
re: H, heeeavyyy. But, we will unfailingly transport it to the castle!

eng: Okay, everyone! Lift!!!
jap: みんな～！ がんばれー！！
re: Everyone! Keep at it!!

eng: So,  [member1], you beat me to the Rainbow Shell? Nah, I'm not sour about it. I probably couldn't have handled the monsters... But I WILL find the Sun Stone first!
jap: よう、[pc1]、虹の貝がらを 見つけただって？ 気にするなって。 勝ち目がねェ。 さァて、次にねらうは伝説の太陽石だ！
re: Yo, [char1], I hear you found the rainbow shell? Don't worry about it. over there anyway. Okay, I'll aim for the legendary Sun Stone next!

eng: Why is there a different guard on duty at the castle every time I go there?
jap: 最近のガルディア城って 兵士の出入りが多いわね……。 そりゃお城なんだからっていったら そうだけどね。
re: There's been a lot of soldiers moving in and out of Guardia Castle lately...... Well, if you say it's because it's the castle, I guess you're right.

eng: The soldiers say the Chancellor's been acting funny.
jap: 城の兵士に聞いたんだが 最近、大臣の様子がなんか変だとか……。
re: I heard about it from the castle soldiers, the chancellor's seemed kind of strange lately......

eng: Hmm... It's taking forever for the King's parade to begin. I wonder if something's wrong?
jap: そういえば……、楽しみにしてる ガルディア王のパレード いつまでたってもはじまらない……。 どうしたんだろう？
re: Come to think of it...... King Guardia's parade that I'm looking forward to isn't starting however much time passes...... I wonder what's wrong?

eng: Sealed with a mysterious power... Reacting to the pendant, something inside begins to glow. Remove it?
jap: 不思議な力で封印されている……。 ペンダントに反応して中の物が光りだした。 なかみを取り出しますか？
re: It's sealed with a mysterious power...... Something inside reacted to the pendant and began glowing. Remove the contents?

eng: Yes.
jap: はい
re: Yes

eng: No.
jap: いいえ
re: No

eng: Level up for the Red Vest! Got the Red Mail!
jap: レッドベストがバージョンアップ！ レッドプレートを手に入れた！
re: Red Vest version up! Got a Red Plate!

eng: They say the King sold off the royal treasures.
jap: 王が代々伝わる家宝をひそかに 売り飛ばしたという事ですが……。
re: They say the king secretly sold off an heirloom that was passed down for generations......

eng: The trial of the century is about to begin. Who's, you ask? King Guardia's, of course!
jap: 間もなく裁判が始まります。 誰って？ ガルディア王の裁判です。
re: Before long, the trial will begin. 'Whose'? King Guardia's trial.

eng: I can't get anything done, with you standing around!
jap: 見はられてちゃ料理にしゅうちゅう 出来ないだろ！
re: How am I supposed to concentrate on cooking when I'm being watched!

eng: Cut the foolishness!
jap: よけいな事は言うな！
re: Don't say anything unnecessary!

eng: Jeez, I ain't gonna poison the Chancellor.
jap: 見はってなくたって大臣の料理に 毒なんかもりませんよ。
re: I wouldn't put poison or anything in the Chancellor's food even if you weren't keeping watch.

eng: The King ordered that the court be locked until the trial's over.
jap: 裁判が終わるまでは ふうさしろとの大臣のご命令です。
re: Until the trial ends, the Chancellor's orders are to close this off.
RetranslatorComment: It's the chancellor giving orders, not the king.

eng: Same thing on the left... But weren't there some stairs, over there?
jap: 左に同じです。 そこに、かいだんなんか あったっけな……？
re: Same as the left. Weren't there stairs or something there......?
RetranslatorComment: Still not sure what he means by 'the left'.

eng: No entry allowed!
jap: 通せません！
re: We cannot let you pass!

eng: Let me through!!
jap: 通しなさーい！！
re: LET US THROUUUGH!!

eng: Had any of you heard of the «Rainbow Shell?» I too, had no idea until I found this...
jap: みなさん！王家に伝わる家宝 『虹色の貝がら』をご存じですか？ 私もこれを見るまでは 知りませんでした。
re: Everyone! Do you know of the "Rainbow-Colored Shell" heirloom passed Until I saw this, I did not know of it either.

eng: It's an ancestral will. It says, «Unveil the Rainbow Shell to the people at the Millienal Fair.»
jap: ガルディアの遠い祖先の書いた 遺言です。 『千年の建国祭の時に 家宝『虹色の貝がら』を 国民の前にまつれ。』
re: It's a will that Guardia's distant ancestor wrote. "At the time of the National Foundation Millennial Festival, present the heirloom, "Rainbow-Colored Shell" before the people."

eng: What are you talking about?! We have no family heirlooms here!
jap: そんな物は知らん！ だいたい家宝などこの城にはない。
re: I know of no such thing! There's no such thing as an heirloom in this

eng: So this is a forgery? Why does the defendant deny the people a glimpse of the «Rainbow Shell?» Because he no longer HAS it!! He sold the heirloom for cash! Witness, please!
jap: これがニセモノとでも？ なぜヒコクは『虹色の貝がら』を 国民の前に出さないのか？ よくに目がくらんだヒコクはお金ほしさ に大事な家宝を売ってしまったのです。 さ、証人を……。
re: Are you suggesting this is a forgery? Why does the defendant not bring out the "Rainbow-Colored Shell" before the people? The defendant, dazzled by greed, sold the precious heirloom out of a want for money. Now, the witnesses......

eng: Wh, what is it, Nadia? We are conducting a trial here.
jap: な、何です王女様。裁判中です。
re: Wh, what is it, Princess? We're in the middle of a trial.

eng: Father!
jap: 父上！
re: Father!

eng: Nadia! The Chancellor is trying to frame me!
jap: おお、マールディアよ 私は大臣にはめられようとしている！
re: Oh, Marledia, I'm the victim of a framing attempt by the chancellor!

eng: He hurls insults! Confirm your innocence with proof!
jap: 人聞きが悪いですなあ。 しょうこさえあれば王の無実は 証明できるのですよ。
re: You're disreputable. If only you had proof, you could verify the king's innocence.

eng: Proof?
jap: しょうこ？
re: Proof?

eng: Yes. If he hasn't sold the heirloom, it should be in the castle. Show me the «Rainbow Shell,» and I'll accept his innocence, heh, heh...
jap: ええ もし家宝を売っていなければ 私の目の前に『虹色の貝がら』を 持って来られたのならば、無罪を みとめましょう。 ま、無理でしょうけどね……くく…。
re: Yes, because supposing that he hasn't sold the If you go bring the "Rainbow-Colored Shell" before my eyes, I shall admit the king's innocence. Well, I doubt that's possible, though...... ku, ku...

eng: Chancellor! What kind of trickery is this?!
jap: 大臣！　何をたくらんでおる？！
re: Chancellor! What are you plotting?!

eng: Remove them!
jap: さ、そいつらをつまみ出せ！
re: Now, throw them out!

eng: Princess, not even you may enter.
jap: だめです。 王女さまといえどもお通しできません。
re: We cannot. Even though you may be the princess, we cannot allow you to pass.

eng: What ARE you saying!? It's a lie! There IS no heirloom!
jap: 何言ってるの！ あれは大臣のでっちあげなのよ。 初めっから家宝なんてないのよ！！
re: What are you saying! That's the chancellor's made-up story. There's no such thing as an heirloom in the

eng: Aha! The «Rainbow Shell» we gave to my ancestor 400 years ago is still here.
jap: なるほど！ AD600年の王様…… つまり先祖さまにわたして来た 『虹色の貝がら』が400年たった 今でもしまってあるって言うのね？
re: I get it! You mean the "Rainbow-Colored Shell" we handed over to the King in A.D.600...... that is, my ancestor, is shut away even now that 400 years have passed, right?

eng: It's probably in the basement!
jap: 行きましょう。 きっと地下だわ！
re: Let's go. It's got to be in the basement!

eng: Find the «Rainbow Shell,» and we'll be able to prove the King's innocence!
jap: 『虹色の貝がら』を 持って行けば無実を証明出来るわ！
re: If we bring the "Rainbow-Colored Shell", we can prove his innocence!

eng: We changed history back in 600 A.D., so the «Rainbow Shell» should still be in the castle!
jap: わすれたの？ 私達がAD600年でやってきた事…。 歴史を変えたため、今の時代のこの城に 『虹色の貝がら』はあるはずなのよ！
re: Have you forgotten? What we did in A.D.600... Because we changed history, the "Rainbow-Colored Shell" should be in this castle in the current era!

eng: The «Rainbow Shell» will prove the King's innocence.
jap: 『虹色の貝がら』を 持っていけば無実を証明デキマス。
re: If we bring the "Rainbow-Colored Shell", we CAN prove his innocence.

eng: We altered history in 600 A.D.! The «Rainbow Shell» should be here in the castle.
jap: わすれマシタカ？ AD600年でやってきた事。 歴史を変えたため、今の時代のこの城に 『虹色の貝がら』があるはずなのデス。
re: HAVE you forgotten? What we did in A.D.600. Because we changed history, the "Rainbow-Colored Shell" should BE in this castle in the current era.

eng: 'Tis the «Rainbow Shell» that shall prove his innocence.
jap: 『虹色の貝がら』を 持って行けば無実を証明できるぜ。
re: If we bring the "Rainbow-Colored Shell", we can prove his innocence!

eng: Hast thou forgotten? History hath been changed, and the shell is within the castle.
jap: わすれたか？ 俺達がAD600年でやってきた事を。 歴史を変えたため、今の時代のこの城に 『虹色の貝がら』があるはずなんだ。
re: Have you forgotten? What we did in A.D.600. Because we changed history, the "Rainbow-Colored Shell" should be in this castle in the current era.

eng: Take «Rainbow Shell!» Save Marle's father!!
jap: 『虹色の貝がら』　持ってく！ マールの父親　助かる！！
re: Bring "Rainbow-Colored Shell"! Help Marle's father!!

eng: Remember Marle?! We ask old king save shell! «Rainbow Shell» here now!
jap: 思いだせ　マール！ エイラ達　むかしの王様 たのんだ！ 『虹色の貝がら』　今　この城ある！ ちがうか？
re: Remember, Marle! Aylas asked old times king! "Rainbow-Colored Shell" now in this castle! That wrong?

eng: Taking the «Rainbow Shell» to them will solve this problem.
jap: 『虹色の貝がら』を 持って行けばいいではないか……。
re: Shouldn't we just bring the "Rainbow-Colored Shell"......?

eng: Idiot! Have you forgotten our trip to 600 A.D.?
jap: バカめ、わすれたか？ AD600年でやってきた事を……。
re: You idiot, you forgot? What we did in A.D.600......

eng: The decision is about to be handed down. The King requests that no one enter or leave.
jap: まもなく判決が出ます。 それまで誰も出入りを許すなとの 大臣のご命令で。
re: A verdict will be reached before long. The Chancellor's orders are to allow no one in or out until then.

eng: This is the treasury. No entry permitted!
jap: ここは宝物庫です。 危険ですので入れません。
re: This is the treasure vault. It is dangerous, so you cannot enter.

eng: Ouch! A rat bit me!
jap: く…… ネズミにスネをかじられた。
re: Kh...... My leg got bitten by a rat.

eng: The boss is itching to avenge the grudge that's been in the family for 13 generations! Gee hee!
jap: 親分は13代にわたる うらみがはらせるってウキウキさ。 きっきっきっき！
re: It's so great the boss'll be able to avenge his 13-generation grudge. Kee, kee, kee, kee, kee!

eng: He's gonna frame the king! Ga haw!
jap: きっきっきっき！
re: Kee, kee, kee, kee!

eng: So there IS a plot! Let's hurry!
jap: やっぱりいんぼうよ！ 急ぎましょう！
re: There really is a conspiracy! Let's hurry!

eng: I confess. I bought it from the king. He said he needed the cash.
jap: ええ、たしかに王様から 買いましたよ。 大変お金に困られていた様子で……。
re: Yes, I definitely bought it from the King. He seemed to be having serious money troubles, and......

eng: Liar!! I've never even seen you before!
jap: うそをもうすな！ 私はお前など会ったこともない。
re: Don't lie! I've never even met you.

eng: Order in the court!
jap: せいしゅくに！
re: Silence!

eng: Heh heh. Was I convincing?
jap: へへ これでよかったかい？
re: Heh heh, Was that good?

eng: Perfect!
jap: グーだ！

eng: The Rainbow Shell!!
jap: あった！　虹色の貝がら！！
re: Here it is! The Rainbow-Colored Shell!!

eng: What's this...a letter?
jap: 何これ……、てがみ？
re: What's this...... a letter?

eng: There is a letter?
jap: 何デスカ、このてがみハ？
re: What IS it, this letter?

eng: Why, 'tis a letter?
jap: こんな所にてがみ……？
re: A letter in a place like this......?

eng: Something here! Paper here, paper!
jap: ここ　何かある！ かみ　ある　かみ　ある！
re: Something here! Paper here, paper here!

eng: There's a letter here. Shall we burn it?
jap: てがみがあるぞ。 もやすか？
re: There's a letter. Burn it?

eng: To Marle...? «Dearest Marle, I know things are tough between you and your father. But nothing can break your bond of blood. Neither words of anger, nor great distances. Someday, when you have children, you will understand. This special bond is part of a family tree which links us together. -Queen Guardia XXI, Leene.»
jap: マールへ……？ 親愛なるマールへ。 父上との仲はいかがでしょう？ 知れませんが、いがみあっても はなれていても、親子は親子。 行かねばなりません。 そして、あなたもいつか親となる。 それはいつの世も変わりないはず。 だからこそ、私達とマールも つながっているのですから……。 ガルディア王21世 その妃リーネより。
re: To Marle......? Dear Marle. How are your relations with your father? even when you quarrel, even when you are apart, parent and child are parent and child. And then, you too will someday become a parent. I doubt that will change in any generation. That exactly is why we and you are also linked...... From King Guardia the 21st's Queen Leene.

eng: Boy, can she tell it like it is!!
jap: ニクい事やってくれるわね…… って、それどころじゃないわ！
re: What a horribly wonderful thing to do...... Hey, this is no time for that!

eng: Although I have no emotions, there is something warm and cozy about this letter.
jap: ワタシは親がいないので 子を愛する気持ちがわかりまセンが この文章は何か……あたたかいデスネ。
re: I have no parents, so I do NOT understand the feeling of loving a child, but this text IS somehow...... warm.
RetranslatorComment: Robo does have emotions.

eng: Dear Queen Leene...! Let us now make haste and fulfill our quest!
jap: リーネ様…… さ、先を急ごう！
re: Leene-sama...... Come on, let's hurry on!

eng: Ayla know about leaving nest! Time pass, grow big, leave nest! Ayla leave nest! Dactyl leave nest too. Marle leave too? Big change!
jap: おう　すだつ！ エイラにもそれ　わかる！ プテランもすだつ。 マールも　すだつか？ それすごい！
re: Oh, leave nest! Ayla understand that too! Pteran leave nest too. Marle leave nest too? That great!

eng: Leave nest! Have baby! Baby grow big! Leave nest too!
jap: すだつ！　ねねする！ 子供うむ！　おっぱいやる！ そしてまた　子がすだつ！
re: Leave nest! Sleep! Bear kids! Give boobs! And then kids leave nest again!
RetranslatorComment: Omitted from the English version. It's clear from the concept art that Marle does have breasts, but of a modest size (unlike Ayla and most other anime females), and her clothing is fairly baggy as well. It seems that Ayla is concerned that Marle may have trouble nursing her future kids, and doesn't realize that saying this could be considered embarrasing or insulting.

eng: Sure you ready leave nest? Not too big yet.
jap: オマエ　だいじょぶか？ おっぱいないな……。
re: You be okay? Not have boobs......

eng: Perhaps we could have this conversation later...?
jap: 感動している場合では ないと思うが……。
re: I don't think this is any time to be getting all emotional......

eng: Father! Hang in there, we're coming!
jap: 父上！今行くからねッ！！
re: Father! I'll be right there!!

eng: Members of the jury... If he is guilty, stand to the left. If innocent, stand to the right.
jap: ばいしんいん達よ。 有罪と思う者は左へ 無罪だと思う者は右へ行きなさい！
re: Jurors. Go, those who think he is guilty to the left, those who think he is not guilty to the right!

eng: Guilty.
jap: 有罪
re: Guilty.

eng: You won't reconsider?
jap: どーしてもダメと言うの？
re: You mean it's no good no matter what?

eng: No, Princess.
jap: はい、どーしてもです。
re: Yes, no matter what.

eng: There is one way... It's a bit rough, but just follow me!
jap: 手はあるわ！ 少々あらっぽいけど…… ついて来て！
re: There's a way! It's a bit rough, but...... Follow me!

eng: The verdict is in! Guilty!!!
jap: 判決をいいわたす！ 有罪4　無罪1 よって有罪とする！！
re: I shall announce the verdict! Guilty: 4, innocent: 1 Accordingly, we find him guilty!!

eng: The Guardia line ends here. This domain shall be mine! Take him away!
jap: これでガルディアの時代は 終わりましたな…… これからは、この私が国をしきします。 さ！　つれて行け！！
re: With this, the age of Guardia has ended...... From now on, I will run the country. Now! Take him away!!

eng: Wait!!!
jap: 「待ってーーー！！
re: 'Waaaaaaiiit!!

eng: Who is it?!
jap: 誰だ！
re: Who is it!

eng: FATHER!!!
jap: ちちうえェーー！！
re: Fatherrrrr!!

eng: Nadia!
jap: マールディア！
re: Marledia!

eng: Princess! Control yourself!
jap: マールディア様！
re: Marledia-sama!

eng: You're too late! The King has been found guilty. Even kings are subject to our laws.
jap: し、しかしもうおそい！ ガルディア王は国民の裁判によって刑は 決まったのです。　王と言えども……
re: H, however, it's too late! King Guardia's sentence was decided though a trial of the people. Even though he may be king......

eng: No, this was a set up!
jap: そんな事ないわ！ それは、あなたのでっちあげよ！！
re: Not a chance! You framed him!!

eng: Nonsense! The King's a crook!
jap: いやいや、事実王は王家の宝を……
re: No, no, the truth about the king is, the royal family's treasure......

eng: But the treasure is right here!
jap: 宝ならここに！！
re: If it's the treasure, here!!

eng: IMPOSSIBLE!!
jap: そ、それは！
re: Th, that's!

eng: Your little scheme is over, Chancellor!
jap: かんねんなさい！ 大臣！
re: Give it up, chancellor!

eng: Grrr...I mean...uh...
jap: くく……

eng: Huh?
Hee hee hee! It's not the plot you think! I'm here to avenge my ancestors!
jap: くくくく…… かんねんするのは君達の方だよ。 先祖代々うけつがれてきたうらみ 今ここではらさせてもらうよ！
re: Ku, ku, ku, ku...... The ones who should give it up are you. I'll make you pay back the grudge inherited for generations from my ancestors, here and now!

eng: Super, ultra, presto... TRANSFORM-O!!!!!!
jap: スーパーウルトラデラックス 大臣チェーーーンジ！！
re: Super Ultra Deluxe Chancellor Chaaaange!!

eng: Father... I...
jap: 父上…… 私……

eng: No, don't say it. I was wrong to be so stubborn.
jap: いいんじゃ、何も言うな。 わからずやの私がいけなかったんだ。
re: It's fine, don't say anything. I shouldn't have been so obstinate.

eng: No, I didn't even think about how you felt. Um... I know it in my heart, but the words just come out wrong.
jap: 私こそ父上の気持ちも 知らないで…… ううん…… 頭ではわかっていたけど うまく言葉にならなくて……。
re: It's me, who not even knowing your feelings...... No...... I understood in my head, but couldn't put it into words well......

eng: I too, have that problem. I thought you left me, but realized that it was I, who abandoned you.
jap: 私もさ。 一時はお前が本当に遠くに行って しまったように思えた。 でもよく考えてみると、遠くに行って いたのは私のほうだったのだな。
re: I too. For a time, it seemed as though you were truly going far away. But when I tried thinking it over well, the one who had gone far was I.

eng: But I'm here now. We'll talk about everything that's happened. About Crono, and mother, and...
jap: 今は近くにいる。 これからは父上に何でも言える。 いろんな事をそうだんしたり クロノの事を話したり 母上の事を聞いたり……
re: Now we're close. From now on, I can tell you anything. Seek advice on various things, talk about Crono, ask about mother......

eng: Your mother... How sad! It has taken me so long to understand what Aliza meant with her last words. «Someday when Nadia grows up, she will bring her beloved to meet you. Welcome him warmly. It will be a day you remember forever.»
jap: 母か……はずかしい話だが あの時の言葉が今やっと わかってきた気がする。 言った言葉…… 『マールディアが大きくなれば あなたの前に好きな人を連れて来る日が その時は2人をあたたかく むかえてやってね。
re: Your mother...... it's embarrassing to talk about, but I feel like I've finally come to understand her words of that day. her last...... "When Marledia grows up, the day will likely come when she brings the person she loves At that time, welcome the two of them warmly.

eng: You...heard her last words?
jap: 母上の最後の言葉を 父上は聞いていたのね？
re: So you were listening to mother's last words?

eng: Of course! You were so young! You ran around saying «Daddy, it's fun having all my favorite people here!» Seeing you so happy, she felt reassured, and she left us quite peacefully.
jap: ああ…… お前は小さかったからおぼえて 『パパ、私好きな人いっぱいいるよ！ いっぱい　いっぱい！』 そんなマールディアを見て安心した アリーチェはほほえみながらいきを 引き取った……。
re: Yes...... You were little so you may not remember, You were being cheerful, saying "Papa, there are lots of people I like! Lots, lots!" Seeing you like that, Ariche was at peace and smiled as she breathed her last......

eng: So that's how it was...
jap: そうだったの……
re: So that's how it was......

eng: Yes, why?
jap: どうしたんだい？

jap: 私って小さいころは 父上のことパパって呼んでいたのね。

eng: You did.
jap: ああ、そうだよ。

eng: ...Yessir!
jap: ……はい！

eng: Indeed, Sir.
jap: ……しょうちいたしました。
re: ......understood.

eng: It's my turn, now...
jap: 「さて、ワシの出番じゃな……。
re: 'Well then, it's my turn......

eng: Melchior!
jap: ボッシュ！
re: Bosch!

eng: Melchior!
jap: ボッシュ！
re: Bosch!

eng: Mr. Melchior!
jap: ボッシュサン！

eng: Melchior!
jap: じーさん！
re: Old man!

eng: Melchior!
jap: ボッシュ！
re: Bosch!

eng: Can't let you run the whole show. Let me make some weapons from the Rainbow Shell! Finally time for me to do somethin'. Watch and learn!
jap: お前さん達ばかりに おいしい所を持ってかれてたまるか。 虹色の貝がらからの防具作りは ひさかたぶりの出番じゃ。 腕がなるわい！
re: As if I'd let you guys take all the tasty parts. I'll take care of making armor from the Rainbow-Colored Shell! My first turn in quite a long time. I'm itching for action!

eng: This is a very rare! As armor, it deflects magic! I can make you 1 Prism Dress, featuring maximum defense. Or I can make 3 less-effective Prism Helms. Which would you prefer? 1 Prism Dress 3 Prism Helms
jap: これは特別な物質じゃ。 これから作る防具は魔法攻撃を受けた プリズム・ドレスはききめが大きいが 1つしか出来ん。 ききめの小さいプリズム・メットは3つ どっちにするね？ プリズム・ドレス一つ プリズム・メット三つ
re: This is a special material. Armoring made from this will be able to weaken the A Prism Dress will have a great effect, but I can't make more than one. I can make three Prism Helms that have a Which will it be? 1 Prism Dress 3 Prism Helms

eng: The Prism Dress? Only females may equip it. I want the Prism Dress. I've changed my mind.
jap: プリズム・ドレスじゃな？ こいつは女の子しか装備出来んぞ？ はい いいえ
re: The Prism Dress? No one but the girls can equip that one. Yes. No.

eng: You want Prism Helms? You're sure? Yes No
jap: プリズム・メットじゃな？ こいつは誰でも装備可能じゃが？ はい いいえ
re: The Prism Helms? Anyone can equip those. Yes. No.

eng: All right, you just wait there!
jap: よーし、待っておれ！ 腕によりをかけて、このボッシュ 一世一代の代物をこしらえてやるぞ！
re: Okay, just you wait! Applying my skill to its utmost, I, Bosch, will manufacture once-in-a-lifetime goods!

eng: Finished! Off you go, now!
jap: 完成じゃ。 これを持っていけ！
re: It's done. Take this with you!

eng: I finally feel like I'm doing something worthwhile!
jap: これで役に立てたわい。
re: I have now been of use.

eng: Interesting substance! I could make some great stuff with an alloy of it!
jap: この物質…… もうひとつ別の何かとかけ合わせれば とんでもない物が出きるぞい！
re: This material...... If I could cross it with another special something, I could make something incredible!

eng: Ahh! A Sun Stone! I'll create an alloy out of it!
jap: おお！太陽石か。 さっそくこいつとかけ合わせてみよう！
re: Oh! The Sun Stone? I'll try crossing it with this one right away!

eng: Heh heh! Don't think that's the last of my bag of tricks!
jap: ふふ。 これで終わったと思うな。 今回のボッシュはおおはりきりじゃ！
re: Hu, hu. Don't think I'm finished with this. Bosch is really enthusiastic this time!

eng: So! The Chancellor was a beast!
jap: まさか大臣がモンスターだったとは……
re: How could the chancellor have been a monster......?

eng: The King's finally feeling better.
jap: 王もやっと、お元気になられた。
re: The King has finally recovered his health too.

eng: No one could tell that the Chancellor was a beast...
jap: 大臣が魔物だったのを見ぬけんとは……
re: To think we couldn't see through the chancellor being a monster......

eng: Now THIS is what I call a 1000th Anniversary.
jap: これで城も千年祭らしくなったな。
re: Now the castle feels like a Millennial Festival too.

eng: The soldiers hired by the fake Chancellor were all monsters.
jap: ニセの大臣がひきいていた兵達は みな魔物だったらしい。
re: I hear that all the soldiers the fake chancellor led were monsters.

eng: I'm Pierre, the lawyer. So, like, where's the real chancellor?
jap: ベンゴシのピエールです。 だとすると、本物の大臣はどこに？
re: I'm the lawyer Pierre. So, where's the real chancellor?

eng: Phew, finally! That beast, keepin' me locked up in here...!
jap: ふーっ、助かったわい！ あの化け物め、こんなとこに おしこめおってからに……！
re: Phew, I'm saved! That damn monster, leaving me shut up in a place like this......!

eng: Princess Nadia! Your friends, I presume?
jap: お、マールディア様！ お友達ですかな？
re: Oh, Marledia-sama! These are your friends?

eng: Wait, I don't have time for this. I must prepare for the Moonlight Parade!
jap: と、こうしちゃおれん。 千年祭ムーンライト・パレードの じゅんびにとりかからねば！
re: Ah, I can't be doing this. I have to set about preparing for the Millenial Festival Moonlight Parade!

eng: Princess Nadia! At the moonlight parade, you shall receive a lovely present from me!
jap: マールディア様！ こよいのムーンライト・パレードで このじいより、すてきなプレゼントを いたしますぞ！
re: Marledia-sama! You shall receive a wonderful present at tonight's Moonlight Parade from this old man!

eng: I'm Pierre, the lawyer. I've been planning the Millennial Parade with the Chancellor.
jap: ベンゴシのピエールです。 かねてから千年祭のパレードを 大臣と計画していたのです。
re: I'm the lawyer Pierre. I have been planning the Millennial Festival's parade with the chancellor for some time.

eng: Enjoy yourselves at the moonlight parade!
jap: こよいのムーンライト・パレード キミ達も楽しみにしていなされ！
re: You all look forward to tonight's Moonlight Parade too!

eng: Now we can go on with the moonlight parade.
jap: これでムーンライト・パレードを 予定通りおこなえる。
re: Now the Moonlight Parade can be carried out as planned.

eng: Gonna be a great night.
jap: きっと、すばらしい夜になるぞ。
re: It's sure to be a magnificent night.

eng: The parade's the grand finale.
jap: パレードは千年祭のグランドフィナーレだ。
re: The parade is the Millennial Festival's grand finale.

eng: It's the kind of parade that brings out the kid in all of us.

re: Everyone will be able to go back to when they were children. It's that kind of a parade.

eng: That's great to hear...!
jap: よかった、本当に……。
re: Honestly, thank goodness......

eng: Sorry, fellas. I'm terribly embarrassed... Take care of Princess Nadia, OK? The real Chancellor's okay. He took off to the Knight's room sayin' he was gettin' ready for the parade!
jap: すまなかったな、キミ達。 いや、思いかえせば、はずかしい所を 見せてしまった……。 これからもマールディアを よろしくたのむぞ。 やはり本物の大臣は無事じゃったな。 兵士の部屋でパレードのうちあわせをすると すっとんで行きおったぞ！
re: I'm sorry, all of you. No, now that I look back on it, I let you see something embarrassing...... Take good care of Marledia from now on too. The real Chancellor was okay after all. He rushed off saying he was having a parade meeting in the soldiers' room.
RetranslatorComment: He adds this to his dialogue after the Chancellor has been  freed.

eng: Princess, let's start with P. E.!
jap: さ、姫様！　まずは体育から！
re: Come on, Princess! Start with athletics first!

eng: It's no game, now !
jap: いやいや、教育じゃ！
re: No, no, education!

eng: No, we MUST start with discipline!
jap: いいえ、やはりしつけをやり直さないと！
re: No, we really must start discipline all over again!

jap: お食事なら、こちらにおかけ下さい。
re: If you are eating, please be seated here.

jap: 何にいたします？
re: What shall it be?

eng: Refresh bread.
jap: リフレッシュパン
re: Refresh bread

jap: かしこまりました。 お待たせしました。 MPが回復した！
re: Certainly. Thank you for waiting. MP recovered!

jap: スタミナうなじゅう

eng: A fine choice [HP recovered!]

re: You have an eye for quality. Thank you for waiting. HP recovered!

eng: Crono special.
jap: クロ・スペシャル

jap: お待たせしました。 お待たせしました。
re: This dish takes the name of a hero who appeared in these lands long ago. Thank you for waiting. HP/MP recovered!

eng: Come on, now!!
jap: そらそら～ッ！！
re: Yah yah yah!!
RetranslatorComment: This would be the cook in  a... cooking frenzy, I guess. What she's saying doesn't really mean anything  as much as it is impassioned shouts, more suited to a battle than a kitchen.

eng: We owe it all to you! Eat all you want.
jap: いや、あんたらのおかげだ！ 食べてって下さいよ。
re: Hey, it's thanks to you guys! Please, eat.

eng: Know this! The mighty Lavos reigns here!
jap: 見よ！ ラヴォス神が世界の王となられたこの星を！
re: Behold! This planet where Lavos-god is king of the world!

eng: Relax, poor creatures... The Mighty Lavos has already consumed this world's life energy!
jap: おぬし達虫ケラどもが いくらあがこうとも、もうおそい。 すでにこの星は、ラヴォス神によって
re: However you worms may try to struggle, it's already too late. This planet has already been completely

eng: It's shut tight...
jap: かたく閉ざされている……。
re: It's tightly closed......

eng: Return to Epoch? Yes No
jap: シルバードにもどりますか？ はい いいえ
re: Return to the Sylbird? Yes No

eng: Fools! Haven't you learned your lesson?! We are immortal! We shall live forever with Lavos, who devours this planet even as he sleeps. Draining this planet's power, Lavos will rule the world in a mere 14,000 years.
jap: 虫ケラどもが！ またも、わらわにさからうつもりか！ わらわは永遠の命を手に入れた！ ラヴォス神とともに永遠に生き続けるのだ！ ラヴォス神は地中でゆっくりと星を食らう。 そして力をたくわえ14000年のちに 星をほろぼし、世界の王となられるのじゃ！
re: Worms! Do you intend to oppose me once again?! I have obtained eternal life! I will keep to living forever along with Lavos-god! Lavos-god is underground, leisurely consuming the planet. And it will store up power, destroy the planet in 14,000 years, and become king of the world!

eng: Within 1,400 years he will emerge to become ruler of this world!
jap: そして力をたくわえ1400年のちに 星をほろぼし、世界の王となられるのじゃ！
re: And it will store up power, destroy the planet in 1400 years, and become king of the world!

eng: Within 999 years he'll become the ruler of this world.
jap: そして力をたくわえ999年のちに 星をほろぼし、世界の王となられるのじゃ！
re: And it will store up power, destroy the planet in 999 years, and become king of the world!

eng: The Black Omen is a path which leads to Lavos. It is a shrine which provides us with limitless power. As long as the mighty one reigns, your dreams are hopeless! You should sacrifice yourself to the mighty Lavos! HAAhahahaha!
jap: この黒の夢は、ラヴォス神へとつながる道。 わらわに無限の力をあたえてくれる神殿。 おぬし達のもとめる未来なぞ この奥におわすラヴォス神があられる限り 望むべくもないわ！ おぬし達は、ラヴォス神への 生けにえとなるがよい！ フォフォフォ！！
re: This Black Dream is a road connecting to Lavos-god. A temple that provides me with infinite power. You should not even wish for such a thing as the future you seek as long as Lavos-god within here exists! May you become a sacrifice to the god Lavos! Foh, foh, foh!!
RetranslatorComment: unusual laughing noise

eng: 3 of you! And in a place like THIS! You've got a long journey ahead of you so please rest awhile. And if you wish to awaken from this dream, there probably is a way... What will you do?
jap: およっ！　こんな所に、それも3人も！ この先まだ長いですから、ここでゆっくり していって下さいな。 この夢からさめたいのなら なんとかしますけど……。 どうしますか？
re: Oyo! In a place like this, and three besides! The way ahead is still long , so please take your time here. Though if you want to wake from this dream, we'll manage it somehow...... What will you do?

eng: Wake up.
jap: もどる
re: Go back

eng: Stay.
jap: もどらない
re: Don't go back

eng: Hey! We've got a customer!
jap: おーい！　お客さんだよー！
re: Hey! Customers!

eng: What will you do?
jap: どうしますか？
re: What will you do?

eng: Shop!
jap: 売ってくれ！
re: Sell me something!

eng: Got a lot of great stuff! Come again!
jap: いい物、たくさんあるよ！ まいどありっ！
re: I've got a lot of good stuff! Come again!

eng: Just chat.
jap: あいさつだけ
re: Just saying hello.

eng: These just don't sell too well, ho, ho!!
jap: なかなか売れませんよ、とほほ。
re: I can't do much selling, to, ho, ho.

eng: You're starting to bug me! How long do I have to put up with your drivel, ribbit?
jap: まったく！　いつまであいつの言 うこと聞かなきゃいけない、ケロ？
re: Sheesh! How long have we got to listen to what he says, ribbit?
RetranslatorComment: These scenes appear depending on how many times you've used the exit.

eng: Just shut up and push, will ya, GRIBBIT!
jap: いいからだまって押すゲロ！
re: Just shut up and push, gribbit!

eng: Hey, Boss. What's your life's dream, ribbit?
jap: ねえおやぶん。 おやぶん夢って何でケロ？
re: Hey, boss. What's your dream, ribbit?

eng: My personal dream? To be King of the Sewer! Gribbit!
jap: 夢か……。 そうさなあ……、地下水道の王！ うーん、それだゲロ！
re: Dream......? Let's see...... king of the underground waterway! Yeah, that's it, gribbit!

eng: Oh, all right...! What's your little dream? Gribbit.
jap: じゃあ、おめえの夢ってのを 聞かせてゲロ。
re: Well then, let me hear what your dream is, gribbit.

eng: I just want to keep being your apprentice, ribbit.
jap: おいらは、こぶんのまんまが 夢だケロ。
re: My dream is to keep being your lackey, ribbit.

eng: Sheesh! You're making me cry, here. I'm gonna tell Krawlie what you just said!!
jap: くーっ！ 泣かせること言いやがって！ みはりとクロウリーのコンビに 聞かせてやりてえゲロ！！
re: Kuuuuh! Going and saying something that makes me cry! I wanna let the lookout and Crawlie combo hear that, gribbit!!

eng: Ribbit...ribbit, ribbit!
jap: ケロッ　ケロッ　ケロッ！
re: Ribbit, ribbit, ribbit!

eng: Gribbit, gribbit, GRIBBIT!
jap: ゲロッ　ゲロッ　ゲロッ！
re: Gribbit, gribbit, gribbit!

eng: Get on, ribbit!
jap: 乗ってケロ！
re: Get on, ribbit!

eng: Behold, my pretties! Destiny, in its most brutal form. All the dreams that might have been. All the happiness, and sorrow, you might have experienced. Gone forever!!! For you there will be no tomorrow!
jap: ククク……。 そこにねむっているのは、 お前達の未来だ……。 これから、かなうかもしれぬ夢…… えられるかもしれぬ、よろこび 悲しみ…… お前達の明日そのものなのだ！
re: Ku, ku, ku...... What sleeps there is your future...... The dreams that might have come true after this...... The joy and sadness you might have been able to earn...... Your tomorrow itself!

eng: The Dark Omen transcends time and space, waiting for Lavos to awaken! Destiny has led you here. And here you shall rest forever, unless you can defeat me, and smash the Omen!
jap: この黒の夢はあらゆる時間 次元をこえてながれている……。 ラヴォス様がめざめる その時を待ちながら……。 お前達の未来は いつか必ずここにたどりつく。 お前達に未来はない！ わらわを倒し、この黒の夢を 止めぬかぎりな！
re: This Black Dream flows across all temporal dimensions...... While waiting for that time when Lavos-sama will awaken...... Your future will invariably reach here eventually. You have no future! As long as you don't beat me and stop this Black Dream!

eng: Come, dear friends. Perhaps I can persuade Lavos to share his dreams with you! Did I say dreams? I meant his eternal nightmare!
jap: 来い、人の子よ！ わらわがいざなってやろう ラヴォス様のねむりの中へ……。 永遠の黒き夢に……！
re: Come, children of humans! I shall lure you into the midst of Lavos-sama's slumber...... To an eternal black dream......!

eng: Argh! My powers don't seem to work here! Wait! I'll simply toss you into the Mammon Machine! You'll be one with the Omen, Lavos...and me!
jap: ここでは力が出せん……。 良い事を思い付いた。 キサマら魔神器に取り込んでくれる。 ありがたく思うとよいぞ……。 この船の一部になれることを！ この私の一部になれることを！！ ラヴォス様の一部になれることを！！！
re: I can't draw out my power here...... I've come up with a good idea. I'll take and stick you vermin into the Demonic Vessel. I hope you're thankful...... To be able to become a part of this ship! To be able to become a part of me!! To be able become a part of Lavos-sama!!!
RetranslatorComment: 'Vermin' seems more in  character than 'bastards'. 'Kisama' is just an insulting way of saying 'you'  after all. Kanji compounds can get  to be very messy... 魔神器 is one of the more annoying ones  I've seen, but I think I've got the right idea here.

eng: You cretins... I plan to live with Lavos, and control the universe forever. You will not get in my way!
jap: 虫ケラどもが……。 わらわは、ラヴォス神と共に 永遠にこの世をしはいする女王なるぞ。 そのわらわに、さからおうというか。
re: Worms...... I am the queen who will rule this world eternally together with Lavos-god. You would oppose me?

eng: Idiots... Nothing can live forever.
jap: おろかな……。 全ての存在は、ほろびの宿命から 逃れる事は出来ぬ……。
re: Foolish...... All existence is unable to escape from the fate of perishing......

eng: Zeal... A pitiful woman, duped by Lavos!
jap: ジールよ。 ラヴォスに見入られた、悲しき女。 せめてもの情けだ……
re: Zeal. A sad woman enthralled by Lavos. Pitiful at best......

eng: I, myself, will bring an end to all of this!
jap: この手で、全てを 終わらせてくれる！
re: I will bring it all to an end by my hand!

eng: Prophet! You are doomed. I haven't forgotten what you did at the Ocean Palace. You will now forfeit your life. How dare you insects come after ME! Oh almighty Lavos, lend me your power! Mwa, ha, ha... At last, Lavos awakens! Compared with him, you are like germs. But, I...I shall obtain immortality! Indulge in such regrets in the next life!
jap: 呪われし予言者よ。 そなたが海底神殿でおかした罪 わらわはわすれておらぬぞ。 今こそ、その死を以てつぐなうがよい！ ム、虫ケラのぶんざいで このわらわを追いつめるとは…… ラヴォス神よ、その御力をわらわに！！ フフフ…… ハハハ…… ついに、ラヴォス神がおめざめになる！ キサマ達虫ケラなぞ ラヴォス神の前では赤子同然。 わらわは、ラヴォス神とともに 永遠の生命を手にする事としよう！ 死してその思い上がりをくやむがよい！
re: Cursed prophet. I will not forget the sins you committed at the Ocean Floor Temple. Now, may you atone for them with your death! H, how could mere worms would back me into a corner......? O Lavos-god, thy power unto me!! Hu, hu, hu...... Ha, ha, ha...... At last the Lavos-god shall awaken! Before Lavos-god, the likes of you worms are as good as babies. I shall take hold of eternal existence along with the Lavos-god! May you die and regret your conceit!

eng: The Final Battle
jap: 星の夢の終わりに
re: At the End of the Planet's Dream

eng: That poor woman can finally rest, now that the Black Omen is gone. She's reverted back to a human... Now it is time for you to access the Gate contained within that bucket! You fight not just for yourselves, but for all living things... This is a battle between Lavos and the entire world!
jap: 黒の夢は消え、あの女もようやっと 眠りにつく事が出来た。 人にもどれたのじゃ……。 今こそ、そこのバケツからのゲートに 飛び込むのじゃ……！ これはお前さん達だけの戦いではない。 この星の生命達…… そう、この星とラヴォスとの 戦いなのじゃ……！
re: The Black Dream is gone, and so too was that woman at long last able to settle into slumber. She was able to turn back to being a person...... Now, dive into the Gate from the bucket over there......! This is not just your battle. The lives on this planet...... Yes, the battle is between this planet and Lavos......!

eng: Great weather.
jap: いい天気だねェ。
re: Nice weather.

eng: Great weather today. [Lavos Battle, 1999 A.D. (Without Winged Epoch)]
jap: 今日も、いい天気じゃのう。
re: Good weather today too.

re: What!?

re: Energy value, 100! 200......! It still CONTINUES to rise!

jap: な、何だってんだ！？

jap: 来る……。

jap: で、出てくるの！？
re: It, it's coming out!?

jap: A．D．1999！ 1時24分！ まちがいアリマセン！
re: A.D. 1999! 1:24! THERE IS NO mistaking it!

eng: Lavos...!?
jap: ラヴォス……！？

jap: 強いヤツ！ いっぱい　いっぱい　強いヤツ！！
re: Strong one! Really really strong one!!

jap: さ、出て来い……！
re: Come on, get out here......!

jap: こ、これが……！
re: Th, this is......!

jap: あ、あわわ……。
re: Ah, awawa......

re: Combat ability level, measurement impossible!?

jap: で、でけえ……。
re: H, huge......

eng: Uoooo...
re: Uuuuuuu......!

eng: I've been waiting for this! Lavos...
jap: 待ちわびたぞ……！ 「ラヴォス……！
re: Long have I awaited this......! Lavos......!

jap: どうしよう？　[pc1]！ 戦う！ 今は逃げよう！
re: What should we do? [pc1]! Fight! Let's run for now!

jap: ま、まさか行かないわよね？ 戦う！ 今は逃げよう！
re: D, don't tell me we're going in? Fight! Let's run for now!
RetranslatorComment: It's just 'go' (here and in several following lines), but if I just say 'go' in English it sounds too much like go ELSEWHERE, when they all mean go FORWARD...

eng: [member1], shall we go on? Fight! Run away for now!
jap: 行きマスカ？　[pc1]！ 戦う！ 今は逃げよう！
re: SHALL we go in? [pc1]! Fight! Let's run for now!

eng: [member1]! Be thee certain? Fight! Run away for now!
jap: マ、マジか？　[pc1]！ 戦う！ 今は逃げよう！
re: Are, are you serious? [pc1]! Fight! Let's run for now!

eng: Fight now? Fight! Run away for now!
jap: 戦うか！？ 戦う！ 今は逃げよう！
re: Fight!? Fight! Let's run for now!

eng: Hm, how frightened are we? Fight! Run away for now!
jap: フッ、おじけづいたか？ 戦う！ 今は逃げよう！
re: Hmph, lost your nerve? Fight! Let's run for now!

eng: You're right! For Doan and the others too!
jap: そうだね！ ドン達のためにも！
re: You're right! For Don and the others too!

eng: Ours...was a short youth!
jap: み……、みじかい せいしゅんだったわ！

jap: 今こそ、この私がお前を 消し去ってやる……！

jap: やったか！？

eng: Lavos down! Ayla No1!!
jap: ラヴォス　倒した！ エイラ達　一番　強い！！
re: Beat Lavos! Aylas strongest!!

eng: It's over?
jap: やったか……？
re: We did it......?

eng: Look, a hole!
jap: あ、あなが開いてるよ！
re: Th, there's a hole's open!

eng: Did we do that?...
jap: 私達が戦った跡……？
re: That's from our battle......?

eng: A...hole... Did WE do that?!
jap: コレは…… ワタシ達が戦った跡デショウカ？
re: THIS is...... COULD it BE from OUR battle?

eng: That hole... Did we do that??
jap: こりゃ……俺達の戦った跡？

eng: Lavos has hole!
jap: ラヴォス　あな　あいてる！
re: Lavos, hole open!

eng: The exterior's slain...
jap: 外がわは死んでいるか……。
re: So the outside's dead......
